Description: Happy Indigenous Peoples’ Day! Today, we honor the important legacy of Indigenous peoples of the United States. Title: NA
Description:
We’re nearing dangerous climate tipping points — and unless we change course quickly, the climate crisis will only accelerate faster. According to the UN IPCC, tipping points are critical thresholds beyond which an ecosystem will reorganize itself - and usually not to our advantage. As nature tries to stabilize in the wake of a changing climate, the results could be catastrophic. 

We still have time to avoid many tipping points and prevent the worst of the climate crisis. But it’s going to take real climate action NOW. 

Go to bit.ly/Climate-Tipping-Points to learn more!

Title: NA
Description:
Wondering how you can passively take climate action? Try banking! Green banks are financial institutions that seek to combat climate change and environmental injustice. Rather than investing in fossil fuels or large companies, green banks invest in decarbonization, middle-class jobs, and economic growth by supporting clean energy projects. Money is reinvested every time a loan is paid off, creating a snowball effect of community-driven climate solutions. Sounds good to us! Learn more here: bit.ly/wewantgreencommunities 

#climatereality #greenbank #greencommunities #climatesolutions #climateaction

Are you sick and tired of #BigOil destroying your communities? We're talking to you, environmental justice advocates in the Gulf South and Ohio River Valley! The Climate Reality Project and former Vice President Al Gore want you to apply for the first-of-its-kind, Power Up: A Climate Reality Training on Advocacy in Action. This training is all about taking back your communities and fighting for environmental justice and public health and safety. The conversations and solutions held at the training will focus on a just transition, clean energy practices, and advancing green communities and natural solutions. 

If you are living with fossil fuel pollution, you are part of the movement. Part of the solution. That's why we need environmental/ climate justice leaders and community organizers from TX, MS, AL, LA, FL, PR, OH, WV, and PA to join us in Houston, TX this October 27 and 28 and together fight the petrochemical and fossil fuel industry.

Click the link in our bio for more. Apply today!

Title: NA
Description:
Fewer bugs may seem like a good thing, but it could signal ecological disaster. Each creature plays an invaluable role in their ecosystem, and as populations dwindle, they become less stable with real consequences for crops. Not to mention, out-of-whack ecosystems and climates mean more pests like mosquitos, ticks, and crop-eating insects – and more pests means more diseases. Bringing down our carbon emissions means bringing back healthy and stable biodiversity. 

#ecosystems #biodiversity #climatechange #climatecrisis #insects #protectourwildlife #leadonclimate #actonclimate
Image Text: OVER 40% OF OUR INSECT SPECIES ARE IN DECLINE, AND THE CLIMATE CRISIS IS PARTIALLY TO BLAME. IT COULD SPELL DISASTER FOR OUR ECOSYSTEMS. Source:n.pr/3al1Ycu

Title: NA
Description:
Clean, safe drinking water isn't just a need - it's a right. Each and every community, family, and individual deserves water without restrictions and free of harmful chemicals. We can bring back clean and abundant water, but it's going to take bold global action to stop climate change in its tracks. Swipe through to learn more about how the #ClimateCrisis play a role in our water quality.

#climatechange #water #drought #extremeweather #safewater #actonclimate

Title: NA
Description: Bees (and their pollinator friends) play a crucial role in our ecosystems, agriculture, and food supplies. This #WorldHoneyBeesDay, we want to remind you why it's important to #savethebees, and every other creature that plays a unique and irreplaceable role in our ecosystems. By combating the #climatecrisis we help secure their - and our - survival. It's time to #ActOnClimate!

Title: NA
Description:
Today, @potus signed the #InflationReductionAct into law! Not only is this a win for the American people, but its broader implications will benefit people across the globe. This is historic, life-saving, and climate-mitigating legislation that will provide us with cheaper electrification and cleaner air. After a tough year of losses for climate, the United States is finally turning a corner with a bill that will reduce greenhouse gas emissions by an estimated 40 percent by 2030.

Although a win, there are terrible tradeoffs at the heart of the Inflation Reduction Act. It keeps us tied to fossil fuels when better alternatives exist. Painful concessions to fossil fuel interests will hurt communities of color and poor families at the same time others celebrate progress. We believe no community should suffer so another can keep the lights on, and we’ll fight to end of the terrible sacrifice zones in regions like the Gulf South.  Everyone has the right to #CleanAir.

Thank you to the hundreds of thousands of activists who signed our actions, contacted their representatives and senators, and made waves in their communities and beyond to build a brighter future for all Americans. We couldn’t have done this without you!

Today, we celebrate the victories of the IRA. Tomorrow, we fight for justice for those it leaves behind.

Title: NA
Description: Let’s give the #climatecrisis the cold shoulder. Swipe through to learn more about how permafrost and ice caps help protect the planet by doing their job and staying frozen.

Title: NA
Description:
BREAKING NEWS: the House passed the #InflationReductionAct! This is a monumental and historic moment that will protect families, livelihoods, and future generations from the #climatecrisis for years to come. Now, it’s off to @POTUS’ desk to become law! 

This is a great step forward for climate action, but this is just the start. The bill features painful concessions to fossil fuels that will harm poor families and Black, brown, and Indigenous communities across the country. At Climate Reality, we plan to fight these measures every step of the way.  To learn more about what this legislation means for America, climate action, and the world, read our latest statement by The Climate Reality Project’s founder and chairman, @AlGore.
Image Text: "AFTER THE FINAL NO THERE COMES A YES AND ON THAT YES THE FUTURE WORLD DEPENDS." WALLACE STEVENS THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT PASSED IN THE UNITED STATES!

Title: NA
Description: This #InternationalYouthDay, we're grateful for youth climate activists! Our younger generations have grown up on a planet constantly under attack from #BigOil and the #climatecrisis. Now, they're taking action by creating better lives for their communities and the planet. If this sounds like you, give @inconvenient_youth a follow to learn more about how you can help make the world a better place as a #climateactivist.

Title: NA
Description: Today we celebrate International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples! Many Indigenous peoples are feeling the impacts of climate change earlier and more severely than others, and many are leading the fight for solutions. Honor the day by taking the opportunity to acknowledge and appreciate the origins of the land we stand on. If you don't know whose land you are on, we suggest clicking the link in our bio to find out!

Title: NA
Description:
“In the history of the climate movement, this is an extraordinary moment. At long last, the U.S. Congress is poised to deliver much-needed investments in clean energy and environmental justice at a size and scale never before enacted. The result will be U.S. emissions slashed dramatically, our economy transformed to build climate solutions at home by Americans earning a fair wage, and U.S. credibility as a global leader re-established."

Success! The #InflationReductionAct is a historic piece of legislation that will benefit generations of Americans to come. Thank you, @senatedems, for finally prioritizing climate. Click the link in our bio to read our full statement.
Image Text: Climate Reality @ClimateReality Success! The #InflationReductionAct is a historic piece of legislation that will benefit generations of Americans to come. Thank you @SenateDems, for finally prioritizing climate.

Title: NA
Description: It's no surprise that the #ClimateCrisis impacts every living creature, but what about the ones who can't tell us about it? Environmental changes, lower food supplies, and less reproductive success means that species all over the world are now endangered. We can protect them, and every other living thing on the planet, but we have to #ActNOW.

Title: NA
Description:
While hardworking families struggle to make ends meet in the midst of skyrocketing gas prices, #BigOil is raking in billions of dollars in profit. Companies like BP, Chervon, and Exxon Mobil posted record-breaking profits this quarter, with some companies seeing over 1000% growth in just the last year alone. We can’t allow these companies to rob us blind as they line their pockets with the money of hardworking Americans.

Luckily, we now have part of the solution: The #InflationReductionAct. The #IRA2022 will accelerate our transition to a clean energy economy, freeing us from our dependence on fossil fuels and corrupt #BigOil executives. Click the link in our bio to tell your representatives and senators that we need them to #LeadOnClimate and vote for the Inflation Reduction Act.

Title: NA
Description:
Introducing Extreme Weather Wednesdays! For six weeks, we're focusing on a specific extreme weather event magnified by climate change. First up, we have hurricanes. Atlantic hurricane season is June 1 - November 30. With rising temperatures, hurricanes are becoming more devastating and impacting people around the world. To learn more, listen to our resident climate crisis meteorologist Ryan Towell talk all things hurricane in our @Climatereality News Network reel series. 

Stay tuned for next week’s forecast on wildfires! 

#climatereality #hurricanes #globalwarming #extremeweather #leadonclimate #actonclimate #tropicalstorms #category5 #stormsurge #climate #cyclone #flooding #devastation #reels #explorepage #hurricaneseason #climatechange #savetheplanet

Title: NA
Description:
Say it with us: No. More. Oil. Spills. #BigOil seems to do damage wherever it goes, whether that be leaching chemicals into our air, contaminating our drinking water, or dumping 200 Olympic-sized pools worth of oil into the ocean like the Deepwater Horizon spill. Depending on these fossil fuels means that we'll keep letting oil companies profit by destroying our land, water, air, and atmosphere. Enough is enough. It's time for a clean energy future! 

#bigoil #oilspills #pollution #polluters #cleanenergyeconomy #solar #windpower #protectouroceans #actonclimate #leadonclimate

Title: NA
Description:
Maybe it’s fun on TV, but it’s not so fun at the beach. Some shark species like Tiger sharks are showing up in new places, and signs point to climate change. Global warming has led to warmer oceans and rising sea levels, and higher CO2 levels are making oceans more acidic. The climate may change, but the shark’s preferences don’t. As northern oceans begin to reach that preferred 72 degree plus range, Tiger sharks (and their prey) are discovering new habitats, including beaches that were previously too cold for them. That species has shifted more than 200 miles closer to the poles! Forget a bigger boat, we’re going to need a cooler climate! 

#sharkweek #sharks #ocean #actonclimate #leadonclimate #beach #savethesharks
Image Text: SHARK WEEK IS LOOKING A LITTLE DIFFERENT THIS YEAR. GLOBAL WARMING HAS CAUSED A NORTHWARD SHIFT IN SHARK MIGRATION. Source:bit.ly/3zavSZm

Title: NA
Description: 32 years ago, on July 26, 1990, the Americans with Disabilities Act was passed. That’s why we celebrate #DisabilityPrideMonth every July! Having a disability can critically change an individual's experience with climate change impacts like extreme weather, making it vital to include those with disabilities in the climate conversation. The representation and involvement of the disabled community is necessary in order to solve climate change.

Title: NA
Description: Trees play a pivotal role in our fight against the #ClimateCrisis. We mostly think of them as vital carbon sinks, absorbing greenhouse gases and slowing climate change, but they do so much more. Nearly 250 million people, many of whom are among the poorest in the world, rely heavily on forests for food, protection, and work. Add in the 80% of animals that live in forests, and we have ecosystems that support lives all over the globe. Protecting our trees means protecting our futures.

Title: NA
Description:
Today is a day to be angry. Congress’s continued failure to pass concrete legislation to combat the #ClimateCrisis is a loss for the American people, for the frontline communities bearing the disproportionate  impacts, and for life on the planet. Our Climate Reality Leaders and activists across the US have spent months working for bold climate legislation to protect our communities, families, and planet. Yesterday, that plan was derailed by a single Senator.

In the absence of meaningful action from Congress, it’s time for the Biden Administration to take a stand to #GetClimateDone. @potus has to step up and use his full presidential power to #ActOnClimate while we still have time. Our work over the past year was not in vain. We know that we need sweeping climate action.  And we know that @potus can deliver. We’re ready to keep up the fight, and we’re here to support you as you do the same. We can still do this before it’s too late. It’s @potus’ turn to be our climate hero.

Description:
This #WorldPopulationDay, it's important to remember why population impacts climate. People, all by themselves, don't emit damaging levels of carbon. What does, however, is our fossil fuel-driven economy. It's easy to pin the blame on poorer nations with increasing populations, but that doesn't change the fact that #BigOil keeps fighting tooth and nail to keep high-carbon energy sources running as much as possible. As our population grows, we'll need bigger solutions. And we'll need Big Oil out of the picture. 

#ClimateCrisis #BigOil #Emissions #Population #ClimateAction #ActOnClimate #LeadOnClimate

Title: NA
Description:
Today’s #SCOTUS decision to overturn #RoevWade puts lives at risk. We stand with our allies who are working to ensure everyone, particularly people of color and those in poor and rural communities, can continue to make their own reproductive health care decisions. Protecting our fundamental rights – from abortion to the quality of the air we breathe – is critical for the future of democracy. 

This moment demands that we double down in our fight for a future where all can exercise their right to a healthy and safe environment. Today’s decision abandons nearly 50 years of legal precedent and marks the first time in U.S. history that SCOTUS has taken away a fundamental right. We will continue to work with our allies to train activists across the country and around the world in pursuit of protecting these rights. In the U.S., we will also work to ensure that this ruling, and the dangerous precedent it sets, is not the final word. 

For those who are looking to take action in the U.S. today, you can use this site to find a march in your area: 

https://map.wewontgoback.com/

Title: NA
Description:
The fight for racial justice continues. 

157 years ago, on June 19, 1865, over 250,000 Black people were enslaved in Galveston, Texas -- two years after the Emancipation Proclamation was signed. History shows us Black people in the United States and globally have struggled to realize true freedom and equality to this day. 

In our climate fight, we've committed to shining light on injustices and inequalities Black people within our communities face daily. In order for change to happen, we all must work to dismantle the systems of racism that continue to rob people of true justice and freedom. Like climate change, our time to act is now.

#juneteenth #environmentaljustice #climatejustice #freedom #actonclimate #leadonclimate #racialjustice

Title: NA
Description:
Green banks are financial institutions that seek to combat climate change and environmental injustice. And every time a loan is paid off, the money gets reinvested into another community project, creating a snowball effect of community-driven climate solutions. Sounds good to us! 
 
Green banks help close the financial gap between the investments needed for a just transition to a greener future and the climate solutions we have in-hand today. Learn more on our website! 
 
#climatereality #greenbank #greencommunities #climatesolutions #climateaction

Title: NA
Description:
Earth Day means nothing if it’s just one day.

Science tells us that the path we choose in the next few years really matters. But the window to avoid the most catastrophic impacts of climate change is closing quickly.

So this year, ignore all the feel good speeches and corporate greenwashing.

Remember what matters on this one incredible, precious Earth we call home.

Recommit to fighting like your world depends on it, for the next 364 days and beyond.

Because it does.

And it’s worth it.

And if not you, then who? You are our climate hope.

Here are two ways you can make an impact today:

🌏 Support Climate Reality globally by donating to our Earth Day fundraiser now!
🌱Learn at http://www.climaterealityproject.org/act how you can help save our planet.

The time to #actonclimate is now.

#earth #noplanetb #noplanetb🌎 #leadonclimate

Description: The EPA’s superfund program is designed to hold Big Polluters accountable for cleaning their own dump sites to benefit the environment. However, when these companies put profit over planet or avoid making substantial changes to their sites, they continue to produce pollution, while being ever-more vulnerable to climate disasters that can create environmental justice crises. Read more about the superfund program in our blog!
Image Text: The EPA's Superfund Program helps clean up processing plants, mining sites, and other hazardous areas to prevent dire health risks to communities. Climate Climate change is making it less effective. Source wre:https:/bi.ly/cRsuperunds

Title: NA
Description:
Communities deserve clean air and water and strong climate policy that ensures that the most vulnerable stay protected. 
 
The Clean Air Act of 1970 proved that by setting tight standards on emissions and air quality, we could improve life for Americans, save trillions in health care costs, and boost the economy while saving the planet. 
 
The Clean Water act of 1972 ensured high standards for water infrastructure, waste management, and lake restoration, eliminating toxic chemicals (often produced from the work of Big Oil) from our water systems. No one has ever complained about their drinking water being too clean before or since! 
 
When the need for breathable air and drinkable water for vulnerable communities is valued above the greed of Big Polluters to destroy our climate for profit, that’s climate justice. 

#environmentaljustice #climatereality #greenbank #communityempowerment

Title: NA
Description:
With Transit emissions accounting for a little over a quarter of annual climate emissions in the US, providing green transportation solutions are a must for the climate. That’s where electric busses come in! Not only are buses that run on electricity more cost effective than their diesel fuel counterparts, but they also reduce the amount of air pollution along their routes, which often overlap with vulnerable communities. Electric busses are a climate win – win – win: for climate, for the economy, and for communities! 

 #environmentaljustice #climatereality #justtransition #electricbusses #ev #cleanelectricity
Image Text: Transit emissions account for a little over a quarter of annual climate emissions in the US. Providing green transportation solutions are a must for the climate and commuters, and electric busses are a great place to start. READ MORE: bit.ly/zerocarbontransportation ELECTRIC

Description:
You’ve heard of food deserts, but what about food apartheid? Nutritional gaps aren’t just a coincidence—they’re the result of decades of discrimination and redlining. Tackling environmental and climate justice means giving each and every community access to a healthy and sustainable future. 
 
In December @algore convened farmers, scientists, and climate activists for a conversation on regenerative and climate-smart agriculture at his annual Climate Underground conference. Listening to those fighting on the frontlines, like @karwasher, is crucial to solving the climate crisis and creating a just future for all.

Description:
Climate Reality Europe's virtual conference, “Businesses Fit For 1.5C: An Integrated Approach for Climate Health,” is coming in February 2022. ⚡ 

This event will: 

Contribute to a dialogue with business organizations on their role & responsibility in reaching emissions limits in line with the Paris Agreement (PA) and supporting the just transition. 

Provide a breakdown of the EU legislative landscape, expected regulatory changes, as well as showcase existing initiatives and best practice scenarios to reach the PA targets. 

Work to develop holistic strategies to assist the business community in advancing their climate objectives. 

Check the link in our bio to read more and register for the event.

Description: Let’s talk about methane: a greenhouse gas about 90x more potent than CO2 on a 20-year timescale. Natural gas wells, even inactive ones, leak it into the atmosphere at alarming rates. What’s worse? Gas company executives are cashing out and sticking marginalized communities with the bill.
Image Text: Over a 20-year period, methane is about 90X more potent at trapping heat than CO2. TELL YOUR REPRESENTATIVE ENOUGH IS ENOUGH AND WE DEMAND STRONGER REGULATIONS. SIGN THE PETITION TODAY! Source:htps://bit.ly/3lfAy2V

2021 was a critical moment for our planet. It became clearer than ever that the climate crisis isn’t some far-off issue. From heatwaves and floods to wildfires and more, it’s affecting real people every day. Right now. We are asking you to make an urgent year-end donation to Climate Reality before our December 31 deadline – TOMORROW – and have every dollar MATCHED up to $200,000! Help us keep pushing for the critical change we need for the climate while we still have a chance to turn the state of our world around. 

Click the donation icon and double your impact today.

Title: NA
Description:
“Why do you want to poison us?” 

Formosa Plastics is trying to build a massive 14-facility petrochemical complex in the heart of Louisiana’s #CancerAlley — adding to the toxic pollution that already drives a death rate in the region 50 times higher than the national average.

@RISEStJames, led by Sharone Lavigne, is fighting back for environmental justice and a healthier future. We need to stand with them. ✊

🔗 Go to the link in our bio to tell @BankOfAmerica not to fund this devastating pollution in Cancer Alley. 🗣 Stop funding Formosa Plastics! 

#VoicesFromTheFenceline #PlasticJustice @peakplastic

This is what a crisis of inaction looks like. Not a single one of the world’s largest economies is doing enough to actually fulfill its #ParisAgreement commitments. 

☀️ But there’s reason for #ClimateHope: last month at the UN, world leaders from the US to Europe to China announced real climate action, like an end to overseas coal financing and increased investments for developing nations. 

It’s a start — and it must be followed with even more rapid and ambitious action at #COP26. Because we don’t have a second to wait. 💥

Title: NA
Description:
Today we’re honoring #Juneteenth, in recognition of the day 156 years ago when the enslaved people of Texas were finally met with the far overdue promise of freedom. For more than two years after the Emancipation Proclamation was signed, more than 250,000 Black people in Confederate-controlled Texas remained enslaved. It was only on June 19, 1865, with the arrival of Union troops to Galveston, that their enslavement ended.

But the story doesn’t end there. We know from our history that this promise of freedom has never been fully realized, and that we must all work to dismantle the systems of racism that continue to fuel violence and oppression. Because we know there’s no justice, until there’s justice for all.

Check the link in our bio to learn more about Juneteenth and why it’s so important to our history! ➡️

Title: NA
Description:
It’s getting hot in here. And it’s not “normal.” 🔥
(Repost @nytimes, source: https://nyti.ms/33J3C0D) 

・・・
There’s a new definition of ‘normal’ for weather, and the U.S. is getting warmer.

The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration last week issued its latest “climate normals”: baseline data of temperature, rain, snow and other weather variables collected over three decades at thousands of locations across the country.

The temperature results (pictured here) are in keeping with what we’ve long known: that the world has warmed by more than 1 degree Celsius (about 1.8 degrees Fahrenheit) since 1900, and that the pace of warming has accelerated in recent decades. As for precipitation changes, the maps reveal America’s split personality — some regions, notably the Southwest, are becoming increasingly drier, while the Central and Eastern parts of the country are getting wetter.

The normals are computed using 30 years of data and the newest ones include data from 1991 to 2020. Updated every 10 years, the normals are used by TV meteorologists when they tell you that today’s blisteringly high temperature was 10 degrees above normal for that location and date, for instance, or that a single heavy downpour brought more rain than is typical for an entire month. 

The normals are invaluable to farmers, energy companies and other businesses, water managers, transportation schedulers and any one who plans their activities in coming weeks or months based on what is likely, weather-wise.

“What we’re trying to do with climate normals is put today’s weather in the proper context,” said Michael Palecki, who manages the project at NOAA’s National Centers for Environmental Information. The change is especially drastic between the new normals and the previous ones, from 2010. “Almost every place in the U.S. has warmed,” he said.

Description:
You demanded it, and President Biden is taking action. 👊

👉 The White House just announced that the US is committing to reduce emissions by 50-52% by 2030, compared to 2005 levels, as part of the Paris Agreement. It’s the biggest, most ambitious goal the US has ever set. It’s a goal that the US can achieve, and should exceed. And it’s what thousands of @ClimateReality supporters joined us in calling for. Thank you, @POTUS! 

But pledges alone won’t solve the climate crisis. It takes real action and courage. 💪 The historic climate and clean energy jobs investments in the #AmericanJobsPlan are a great start, and today’s announcement makes clear: the White House is listening to science and listening to the people. 

So keep raising your voice for #ClimateAction and environmental justice! 🗣🗣 Go to the link in our bio for ways to take action, like joining your local Climate Reality chapter to learn how you can make a difference in your community and nationwide. Because your voice matters, and our leaders are finally listening. 🙌

Title: NA
Description:
Last year, we launched Climate Justice For All, a grants program to support community-based climate projects by local organizations fighting for solutions in their own backyards. So far, we’ve awarded $10,000 grants to 19 organizations in 15 states - including Bridging The Gap in Virginia.  

Bridging The Gap in Virginia supports individuals struggling with addiction, incarceration, chronic homelessness, and lack of employability, and has expanded their mission to address #EnvironmentalJustice and green workforce development.  

You can learn more about @btgvirginia at the link in our bio, and read what its director of operations, Raye Elliott, shared with us below 🌎⤵️

“As a result of fossil fuels, oil and gas projects, and corporations targeting marginalized communities, we are re-focusing and educating the populations that inhabit these areas, of how these fossil fuels affect climate, well water, and the landscape as a whole for communities of color in rural Virginia.

Our focal point is to educate the population on how through renewable energy, green jobs, energy efficiency, and weatherization will help change the mindset promulgated by corporate greed. So with the implementation of our workforce development initiative, we are bringing a cross-sectional education that includes climate change informational sessions, entrepreneurship opportunity training, and workforce development (for both low-income groups and justice involved individuals) with hopes to re-program the minds of the residents that would otherwise be taken advantage of.  

Thanks to Climate Reality’s recent grant award support, we have been able to achieve our goals by creating partnerships with the Town of Dillwyn, the City of Richmond, and county municipalities to expand our outreach as well as local nonprofits. We have been able to conduct educational workshops, provide COVID-19 PPE, provide energy efficiency giftbags, and conduct in-home interviews with residents for our weatherization program. Bridging The Gap in Virginia is immensely grateful for the opportunity to participate in the Climate Reality grant program and would like to reiterate our targeted commitment to climate justice."

🚨 Fossil fuels kill, and this is a crisis. But not everyone is affected equally.

In the US, 57% of people of color live in counties with a failing pollution grade – compared with just 38% of White Americans. This is what environmental injustice looks like, and it’s having dire health consequences for communities nationwide.

Title: NA
Description:
Our movement must be centered on climate and environmental justice. But what do the terms actually mean to you? 

We asked some of the Black activists leading the fight for climate justice across the US to tell us in their own words. Swipe through to learn from these four leaders! #BlackHistoryMonth 

----------------- 

Kari Fulton is an award-winning environmental and climate justice organizer, advocate, and writer. Her work has been featured in various media including Black Entertainment Television (BET), Teen Vogue, Essence Magazine, and Chinese Global Television Network (CGTN). Currently, Fulton serves as the frontline policy coordinator with the Climate Justice Alliance and is an alumna of Howard University and Georgetown University.  Her work can be found at www.checktheweather.net 

----------------- 

Born and raised in Detroit, Michigan, Jeremy Orr currently works as a senior attorney for the Natural Resources Defense Council. And you can follow him on Twitter @jeremyforr. 

----------------- 

Born in Gallatin, Tennessee and now living in Atlanta, Chandra Farley is an activist at heart and credits her parents with instilling a sense of duty to always do what she can to advance justice and fairness. With a passion for elevating the connection between environmental stewardship, strong communities, and our daily lives, she currently develops local and regional strategies to advance equity-centered energy, utility and climate policies informed by first and most impacted communities that stand to benefit the most from a just transition to a clean energy future. @chandrafarley on Twitter, @chandraresolves on Instagram. 

---------------- 

@TeronMcGrew is co-chair of the Climate Reality Project: San Francisco Bay Area Chapter and CEO, McGrew & Associates, a fair housing, legislation, development, urban ecology and construction and sustainability company working to improve the lives of marginalized communities in Oakland, California.

Description: The Trump Administration announced on Tuesday that it is beginning the process of auctioning off nearly 1.6 million acres of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to lock in drilling rights before President-elect Joe Biden takes office in January. #ANWR should not be up for auction – the refuge is home to more than 270 species, several of which are threatened or endangered. We need to preserve our environment to protect our climate, not give Big Polluters a free pass to endanger our future. Source: https://wapo.st/2KcwW9b

Title: NA
Description:
Our hearts are with the people of Honduras, Nicaragua, and surrounding countries as they cope with incredible devastation and rebuild their communities in the wake of Hurricane Iota, which made landfall just two weeks after Hurricane Eta.

When it comes to the climate crisis in 2020, unprecedented extreme weather events have seemingly battered communities around the world week after week. We've seen all too clearly how the climate crisis fuels this destruction. The science is clear: Without urgent, ambitious action to reduce emissions and transition to a global clean energy economy, hurricane seasons like this will become a new normal. 

As we continue to beat back the worsening COVID-19 crisis, we cannot forget that the climate crisis is also an existential threat to our health, safety, and security, especially for the world’s most vulnerable communities and groups. In order to rebuild our economies, protect our health, and safeguard our future, our recovery from the pandemic must be bound together with taking climate action.

(Image from NOAA / NESDIS Center for Satellite Applications and Research)

Title: NA

Title: NA
Description:
Here’s something that will give you #ClimateHope! Last month, the governments of Japan and South Korea both committed to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. This is exactly the type of ambitious climate commitment that it’s going to take to solve the climate crisis and usher in an era of sustainable growth. It’s also a reminder of the power of regular people raising their voices for climate action. 

But let’s be clear: we still need to go bigger, faster, and more specific. Nations around the globe need to take immediate action and provide clear plans on how they will rapidly transition away from fossil fuels and invest in the energies of tomorrow. 

We’re excited to see Japan and South Korea take this bold step, because they know that taking on the climate crisis is a major opportunity to spur economic growth and invest in the health of their people. And we can’t wait to see which nations step up next.

Title: NA
Description:
The duty of the Supreme Court is to faithfully and fairly uphold the laws of our nation, free from political or ideological influence. Thus far, the nomination process for a new Justice has been anything but apolitical, and Judge Amy Coney Barrett’s long-running ties to the oil and gas industry and prior record on  issues relevant to environment protections make her a concerning choice for a lifetime appointment to our nation’s highest court.

 The functioning of our democracy hinges on ensuring the court remains fair, unbiased, and uncompromised, especially in its judgments on critical climate legislation and its ability to uphold the authority of agencies like the EPA to regulate carbon dioxide as a pollutant. The Climate Reality Project – and millions of people around the country – believe we cannot uphold the Constitution’s most sacred promises without bold, ambitious climate action that meets the urgency of this crisis.

Title: NA
Description:
Fifteen years ago this weekend, Hurricane Katrina came ashore in Louisiana with historic fury. By the time the waters receded, an estimated 1,833 people had died, millions of people along the Gulf Coast were displaced, and 80 percent of New Orleans had flooded. 
 
But what started as a natural disaster had also become a man-made catastrophe. Its human toll was a direct result of systemic inequities and the types of environmental racism that leave Black and Brown communities in the areas most susceptible to storm damage, with little or no support when disaster strikes. And while hundreds of thousands evacuated, those who were too poor to do so were left to ride out a historic storm. Nearly 2,000 didn’t make it. 
 
After the storm moved on, a slow response operation made matters worse. Residents waited on their rooftops to be rescued. Others waded through dangerous waters in the hopes of finding safety. In the Superdome, evacuees endured dangerous and unsanitary conditions. In many cases, help came far too late — or never came at all. 
 
As climate activists, we know that warming ocean waters will make powerful storms like Hurricane Katrina more common. We’ve seen it this week, as Hurricane Laura’s destructive path tore through the Gulf Coast region once again. 
 
But we must also acknowledge that structural inequalities and entrenched discrimination make communities of color more likely to bear the brunt of the climate crisis. We saw how the Lower Ninth Ward suffered and was abandoned in New Orleans during Hurricane Katrina. To honor the legacy of those we lost 15 years ago, we must keep climate justice at the heart of our cause, and do the work needed to dismantle the systems of oppression that have led to suffering and catastrophe time and time again. 
 
Sources: https://cnn.it/31do8WZ, https://bit.ly/3gebQBz

Title: NA
Description:
We’re continuing to celebrate International Youth Day by featuring some of the incredible youth Climate Reality Leaders making a difference for our planet and future! 

Tonight, we’re featuring Marie-Claire Graf, 24, from Zurich, Switzerland, who was trained at our 2017 event in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

“Intergenerational equity is at the heart of unprecedented climate action. Youth must sit at the table when decisions are taken and be included in climate-related policy formulation and its implementation. Together with Climate Reality Leaders around the world, we are demanding a rapid and just system change.”

------

We’re also excited to introduce one of our newly trained Climate Reality Leaders, Brynne Rardin, 24, from Concord, NH, who recently attended our first-ever virtual training!

“Climate change warms our oceans, which in turn kills our oceans’ coral reefs and thus affects the marine food chain. This food chain is directly linked to the 70 percent of oxygen we receive into our atmosphere from the ocean. If these chains start to be broken because of climate change, humans and animals everywhere will suffer immensely. As an underwater videographer, I work to visually educate people on the importance of our oceans and sharks and ways in which every single person can make small steps to create positive change.”

Title: NA
Description:
Today, we’re celebrating International Youth Day by highlighting some of our incredible youth Climate Reality Leaders who are making an impact around the world. 

First up is Kevin Patel, 19, from the US. Kevin was trained at our 2018 Los Angeles training!

“Climate change is a fact of life that people in cities around the world have to live with every day. It is a grave threat to our health, our environment, and our safety — and it shouldn’t be debatable or negotiable. So it’s important that during International Youth Day, we not only uplift young people who are doing this important work of making a difference but we ourselves start taking the necessary steps to change the world and support youth making the difference.”

----

We’re also excited to feature Beatrice Ann Dolores, 24, from Laguna, Philippines, who was trained in 2016 in Manila!

“You cannot love and care about something you don't know. Spend more time with nature to realize how precious it is for us to take good care of it now. The world might have come to a halt because of this pandemic, but environmental degradation hasn't. Let's keep bringing awareness, increase our carbon sinks (protect our forests and plant more native trees) and call for a just, sustainable transition of our countries.”

Title: NA
Description:
On July 25, a Japanese transport ship crashed on coral reefs just off the coast of Mauritius. By Thursday, August 6, the freighter began spilling its contents into the Indian Ocean - an estimated 4,000 tons of fuel.

The result?

The declaration of a “state of environmental emergency” by Mauritian Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth.

The jeopardized well-being of people and rare biodiversity alike, including the UNESCO World Heritage Ramsar wetlands.

A severely threatened Mauritian economy because of its dependence on healthy marine ecosystems.

This is our world on fossil fuels.

To protect our climate and the right of every person to a healthy environment, it’s time to move past fossil fuels with a just and equitable transition to clean energy.

Sources: https://bbc.in/33Q2XM7 & https://bit.ly/33Ne1tC

Title: NA
Description:
Today, we’re celebrating Juneteenth, honoring Black freedom, resistance, and liberation. On June 19, 1865, Union general Gordon Granger arrived in Texas to inform enslaved black people about their freedom – two years after the Emancipation Proclamation. ⁣⁣⠀
⁣⁣⠀
Juneteenth is a day of celebration, education, and community for Black people in America – and this year, that includes the fight against systemic and environmental racism, and police brutality. ⁣⁣⠀
⁣⁣⠀
We encourage you to organize and support the ongoing fight for racial justice in America in whatever ways you are able. #BlackLivesMatter #Juneteenth

Title: NA
Description: That’s a wrap! 🎉 Thank you to the more than 1,750 Climate Reality Leaders that took action around the world to lead the global climate conversation during 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action. Want to join the fight and keep taking action? Find out how with the link in our bio ➡️🌎

Title: NA
Description: Today is the big day! For the next 24 hours, people on all seven continents are coming together for a global conversation about the climate crisis – and what we can do to address it. We hope that you’re able to take part in 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action by attending a presentation in your own community (if you do, share your photos with us with #TruthIntoAction). Or, if you can’t attend a presentation, join us throughout the day on our social media channels to be a part of the conversation. Click the link in our bio to find a presentation near you today! ➡️🌎

Title: NA
Description:
Tomorrow is the big day! We are less than 24 hours away from 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action. We are so excited to see everyone attend and present around the world. If you haven’t RSVP’d for a presentation yet, it’s not too late. 
Climate Reality Leaders like Anisha Sharma, a senior at Appalachian State University, are excited for you to join the global climate conversation. Her presentation will focus on the climate crisis in the Appalachia region, especially as it relates to jobs, weather-related worries, and the larger human impact of this crisis. If you don’t live near this presentation, don’t worry! Click the link in our bio to find a presentation in a community near you: ➡️

Title: NA
Description:
Two days and counting until 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action! You can still make a difference in the climate fight – all you have to do is sign up and attend a presentation near you! 
We’re excited to see Climate Reality Leaders like Patryk Białas preparing to present on the big day. He’ll be talking about dirty energy… from inside a historic Polish coal mine! How cool is that? Patryk will be presenting alongside six other speakers about the green future and a fair transition to clean energy. Find out how you can attend with the link in our bio: ➡️ #TruthIntoAction

Title: NA
Description:
We’re only three days away from 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action! If you haven’t already, you can still sign up to participate in this incredible global climate conversation. 
Climate Reality Leader Rituraj Phukan is known for giving the Truth in 10 presentation during his many exciting journeys around the globe. For this year’s 24 Hours of Reality, he’s heading to Majuli, the world's largest river island, which is facing the twin challenges of destructive flooding and mass erosion. It’s time we talk about solutions to this crisis – find out how you can make a difference by clicking the link in our bio ➡️ #TruthIntoAction

Title: NA
Description:
Four days away! 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action is coming up quick – but you still have time to RSVP to attend a presentation about the climate crisis and its solutions in a community near you. 
We’re excited to see presenters like David Rodwell – who is going above and beyond by giving 28 presentations in just 24 hours. By partnering with a local cinema, David will be giving quick, fact-filled, and free presentations to moviegoers to get all of their questions about the climate crisis answered before they sit back and enjoy the show! 
Click the link in our bio to find out how you can attend a presentation near you! ➡️🎬

Title: NA
Description:
We are only five days away from 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action! We’re so excited to see more than 1,500 presentations happening as part of this worldwide global climate conversation. 
During the event, Asif Iqbal will be presenting in the small village of District Mansehra, Pakistan, where the campaign "Solar For Her" has equipped a Community Model Girls School with solar technology. The campaign's plan is to establish 30 solar-powered schools for girls in every province of Pakistan! We can’t wait to see presentations like Asif’s around the world. Click the link in our bio to sign up and attend a presentation near you! ➡️

Title: NA
Description:

Join us for 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action on November 20-21. Over 1,300 Climate Reality Leaders across all 50 states and on all seven continents will deliver presentations discussing the climate crisis and its solutions. Click the link in our bio to find out how to participate➡️ #ClimateByTheNumbers

Title: NA
Description:
There are only 10 days until 24 Hours of Reality: Truth in Action! As we count down to the big day – we’ll be featuring a few of our most exciting presentations! 
During 24 Hours, Linh Do, our Australian branch manager, will be discussing the climate crisis and its solutions with 100 women aboard the fourth Homeward Bound voyage ship in Antarctica. Thanks to her hard work, Climate Reality Leaders will be represented on all seven continents. Find out how you can attend a presentation near you with the link in our bio ➡️ #TruthIntoAction

Title: NA
Description:
"I live in a city which is one of the most polluted in Mexico and Latin America. I’m aware of the global situation as well as the local, concerning climate change. I’m taking action, but there’s still so much to do and to learn. By raising our voice and striking, I’m sure there will be more and more people aware of this big problem, and eventually, we will all understand that we ALL need to change our bad habits that have been affecting our planet for decades. Until then, we must continue raising our voices. We are all part of the problem, but we are all part of the solution." - Edgar Sánchez (@edgar13sanchez )

With the Global Climate Strike happening TOMORROW, we're counting down to the day-of by sharing why some of our Climate Reality leaders are striking! Click the link in our bio to join the strike: 🌎➡️ #strikewithus

Title: NA
Description:
“I'm involved with climate activism because I don't really have any other choice. We are currently suffering the consequences of climate change and it will only continue to get worse within our lifetimes. We have an obligation to fix the damage that we've done to the planet that gives us life. I'm striking on September 20th because I want a livable environment for myself, for our society, and for our ecosystems; and I want our world leaders to take the necessary steps to ensure that.” - Toni Sleugh (@toinysluge)

With the Global Climate Strike in TWO days, we'll be counting down to the day-of by sharing why some of our Climate Reality leaders are striking! Click the link in our bio to join the strike: 🌎➡️ #StrikeWithUs

Title: NA
Description:
“I am a climate justice activist because my life and the lives my entire generation depend on it. I am striking because it is pointless to study for a future that does not exist. I am striking for complete system change. Will you strike with me?” - Jamie Margolin (@jamie_s_margolin) 
With the Global Climate Strike in three days, we’ll be counting down to the day-of by sharing why some of our youth Climate Reality leaders are striking! Click the link in our bio to join the strike: 🌎➡️ #StrikeWithUs

Title: NA
Description:
We all grew up learning that the government represents us, the American people. So, what happened? Since taking office, the president and his cabinet of Big Oil insiders have done their best to reverse years of progress addressing the climate crisis. 😖
.
But outside the White House, the majority of Americans know that our climate is changing and support commonsense solutions. In fact, seven out of 10 Americans want the government to confront the crisis and support clean energy over dirty fossil fuels. 🇺🇸
. 
And that tells us something: He may be the president, but he doesn’t speak for us on climate. We are the Climate Majority. Will you join us? Add your name now: climaterealityproject.org/climatemajority (link in bio and story) 🌎

Description:
When you think of @NASA, you probably think of astronauts and satellites. But NASA doesn’t just study other planets — it studies *our* planet (Earth system science). And that includes our changing climate. Now, meet Jim Bridenstine. NASA’s newest administrator, he has no scientific background and doesn’t own up to the fact that humans are the primary cause for our changing climate (link in bio). It’s not rocket science: We deserve competent leaders who know Earth’s climate is changing due to our burning of fossil fuels. 🚀
.
Now more than ever, it’s important to arm yourself with the facts: climaterealityproject.org/facts (link in bio and story) 🌍
.

Description:
As the reality of the climate crisis becomes more apparent and urgent by the day, activists like you know that *every day* should be Earth Day. The facts are clear that our climate is changing and that we need to take action to save our planet before it’s too late. 🌎
.
At Climate Reality, we know we can solve this crisis, and we’re optimistic about the future. We have the tools in our hands to transition to clean, renewable energy around the globe and create a safer environment for us all. But we can’t do it alone. 🌱
.
Download our free new e-book, 24 Reasons to Choose Hope, to find out why we’re more hopeful than ever about the future of our planet and how you can help in the fight for climate solutions: climaterealityproject.org/choosehope (link in bio)👆

Title: NA
Description:
Here are the #Facts: Weather is what’s happening outside the door right now; today a snowstorm or a thunderstorm is approaching. Climate, on the other hand, is the pattern of weather measured over decades. ✅
.
.
.
#ActonClimate #ClimateChange #ClimateFacts #FactCheck #ClimateAction #Weather #Climate
Image Text: FACT: WEATHER IS NOT CLIMATE. WEATHER is what we see over a short period of time in a given location. CLIMATE is the average weather patterns we see over decades. @CLIMATEREALITY FACEBOOK.COM/CLIMATEREALITY The Climate Reality Project

Title: NA
Description:
Mr. President, we recommend our free e-book (link in our bio and our story). In it, we explain why global warming doesn't mean the absence of cold weather or snow. 
The simple fact is that climate change throws natural systems out of balance. Since 1950, hot days have become more common and cold days have become less common around the world. In the US, record-high temperatures are being set more than twice as often as record-cold temperatures. 
The bottom line is this: “Less cold” doesn’t mean “never cold.” Cold days – and the snowstorms that come with them – will happen less often as the world warms, but they won’t go away.

Peter Kalmus Climate Scientist

Title: NA
Description:
Scientists have warned for decades that some kinds of extreme weather are becoming more frequent and intense as more heat-trapping gases get pumped into the atmosphere. As the planet warms, more water evaporates from the oceans. Hotter air also holds more moisture. 

THIS IS NOT NORMAL. 

Countries contributing the least to climate change are affected beyond measure. 

TAKE ACTION NOW. CALL FOR CLIMATE EMERGENCY. 

#ClimateEmergency #actnow #SaveThePlanet #GlobalWarming #climatecrisis

Title: NA
Description:
@xrsaopaulo RESISTÊNCIA PELA EXISTÊNCIA Resisting for our existence! 

Brazil is the country with the most biodiversity in the world. But we are also the champions of forest fires.

We have lost more than 20% of the Amazon in the last 4 years due to an irresponsible government.

We wash the flag to get rid of the blood of all beings, humans and other living beings that are being murdered for economic gains in our country.

#climateemergency #amazonforest #juststopoil @extinctionrebellionbrasil #savetheamazon #climateactivist

O Brasil é o país com a maior biodiversidade do mundo. No entanto, somos também campeões em desmatamento e queimadas. Desde que os primeiros colonizadores chegaram aqui, perdemos muito de nossas florestas e espécies. A Mata Atlântica, bioma que cobre 15% do território nacional, foi praticamente varrida do mapa. Segundo dados da Fundação SOS Mata Atlântica, hoje restam pouco mais de 12% de sua área original.

A Floresta Amazônica, infelizmente, segue pelo mesmo caminho. Já perdeu mais de 20% de seu território - parte significativa disso só nos últimos 4 anos, devido a um governo irresponsável cujo líder declarou ter interesse apenas em sua riqueza mineral, desconsiderando por completo sua biodiversidade e as populações indígenas que ali habitam. Populações essas, aliás, que ajudam a proteger a floresta.

Lavamos a bandeira para lavar o sangue de todos os seres, humanos e não-humanos, massacrados pelo descaso e pelo interesse exclusivamente econômico em nossas matas. Por Bruno Pereira, Dom Phillips e tantos outros que se foram nas mãos desse governo genocida e ecocida. Resistimos para existirmos!

📸1, 4 e 5: @victrbravo / Greenpeace Brasil 
📸2, 3 e 6: @camillac.dias 

#climatestrike #greveglobalpeloclima #extinctionrebellion #extinctionrebellionbook

Description:

They were raising awareness of the need for an oil and gas free DRC through music, talks and creative artistic performances. 

Many people joined to mobilise for a#FossilFreeVirunga and enjoy the arts in an incredible atmosphere.

As we await the outcome of the recent oil auctions in the DRC, XR Université de Goma continue their mission to keep oil companies out of Virunga National Park and out of the Congo. We love their creative ways of mobilising and spreading awareness. 

#ConcertPourLeClimat
#CongoFossilFree
#Goma
#ClimateJustice
#DontAuctionCongoPeatlands

Description:
Can individual lifestyle change help to tackle the climate and ecological emergency, or is it an unhelpful distraction?

System change is not a “get out of jail free” card

#CongoFossilFree

Yesterday activists from a collaboration of groups took action in London in solidarity with activists in the DRC against the oil auctions happening today and yesterday 🇨🇩.

They handed in a letter to the DRC embassy, and also visited BP and Shell (who announced record profits yesterday) warning them not to invest in the auction. 

Voices were raised through placards with messages from DRC activists and speeches. Clear messages were shared to cancel debt and provide reparations and climate finance for a just transition to a resilient and peaceful Congo.

Title: NA
Description:
Don’t Auction Congo’s Peatlands for oil 🇨🇩 ACTION IN LONDON
 
On the 28th and 29th of July 27 oil blocks will be auctioned in the DRC (significantly increased from the previously planned 16 blocks). 9 of which lie in climate critical Peatlands in the Congo basin, and 2 of which lie in Virunga National Park.

Join the global resistance against this catastrophic sale, which will remove indigenous people from their land, continue to abuse human rights in the DRC and cause unthinkable damage to the climate and biodiversity

WHEN: 10.45am Thursday 28th July 
WHERE: Outside the DRC embassy in London - 281 Gray’s Inn Road, WC1X 8QF
WHAT: as well as visiting the DRC embassy we will visit BP and Shell’s HQs, warning them not to invest and delivering letters. Bring placards with the message #CongoFossilFree!
WHO: The campaign is a collaborative resistant and all groups and individuals are welcome

Use the digital toolkit for more info on the link @envirobite and other actions including social media posts, donations and petitions!

@xr_universite_de_goma

Title: NA
Description:
$3bn a day of pure profit made by the oil and gas industry means that they have the power to

'Buy every politician, every system' and delay action on the climate crisis.

Emissions from the burning of fossil fuels are the main contributors to the climate emergency, something that oil companies have known for decades.

To keep to 1.5c means that oil companies alone would have to forgo $100 trillion in profit which is why they have done everything possible to stop all efforts to switch to our energy systems.

We are suffering at 1.2C of warming. The huge cost of power is crippling people all over the world. Oil rich nations deliberately obstruct supply to drive up prices too.

So are we going to continue paying through the nose for something that is killing us and killing our planet, or are we going to do something about it?

#ClimateEmergency #juststopoil #SaveThePlanet

Title: NA
Description:
🚨In case of medical climate emergency break glass🚨 

This morning medical professionals have broken the windows of @jpmorgan to protest the continuing financing of new fossil fuel developments.

This is a peaceful act of civil disobedience.

Why?

The next few days bring unprecedented deadly heat to the UK and the Met office has issued its first ever extreme heat red warning.

Despite these impacts of continued fossil fuel burning and climate breakdown JP Morgan is still funding new fossil fuel developments.

The climate crisis can’t wait we need to act now as Dr Elena McKeown, fmr chair of the @thebma BMA make clear the climate emergency is a health emergency - forging a path to net zero has never been more important.

Leading medical journal the Lancet says ‘climate change is the greatest global health threat facing the world in the 21st-century but it is also the greatest opportunity to redefine the social and environmental determinants of health’

A report by @unicef UNICEF published last year describes how already over 1 billion children’s lives are at extremely high risk from climate breakdown.

Gov.uk state ‘Tackling the climate climate crisis as a health determinant is a crucial aspect of the role of health and care professionals’

What, when governments and investments refuse to act on repeat scientific warnings?

We protest as a considered last resort as medical professionals we have sworn oath to protect public health.

We are proud to step into long tradition of medical protest to defend lives.

#juststopoil #climateemergency #climatechange #healthcrisis #savetheplanet #climateemergency

Title: NA
Description:
☀️ HERE COMES THE SUN ☀️ 

The Global North braces for some of the hottest temperatures ever recorded (up to 40C/104F in some areas) in the coming days. You see, back in 2020 the UK Meteorological Office using long-range climate models made a mock-up weather forecast to see what kind of temperatures we would be facing in 2050. Well the plausible has become a reality three decades early. 

When people are exposed to extreme heat, they can suffer from potentially deadly illnesses, such as heat exhaustion and heat stroke.

The Goverment isn’t responding to the crisis today or building a better future. ⁣
⁣
Any fool can see that 2050 is too late for net zero. It's time to share the science, and stand up for the billions of lives at stake, if we fail to act like it's an emergency.⁣

Join the movement. See link in bio. 
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Post a photo of yourself with a placard/message such as:
 
‘Don’t auction Congo’s Peatlands’
‘No oil exploration in the Congo Basin’

Use the hashtags #CongoFossilFree and #DontAuctionCongoPeatlands and tag @xr_universite_de_goma in your posts.

Cabinet ministers in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) have approved the auction of 16 land blocks for oil extraction worth $650bn at the end of July, including peatlands that form some of the world’s most important carbon sinks.
 

The land will be auctioned to oil giants on the 28th and 29th of July 2022.
• A significant proportion of the blocks overlap with the world’s largest tropical peatland complex in the Congo Basin.  

• The Congo Basin is the world’s second largest carbon sink after the Amazon.
• The peatland stores approximately 30 billion tons of carbon - equivalent to about 82% of annual global carbon dioxide emissions.

Unequal development pathways imposed by appropriation of Congo’s wealth has created $11 billion of official Congolese debt

Until the debt is cancelled the Congo will be reliant on fossil fuel extraction to create revenue to pay off the interest.

#congofossilfree #dontauctioncongopeatlands 
#xrglobal

Title: NA
Description:
to view the full article visit:
bit.ly/3u13MOr

Anxiety and Alienation
Navigating Your Relationships in an Age of Climate Crisis
Wednesday, June 08, 2022 by Neil Simpson @nrichsimps 
with original artwork by Dustin Jacobus @solarpunkart 

The climate and ecological crisis smashes around inside my head like rocks in a washing machine. 

When I hit general anxiety overflow, my family and friends usually help me to express myself, and I feel better. When it comes to eco-anxiety, however, my experience is often different.

I feel adrift and alienated in my feelings for an issue that does not warrant alienation. I began to wonder: how many other people feel this way? There must be loads of us.

Capitalism necessitates individualisation so that we continue consuming. If my anxiety regarding the climate and ecological crisis is regarded as a problem within me, an individual, I can be sold solutions. 

If members of your personal collective aren’t willing to confront the enormous threat that the climate crisis represents, it is crucial that you find like-minded communities. 

Try not to pull away from those you love, despite how they make you feel when you talk about the climate and ecological crisis. As Joanna Macy says, “Of all the dangers we face, from climate change to nuclear wars, none is so great as the deadening of our response.” 

#climateanxiety 
#regenerativeculture 
#xrglobalarticle

Title: NA
Description:
Dinsdag, de afsluitende actiedag van de Rebellie tegen de fossiele industrie! Meer dan 300 rebellen waren afgelopen dinsdag op de been. 175 rebellen lieten zich arresteren. 

We hebben blokkades opgezet in het havengebied (hier later meer over) en in het centrum van Rotterdam. Voor het hoofdkantoor van Shell, bij het hofplein. Samen eisen wij een einde aan de fossiele industrie en een rechtvaardige transitie voor iedereen, zowel in Nederland als daarbuiten. 

We hebben het Hofplein platgelegd door middel van een massale actie. Zolang de fossiele industrie haar verantwoordelijk niet neemt blijven wij terugkomen!!

—————————— e n g l i s h 

Tuesday, the last day of the Rebellion against the fossil fuel industry! Last Tuesday more than 300 rebels were out on the streets. 175 rebels were arrested. 

We set up blockades in the port area (more on this later) and in the center of Rotterdam. In front of Shell's headquarters, near the hofplein. Together we demand an end to the fossil fuel industry and a just transition for everyone, both in the Netherlands and abroad. 

We shut down the Hofplein with a mass action. As long as the fossil fuel industry doesn’t take their responsibility we will keep coming back!!

📸; Amongst others: @pierrelarrieu (@studiohanslucas) and Steffie Emmerson

Title: NA
Description:
Why we are here? Our demands.
1. Tell the truth.
Governments must tell the truth by declaring a climate and ecological emergency, working with other institutions to communicate the urgency for change.

2. Act now.
Governments must act now to halt biodiversity loss and reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero by 2025.

3. Go beyond politics.
Governments must create and be led by the decisions of a Citizens’ Assembly on climate and ecological justice.

Title: NA
Description:
De Rebellie tegen de Fossiele Industrie is begonnen! Ons Kick-Off protest begon in de regen, maar het klaarde al snel op. Prachtige speeches en een fossiele dans zetten de Walk of Resistance goed in. 

Op het eerste stoppunt hielden we een begrafenis van onze moeder: Moeder Aarde. Begeleid met vioolmuziek rouwden wij om alles wat we nu al hebben verloren en we vervolgden ons protest met een stille tocht. 

Op het volgende stoppunt was er een die-in met een krachtige speech over de schade die de fossiele industrie de aarde allemaal al heeft aangedaan. Daarna vervolgden wij onze tocht om te eindigen bij OASE om samen te eten en te ontspannen. 

Want dit was pas de eerste dag. Morgen staat er nog veel te wachten. 

Bedankt aan iedereen die mee heeft gelopen, heeft gesproken, of anders heeft bijgedragen aan dit prachtige Kick-Off Protest van de Rebellie tegen de Fossiele Industrie. 

We zijn begonnen. Tot morgen. 
Liefde en woede. 

(Foto credits: Jaap van den Berg en Steffie Emmerson) Posted @withregram • @extinctionrebellionnl

Title: NA
Description:
! BREAKING ! ACTIVISTS DISRUPT AFRICA ENERGIES SUMMIT​​​​​​​ IN MAYFAIR, LONDON DEMANDING AN END TO OIL COLONIALISM.

A coalition of groups including  XR Africa, Sustaining the Wild Coast, StopEACOP, African's Rising, The Green Connection, Oceans Not Oil, Jubilee for Climate, XR UK, XRY, 350.org and Greenpeace UK have disrupted day one of the Africa Energies Summit in London. The group hung 'END OIL COLONIALISM' and 'JUSTICE FOR AFRICA' banners and blockaded the doors to the 5-star hotel. Voice recordings from African activists were played and placards displayed with messages from activists from South Africa, Namibia, Nigeria, the DRC and Uganda. 

The summit is sponsored by oil giants Shell, Total, ReconAfrica, Perenco and Schlumberger and more, all who have published record profits in the last quarter and continue to sign new oil deals in debt-burdened African nations, who have contributed the least to the climate crisis, yet suffer the consequences of fossil fuel exploitation the most. 

Continued oil exploitation in Africa is a form of neo-colonialism, with governments tied into making oil deals due to crippling debt repayments to Global North countries, and the majority of oil profit going to companies from the Global North. New fossil fuel projects tie the world into emissions that we can't afford, and communities on the ground into suffering rather than benefting from exploitation. 

Only 55% of Africans have electrcity and only 2% of global renewable energy investment is in Africa. Limiting global heating to 1.5ºC means 7 x the current investment into renewables in Africa. Africa needs a #JustTransition to renewable energy.

#EndOilColonialism

#JusticeForAfrica Extinction Rebellion Africa Extinction Rebellion UK 350.org Greenpeace UK  Oceans NotOil @xr shef

Title: NA
Description:
Die Red Rebels sind eine internationale Performance-Aktivistengruppe, die auf die globale Umweltkrise mit eindrucksvollen, nonverbalen Prozessionen und Tableaus auf der Straße aufmerksam machen will.

Sie wurde von Doug Francisco und Justine Squire von Bristols “Invisible Circus” für die erste Rebellions Woche von Extinction Rebellion UK im April 2019 in London entwickelt und geht auf eine Zeitlupen-Pantomime Show aus den 90er Jahren zurück. Damals ganz in Weiß gekleidet begleiteten die geisterhaften Darsteller auch Friedensproteste, beispielsweise 2003 während der Demonstrationen gegen den Irak Krieg.

Die Wahl von Rot als Rebellions-Farbe ist teils ästhetisch, teils symbolisch zu erklären, indem Rot für das Leben und das Blut, was alles Lebendige vereint, aber auch für Leidenschaft und Gefahr steht. Das bewusst langsame Dahinschreiten, die wehenden roten Tücher und die maskenhaft geschminkten Gesichter sorgen für einen starken Kontrast zu den traditionell lauten, ungeordneten Straßenprotesten. Die Performance kreiert ein Momentum des Innehaltens und schafft mitten auf der Straße Raum für die Trauer, die viele von uns angesichts der Klimakrise und des Artensterbens erfüllt. So begleiten die Red Rebels viele Aktionen von Extinction Rebellion und anderen Umweltaktivisten, sorgen für eine starke Bildsprache, sind aber ebenso ausgleichend und befriedend wirksam.

Mittlerweile haben sich Red Rebels Gruppen in vielen Ländern der Welt gegründet. Sie bestehen aus engagierten Menschen ohne speziell künstlerischen oder performativen Hintergrund, nähen sich die Kostüme in der Regel selber und üben die Bewegungen gemeinsam nach den Lehr-Videos der Gründer ein. Jede und jeder ist willkommen, der/die diese Art des nonverbalen, künstlerischen Protestes für sich entdecken möchte!

Photos von @gilbertocavalli 

🇮🇹Testo in italiano nel post di Facebook

Posted @withregram • @xr.bz 

@redrebelbrigade #redrebels #redrebelbrigade #pace #peace #friede #nonviolenza #gawaltfrei #iveco #bolzano #bozen #altoadige #südtirol

Title: NA
Description:
Caption by @atmos: 

We’re heartbroken by the devastating news in the U.S. 

The leaked draft opinion obtained by POLITICO from the U.S. Supreme Court indicting the overturning of Roe v. Wade is nothing short of an assault on human rights. Once officially published, the ruling's immediate impact would end federal protections of abortion rights, leaving it up to individual states to decide a person’s right to choose what to do with their body. 

To be clear, like many unruly laws in the U.S., this overturning is a direct attack on low-income, working-class communities of color that will be most impacted by the decision. This is the case for many of the crises we’re currently facing. The effects go to show just how intertwined these issues really are—all operating under a patriarchal, capitalist system prioritizing power, control, and capital over human lives. 

Fighting for reproductive rights means fighting for LGBTQIA+ rights, worker rights, Indigenous rights, and yes—the right to a clean and healthy environment for all. 

Caption: @atmos

Source: POLITICO
. 
. 
. 
. 
#abortionrights #SCOTUS #roevwade #supremecourt #womensrights #lgbtqrights #humanrights #climatechange #climatecrisis #workersrights #vote #votingrights #droughts #studentloans #reproductiverights #healthcare #racialjustice #healthcare

Title: NA
Description:
The people least responsible for the climate crisis are suffering the most from its consequences.

The heatwave being experienced in India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh shows the disproportionate effects the climate crisis brings to the Most Affected People and Areas (MAPA).

As temperatures reach record levels, the lives of millions continue to be at risk. 

1st photograph: June 24, 2015, Pakistan Declares a State of Emergency as Heat Wave Death Toll Soars to Nearly 800 as temperatues reached 45°C (113°F). Photograph by Sabir Mazhar via @time 

2nd photograph: June 4, 2017, Pakistani people bathe in a canal to beat the heat and get some relief from the extremely hot weather during the eighth day of Ramadan. On this day, maximum temperatures of 47°C (116.6°F) were recorded in Lahore, Pakistan. Photograph by Rana Sajid Hussain via @natgeo

3rd photograph: June 11, 2019, Women fetching water from an opening in a dried-up lake in Chennai, India. During this heatwave temperatures reached 51°C (123°F). Photograph by P. Ravikumar via @nytimes 

4th photograph: April 25, 2022, A forest on fire in Dharmsala, India. The average maximum temperature for northwest and central India in April was the highest since records began 122 years ago, reaching 35.9°C and 37.78°C (96.62°F and 100°F) respectively, according to the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD). Photograph by Ashwini Bhatia via @apnews 

#heatwave #MAPA #Pakistan #India #Bangladesh #temperaturerise #climatecrisis #climatechange 

Posted @withregram • @ecoresolution

Title: NA
Description:
This Critical Mass (occupation of the road in soft mobility), adapted to children, allowed families and anyone who wanted to join the procession to reappropriate public space. This made them visible to relay on their behalf, the three demands of Extinction Rebellion:

- the declaration of an emergency for the climate and biodiversity by the government, 
- the complete stop of greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 
- the establishment of local, cantonal, national and international citizens' assemblies. 

We believe that for many people, especially families, participation in demonstrations or acts of rebellion is sometimes logistically complicated. Their concerns remain unheard. We hope by this action to relay their existential preoccupations for the future and their wish to favour life.

It is around these questions that the XR Families group was born.

Let's act for our children, let's act for everyone!

#XRfamilies #ExtinctionRebellionFamilies #Switzerland #Lausane #Kidicalmass

Title: NA
Description:
More than one billion people are facing a relentless heatwave in India and Pakistan this week as a result of climate change.

Temperatures are forecast to reach 49° Celsius (120°F) along the border of the two countries in the coming days, meteorologists warn, under a record-breaking ‘heat dome’ for April. Late spring typically brings the hottest days of the year to India, before the cooling monsoon rains arrive in June. But it has been much hotter than average since early March as a result of climate change, imperilling millions of people and scorching crops the world is relying on.

“This heatwave is going to have an impact on more than 10 percent of the entire population of the planet”

cc euronews.green 

#heatwave #climatechange #climatecrisis

Title: NA
Description:
Posted @withregram • @futureearth 

Today marks the 12 year memorial of British Petroleum’s Deepwater Horizon — the largest oil spill in American history. For 85 days, the Earth bled 4.9 million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico.

It was an assault to wildlife, we lost so much. 3/4 of pregnant bottlenose dolphins miscarried that year, and 2-5 trillion young fish, 8 billion oysters, and 50% of coastal biodiversity died.

The fallacy that we can control nature, and that we should want to, was revealed. The oil company responsible for the disaster took little precaution, boasted the depths they drilled for that well, and still denounce the long-term effects.

As the Earth bled hydrocarbons that would poison the water and decimate the fisheries that rely on the Gulf, Tony Hayward, former chief of BP, shrugged and said “it’s a very big ocean.”

11 people died on the rig that day, doing the unseen “dirty work” that our economy runs on. 

Credit: photos (besides the first) by @danielbeltraphoto, information gathered from “On Fire: The Burning Case for a Green New Deal” by Naomi Klein

Title: NA
Description:
Yes, colonialism caused climate change.

At last, in its sixth report, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change acknowledged colonialism as a historical and ongoing driver of the climate crisis.

A large part of this landmark conclusion is driven by the fact that more social scientists, scientists of color, and women scientists were involved than in previous reports. The IPCC also engaged with more Indigenous authors—covering Indigenous knowledge in every chapter of the working group two report on the human impacts of climate change.

The @ipcc’s mention of colonialism shows how intersectionality can not only create more historically accurate climate reports—but also drive more well-rounded climate adaptation and mitigation efforts.

@atmos is credited for both post caption and post content. 

Follow them for more on climate justice!

Title: NA
Description:
During the night of April 6 in the center of Bogotá, an attack was seen against the Embera Katío indigenous peoples of the Colombian Pacific. Leaving more than 20 injured from the community, including pregnant women and children, this same community was displaced from its territory due to the armed conflict more than 1 year ago. Seeking a solution to their situation, they fled to Bogotá, the administrative, legislative and political center, to request a solution from the state entities. However, during their stay they have been the object of persecution by the mayor's office, not allowing them to stay in the public space or giving a solution for their safe return to the territory.

The forced displacement due to conflict is a dynamic that has been repeated with different indigenous peoples (and farmers) of Colombia who are displaced for the development of extractivism projects, including mining and industrial projects in their territory and even the cultivation of coca leaves by government-tied groups[0], the Colombian State has allowed this to continue to happen even with the tools to protect the reservations and even stop the armed conflict, going completely contrary to the statements made by the World Resources Institute (WRI) that states that 80% of indigenous lands are carbon sinks necessary to counteract the climate crisis[1] and the Peace agreement.

Not only displacement is enough, more than 81 indigenous people were murdered in Cauca as of October 2021 [2] and more than 122 massacres were seen in the 3 departments with the largest presence of indigenous peoples in Colombia[3].

The violent response by the police against yesterday's Embera demonstration in Bogotá belongs to the systematic persecution of defenders of the environment and life in the country with more environmental leaders assassinated.

#Colombia #IndigenousRights #IndigenousCommunity
