Title: NA
Description:
US AUCTIONS OFF OIL AND GAS DRILLING LEASES IN GULF OF MEXICO AFTER CLIMATE TALKS

Just four days after landmark climate talks in Scotland in which Joe Biden vowed the US will “lead by example” in tackling dangerous global heating, the president’s own administration is providing a jarring contradiction – the largest ever sale of oil and gas drilling leases in the Gulf of Mexico.

The enormous size of the lease sale – covering an area that is twice as large as Florida – is a blunt repudiation of Biden’s previous promise to shut down new drilling on public lands and waters. It has stunned environmentalists who argue the auction punctures the US’s shaky credibility on the climate crisis and will make it harder to avert catastrophic impacts from soaring global heating.

Experts have said that the development of new oil and gas fields must stop this year if the world is to avoid more disastrous heatwaves, floods and other climate impacts, with fossil fuel production on America’s public lands causing around a quarter of the country’s overall greenhouse gas pollution.
However, the oil and gas industries immediately objected to Biden’s move, claiming it imperiled jobs and risked pushing up energy prices, and a dozen states sued to lift the moratorium. In June, a federal judge in Louisiana agreed with the states and found that the government hadn’t taken the required steps to pause new leases. This courtroom setback has forced the Gulf of Mexico sale, according to the Biden administration.

Interior estimates that the 80+ million acre megasale will lead to the production of up to 1.12 billion barrels of oil, 4.42 trillion feet of gas. Burning this amount of oil and gas would result in more than 516 million metric tons of greenhouse gases, equivalent to 112 million cars, 130 coal-fired power plants operating for a year, or the carbon sequestered by 632 million acres of forests. 

Source: @earthjustice @guardian 

#stopdrilling #bidenadministration #climatecrisis #stopfossilfuels
Image Text: Earthjustice @Earthjustice BREAKING Today the Biden administration bowed to industry pressure and offered up 80 million acres of the Gulf of Mexico for lease to Big Oil. We will continue fighting in court on behalf of Gulf communities and our future to stop this lease sale.

Title: NA
Description:
CANCELLED AT COP

We're here to give you the latest news from the UN climate summit.

Today we are excited to share the updated list of fossil fuel projects cancelled during COP26. We can't wait to congratulate world leaders on their ambition.

By region, the total fossil fuel projects cancelled, during COP26:

THE EU CANCELLED: 0
THE US CANCELLED: 0
THE UK CANCELLED: 0
AUSTRALIA CANCELLED: 0
INDIA CANCELLED: 0
CHINA CANCELLED: 0
RUSSIA CANCELLED: 0
BRAZIL CANCELLED: 0
THE REST OF THE WORLD CANCELLED: 0

Today across the world they will announce the task ahead is difficult, but 1.5 degrees is still in reach. Some NGO's will even agree with them. But given the UK Government has failed to meet most of it's pledges on climate in the last 10 years, will they even meet these woefully inadequate climate targets anyway. 

Are they in denial, delusional, or deceiving us. To claim to believe we can keep global average temperature within just an extra 0.3C of warming without cancelling new and expanding fossil fuel projects is just lies. Since 2001 we've had a rise of 0.7C, and in 2021 we have 20% MORE fossil fuel infrastructure than 2001. Yet any attempt to make firm plans to stop funding fossil fuels have been lost from this process.

Two weeks ago world leaders were criticized for throwing coins in a wishing well.

Today as world leaders celebrate signing the death warrant of millions, we are required to do more than critique. It's time for mass civil resistance.

#ClimateEmergency #TellTheTruth #ActNow

Until world leaders tell the truth, act now, and empower citizens assemblies

We will disrupt and disobey to pressure for change

Description:
Most of us will be feeling intense disappointment, anger and grief about the outcome of COP26 - about world leaders’ shameless prioritisation of profit over planet. 
🌱
But we cannot let this grief paralyse us. We must feel it, deeply, and use it to power us forward. Let us draw on the resilience, power, and unstoppable determination that we have seen from countless people over the past two weeks - in Glasgow and across the world. Our fight for climate justice unites us across countries, seas, languages and cultures, and we will never, ever give up.
🌱
Thank you to everyone who joined COP26.tv and supported the channel. Thank you for caring, listening and sharing. COP is over, but please do stay tuned for updates and highlights from over the last two weeks of live-streaming ❤️

Title: NA
Description:
On November 6, XR Bogota @xrbogotaa takes to the streets of the city. It all started as a parody in which activists dressed up as Joe Biden, Boris Johnson, Jair Bolsonaro, and Ivan Duque on vacation at different locations in the city. Playing at the beach, partying in a car, posing for pictures at historical landmarks reflecting the carefree attitude and little commitment these heads of state have regarding the climate and environmental crisis. The action ended with a non-violent blockade of one of the major roads in Bogota, where climate activists detained and berated the politicians trying to teach and engage with them about their negligence using pedagogical actions involving onlookers, explaining the importance and urgency in stopping climate change.

El 6 de Noviembre, XR Bogota realiza una acción por las calles de la ciudad. Esta empieza con una parodia, la cual está compuesta por activistas disfrazados de Joe Biden, Boris Johnson, Bolsonaro e Iván Duque, estos personajes van a estar paseando muy despreocupados por la ciudad, intentando mostrar el poco compromiso y poca seriedad que tienen estos jefes de estado con las acciones para detener las crisis eco-climática. La acción termina en un lugar público con quienes interpretan a los jefes de estado siendo detenidos y juzgados por activistas, esto explica la negligencia y lleva acciones pedagógicas a quienes estén mirando, explicando la importancia y urgencia de tomar acciones para detener el cambio climático.

Intagram: @xrcolombiaa
Twitter: https://twitter.com/xrcolombiaaa
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/extinction.rebellionbogota.1

Title: NA
Description:
🚨🔥🔥🔥🔥🚨

탄소중립위원장 윤순진은 "COP26에 와 보니 한국이 제조업 비중이 높고 탄소배출 정점을 찍은 지 얼마 지나지 않은 사정을 감안할 때 이번 목표가 도전적이란 점을 인식하며 환영하는 분위기가 있다"고 말했다.

-----

몇십년 넘게 목표 계획만 외치고 있는 한국 및 부유국의 지배자들👺
심지어 그 목표마저 세계 온실가스 배출 7위 국가로서 처참한 수준입니다.💩

온실가스 감축 목표에는 들어가지도 않는 포스코,SK등 대기업이 세계의 바다와 땅에서 시추하고 투자하는 화석연료 
🛢🏗

엄청난 밀도의 공장식 축산업에서 매년 발생하는 구제역과 AI,이어지는 대규모 살처분을 생각해보세요. 
☠️🦠

결국 이 모든 위기와 이어진 코로나로 인해 평범한 사람들의 삶은 무너졌지만, 코로나 호황으로 온실가스 다배출 기업들의 주가는 고공행진 중 입니다.
📈

-----
👹
기후생태위기의 비상사태에 대응하지않는 주요 원인은 필요한 조치를 취하려는 정치적 의지가 없다는 것입니다. 

☠️
지배자들은 기후위기를 부정하는 전략에서 좋은 말을 늘어놓으며 실질적 조치를 지연시키는 전략으로 전환하고 있습니다.

📣
"올바른 말을 하는 것"은 매우 쉽지만, 이러한 단어를 필요한 실질적 조치로 행하는 것은 훨씬 어렵습니다.

🏭🤵🏻‍♂️
지금의 현상을 유지해야 이익을 얻는 이들의 엄청난 반대와,
그들과 유착되어 있거나 초라한 임시조치만 취한 채 책임을 회피하는 정치인.

🫀🎳
이들이 우리의 목숨을 건 게임을 하고 있는 것이 지금의 현실입니다.
우리가 그들을 자리에서 내려오게 하지 않으면, 변화는 불가능합니다. 

🏃🏽‍♀️🏃🏻‍♂️🌎
기후운동은 COP26 뒤에 많은 사람들과 더 크고 더 단단히 성장해야합니다. 이 글을 읽고 있는 바로 당신과, 한사람 한 사람이 절실히 필요합니다. 

⏳⌛️
멸종반란은 원칙에 동의하는 누구나 허락없이 조직하고 시작할 수 있으며, 여러그룹의 소규모 불복종행동은 효과적으로 사람들의 각성을 이끌어낼 수 있습니다. 

⛓🔒🪜
시간이 많이 남지 않았습니다. 목소리가 모이지 못하게 우리를 가두던 정치 방역이 조금이나마 누그러진 지금, 파업, 도로 점거, 봉쇄 및 창의적인 불복종 행동을 시작할 때입니다!

Posted @withregram • @xr_korea 

📸Photo by 지미(@gim_hyeonji_)

Title: NA
Description:
HUNT HAS A DUTY OF CARE TO ACT ON THE CLIMATE CRISIS

On Monday @XR_Vic's Mornington Peninsula local group held a demonstration outside the office of Greg Hunt, as part of ongoing actions shedding light on failing #COP26 climate talks in Glasgow.

Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt has said he bases his management of COVID-19 on the science provided by experts.

XR Mornington Peninsula demand that MP Hunt apply the same logic & protect the health of Australia’s children, and all future generations, from the climate crisis.

“Hunt can no longer ignore his duty of care to represent the worried families on the Mornington Peninsula who fear for their children’s future! I fear what the world will look like for my kids if countries like Australia continue to do nothing!" said rebel Vanessa

Rebels staged a parade of prams followed by speeches and a die-in. During the die-in Scomo chucked another planet on the barbie.

✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿

This action is taking place place on stolen Boonwurrung country.⁣

We pay respect to Elders past and present. We acknowledge their sovereignty and ongoing resistance against the destructive forces of capitalism and colonialism which fuel the climate and ecological emergency.

📸 @matt.hrkac

🚨🐨 CODE RED FOR KOALAS AND HUMANS 🐨🚨

This morning @xrvic_aus rebels held a funeral march for a four-metre tall burning koala, Blinky. This spectacular & disturbing creature, is part distressed koala, part skeleton. As you can see, they are emitting smoke, and is loudly crying in pain 

🔥🔥🔥

Blinky “represents the terror our animals are facing in the climate emergency,” Billions of native animals, including roughly 60,000 koalas, were killed, injured or displaced by catastrophic bushfires in 2019/2020

🐨☠️ Both koalas and humans face a risk of extinction, this has been exasperated by the failure of governments to take the emergency action that is so desperately needed. Earlier this morning, skeletons rode through the city, highlighting #COP26’s failure. ☠️🐨

Title: NA
Description:
Extinction Rebellion and Rete Ecosistemica Roma blocked Cristoforo Colombo, the street where the Ministry of Ecologic Transition is located.
An ambulance was let pass through, but not the world leaders, who wanted to reach the G20 summit to decide behind us, and behind the other 188 countries of the world.

The police intervened to remove the activist, subsequently agents in riot gear surrounded the demonstrators.

However, in the afternoon the city of Rome was crossed by a procession of thousands of people entitled "you G20, we the future"

The governments of the G20 have failed to defend the citizens of the world from the climate and ecological crisis, staining themselves with crimes against humanity because of their negligence and their action in favor of the destruction of ecosystems.

We were here to unite with those who will demonstrate from 2 November in Glasgow for the COP26, where the same heads of state present in Rome will risk concluding the summit with the same postponement, made up of non-binding promises and agreements empty of commitments and solutions.

To the G20 we say: from Rome to Glasgow, your solutions are the problem! 

#G20 #cop26 #climatecrisis #ecologicalcrisis

Title: NA
Description:
WE NEED FIRST NATIONS JUSTICE 
⁣
Sydney’s @COP26 Global Day of Action for Climate Justice was a beautiful display of solidarity across the entire climate movement.⁣
⁣
Organised by @Workers4ClimateAction.⁣
⁣
Endorsed by @ExtinctionRebellionSydney  @nswgreens @nteu_au @maritime_union_australia @350.org.au @unitedworkersoz @gasfreehunter Water for Rivers, Firefighters for Climate + many more⁣
⁣
We NEED a united climate movement! 
We saw this today! ⁣
⁣
🖤💛❤️⁣
⁣
“Ngara nura. In our Aboriginal language, hearing means understanding,” said Aunty Nadeena following the Welcome to Country.⁣
⁣
“We understand in a deep way, just like a tree understands it’s a tree. It has a deeper wisdom.”⁣
⁣
🌊🌏🌊⁣
⁣
WE ARE NOT DROWNING,⁣
WE ARE FIGHTING ✊⁣
⁣
Maryjane Mckibbin Schwenke, director of the Matavai Pacific Cultural Arts Centre, reminded us that the Pacific Islands are already experiencing climate chaos.⁣
⁣
“If our governments do not act now, it will be too late,” said Maryjane.⁣
⁣
✊🌿✊⁣
⁣
After hearing from a host of inspiring comrades, we marched from Hyde Park to Circular Quay demanding global solidarity with First Nations / Indigenous-led land management, jobs on Country, @Santos_Ltd off Gomeroi land.⁣
⁣
👉 There is no climate justice without First Nations justice!⁣
⁣
Other demands:⁣
⁣
🌿 No fossil fuels + 100% publicly owned renewable energy by 2030. XR demands 2025.⁣
⁣
🌿 Just transition plan now!⁣
⁣
🌿 Climate jobs not nuclear subs! No to the AUKUS deal! No shift to nuclear power! No gas-led recovery!⁣
⁣
🖤💛❤️⁣
⁣
This rally took place on stolen Gadigal land. ⁣
⁣
We pay respect to Elders past and present. We acknowledge their sovereignty and ongoing resistance against the destructive forces of capitalism and colonialism which fuel the climate and ecological emergency.⁣
⁣
#ClimateJustice #COP26 #COPOut #ClimateCodeRed #DutyOfCare #ClimateEmergency  #ActNow #RebelForLife #SystemChangeNotClimateChange #ExtinctionRebellion #XRSydney #ExtinctionRebellionSydney #ExtinctionRebellionAustralia⁣

Title: NA
Description:
STOP PLAYING GAMES #COP26 

🌳 Well done rebels! What a day. Over a thousand rebels were out on the streets protesting against false climate solutions! 

Greenwashing March 
💀 Over 1000 rallied at Buchanan Street steps with banners, samba drumming, and large props including a giant skeleton puppet

❤️ Dirty Scrubbers, Red Rebels, and Blue Rebels all performed during the march

⛽️ Half of the march went to George Square, where there were speeches and an "oil spill" performance

👩🏼‍🎨 The other half went to SSE on Waterloo Street, where four we arrested for locking-on, blocking the entrance, and spraying chalk paint at the building

🏦 The march also protested outside JP Morgan on Waterloo Place and Lloyds on St Vincent Street

👮‍♀️ The police kettled 500 marchers on St Vincent Street for two hours

🦚 The kettled march was taken to the COP26 venue, and then allowed to disperse

****

🛢️ Stop Cambo - Turn off Tap 

Stop Cambo held an action on Buchananan steps in Glasgow to commemorate the anniversary of the first North Sea oil pipeline being turned on by the Queen in 1975. 

👑 In a mock ceremony ‘the Queen’ turning off the taps 

****

🕺 Divest Discobedience

Glasgow was treated to some Divest Discobedience courtesy of Divest Strathclyde with BP or not BP, Fridays for Future and Money Money Money, and speakers including local councillors and 350.org founder Bill McKibben.

With dances, songs and speeches the event called for Divest Discobedience:

With dance and songs and speeches to those gathered, speakers focussed on the £836 million Strathclyde Pension Fund – one of the largest Local Authority pension funds in the UK - has invested in fossil fuels to date.

Title: NA
Description:
🧟 aCOPalypse NOW !

Alors que s’ouvre à #Glasgow la #COP26, des militant·e·s d’#ExtinctionRebellion ont pris place hier dans le centre commercial des Halles à Paris pour alerter sur le futur apocalyptique qui nous attend, et dénoncer l’inaction des gouvernements 😒

🗣 Depuis plus de 50 ans, les scientifiques dénoncent le lien entre réchauffement climatique et activité humaine, et appelent les Etats à réduire les émissions de gaz à effet de serre. 
Depuis 25 ans, les COP successives ont échoué à imposer les mesures suffisantes aux gouvernements. Les engagements pris ne sont pas à la hauteur et ne sont pas respectés. Partout, les émissions de gaz à effet de serre ne cessent d’augmenter. 
Alors qu’ils sont parfaitement conscients des conséquences, les gouvernements et les banques continuent d’investir massivement dans les énergies fossiles. Ils préfèrent les intérêts privés des entreprises à la sauvegarde du vivant.
 
Des scientifiques, des représentants d'Attac France , d'Alternatiba, de Greenpeace France dont son président Jean-François Julliard, ainsi que l’activiste Camille Etienne ont pris la parole pour alerter sur les conséquences dramatiques du réchauffement, et exprimer leur colère face à l’irreponsabilité de nos dirigeant·e·s.

🧟 Des zombies symbolisant les catastrophes qui nous menacent - effondrement de la biodiversité, inondations, sécheresses, montée des eaux, mégafeux, famines, guerres - ont envahi l’espace public.

⚫️ Après un die-in sanglant, les #BlackRebels ont fait leur apparition pour la première fois en France. Des équipes se sont dispersées pour afficher des messages autour du centre commercial tandis que zombies et militant·e·s ont initié une marche pour le climat. 

📆 Rendez-vous le 6 novembre pour une mobilisation commune à #Paris !
Repost from @extinctionrebellionfrance 
📸 : @le_duq_ ❤️‍🔥🤩

Title: NA
Description:
#COP26 REBELLION OF ONE 🧘🏼‍♀️⁣
⁣
Rebel Larissa Payne has scaled a four metre ladder, locked on, and blocked the road to the Sydney Opera House on unceded Gadigal land to protest the catastrophic failure of @ScottMorrisonMP and world leaders. ⁣
⁣
The internationally coordinated #RebellionOfOne is where individuals act in solitary nonviolent civil disobedience which is both vulnerable and powerful, the essence of what makes us human.⁣
⁣
🚨⁣
⁣
This is #ClimateCodeRed for humanity!⁣
⁣
2050 is too late!⁣
⁣
WORLD LEADERS MUST ACT NOW!⁣
ANYTHING LESS IS DENIAL!⁣
⁣
🚨⁣
⁣
“Capitalism is killing the biosphere. We must abandon the death cult of neoliberal economics to survive. We can’t have infinite growth on a finite planet,” says @Lala_Dolce_Vita, XR organiser, high school teacher and journalism master’s student. ⁣
⁣
“We need systems change, not climate change. The colonial-capitalist system has caused the climate crisis and upholds it. Scientists leaked part of the IPCC Report which is explicit when it says civilisation will not survive a heating planet if we don’t abandon the capitalist model.”⁣
 ⁣
“We need to make sweeping changes to the nature of economy and the way we share our planet. We must listen to the voices of global Indigenous and tribal communities who care for 80 per cent of the planet’s biodiversity. We must listen to those already affected like the #TorresStrait8 and those who will be disproportionately affected in future. We must #DecoloniseToSurvive.”⁣
⁣
“Let’s reimagine and rebuild a society that is equitable and sustainable, where no one is left behind! Together we can do it! The clean tech and answers to #ClimateJustice exist!”⁣
⁣
“Murray Bookchin said, ‘The assumption that what currently exists must necessarily exist is the acid that corrodes all visionary thinking.’ F*ck that acid! It does NOT have to be this way!”⁣
⁣
“WE have the visionary thinking that so-called leaders lack! Humanity — the 99%— is the hope. We are the hope! But we must #RebelForLife.”⁣

⁣
⚠️ Larissa was arrested and faces court in December ⚖️
⁣ @xrebellionaus 🧘🏿‍♂️
⁣
📷 Hugo Photography, John Janson-Moore, @robertknapmanphotography⁣
⁣
#COPOut #SystemChangeNotClimateChange⁣

Title: NA
Description:
On Monday I was arrested for the fourth time this year in relation to the climate crisis. We shut down two major highways in Manhattan. Students, social workers, grandmothers, engineers, mamas, teachers, and friends. We stepped out into busy highways and asked people to be patient with us as we shouted about the planet dying. About how afraid we are of losing each other, our futures, our favorite places. About all of the people, beings, and treasures we have already lost and the injustice of a system that protects those who have done the most damage and punishes those who have contributed the least. I’m terrified of the future we’re heading into.

We’ve tried everything else from petitions, phone banking, marches; begging our politicians to do literally anything. And now, one of our last chances to do the bare minimum is slipping by as the Build Back Better Act continues to be threatened by politicians held in comfort by the fossil fuel industry. All of this before COP26, a major climate conference that produced the Paris Climate Accords six years ago (which were again, a major failure that no country actually stuck to). We need climate action now, for all of us. 

I’m from Wyoming, a major fossil fuel producing state that I absolutely adore and love and I’m worried about losing. I’m also worried about all of those families and individuals who I know that rely on fossil fuels to survive, I love you and hear you and want you all to know that a just transition off of fossil fuels is 100% possible and while it may feel like a sacrifice, so to are the millions of people and other living relatives that we stand to lose by continuing to produce harmful products that are destroying our collective home. We can move through this together but time is running out and we have to act now. Our press release has more information linked in it if you’re interested! #climateactionnow
Credit: @pres.hayashida 

📷: @jrobertson.nyc 
https://www.xrebellion.nyc/news/climate-activists-block-nyc-highways

Title: NA
Description:
STOP OLD GROWTH LOGGING NOW 

The land surrounding Ada'itsx (Fairy Creek) is on Unceded Pacheedaht and Ditidaht Territory and actually the majority of "British Columbia" is on unceded land which means the land was never surrendered, never signed over in a treaty and never won in a battle - simply occupied and taken.

A string of protests against old-growth logging in western Canada have become the biggest act of civil disobedience in the country’s history, with the arrest of least 1126 people to date. They have also exposed both the legacy of old growth logging in a vulnerable ecosystem and the complex politics of the region.

Sovereign land is land that has not been incorporated into the colonial world, land that is not owned and not under the “dominion“ of settler colonialism. In short sovereign land is indigenous land.

Old growth forests are among the last sovereign lands on Vancouver Island, and their annihilation is just a continuation of the colonial genocide that has taken place against indigenous peoples since occupation began in 1492. @xr_vancouver and @fairycreekblockade and other amazing groups are working closely in alliance with the land defenders at Ada'itsx and old growth protection groups around Vancouver Island. 

HERE IS HOW YOU CAN HELP! 
Follow and support: @camplandback 
@fairycreekblockade @xr_vancouver @rainforestflyingsquad @xr_westkootenay @oldgrowthrevylution 

#actnow #stopoldgrowthlogging 

Credit for information: @fairycreekblockade and @guardian

Description:
THE RACE TO SAVE THE WORLD - TICKETS AT THE LINK IN BIO 

The Race to Save The World is a climate documentary with a uniquely optimistic approach. It follows passionate activists whose single-minded focus is the creation of a sustainable world for future generations. These climate warriors, ages 15 to 72, are in the trenches fighting for a livable future, regardless of the personal cost. Emmy award-winning filmmaker Joe Gantz brings an urgent and intimate portrait of the protests, arrests, courtroom drama, and family turmoil these activists endure as they push for change. The Race to Save The World is an energizing call-to-action that inspires viewers to quit waiting on the sidelines and start making their voices heard.
 
 
This is a film for your friends and family who still do not quite understand why you do what you do. Invite them to watch it with you. - 50% of the net proceeds from your ticket purchase cost and 100% of your additional donations will go to XR Global, towards activists in the Global South.
 
Purchase tickets at the LINK IN BIO!

Title: NA
Description:
We need to talk about #ChinaSyndrome.

(LINK IN BIO for our sources and facts)

First, where did this come from? Well, there’s a long, racist tradition of invoking the threat of China as a scapegoat/excuse for everything powerful people do or don’t want to do. China is the world’s excuse for cruelty and barbarism. If we don’t behave atrociously, politicians and columnists assure us, China will, so we had better do it first, before we are outcompeted.

China Syndrome is the 21st century extension of the Yellow Peril myth. First formulated by Kaiser Wilhelm II, whose extreme militarism, racism and anti-Semitism prefigured the rise of Nazism in Germany, the term reflects a long-standing apprehension about the people of Asia.

It is, of course, true that China contributes substantially to the threat of climate breakdown: it is now the world’s largest emitter of greenhouse gases. So pointing at China, even when its per capita emissions were much smaller than the UK, came naturally to racists and deniers.

The paternalistic assumption that only the rich nations can afford to care is also based on a myth: a myth that dates back to the colonial era. The Greendex survey of consumer attitudes shows that people in developing countries tend to feel much guiltier about their impacts on the natural world than people in developed countries, even though those impacts might be far smaller. Of the nations surveyed, the people of Germany, the US, Australia and Britain felt the least consumer guilt; while the people of India, China, Mexico and Brazil felt the most. The more we consume, the less we feel. There is no scope for moral superiority in the climate talks, least of all a moral superiority based on unfounded national stereotypes.

So don’t forget that “Yeah, but China” is just an excuse. An excuse fuelled by a lethal combination of historic racism and current selfishness. China’s emissions certainly need to be reduced. But a failure by China to take sufficient action neither cancels nor excuses inaction over here.

Source: George Monbiot via twitter.

Title: NA
Description:
STANDING IN SOLIDARITY WITH THE GLOBAL SOUTH 

“Vrijdag was een intenste dag. Eerst liepen we in een solidariteitsmars langs verschillende ambassades en betoogde we hiermee onze steun aan mensen en gemeenschappen die de grootste klappen vangen in de klimaat en ecologische crisis.🌏

Er waren maar liefst drie blokkades. Voor het NOPEGA lobbygebouw, op de Bezuidenhoutseweg ter hoogte van de Sociaal Economische Raad (SER) en bij de tweede kamer.

Aan het einde van de vreedzame blokkade voor de tweede kamer trad de politie opnieuw zeer gewelddadig op. Deze bewijst voor de zoveelste keer te staan voor een giftig en gewelddadig systeem, hetzelfde systeem dat het leven op Aarde bedreigt…

Het was een dag vol emoties en het zijn momenten als deze waarop we als beweging kunnen samenkomen en onze veerkracht kunnen tonen🔥💚

Iedereen die heeft deelgenomen aan de klimaatrebellie mag trots zijn op wat we hebben bereikt!!🌼

———— e n g l i s h 

FRIDAY

Friday was an intense day. First we walked in a solidarity march past several embassies and showed our support for people and communities who are taking the biggest hit in the climate and ecological crisis.🌏

There were no less than three blockades. In front of the NOPEGA lobby building, on the Bezuidenhoutseweg near the Social and Economic Council (SER) and at the Parliament.

At the end of our peaceful blockade in front of the Parliament, the police again acted very violently. The police are proving once again to stand for a toxic and violent system, the same system that threatens life on Earth....

It was a day full of emotions and it is moments like these when we can come together as a movement and show our resilience🔥💚

Every single person who participated this climate rebellion can be proud of what we accomplished!!🌼

Images from MONDAY and FRIDAY of the XR.Rotterdam rebellions. 
📸: @savannahvdr & @catharinagerritsen “
@pdebebe 
Caption and credit : @xr.rotterdam 

#klimaatcrisis #climatecrisis #xr #extinctionrebellion #climaterebellion #klimaatrebellie

Title: NA
Description:
XR, ReconOut and Frack Off London gathered outside the Africa E&P (Extraction and Production) Summit, May Fair Hotel, London, described as '..bringing together deal-makers, governments and ministries in Africa's E&P community'. 
All  major oil companies were inside.  Particular targets for protest were ReconAfrica, with drilling rights in the Okavango Delta, Total and CNOOC (China) responsible for  the 1,445 km heated East Africa Crude Oil Pipeline,  and the possibility of talke inside where drilling rights could be granted in Virunga National Park, DRC

As the International Energy Agency states:
- There should be no new oil and gas projects
- We must invest in clean energy to create millions of new jobs, universal access to electirity and clean cooking worldwide.
- This decade annual spending on clean energy in developing economies must expand more than seven times to $1 trillion

East Africa Crude Oil Pipeline is being constructed by French Total and Chinese CNOOC - it is the world's longest heated oil pipeline - 1445 kms from Uganda to Tanzania.  It is threatening critical ecosystems, large scale displacements and risking water and wetlands that tens of millions of people rely on.

RecoAfrica has oil exploration rights across 35,000 squ km in Namibia and Botswana.  The alleged oil discoveries if burnt would amount to one sixth the world's remaining carbon budget.  It lies in the watershed of pristine Okavango Delta, home to the largest remaining wildlife populations in Africa and the livelihoods of a million people that rely on its waters. 

Virunga National Park is home to forillas and immense biodiversity, but DRC has recently made oil extraction in protected areas such as Virunga legal, opening the way to catastrophic environmental damage and threatening the water sources of 3 million people. 

Credit @xrebellionuk @xr_london 

#okavangodelta #rewild #climatechange

Title: NA
Description:
BREAKING: "Columbus must fall!" - Youth activists deface Columbus statue to stand in solidarity with Indigenous Resistance Day (12th Oct)

tldr- we will not be complicit as youth, we stand alongside our siblings, indigenous resistance day 2021

Posted @withregram • @xryouthsolidarity 

October 12th, 2021 by Extinction Rebellion Affinity Youth Network -

3 youth activists chalk spray and hang placards on the Belgrave Square statue of Christopher Columbus in solidarity with Indigenous Resistance Day protestors across the world. 

They livestreamed themselves holding banners and setting off flares to highlight the continued neocolonial violence that Abya Yala, the so-called Americas, is subject to and has been since the invasion initiated by Columbus and to demand the statue be removed.

Christopher Columbus is still revered as an “adventurer” who “discovered” the so-called Americas, named by communities of resistance as Abya Yala, the Indigenous name in the Kuna language (1). However, in truth, Christopher Columbus was so brutal and genocidal that at one point the Spanish Crown itself ordered his imprisonment and stripped him of his rank (2). continued in comments

Title: NA
Description:
"Notre planète brûle, et la mode regarde ailleurs" 👗

Alors que nos rebelles infiltraient le défilé #LouisVuitton, une trentaine d’activistes des @amisdelaterrefr @youthforclimateparis et d’@extinctionrebellionfrance ont realisé un défilé devant la pyramide du Louvre pour attirer l'attention des passant.e.s sur les ravages de la mode et sur la connivence entre LVHM et le gouvernement !

Le Gouvernement a, à l’heure actuelle, l’opportunité d’adopter une réglementation ambitieuse pour le secteur et il n’en fait rien :

☑️ Il refuse de limiter la surproduction (refuse le plafonnement sur les mises en marché ou la limitation du nombre de collections dans la réforme de la filière à responsabilité élargie des producteurs).

☑️ Il refuse d’encadrer la publicité sur le textile (a refusé l’interdiction des publicités sur les produits polluants dans la loi Climat, a refusé les mentions légales sur la publicité textile dans la Loi économie circulaire).

☑️ Il refuse d’inclure le textile dans la taxe carbone aux frontières en négociation à l’Union européenne, ou les standards environnementaux et sociaux minimaux sur les produits.

☑️ Il a permis que l’ensemble des produits neufs invendus puissent être recyclés (donc broyés) pour protéger le secteur du luxe qui ne voulait pas être obligé de solder ou donner ses invendus.

☑️ Il mise tout sur le recyclage des textiles qui ne permet pas de réduire les émissions de gaz à effet de serre.

🚫♻️ Le Fashion Pact porté par Emmanuel Macron et Kering est ainsi une opération de Greenwashing et non le début d’un vrai changement dans le secteur. 

Face à ces clowns du climat, passons à l’action : refusons, réduisons, réparons, réutilisons, recyclons ! 

Et surtout, rebellons-nous ✊

Crédits Photos : @le_duq_ 📸

Repost @extinctionrebellionfrance 
#PFW #ParisFashionWeek #FashionWeek #LouisVuitton #LVSS22 #ExtinctionRebellion #ActNow

Title: NA
Description:
FUCK PRIVATE JETS⁣
⁣
On Saturday, Extinction Rebellion activists blocked all major entrances to Farnborough Airport, calling on the world's super-rich elite and governments to ditch private flights.⁣
⁣
Farnborough caters to the 1% by exclusively providing services for business and private aircraft. Private jet flyers are responsible for half of aviation’s global emissions. ⁣
⁣
The climate and ecological emergency is happening now, it will affect everyone, but it is not being caused by everyone. We know the most wealthy emit many more tons of carbon than any other group. In an emergency private jets should simply not be an option, but instead it's the only growing aviation sector since the start of the pandemic.⁣
⁣
Climate Assembly UK, a citizens' assembly commissioned by Parliament in 2019, proposed a ban on private jets. Their recommendations have been ignored by our government. ⁣
⁣
In an emergency, when the government refuses to listen to the people, the people need to take action. We demand the Government listen to the people and empower citizens assemblies to decide the policy we need to tackle this crisis. ⁣
⁣
#CitizensAssembliesNow #ClimateEmergency #ActNow #RebelForLife ⁣
⁣
Disabled rebel James Brown is currently serving 12 months for disrupting London City Airport, another airport catering to business and private fliers, in 2019. Join him and others taking direct action to tackle the biggest emitters in a climate emergency. ⁣
⁣
Links in bio for more info on XR⁣
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
SPOT THE GREENWASHING TRAITORS

All of these companies are BACKING GROUPS FIGHTING A LANDMARK CLIMATE BILL. 

Some of America’s most prominent companies, including Apple, Amazon, Microsoft and Disney, are backing business groups that are fighting landmark climate legislation, despite their own promises to combat the climate crisis, a new analysis has found. But these leading companies, and others, either support or actively steer the very lobby groups that are attempting to sink the bill that carries the weight of Joe Biden’s ambitions to tackle the climate crisis, threatening one of the last major legislative efforts that will help decide whether parts of the world plunge into a new, barely livable climatic state.

“Major corporations love to tell us how committed they are to addressing the climate crisis and building a sustainable future, but behind closed doors, they are funding the very industry trade groups that are fighting tooth and nail to stop the biggest climate change bill ever,” said Kyle Herrig, president of watchdog group Accountable.US, which compiled the analysis.

None of the companies contacted by the Guardian would rebuke the stance of the lobby groups they are part of and none said they would review their links to these groups.

Source: @theguardian

Title: NA
Description:
🍃We presenteren: de Grote Groenwasserij Show.🍃

Onze muze? H&M. 

H&M hoopt mee te liften op de 'duurzaamheidsgolf' met zijn 'Conscious Collection', maar de praktijken van het merk zijn verre van bewust. 96% van de collectie bleek niet te voldoen aan de beloofde duurzaamheidsdoelstellingen. Het recente gebruik van jonge activisten voor hun campagnes laat bovendien zien dat H&M niet gaat voor een echte toewijding aan duurzaamheid, maar eerder voor een aantrekkelijk verpakte misleiding.

Dus hebben we het script omgedraaid♻️

6 rebellen werden "groen gewassen" terwijl ze slechts een paar van de praktijken vertoonden die doorgaans met fast-fashion worden geassocieerd. 

Met onze actie roepen we de H&M-groep op om haar praktijken in overeenstemming te brengen met wat het beeld wat ze uitdraagt, want onthoud: er is geen mode op een dode planeet.🌍🌏

--- e n g l i s h 

🍃You are looking at our Great Greenwashing Show. 🍃

Our muse? H&M. 

H&M hopes to ride the ‘sustainability’ wave with its ‘Conscious Collection’’, but the brand’s practices are far from conscious. 96% of the collection was found to not live up to its promised sustainability targets. The recent instrumentalization of young activists for their campaigns furthermore shows that H&M isn’t going for a true commitment to sustainability, but rather just a performative deception. 

So we flipped the script♻️

6 rebels were "washed green" while showcasing just a few of the practices that are commonly associated with the fast-fashion industry. 

With our action we call upon H&M group to align its practices with what they preach, because remember; there is no fashion on a dead planet.🌍🌏

📸: amongst others @pdebebe 

Repost @xr.rotterdam 
#climatecrisis #klimaatcrisis #hm #greenwashing #stopfastfashion #groenwassen

Title: NA
Description:
OUR BIGGEST ENEMY IS NO LONGER CLIMATE DENIAL BUT CLIMATE DELAY.

"Nothing is more dangerous than the illusion of action.⁠⁠ Heatwaves and flooding here in the UK, temperatures topping 50C in Pakistan, hundreds killed by a heatwave in British Columbia, deadly floods in Germany and China. All within a single month. Add to that the recent dire warning from the Met Office that the age of extreme weather has just begun."

"The window to avoid catastrophe is closing with every passing day. We’re in the decisive decade in this fight, and we must treat the climate crisis as an issue that stands alone in the combination of its urgency and the shadow it casts over future generations."

"These sweeping terms—"humankind," "our planet," and "we"—fail to acknowledge some important truths. For example, the carbon emissions of the world's richest 1% are more than double those of the poorest half of the world or that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions."

"Black, Indigenous, and other people of colour in the Global South have historically contributed the least to global heating but are at disproportionate risk from its impacts—including drought, flooding, and food insecurity. Despite comprising just 5% of the world's population, Indigenous peoples protect 80% of global biodiversity. To homogenize the global population into a collective "we" is to allow those most responsible to evade accountability."

Sources: Ed Miliband for The Guardian 

Oxfam, CDP Carbon Majors Report 2017, Center for Global Development, United Nations, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

@guardian @earthrise.studio @elieoutside @atmos

Title: NA
Description:
WE HAVE A MORAL DUTY TO TAKE ACTION

We are in the midst of a climate and ecological breakdown. We are facing an uncertain future - our world is in crisis and life itself is under threat. Now is not the time to ignore the issues; now is the time to act as if the truth is real. The science is clear. We are in the midst of a mass extinction of our own making and our governments are not doing enough to protect their citizens, our resources, our biodiversity, our planet, and our future.
This crisis knows no borders, race or ethnicity, and while wealth may offer some protection, it is all but temporary. The clock is ticking, and if we don’t succeed in uniting to protect our planet, everyone will be impacted - you, your family, everyone and everything you hold dear…
…and yet every crisis contains the possibility of transformation.

Title: NA
Description:
CLIMATE CHANGE AFFECTS US ALL BUT NEVER EQUALLY

“WE” DID NOT CAUSE THE CLIMATE CRISIS 

WE ARE THE GLOBAL SOUTH. 
WE ARE BLACK; INDIGENOUS; PEOPLE OF COLOUR. 

The language we use around the climate crisis can conceal as much as it reveals.

When referring to human-inflicted damage to the planet, westerners often implement a universal "we." This assumes an idea of a collective humanity destroying the Earth. In Netflix's "A Life On Our Planet," David Attenborough warned: “This is now our planet, run by humankind for humankind. We’ve not just ruined it. We’ve destroyed it.”

But these sweeping terms—"humankind," "our planet," and "we"—fail to acknowledge some important truths. For example, that carbon emissions of the world's richest 1% are more than double those of the poorest half of the world or that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. 

Black, Indigenous, and other people of color in the Global South have historically contributed the least to global heating but are at disproportionate risk from its impacts—including drought, flooding, and food insecurity. Despite comprising just 5% of the world's population, Indigenous peoples protect 80% of global biodiversity. To homogenize the global population into a collective "we" is to allow those most responsible to evade accountability. 

When we talk about human-caused ecological devastation, language and context matter. The COVID-19 pandemic has shown that disaster affects communities in different ways, and denying this is not just naive—but harmful. The same applies to the climate crisis. The most polluting should not be calling on the universal "we" to solve the catastrophe they have had such a pivotal role in producing. 

Sources: Oxfam, CDP Carbon Majors Report 2017, Center for Global Development, United Nations, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Words by @elieoutside 
Design by @tessaforrest 
Repost @atmos 
.
.
.
.
.
#climatechange #climatecrisis #climateemergency #language #languagematters #linguistics #globalwarming #BIPOC #racialjustice #climatejustice #intersectionality #intersectionalenvironmentalism #fossilfuels #oilandgas #climatedisaster #indigenouspeople

Title: NA
Description:
Last week was an exciting one for XRWA! Three more from the #SprayChalk6 had their bail conditions dropped ❤️✊

Laraine (pictured in images 2 and 3) says:

"The harsh treatment for chalking when Woodside can pollute with impunity is a sad indication of a captured state. What's a little bit of chalk compared to the damage caused by the emissions that will come from Scarborough gas? Who is the real criminal?"

Ben, another of the six, says: 

"I am absolutely delighted that I'm now able to associate with my friends and support network. This whole ordeal shows that the police have their priorities very wrong. The prosecutor argued that when we associate we participate in 'anti-social behaviour'. In fact, our actions are in the interest of social justice."

Carmen (pictured in images 1,3 and 4) was the last to face court. She has also had her bail conditions lifted and says:

"I am very relieved that the magistrate has seen sense and removed these very onerous bail conditions. The case is not over yet, but at least I have my support network to get through it now. This example of blatant police over-reach, restricting my freedom to associate should be a concern to all Western Australians. It was washable chalk." 

Stay tuned for more updates from the #SprayChalk6

Images coming soon from the @xrwagrandparents Reclaim Parliament action that took place last Thursday!! Keep an 👁️ out

Title: NA
Description:
SUMMER OF FIRE 

We have a moral duty to take action : follow @xr_vancouver @fairycreekblockade - see you on the streets! Change is coming! We are the rebellion. 

Blazes are destroying whole communities. The Canadian government must act now to tackle this existential threat. 

Once again, we have been thrust into a period of uncertainty. What will happen to us and to other endangered communities to the north and east of our fire?
A federal election has just been called in Canada. We desperately hope our region’s voters, given all that we have gone through, will send a strong protest vote to Ottawa, saying they must take the climate crisis seriously. The land around us is burning, the air is unbreathable, people in our community have become climate refugees. This is an existential threat. If not now, when?

Source: Mary Stockdale, 2021, Guardian 

#britishcolumbia #actnow #wildfires #climateemergency

Title: NA
Description:
IT’S HAPPENING NOW⁣
(sound on)⁣
⁣
Over the last month we've seen major cities flooded, we've seen famine caused by rising temperatures, species have continued to go extinct, and extreme weather events have disrupted communities.⁣
⁣
WE’RE IN A CLIMATE EMERGENCY⁣
⁣
Over the last weeks thousands of people from all across the UK have come together to take mass nonviolent civil disobedience, to pressure the government to act now to stop the harm, starting with ending all new fossil fuel investments, and to invite a citizens' assembly to come to the table. We need a group that is representative of the UK to decide the policies and protections we need now as we face code red warnings from scientists, health experts, industry, and international government panels.⁣

CHANGE IS NOW⁣

Title: NA
Description:
WE TELL THE TRUTH EVEN WHEN IT HURTS 

Here are our demands: 
🚨TELL THE TRUTH
🚨ACT NOW
🚨GO BEYOND POLITICS 

Facebook's internal research into Instagram has raised serious concerns about the photo-sharing app's impact on the mental health of teens, prompting US lawmakers to press the world's largest social network for more answers.

For years, people have called out apps like Instagram for taking a toll on people's mental well-being. Instagram has been criticized by users, advocacy groups and lawmakers for harboring harmful content and fostering anxiety and depression, particularly among younger audiences. 

🚨Amidst all of this, we take a renewed effort to ALWAYS TELL THE TRUTH. 

Governments must tell the truth by declaring a climate and ecological emergency, working with other institutions to communicate the urgency for change.🚨

Visit rebellion.global to learn more about why we rebel, and how you can take on your moral duty to take action. 

#climateemergency #actnow #extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
REBELLION HAS BEGUN IN NYC
 
It’s Rebellion Day and Extinction Rebellion rebels are occupying three NYC bank headquarters in New York City. These banks are among the biggest investors in fossil fuel infrastructure – directly financing the causes of the climate crisis: JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, & Bank of America. 

Extinction Rebellion NYC and its supporters also gathered at noon outside the New York Public Library in Manhattan for a peaceful rally, “die-in” and march. The march weaved through Manhattan, stopping at the Brazilian consulate to protest that government’s destructive environmental policies regarding the Amazon region and then to the United Nations. The day’s events are the start of ongoing actions leading up to COP 26, the global conference that many consider a make or break event to get runaway global warming under control. 

Co-Sponsors of the event: @ny4change, @rainforestactionnetwork, @seedingsovereignty, @climatemondays, @fff.nyc, @reversett, @risenresistnyc, @worldcantwait, @350nyc

Description:
TW: BLOOD

𝗠𝗦𝗖 𝗖𝗘𝗥𝗧𝗜𝗙𝗜𝗘𝗗 𝗟𝗜𝗘𝗦- 𝗡𝗢 𝗠𝗢𝗥𝗘 𝗙𝗜𝗦𝗛 𝗜𝗡 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗘𝗔

The morning of the 16th September, members of Ocean Rebellion staged a theatrical action
targeting the Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) as the finale of their week-long calling out of
drivers of ocean degradation, including corrupt and destructive industrial fishing.

Protestors wearing pinstripe suits and fish head masks oozing blood and viscera stood in a
pool of blood and dead fish in the entrance to the MSC as workers arrived for the day. Thefish carried briefcases with slogans such as 𝗠𝗦𝗖 𝗖𝗘𝗥𝗧𝗜𝗙𝗜𝗘𝗗 𝗟𝗜𝗘𝗦 and 𝗪𝗔𝗥 𝗢𝗡 𝗙𝗜𝗦𝗛.

Protestors are demanding that the MSC stops selling lies to supermarket shoppers.
Currently the #marinestewardshipcouncil
makes no distinction between industrial fishing methods and artisan fishing methods on itslabelling.
The Marine Stewardship Council allows its members to obtain their certification by paying tojoin.
The campaigners contend this undermines the objectivity of the certification and makes itinherently corrupt.

𝗔𝗦 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗘𝗔 𝗗𝗜𝗘𝗦 𝗪𝗘 𝗗𝗜𝗘

Photography: Ilya Fisher | @fisherilya

#NoMoreFishInTheSea #AsTheSeaDiesWeDie 
#OceanRebellion

CLIMATE CHANGE IS A SYMPTOM OF A BROKEN SYSTEM 

For so long, systems of oppression and injustice have contributed to climate breakdown, leaving those least responsible most vulnerable.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
To overcome climate breakdown, we first must look in the face of our fear, grief and outrage to address these broken systems. By channelling our energy into action we can help build a fairer, most just world.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Another world is possible.

Title: NA
Description:
🪡STITCH IT. DON’T DITCH IT🪡

Mass mending today as street stitchers lined up in front H&M, the world's second largest clothing manufacturer.

Our message: Stitch It. Don't Ditch It 🪡👚

The global fashion industry is responsible for 1.2 billion tonnes of CO2 equivalent per year. That's more emissions than the shipping and aviation industries combined. 😯

Fast fashion needs to slow down! That's why we're outside H&M in Rundle Mall.

"But wait doesn't H&M offer a clothes recycling program?”

Yes! H&M recycle an extremely tiny fraction of what they sell. Their recycling program is widely seen as green washing.

The fast fashion industry will never be sustainable if they don't address the vast amounts of clothing they produce.

Recycling is important but it's only part of the solution. Unfortunately corporations often leverage recycling to push responsibility onto individuals and distance themselves from their own responsibility.

Mending enthusiast @localandbespoke said earlier:

"The 'joyful disruption' of #StitchItDontDitchIt is a quiet way to express our concern about the climate crisis that the majority of Australians want to see being met by decisive policy and urgent action on the part of government and corporations.”

For more on this global event, see @streetstitching. Quote: @twistedtwee. Gratitude to @dontditchitstitchit.

🖤💛❤️

This action took place place on stolen Kaurna country.⁣
⁣
We pay respect to Elders past and present. We acknowledge their sovereignty and ongoing resistance against the destructive forces of capitalism and colonialism which fuel the climate and ecological emergency.⁣

#StichItDontDitchIt #RegenerativeCulture #MendClothesDontDispose #ExtinctionRebellion #FastFashion #SlowFashion #SlowFashionSeptember 

Posted @withregram • @extinctionrebellionsouthaus

Title: NA
Description:
YOU CAN’T GREENWASH YOUR WAY OUT OF THIS PROBLEM

You’ve seen the Met Gala pictures flooding your feeds. Fast Fashion is sometimes an affordable choice and sometimes the only choice for some people. Fashion companies on the other hand have a choice, to be better, to do better, to break away from fossil fuels and empty, shallow promises of sustainability. 

🗯Fashion is addicted to dirty oil. FACT.

⚡️Synthetic textiles are made from oil or gas both of which are socially and environmentally exploitative industries.

⚡️ Fashion is addicted to fossil fuels for the production of inexpensive, low-quality, throwaway fashion.

⚡️The fashion industry likes to pretend it cares - producing sustainable collections and sharing wishy washy commitments to reducing CO2 emissions by 2030 whilst the industry’s annual oil consumption to proceed synthetic textiles exceeds the annual oil consumption of Spain.

⚡️ The industry is on track to produce twice the volume but of emissions it requires to within the limited set by the Paris Agreement global warning pathways by 2030.

📢We demand an end to fossil fuel fashion. It's time the fashion industry cleaned up its act!

#extinctionrebellion #impossiblerebellion #xrfashionaction #fossilfuelfashion

Caption @xrfashionaction

Title: NA
Description:
YOUR FACE COSTS THE EARTH 

Yesterday (Saturday 11th September) members of Ocean Rebellion staged a creative theatrical action outside the entrance to Selfridges department store on Oxford Street in London. The protest was part of our week-long series of actions, calling out the drivers of ocean degradation. 

Members of the group dressed in Victorian swimming costumes and covered their skin in ‘sun cream’, whilst a banner read ‘YOUR FACE COSTS THE EARTH’. The action was highlighting the links between cosmetics and the toxic-forever chemicals washed into the ocean down our drains, or else applied directly by swimmers wearing suncream. 

Sophie Miller from Ocean Rebellion says “we demand that the government acts to ban the use of sun-screens and cosmetics containing oxybenzone and other coral-killing substances” 

Rob Higgs adds “The oceans are being poisoned by the toxic chemicals routinely added to consumer items such as cosmetics and sun-screens.  This is hitting the health of both the seas and the marine biodiversity that lives there.”

THE POLLUTANTS STORY

Don’t let anyone ever tell you that the solution to pollution is dilution of a toxic chemical or plastic – it isn’t! 

Some toxic-forever chemicals don’t ever disappear; there is simply no safe concentration. They don’t break down in the environment and they just keep on killing.  Even when they are diluted billions of times in the oceans, it doesn’t make any difference; they can get stuck onto particles of micro or nanoplastics where they get concentrated many millions or millions of times. 

These tiny pieces of plastic, now loaded with the toxic chemical(s) get consumed by plants and animals, the toxins accumulate, and kill them. Researchers are now reporting that 1 in 15 of all living organisms under the surface of the waves contains plastic, and this includes everything from the largest whale, down to a cyanobacteria.

AS THE SEA DIES WE DIE

@apocalypsetheatrics 

Photos: João Daniel Pereira and Ilya Fisher

#selfridges #selfridgeslondon #oxybenzonefree #oceanrebellion #turnthetide #saveourseas #protecttheocean #foreverchemicals 

Posted @withregram • @theoceanrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
DEFEND THE AMAZON

📅 En el día de hoy, nos unimos desde diversos territorios para hacer un llamado de alerta frente a la amenaza del gobierno de Brasil 🇧🇷 contra el Amazonas y los pueblos originarios, quienes se encuentran atacados desde múltiples fronteras. 

⚠️ Actualmente peligra la demarcación de tierras indígenas cuyo objetivo tiene legalizar la toma de terrenos a favor de la industria extractivista 🚜 por sobre la vida de les habitantes y los ecosistemas. 

✊ Alzamos la voz en contra del paquete de leyes que favorece la ya acelerada tasa de deforestación vista en los últimos años, lo cual podría llevar a los ecosistemas por encima del punto límite, implicando que se emita más dióxido de carbono de lo que puede absorber. 🌳
 
🚜 Gran parte de la deforestación en Brasil se encuentra vinculada con intercambios económicos 💲 con Italia, Francia, Reino Unido, Alemania y España. Uno de los más recientes ejemplos se enmarca dentro del acuerdo entre la Unión Europea – Mercosur que perpetúa la continua demanda de productos agroindustriales 🌾desde los países latinoamericanos explotando los territorios y causando la degradación de ecosistemas y los pueblos que se encuentran a su alrededor. ☠️

☠️Otro claro ejemplo de las repercusiones causadas por la devastación del amazonas es la situación actual de sequía histórica del rio Paraná.

Paren el ecocidio, paren el terricidio. 🔥

Matar el amazonas nos está matando. ✊

Title: NA
Description:
SHIFTING THE BLAME: BIG OIL OR YOUR CARBONi FOOTPRINT? 

Big oil coined the phrase ‘carbon footprint’ to blame us for their greed – and while climate-conscious individual choices are good, they're not nearly enough to save the planet. More than personal virtue, we need collective action, writes columnist Rebecca Solnit.

In her piece for @guardian_us, she looks at how “the very short counterargument that individual acts of thrift and abstinence ... won’t get us the huge distance we need to go in this decade".

So what do we need to do instead?

We need to exit the age of fossil fuels, reinvent our energy landscape, rethink how we do almost everything.

“The revolution won’t happen by people staying home and being good."

Link in stories. 

FULL CREDIT AND REPOST FROM @guardian and Rebecca Solnit 

#climatechange #climateaction #greenwashing #climatecrisis #globalwarming #fossilfuels #oilcompany #netzero #cleanenergy #carbonfootprint #rebeccasolnit

Title: NA
Description:
A surge in climate activism has continued as the impacts of the climate crisis continue to be felt acutely across the world. Young climate activists in Rockville, MD, recently staged a demonstration to call for a Montgomery County Green New Deal, halting traffic and demonstrating with striking artistic imagery. 

Demonstrators set up a Green New Deal Village in the middle of Route 28 the four-lane highway between the MOCO Executive and Council Buildings to block lunchtime traffic. The Village included the top three demands of the MOCO GND.

In order of priority, some pushed wheelbarrows carrying plants symbolizing the top demand for community gardens and a more resilient and healthy food supply.

Others wore electricians' hard hats and carried the solar panels and  heat pumps that must replace methane/”natural” gas in all MOCO buildings, the second GND demand.

Finally, one young person played a school teacher driving a police office away from the school representing the GND demand for “counselors not cops.”

Five MOCO young people arrested, age 13-17, demanding a MOCO Green New Deal;
Over 100 block traffic in Rockville in largest-ever MOCO climate demonstration.

#greennewdeal #climatecrisis #climateaction

Title: NA
Description:
‼️THIS CRISIS KNOWS NO BORDERS‼️

We are standing on a precipice. We can acknowledge the truth of what we are facing, or we can continue to kick the can down the road and allow the effects of a heating planet to have even more detrimental outcomes on all living beings. We are already locked in to a certain amount of warming and biodiversity loss, but there is still time to change this story.

This crisis knows no borders, race or ethnicity, and while wealth may offer some protection, it is all but temporary. The clock is ticking, and if we don’t succeed in uniting to protect our planet, everyone will be impacted - you, your family, everyone and everything you hold dear…
…and yet every crisis contains the possibility of transformation.

#actnow #climatecrisis #extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
SAVE OUR WATERS. SAY NO TO FRACKING

El pasado 14 de agosto, acompañamos a más de 15 organizaciones y colectivas socioambientales pertenecientes a Alianza Colombiana Libre de Fracking.
.
Evidenciamos que en plena crisis climática el gobierno colombiano, (en complicidad con) Exxonmobil y Ecopetrol desean destruir y contaminar la región del Magdalena Medio. ☣️💀 Mediante los 'pilotos de Fracking', romperán el suelo y e introducirán un ducto que recorrerá 4km del subsuelo a nivel vertical y horizontal.  Aplicarán 47millones de litros de agua y más de 300 sustancias químicas que terminarán contaminando las fuentes hídricas del subsuelo y superficie de Puerto Wilches.
.
Traerá consigo impactos negativos en la vida, salud, economía y cultura de la población wilchense. No sólo contaminará y dañará completamente las fuentes hídricas de la región; también amenazara las especies en vía de extinción, la calidad del aire, generará enfermedades cancerígenas y desplazará masivamente las especies humanas y no humanas del Magdalena Medio.

.
#congresoprohibaelfracking
#noalospilotosdefracking

Description:
📢 TELL THE TRUTH TODAY OR THERE WON’T BE A TOMORROW 📢

Broadcast and cable news have failed to cover Hurricane Ida as a CLIMATE CHANGE story.

Hurricane Ida has a million people in Louisiana without electricity or running water. The Caldor Fire is forcing mass evacuations around Lake Tahoe and all public parks in California have been forced to close. Siberia continues to burn.

If the mainstream media won’t report the links between the climate crisis and EXCESS BURNING OF FOSSIL FUELS, as these extreme weather events are happening … when will they ever #TellTheTruth? We need journalists to have the courage to do responsible reporting. 

After months of persistent protesting at @NBCUniversal @NBCNews @TodayShow, the news outlet has made it more difficult for us to confront them… instead of focusing on improving their coverage on the climate and ecological emergency. We will not back down!

Title: NA
Description:
HALF THE WORLD'S KIDS AT RISK⁣
⁣
There are 2.1 billion children on the earth. Half are already exposed to risks from the climate and ecological emergency. The crisis is happening now, till we stop all new fossil fuels, it will only get worse. ⁣
⁣
240 million children are highly exposed to coastal flooding.⁣
⁣
330 million children are highly exposed to riverine flooding⁣
⁣
400 million children are highly exposed to vector-borne diseases⁣
⁣
820 million children are highly exposed to heatwaves⁣
⁣
920 million children are highly exposed to water scarcity⁣
⁣
A billion children are exposed to exceedingly high levels of air pollution⁣
⁣
This August UNICEF released a report that makes it absolutely clear the climate crisis is a child's rights crisis. We know children and young people will not only be impacted in the long term but the crisis is having an effect on their communities now as extreme weather events increase. ⁣
⁣
Today @extinction.rebellion.families held a play-in outside the Bank of England, while XR Doctors held an emergency child protection meeting in response to the UNICEF report.⁣
⁣
When will the banks and government follow the data and protect children and young people from this crisis?⁣
⁣
Until they do, we should all be on the streets, standing together for the rights of children here and around the world. ⁣
⁣
#ActNow #StopTheHarm #OurFuture⁣
⁣
Join families and young people in the streets⁣
⁣
Repost @xrebellionuk 

Follow, Support and donate -  @xrebellionuk @extinction.rebellion.families 
⁣

⁣

V sobotu vyšly stovky lidí do ulic, aby požadovaly spravedlnost pro zvířata.  Sjednotili jsme se, abychom se postavili za to, co je správné. Hlasitě a jasně jsme se snažili upozornit širokou veřejnost na to, že si všechna zvířata zaslouží spravedlnost.

Toto je jen začátek!
Po celém světě se lidé spojují a jdou do akcí za všechen život - lidský i zvířecí. Musíme jednat hned a požadovat změnu systému od našich vlád a od korporací, které nadále vydělávají na vykořisťování zvířat a naší planety. Pokud jste zapálení a chcete jednat, jsme uprostřed vzpoury, která požaduje, aby vláda a korporace jednaly hned a přechod na rostlinný stravovací systém pro naši planetu a všechny bytosti.

Přidej se k nám! 💛

#pochodzazvirata #pochodzazvirata2021 #AnimalRebellion #animalrightsmarch

🚨SWIPE for the IMPOSSIBLE REBELLION UK 🚨
Thank you XR REBELS! 💚🙌🏼

We are the change. We are the rebellion. 

Rebels came together, mothers, kids, young people, people from all walks of life. We know we are powerful when we decide to face the climate and ecological emergency together.

The crisis will impact us differently, and we heard yesterday how it will impact women and young people, which is why we want a democracy that truly represents everyone, to decide together, how we get out of this mess.

#DemandTheImpossible #ActNow #ChangeIsNow

Follow @xrebellionuk or find your local group to be a part of the movement 💚

Title: NA
Description:
NO AL ACUERDO PORCUNO

Ayer activamos en todo el país para decir #NoAlAcuerdoPorcino

❌ Sin embargo, esta misma mañana desde Chaco adelantaron fotos de una granja industrial que "se encuentra en expansión para aumentar su producción." ❌

🔥 Desde Rebelión o Extinción exigimos que los gobiernos #AbranLaDemocracia y que creen mecanismos de participación ciudadana para planificar una transición climática y ecológica justa.

👨‍💼 Ellos día a día se niegan a escucharnos, a proponer mecanismos de participación donde podamos expresar cómo queremos que sea nuestro presente y nuestro futuro. 🗣

👉 Tanto el acuerdo porcino como todas las otras decisiones que nos llevan hacia el colapso son tomadas a puertas cerradas y a escondidas por quienes dicen representarnos. 

🤝 Con cada avance del extractivismo se sacrifica una comunidad.

Esto no se termina con el #25A! Vamos a seguir activando. Mientras, te dejamos una web con herramientas para que sigas activando e informando en tu comunidad 🙌

Activar funciona, que te sumes funciona. 🔥

#NoAlAcuerdoPorcino

Title: NA
Description:
SWIPE PARA EL ENLACE 

O ENLACE: bit.ly/passthemicnow

XR GLOBAL INVITA A LOS GRUPOS XR DEL NORTE Y DEL SUR

ACOMPÁÑANOS EN UNA SERIE DE SENCILLAS ACCIONES DE "PASA EL MICRO" DESDE AHORA HASTA EL COP26 Y MÁS ALLÁ.

En agosto, septiembre y octubre, más de 50 activistas del sur darán breves charlas sobre cómo les afectan las crisis de la naturaleza y el clima a nivel local.
Luego, durante la COP26, el sur global estallará con historias y acciones para destacar la urgencia de la acción necesaria sobre el terreno.
Tradicionalmente, estas voces se ven ahogadas por los medios de comunicaciones más sofisticadas y con más recursos, por lo que los activistas de primera línea se están asociando con grupos de solidaridad del norte. Los grupos del norte global reenvían y publican, dan "likes" y siguen e intentan difundir en sus canales de redes sociales los mensajes y las acciones del sur global.

Traducción realizada con la versión gratuita del traductor www.DeepL.com/Translator
ÚNETE A ESTA ACCIÓN SOLIDARIA 
TODOS LOS INDIVIDUOS Y GRUPOS ESTÁN INVITADOS A PARTICIPAR

#passthemic #togetherincrisis

Title: NA
Description:
🚨SWIPE POUR LE LIEN 🚨

Ou LINK : bit.ly/passthemicnow

🚨XR GLOBAL INVITE LES GROUPES XR DES PAYS DU NORD ET DU SUD🚨

REJOIGNEZ-NOUS POUR UNE SÉRIE D’ACTIONS SIMPLES « PASS LE MIC » À PARTIR DE MAINTENANT, JUSQU’À LA COP26 ET AU-DELÀ.

En août, septembre et octobre, plus de 50 militants des pays du Sud donneront de brèves conférences sur la façon dont les crises de la nature et du climat les affectent localement.

Ensuite, au cours de la COP26, les pays du Sud proposeront des histoires et des actions pour souligner l’urgence d’une action sur le terrain. Traditionnellement, ces voix sont noyées par des informations issues de sources bien lissées. C’est pourquoi les militantes en première ligne de la crise climatique font équipe avec des groupes de solidarité des pays du Nord. Les groupes du Nord republient et publient, aiment et suivent et essaient de faire passer sur leurs canaux de réseaux sociaux les messages et les actions du Sud.

REJOIGNEZ CETTE ACTION DE SOLIDARITÉ
TOUTES LES PERSONNES ET TOUS LES GROUPES SONT INVITÉS À PARTICIPER

#passthemic #togetherincrisis

JOIN THE REBELLION to BAN OIL NOT PEOPLE. 
Follow: @extinctionrebellionnl 

Van tien uur vanochtend tot twee uur vanmiddag blokkeerden 30 rebellen de toegang tot Shell Pernis,  de grootste olieraffinaderij van Europa. Één rebel hing aan een acht meter hoge bamboe toren in het hart van de blokkade waardoor tientallen olietankwagens urenlang stil stonden. 
 
De crisis is nu. Extinction Rebelion eist dat de Nederlandse overheid DOET WAT NODIG IS en in actie komt tegen de veroordeelde klimaatcrimineel Shell. Sluit je aan en doe mee met de Klimaatrebellie van 11 tot 18 oktober in Den Haag. 

#ShutdownShell #DeCrisisIsNu #havenrotterdam⚓️ #extinctionrebellion #klimaatcrisis #klimaatrebellie #klimaatactie

Title: NA
Description:
60 YEARS OF CLIMATE CHANGE WARNINGS “IGNORED”

The effects of ‘weird weather’ were already being felt in the 1960s, but scientists linking fossil fuels with climate change were dismissed as prophets of doom. 

In August 1974, the CIA produced a study on “climatological research as it pertains to intelligence problems”“The climate change began in 1960,” the report’s first page informs us, “but no one, including the climatologists, recognised it.” Crop failures in the Soviet Union and India in the early 1960s had been attributed to standard unlucky weather. 

But, the report argued, the world ignored this warning, as the global population continued to grow and states made massive investments in energy, technology and medicine. As the effects of climate change started to spread to other parts of the world, the early 1970s saw reports of droughts, crop failures and floods from Burma, Pakistan, North Korea, Costa Rica, Honduras, Japan, Manila, Ecuador, USSR, China, India and the US. But few people seemed willing to see a pattern: “The headlines from around the world told a story still not fully understood or one we don’t want to face,” the report said*

Read the full article for more information (story) 

*This post has been curated from our understanding of the article cited. We do encourage our audiences to read the entire article to have a more encapsulated, cohesive and in-depth perspective. 

Source: Alice Bell, The Guardian @guardian

Title: NA
Description:
𝘾𝙊𝘿𝙀 𝙍𝙀𝘿 𝙁𝙊𝙍 𝙁𝙊𝙎𝙎𝙄𝙇 𝙁𝙐𝙀𝙇 𝙁𝘼𝙎𝙃𝙄𝙊𝙉

⚡Today four members of Extinction Rebellion Fashion Action glued themselves to the front door of Selfridges on Oxford Street to sound the alarm about the fashion industry's addiction to dirty Oil. One rebel poured fake oil on them. All five have been arrested. 

⚡They were wearing a dress inspired by designer Issey Miyake's 'A Piece of Cloth' (APOC) which displayed the messages: 'Fashion is addicted to dirty oil' and 'Code red for fossil fuel fashion'.

⚡Other members of the protest poured fake oil over the activists and then proceeded to pour fake oil over the windows of the iconic British department store to further highlight the fashion industry's increasing reliance on fossil fuels, especially Oil. Meanwhile, other rebels occupied Oxford Street with samba. 

⛽From fast-fashion to high-end luxury, the fashion industry and its prevailing model rely heavily on the use of cheap synthetic fibres, which are produced from oil and gas. Since the early 2000s, fashion production has doubled - as has the use of polyester, which is now found in over half of textiles.

⛽Selfridges Group is owned by the Weston family, who also own Primark. Primark appeared as one of the worst contenders in the Changing Markets report 'Synthetics Anonymous: Fashion Brands' Addiction to Fossil Fuels, appearing in the red zone for 'transparency, use of synthetic fibres and commitments to phase them out'.

⛽Changing Markets Foundation found that it wasn't just fast fashion that relied the most on fossil fuels. The other brands in the red and yellow zones include Adidas, Nike, Puma, Burberry, and Calvin Klein, all of which are stocked in Selfridges.

Repost from @xrfashionaction 
Follow them for more on the hard truth about the fashion industry.

Photographs @natasaleoni

Title: NA
Description:
“WE” DID NOT CAUSE THE CLIMATE CRISIS 

WE ARE THE GLOBAL SOUTH. 
WE ARE BLACK; INDIGENOUS; PEOPLE OF COLOUR. 

The language we use around the climate crisis can conceal as much as it reveals.

When referring to human-inflicted damage to the planet, westerners often implement a universal "we." This assumes an idea of a collective humanity destroying the Earth. In Netflix's "A Life On Our Planet," David Attenborough warned: “This is now our planet, run by humankind for humankind. We’ve not just ruined it. We’ve destroyed it.”

But these sweeping terms—"humankind," "our planet," and "we"—fail to acknowledge some important truths. For example, that carbon emissions of the world's richest 1% are more than double those of the poorest half of the world or that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. 

Black, Indigenous, and other people of color in the Global South have historically contributed the least to global heating but are at disproportionate risk from its impacts—including drought, flooding, and food insecurity. Despite comprising just 5% of the world's population, Indigenous peoples protect 80% of global biodiversity. To homogenize the global population into a collective "we" is to allow those most responsible to evade accountability. 

When we talk about human-caused ecological devastation, language and context matter. The COVID-19 pandemic has shown that disaster affects communities in different ways, and denying this is not just naive—but harmful. The same applies to the climate crisis. The most polluting should not be calling on the universal "we" to solve the catastrophe they have had such a pivotal role in producing. 

Sources: Oxfam, CDP Carbon Majors Report 2017, Center for Global Development, United Nations, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Words by @elieoutside 
Design by @tessaforrest 
Repost @atmos 
.
.
.
.
.
#climatechange #climatecrisis #climateemergency #language #languagematters #linguistics #globalwarming #BIPOC #racialjustice #climatejustice #intersectionality #intersectionalenvironmentalism #fossilfuels #oilandgas #climatedisaster #indigenouspeople

Title: NA
Description:
SAVE THE AMAZON. 

Stand in solidarity with the indigenous nations of Brazil along with @xrczech in their action on Prague's Wenceslas Square.

🚨This very Wednesday, the Supreme Court of Brazil will vote on a bill which could remove protection from natural reserves, allowing the government to even futher abuse and destroy their valuable rainforests.🚨

If the deforestation of the Amazon continues, we will soon reach a tipping point from which the rainforest, and our planet, will not recover. The actions of the Brazilian government and president Bolsonaro are putting the future of all of us, along with one of the Earth's most precious ecosystems, at risk.

We strongly urge all of you to act, join the #all4theamazon and #hauxhauxmovement campaign and let your disagreement be heard.

Together, united, we can still prevent the worst outcomes of the climate crisis.

YOU CAN STOP THIS. Share this post. Stand in solidarity. Voice your demands.

FOLLOW @extinctionrebellion.brasil to support and further the movement! 

#ActNow #ClimateCrisis #StopBolsanoro #LutaPelaVida

Description:
✨ Habitamos un universo vivo. Los humedales no son UN río, UNA vegetación, UNOS animales. Son la vida que se precisa para seguir existiendo.🌍 

📣 Gobiernos y Corporaciones, grandes accionistas: en esta era donde el hiperconsumo y la individualidad generan una división ficticia e ilusoria sobre lo que realmente somos en conjunto: NATURALEZA, es muy difícil sentir los gritos de los animales en los humedales quemándose como algo de lo que somos responsables, ver las llamas desde la orilla de enfrente como consecuencia de actos que generamos, inhalar el humo y acostumbrarnos a no poder salir de nuestras viviendas por momentos como causa de malas decisiones. 🔥

❌ Cientos de miles de especies muertas, otras desorientadas en la ciudad, personas en las guardias de los hospitales con graves problemas para respirar, y el final, un ecosistema devastado pero listo para el extractivismo que nos lleva a la ruina.

💀 Si no hay biodiversidad la muerte es lo que sigue. 💀

🌍Si son responsables, si quieren que todas las especies vivan, si quieren que esta generación de humanes y la que está naciendo vivan y lo hagan en un universo posible, no hay otra alternativa que ACTUAR AHORA, frenar el ecocidio YA y abrir la DEMOCRACIA. ✊

❌ NO respirar no es una opción, NO tomar agua tampoco. ❌ Sobre cada territorio decide la comunidad que lo habita. ✊

ESTA DEMOCRACIA NO NOS REPRESENTA porque acuerpa intereses destructivos y mortales, porque niega el derecho que tomamos en nuestra primera inhalación al nacer, la libertad de VIVIR. ⏳

Title: NA
Description:
🚨PENGA ELLER LIVET?🚨

ARE YOU READY FOR THE NORDIC REBELLION?

Bli med Extinction Rebellion og vanlige folk fra hele Norden på en historisk stor sivil ulydighetsaksjon i Oslo 21.-29. august! Norge må ta et valg: Skal vi fortsette å velge penger, utbygging, industri og olje hver gang det kommer i konflikt med liv og natur? Eller skifte kurs før det er for sent?

XR fremmer to hovedkrav i aksjonsuka: “La olja ligge” og “liv foran vekst”. Olje og gass er Norges største synd. Våre nordiske venner kommer for å be oss slutte å rasere verden for oljepenger, før det er for sent. Extinction Rebellion forlanger rask utfasing av produksjon på norsk sokkel - og umiddelbar letestans.

I tillegg setter XR økonomisk vekst på dagsorden. Skal vi fortsette å rasere natur og klima for penger? Gjennom aksjoner, gatekunst og festivaler viser vi hva dette betyr. Enten det gjelder gruvedeponi i fjorden, motorveier, ny rullebane, oljefelt, hyttefelt, lakseoppdrett, rasering av matjord, skog eller dyrevelferd: Regjeringen må sette liv foran økonomisk vekst.

------

Vi bruker sivil ulydighet i våre aksjoner. Det er fordi vi mener det er nødvendig for å få til rask endring. Det har vist seg å fungere før, og vil fungere igjen om vi er mange nok. Ditt mot er nødvendig for å endre vårt giftige system! 

Vil du bli arrestert? Registrer deg her:

https://actionnetwork.org/forms/i-pledge-to-be-arrested-in-oslo?source=direct_link

MEN: Du trenger ikke bli arrestert, vi har behov for å dekke mange andre roller. Registrer deg her og velg hva du vil bidra med:

https://actionnetwork.org/forms/nordic-rebellion

@xrnorway 

Velkommen til opprør!

#nordiskopprør #extinctionrebellion #nordicrebellion #xroslo #climaterebellion #tellthetruth #leaveitintheground #equinor #rebelforlife #oslo #rebellion

Title: NA
Description:
⛽️ NATIONAL FUEL BLOCKADE ⛽️⁣
⁣
@Chevron, you are greedy, genocidal, and ecocidal. Your business model = MURDER. The Extinction Rebellion has a message for you:⁣
⁣
KEEP IT IN THE GROUND!⁣ ⛽️ 
JUST TRANSITION FOR YOUR WORKERS NOW! ⛽️
⁣
Your extractivist greed will cook our kids and rob them of a habitable planet. ⁣
⁣
For this we will not relent. We will not forgive. We will escalate. 
⁣
💀⛽️🛢⛽️💀⁣
⁣
8am: @xr_bris_meanjin rebels blockaded the dirty, dirty @Chevron Fuel Terminal in Meanjin (Brisbane).⁣
⁣
As Oilies grieved and bore witness, Climate Emergency workers turned up on site in solidarity with fuel depot workers to demand A JUST TRANSITION FOR FUEL DEPOT WORKERS NOW!⁣
⁣
🛢⛽️🚚⛽️🛢⁣
⁣
“The writing’s on the wall. These industries will not survive into the future,” says Kate, paediatric nurse and extinction rebel.⁣
⁣
“The workers here may not think we are here to support them, but we are. We demand a just transition for workers into sustainable jobs. We’re here to challenge the corporations profiting from unchecked environmental destruction.”⁣
⁣
“Action must happen now across all levels at @Chevron; their supply chains and networks. Climate action must be key to every decision and climate justice assured.”⁣
⁣
🛢⛽️🚚⛽️🛢⁣
⁣
This action is took place on stolen Turrbal land.⁣
⁣
We pay respect to Elders past and present. We acknowledge their sovereignty and ongoing resistance against the destructive forces of capitalism and colonialism which fuel the climate and ecological emergency.⁣

@xrebellionaus @xr_bris_meanjin
