Title: NA
Description:
PASS THE MIC | TOGETHER IN CRISIS 

XR Université de Goma!

Alongside our amplifying of XR Vaal and XR Makassar XR Sheffield’s Justice group have formed a partnership with XR Université de Goma. 

This groups is based in the Democratic Republic of the Congo very close to Virunga National Park and have asked us to help them with some crowdfunding to support them. There bold plans focus around fighting at all costs against oil exploitation in Virunga National Park, a world heritage site with one of the planet’s last surviving populations of mountain gorillas. 

This passionate group of ecologist’s actions so far have included educating in schools and communities, creative and peaceful actions around water preservation and against fossil fuel exploitation.

Stay tuned to hear more about the crowdfunder and a Q and A event with the group, but in the mean time here are some photos of their actions!

FOLLOW @xrsheff @xr_universite_de_goma for more!

Title: NA
Description:
GLOBAL ACTIONS AGAINST FRACKING AS MOVEMENTS AROUND THE WORLD UNITE

Rebellions in Mendoza, Argentina where fracking is having disastrous impacts on water and a solidarity action in Ireland. Climate activists tried to shut down gas terminals and protested fracking plans in several countries on July 30, as a post-lockdown push to influence the agenda ahead of November's COP26 climate summit in Scotland kicks off in earnest.

Up to 3,000 activists from Germany's Ende Gelaende, a green civil disobedience movement, blocked the Brunsbuttel liquefied natural gas terminal in a bid to stop operations. Campaigners also took to the streets in a dozen countries including Argentina, Ireland, Bolivia and Canada.

In a strategic shift, they are targeting gas rather than coal plants, and linking actions in the Global North and South. Their target is European multinationals that are doing abroad what they cannot do at home - namely fracking. The action also intends to create space for the climate movement in Scotland to regroup and rebuild momentum in the run-up to COP26. 

#WorldAgainstFracking #EndLNG #ShaleMustFall #EndeGelaende #Fracking #GlobalBanOnFracking #NotHereNotAnywhere #EndFrackingEcocide #StopGNL #ColombiaLibreDeFracking #ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateChange #ThisIsAnEmergency #ActNow

Title: NA
Description:
AUGUST RISE UP 

Wunderbar bunte und kreative Impressionen erreichen uns vom #Uprising-Festival dieses Wochenende, mit dem der morgen startende #AugustRiseUp in Berlin eingeleitet wird! 
An zwei Tagen wurden dort Vorträge gehalten, Trainings gegeben, Reden gehalten, Musik performt, Textilien bedruckt, Kipppunkte-Jenga gespielt und vieles mehr.

Und am Bahnhof Wannsee haben sich heute hunderte Menschen mit Rädern getroffen, um über die AVUS nach Berlin zu fahren. 

Am Bundesverkehrsministerium wurde sich mit den vier Fingern des @adfc_berlin zu einer großen Kundgebung getroffen, dann ging es weiter zum Festival des @augustriseup!

Bei all dem waren wir natürlich auch dabei und sind voller Vorfreude auf die kommende Woche. Bist du dabei? 🤞

Repost: @extinctionrebelliondeutschland 
#AugustRiseUp #RiseUp #Berlin #ExtinctionRebellion

Posted @withregram • @xrebellionuk IMAGINE THE COLLAPSE⁣

Imagine water sources are scarce, while some countries continue to burn fossil fuels, people go hungry, wars break out, societies collapse, this is not just about the weather, this is about what happens to society as these drastic weather events increase...⁣

We've seen throughout history what it's taken for people to create change. Now it's up to us all to imagine and then organise the movement which will lead us away from water shortages, famine, war, and fascism and towards communities coming together to tackle the climate emergency...⁣

Title: NA
Description:
REBELS IN ACTION

Five rebels appeared in court on August 5th after disruptive rally and road blocks outside the Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment in Canberra.

🎨✊🎨

Taking our message directly to Environment Minister @susanleymp Grandmother Lesley and registered nurse Daisy were arrested after scrawling "Duty of care" in red paint across a wall outside the department. Both were charged.

👴🌏💚

Grandfather and former CSIRO scientist Nick, who covered department signage in red paint, had all of his charges dropped. A win for nonviolent civil disobedience and targeted property damage in light of the climate emergency.

Nick told the courts that he would "continue to break the law if that's what it takes to avert a major catastrophe."

🚗🚙🚗

Disruption spilt onto the streets as a youth-led march created road closures and disrupted peak hour traffic on Kings Avenue Bridge. Rebels Violet and Mark were arrested after obstructing roads and refusing to comply with police requests to move on. Their case has been adjourned till August 14th.

🌏🌏🌏⁣

The stakes could not be higher. The Earth is already too hot.

Resist annihilation. Join with XR.

🖤💛❤️
⁣
This action took place on stolen Ngunnawal land.⁣
⁣
Extinction Rebellion pays respect to Elders past and present. We acknowledge their sovereignty and ongoing resistance against the destructive forces of capitalism and colonialism which fuel the climate and ecological emergency.⁣

📸 Cat Sparks
🎥 Leo Bild

Title: NA
Description:
OUR BIGGEST ENEMY IS NO LONGER CLIMATE DENIAL BUT CLIMATE DELAY.

"Nothing is more dangerous than the illusion of action.⁠⁠ Heatwaves and flooding here in the UK, temperatures topping 50C in Pakistan, hundreds killed by a heatwave in British Columbia, deadly floods in Germany and China. All within a single month. Add to that the recent dire warning from the Met Office that the age of extreme weather has just begun."

"The window to avoid catastrophe is closing with every passing day. We’re in the decisive decade in this fight, and we must treat the climate crisis as an issue that stands alone in the combination of its urgency and the shadow it casts over future generations."

"These sweeping terms—"humankind," "our planet," and "we"—fail to acknowledge some important truths. For example, the carbon emissions of the world's richest 1% are more than double those of the poorest half of the world or that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions."

"Black, Indigenous, and other people of colour in the Global South have historically contributed the least to global heating but are at disproportionate risk from its impacts—including drought, flooding, and food insecurity. Despite comprising just 5% of the world's population, Indigenous peoples protect 80% of global biodiversity. To homogenize the global population into a collective "we" is to allow those most responsible to evade accountability."

Sources: Ed Miliband for The Guardian 

Oxfam, CDP Carbon Majors Report 2017, Center for Global Development, United Nations, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

@guardian @earthrise.studio @elieoutside @atmos

Description:
💥EL MUNDO CONTRA EL FRACKING💥

🌏El viernes 30 de julio el Sur y el Norte Global se unieron contra el fracking, con acciones en Argentina, Colombia, Canadá, Alemania, Irlanda, y EEUU.

💀Las petroleras que extraen gas fósil del Sur Global y lo importan al Norte Global están cometiendo colonialismo climático.

😡La búsqueda de gas de esquisto (shale gas) ha provocado la contaminación de la tierra, el agua y el aire, así como la devastación de los pueblos originarios y sus tierras, y un impacto social desastroso en comunidades locales.

❌La cadena de suministro del fracking en Vaca Muerta, conformada por Chevron, Shell, Total y Pan American Energy (respaldada por British Petroleum), sus financiadores y en general los partidarios del desarrollo del gas de esquisto en la región, se encuentran en los centros de poder europeos y estadounidenses.

✊🏾Es necesario apoyar las luchas de las comunidades del Sur Global que pelean contra estas empresas, y poner de relieve los vínculos de esas empresas nacionales con las del Norte Global.

📢Denunciamos el fraude climático de los países europeos, que importan gas proveniente de fracturación hidráulica (fracking) para mantener limpio su récord de emisiones.

🔥¡No al fracking! ¡No al gas fósil!

Title: NA
Description:
‼️IPCC REPORT: CODE RED ‼️

Climate change does not affect us equally but no more can even those in the Global North sit back watching from a plush chair. It is devastating lives and wrecking havoc with every passing day. Nowhere is safe. The time to act is now, and treat this crisis as the alarming emergency it is. 

“​​It is unequivocal.”

Those three words are the first in the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change’s new report - their starkest warning yet on global heating.

It has laid out how the climate crisis is unequivocally caused by human activities and is unequivocally affecting every corner of the planet’s land, air and sea already.

The report, produced by hundreds of the world’s top scientists and signed off by all the world’s governments, says within the next two decades temperatures are likely to rise by more than 1.5C above pre-industrial levels bringing widespread devastation and extreme weather.

The collapse of major Atlantic currents, ice caps, or the Amazon rainforest “cannot be ruled out”, the report warns.

António Guterres, the UN secretary-general, warned: “[This report] is a code red for humanity. The alarm bells are deafening, and the evidence is irrefutable: greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel burning and deforestation are choking our planet and putting billions of people at immediate risk.”

But the report is clear that there are no cliff-edges to the climate crisis. Each tonne of carbon pumped out increases the impacts and risks of extreme heat, floods and droughts and so every tonne of carbon matters. It will never be too late to act, the report shows. Instead, the real question is how bad will it get?

Source: @guardian 

#climate #climatecrisis #globalheating #environment #ipcc #climatechange #extremeweather #heat #nature #globalwarming #sustainability #climateemergency #unitednations #antonioguterres #worldnews #news

Title: NA
Description:
ALL ROADS MUST LEAD TO REPARATIONS⁣
⁣
On Sunday rebels from across the UK came together with many movements in support of the Afrikan Emancipation Day Reparations Rebellion Groundings to block Brixton Road. It took place on Afrikan Emancipation Day, commemorated in the Caribbean and some parts of Africa marking the passing of the 1833 Abolition of Slavery Act.⁣
⁣
The Reparations Rebellion adopts a broad definition of reparations beyond monetary compensation, towards a focus on repair and stopping the harm. To this end, the roadblock reduced air pollution in Brixton and provided a space, to come together as community, including creating a Global Citizens Garden. People from all walks of life came together to prefigure what Planet Repairs and reparatory justice means for our communities. The day practically envisioned the future world devoid of ecocide which we demand. ⁣
⁣
#StopTheHarm #ActNow #ExtinctionRebellion ⁣
⁣
On 23rd August XR will take to the streets of London again⁣
⁣
This is the weekend of the 230th anniversary of the start of the Haitian Revolution in 1791 which has been declared the United Nations International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade & Its Abolition. And will be marked as part of the rebellion.⁣
⁣
Link in bio to get involved ⁣
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
XR BLOG: COULD REWILDING SAVE US? 

A lot has changed in Yellowstone Park in the past twenty-five years. Healthy stands of willow trees line the banks of streams. Songbirds sing from tree branches. Beaver dams made of willow dot the streams. If you’re lucky, you can spot a beaver slapping its tail on the surface of the water. Twenty-five years ago, it would’ve been difficult to find any of these species. What changed? And what made this healthy ecosystem possible? In one word: wolves. 

Read more on this in our blog article - link in bio.

Six pregnant women bared their bumps at Piccadilly Circus, demanding an end to fossil fuels and a future for their unborn children

Title: NA
Description:
Today, Revd Tim Hewes, 71, has sewn his lips shut outside News Corp offices in London to draw attention to the silencing of climate science by Rupert Murdoch and News corp, which has led to a catastrophic lack of effective action to tackle the climate crisis.

Speaking ahead of the action, Tim said:

‘I’m sewing up my lips to demonstrate the terrible and violent havoc Murdoch’s actions have reaped upon the world and to symbolically make visible this truth. Today there are countless people throughout the world who are voiceless and suffering because of the climate emergency. Climate science and truth has been muted and those who suffer are not being heard. I have tried everything other way I can think of to end the influences and madness represented by Rupert Murdoch and his denial of the climate emergency.’

Please pray for Tim.

#TellTheTruth

Title: NA
Description:
NEWS FROM INDONESIA - UPDATED

30 million hectares are to be returned to indigenous governance. Deforestation has dropped 75%.

But what is the true picture? 

The Widodo administration have managed to pass bills that kills environmental protection, increase support for extractive industries especially coal, removes the space for civilians to contest corporation for operational license and allows criminalisation of communities that blocks any corporation activities in conflict land. We have also seen sharp increase of land grabbing incidences, criminalisation of indigenous communities and our only anti corruption eradication body have effectively been killed. 

Even though we have policies officially in place for land grants, giving land back to indigenous control, the progress is extremely slow and the policy for moratorium palm oil is done without any enforcement, along with additional conflicting laws that makes it possible to still destroy forests. Also they have started a new program called Food Estate which is legally allowed to even use the space of protected forest to turn into monoculture fields of industrial farming, which already has been proven to fail, but they're still going ahead using military power to make. Worth mentioning that 16 out of 30 of Widodo's cabinet ministers are mining industry players and 55% of the current house parliament seats are business owners. We are at our lowest point for environmental protection as well as democracy.😢 

And although the deforestation rate has decreased as a whole country, it is partially due to the forest area already dwindling from the previously deforested islands. But they have now started moving to the east where deforestation has increased in Papua instead. In today's world, we need deforestation to be negative, which is very possible because we have 14 million hectares of degraded land ready to be rehabilitated using funds from Norway but yet to be used because corporations still love to take logs to sell in the international market. 

There is still so much work to do. Support the work of @extinctionrebellion.id 

UPDATED - information @extinctionrebellion.id

Title: NA
Description:
100 DAYS TO COP: XR MAKASSAR CALLS ON INDONESIA TO DECLARE CLIMATE EMERGENCY

Makassar, Indonesia – A number of activists from Extinction Rebellion Makassar staged a demonstration at Lego-lego Central Point of Indonesia (CPI), Makassar City. Activists urged a more ambitious climate action plan and implementation of climate change control in line with the Paris Agreement to President Joko Widodo and the Indonesian delegation at COP26. Saturday, July 24, 2021.

The action, which comes 100 days before the UNFCCC COP26 Climate Change Negotiations Conference, demands, first of all, to declare a climate emergency. 

The actions taken are based on concerns about the impact of the climate crisis and the disasters that many world researchers predict will hit Indonesia in the future if climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts are not ambitious.

In the report of the international climate change research institute, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) in 2018, it was stated that Indonesia is now one of the countries that is vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, because it is an archipelagic country with a tropical climate.

The World Meteorological Agency (WMO) states that the earth is already at a temperature rise of 1.2ºC. With the current increase in temperature, as many as 5.5 million Indonesians have become victims and have had to evacuate and suffer in the first 6 months of 2021.

#climatechange #climateemergency #climateemergencydeclaration

Description:
Our Demands: TELL THE TRUTH. ACT NOW. GO BEYOND POLITICS.

On July 10 and 11, 2021, the First National Environmental People’s Assembly was held in Colombia.
.
The face-to-face meeting took place in Támesis, Antioquia; a territory that has resisted the mega-mining company Anglo Gold Ashanti, who intends to destroy mountains, rivers, trees and endemic species of this incredible place.
.
The indigenous reservations of the south west of Antioquia, peasant communities of Támesis (who work for environmental education and the recognition of their territory), movements, collectives and socio-environmental organizations from all over the country were present.
.
Throughout the day, diagnoses were made on environmental problems at the national level, concerns, proposals and expectations were expressed from communication, mobilization, articulation of territories, political and legal work, among others.
.
We are pleased to show the achievements and objectives that have emerged from the territories and communities and wish to position themselves in the next National People’s Assembly.

Description:
1. SIGN THE PETITION. LINK IN BIO. 
2. FOLLOW @onlyone TO HELP RESTORE THE OCEAN 
3. SHARE THE WORD. 

There’s only one way to do this: Together. 

This #SharkWeek, reflect on the irreplaceable role these magnificent predators play in keeping ocean ecosystems healthy. They are misunderstood, sensationalized, criminalized and exploited. We need to stop. Now. 

‼️Sharks keep our oceans healthy. If our oceans die, we die. Period. ‼️

Sharks emerged long before dinosaurs and have evolved over 400 million years. They exist in diverse ecosystems, from the deep sea to freezing Arctic waters to tropical coral reefs and mangrove forests, and stabilize these ecosystems by eating prey. Sharks are some of the most diversified and abundant top predators in the marine food web, and if you remove sharks, you threaten to damage the entire system. 

Image Credit: @mitty 

#biodiversity #marinebiology #ocean #shark #sharks

#SharkAwarenessDay is an opportunity to separate fact from myth and celebrate these incredible marine animals who have lived in our oceans for millions of years. As top predators, sharks serve a critical role in maintaining the balance of our ocean’s most vulnerable ecosystems.

‼️Humans have driven many species of sharks to the brink of extinction, and today we are asking you to help us protect endangered sharks in Costa Rica. ‼️

Earlier this year, President @Carlosalvq signed an executive decree that gutted vital protections, leaving endangered sharks vulnerable to extinction.

Join us on only.one/costarica (link in our bio) to urge the Costa Rican President to immediately repeal his harmful executive decree and restore the Ministry of Environment’s authority to conserve and protect sharks.

Title: NA
Description:
SIGN THE PETITION - LINK IN BIO 

ACT NOW: Share this post! 

Even before dinosaurs came to be, sharks were flourishing as top predators in the earth’s oceans. They are marvels of evolution and symbols of a healthy marine ecosystem.

All around the world, hundreds of species of sharks are facing extinction, largely due to overfishing and human exploitation. Declines in shark populations can lead to cascading negative effects in marine ecosystems because they play a vital role in the food web, and are also responsible for the circulation and transfer of nutrients. Shark conservation is critical to the overall health of our oceans.

In Costa Rica, the situation is especially urgent. The country has more than 40 species of sharks, and almost half are in serious danger of extinction, including silky sharks and hammerhead sharks. Despite presenting itself as a conservation leader, Costa Rica is failing to protect hammerhead sharks (the country’s national marine conservation symbol). 

Earlier this year, Costa Rica’s government essentially legalized the overfishing, and subsequent extinction, of endangered sharks. Indeed, President @carlosalvq removed the ability of the Ministry of Environment to protect sharks, and shifted management responsibilities to the Institute of Fisheries and Aquaculture (INCOPESCA) – meaning they are no longer protected by Costa Rica’s Wildlife Conservation Law.

We are asking President Alvarado to immediately repeal his harmful executive decree and restore the Ministry of Environment’s authority to conserve and protect sharks. Join the campaign at the link in our bio (only.one/costarica) and share the #petition to help spread the word.

#sharks #hammerheadshark #sharkweek #oceanconservation #shark #CostaRica
Image Text: STOP THE KILLING OF SHARKS IN COSTA RICA only.one/costarica

TAKEOVER BY @onlyone for Shark Awareness Day!

This Shark Week: STOP THE KILLING OF SHARKS. 

ACT NOW: only.one/costarica | LINK IN BIO

Today is #sharkawarenessday. There are more than 40 species of sharks in the waters around Costa Rica, and nearly half of them are in serious danger of extinction. Hammerheads and silky sharks are the two most commonly caught sharks. Snagged on long lines that can be many miles in length with hundreds of baited hooks (intended to fish mahi mahi). 

‼️85 percent of the dead sharks haven't even reached maturity.‼️

The Costa Rican government recently essentially legalized the overfishing and subsequent extinction of endangered sharks, even those species afforded protections through international conventions like CITES.

PROTEST ART IN ACTION:
A HEARTFELT APPEAL TO WORLD LEADERS
 
✨A carpet of living grass 16mx4m, imprinted with a message by Ben Okri, was floated on the River Thames on Friday 25th, marking the launch of Writers Rebel’s latest project #PaintTheLand.

👁 Watch the scene here: 
https://twitter.com/xrrebel/status/1408791958752006151?s=21

🌾 Created by artist-activist team Ackroyd & Harvey, the artwork is the first in a series of mega-graffitos planned by Writers Rebel in the run-up to the COP26 climate summit in November. 

🖤 Speaking to an enthusiastic crowd, Ben Okri said: “Love is the only power that stands between us and extinction. Only love is endless. This is the time we need to show that we are greater than our history. We can be the agents of change.” 
 
⌛️ XR co-founder Simon Bramwell said: “There are no bystanders left any more on this planet. The catastrophe that is about to engulf us will ensure that.”
 
🌱 If you feel inspired to create your own #PaintTheLand landscape artwork, find out more here: https://xrb.link/Sb66OtB5aaB 🌱

👁 We are hoping that many XR groups and communities around the world will continue this idea in the months leading up to COP 26.
 
💚 We look forward to seeing your creations 💚
 
Love and Rebellion ✨
 
✍🏼 Writers Rebel contact: 
xrwritersrebel@gmail.com 🖤

Title: NA
Description:
NO FOOTBALL ON A DEAD PLANET

With Argentina’s men’s football team winning the Copa America and the Euro 2020 final taking place soon we thought we should remind fans that there’s no football on a dead planet. 

You will not be surprised to know that football will not be spared in the climate and ecological crisis. And the football’s governing bodies are only really concerned about endless growth and greed.

Fifa and Uefa are looking to expand almost all of their tournaments, with new tournaments being created by the year (it would seem) - something that neither fans nor teams particularly want to see. The Concacaf Gold Cup, the Africa Cup of Nations and the AFC Asian Cup have also expanded their tournaments. With 70% of football’s emissions coming from spectator travel, the expansion of these tournaments is incompatible with a living planet. It’s that simple. 

If football’s governing bodies really cared about its future they would be enacting positive climate and ecological related changes themselves and demanding action from our governments. Football relies on a stable climate. 

Without action, we will see temperatures (35C+) that will make it harder for both fans and players. At that temperature, we can expect heat cramps, heat exhaustion, heatstroke and loss of memory, hand-eye coordination and concentration. Meaning professional, grassroots, and informal football will become intolerable.

By 2050, we could see Werder Bremen’s Weserstadion and Bordeaux’s Matmut Atlantique flooded annually. In England, 23 of the 92 league grounds can expect partial or total annual flooding of their stadiums by 2050. Similar fates await estuarine and coastal stadiums everywhere.

Can football be saved? 

Yes, but first a few necessary steps would need to be taken:

1. Football needs to declare a climate and ecological emergency 
2. Say no to all championship expansion, embracing a less is more philosophy 
3. Stop all fossil fuel investment and sponsorship 
4. Stop all banking investment and sponsorship from banks and financial institutes that contribute to the climate and ecological crisis

#ExtinctionRebellion #Euro2020 #CopaAmerica #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis
Image Text: NO FOOTBALL ON A DEAD PLANET ACT NOW

Title: NA
Description:
RED REBELS DESCEND ON THE TWELVE APOSTLES 

As an expression of despair, grief and hope, Red Rebel artivists from Warrnambool, Geelong and Ballarat descended on the Twelve Apostles. ⁣
⁣
Their message for the @DanielAndrewsMP and @ScottMorrisonMP governments: ⁣
⁣
#TellTheTruth
#ActNow!⁣
No gas exploration! Seismic testing kills!⁣
⁣
On 1 July, the Andrews government lifted the ban on gas exploration, both onshore and offshore, with plans to explore for gas within five kilometres of the Twelve Apostles. ⁣
⁣
HELLO WE ARE IN A CLIMATE AND ECOLOGICAL EMERGENCY, DAN 🤪🤯⁣
⁣
Seismic testing blasts from gas exploration are so loud that they penetrate through the ocean and kilometres into the seafloor. They inflict violent disruption on marine life, including whales and dolphins, resulting in hearing loss and death⁣
⁣
🚫 Yeah, no thanks 🚫⁣
⁣
And what of economic hardship for Warrnambool? Warrnambool’s economy relies heavily on tourism from whale watching. Dead whales, indeed no whales, will decimate tourism. Fugly gas rigs, leaks or spills won’t bloody help either!⁣
⁣
"To expand fossil fuel extraction, rather than an emergency shut down of the fossil fuel industry, is insanity. We simply cannot keep doing this and expect everything to be okay,” says XR spokesperson Miriam Robinson.⁣
⁣
“…our governments are enslaved by fossil fuel interests."⁣
⁣
Gas exploration in the turbulent waters off the Southern Ocean is as irresponsible as it is absurd!⁣
⁣
It’s hard to believe state and federal governments STILL need reminding that we are in a #ClimateEmergency. They must #TellTheTruth about the climate emergency and #ActNow!⁣
⁣
While they explore earth emotions like grief and despair, the Reds remind us that there is still hope should the government #ActNow by keeping fossil fuels in the sea floor.⁣
⁣
This action took place on the stolen land of the Gunditjmara and Wathaurong people. We acknowledge that First Nations people have been rebelling against extinction for 233 years and that sovereignty was never ceded.⁣
⁣
Photo Credit: Matt Hrkac⁣
Post Credit: @xrebellionaus 

#ExtinctionRebellion #XRAustralia #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis

Title: NA
Description:
🌡🌏 TOPLINSKI VALOVI POPUT TRENUTAČNOG TEK SU POČETAK KRIZE!

Danas smo na Trgu bana Josipa Jelačića u Zagrebu upozorili da su toplinski valovi i požari kojima trenutačno svjedočimo posljedica klimatskih promjena te da ne možemo ignorirati sustavno uništavanje klime.

U sklopu performansa, troje aktivista koji su predstavljali Vlade, banke i fosilnu industriju simbolično su razbili stari i neupotrebljivi, no svejedno simboličan klima uređaj, uz transparent kojim smo zapitali građane “Što biste vi učinili da vam uništavaju klimu?”.

Da vam netko uništi vaš klima uređaj, to bi vas svakako uzrujalo, pa zašto vas onda ne uzrujava još veća razina uništenja – uništenje klime, Planete i živih vrsta? 

Kada pričamo o klimi, kao da pričamo o nečemu dalekom, neopipljivom, pa dolazi do raspršenja odgovornosti i osjećaja bespomoćnosti za djelovanje na zaustavljanju klimatskih promjena. Tako biva sve dok te promjene ne osjetimo na vlastitoj koži, kao što ih posljednjih dana osjećamo kroz toplinske udare, a znanstvena zajednica upozorava da će to biti sve učestalije. 

Zato ovim performansom želimo izazvati ljutnju, osjećaj za pravdu, osjećaj da su klima i naša budućnost u rukama svih nas i odlučnost da se za nju borimo. ✊❤

Post Credit: @xr.zagreb

#ExtinctionRebellion #XRZagreb #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #Heatwaves

Title: NA
Description:
ATTIVISTI IN AZIONE VERSANO LITRI DI SANGUE FINTO DAL PONTE DI CALATRAVA

Oggi, nel terzo giorno di meeting del G20 su Economia e Finanza, abbiamo denunciato le morti causate dal collasso climatico, ecologico e sociale, di cui le grandi potenze del G20 sono responsabili e complici.

Secondo l’Organizzazione Mondiale della Sanità, il collasso climatico causa circa 150.000 morti l’anno. 

Secondo il report Global Climate Risk Index 2021, negli ultimi vent'anni 475 mila persone hanno perso la vita a causa di eventi climatici estremi, i quali hanno provocato un totale di circa duemila miliardi di euro di danni economici.

Le delegazioni dei paesi del G20 sono responsabili del 75% delle emissioni globali di CO2 (Climate Transparency Report 2020).

Sono rinchiuse in questi giorni in una fortezza inaccessibile alla cittadinanza, per discutere di politiche economiche globali le cui ripercussioni avranno esiti sulle sorti dell’intera umanità.

Noi vogliamo portare negli spazi pubblici le paure per le catastrofi che l’umanità dovrà affrontare, secondo quanto dichiara da decenni la scienza mondiale!

Chiediamo con forza che le decisioni sul nostro futuro siano prese in contesti democratici e inclusivi, con il coinvolgimento della cittadinanza e della società civile.

Perché i governi hanno fallito e ci stanno ingannando.

I loro soldi, il nostro sangue.
 
Post Credit: @xrvenezia

#ExtinctionRebellion #XRItaly #XRVenezia #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #ActNow #TellTheTruth #CitizensAssembly

Title: NA
Description:
—

Recent satellite images reveal the scale of deforestation occuring in Bugoma forest reserve as Hoima Sugar company expands its land use deep inside the forest, and others encroach from outside. 

When Hoima Sugar was given premission to log and plant sugar cane in Hoima forest Forest, in 2016, the National Forestry Authority of Uganda took the matter to the High Court.  Yet, despite this forest being home to some of the world's most endangered species, including chimpanzees, and despite each hectare of land being worth $28,000 in carbon sequestration alone, the National Forestry Authority of Uganda lost the court case to protect this land. 

The satellite images reveal just how fast the decline is happening and  that we need to stand behind the earth defenders on the frontline protecting this forest.  The National Forestry Authority wardens are often subjected to violence and it is hard for local people to publicly support the forest for fear of reprisals. 

Around the world we stand united and strong. You have to act now! #climatecrisisishere
@xr_uganda #passthemic #climatejustice #bugomaforest

Title: NA
Description:
HOW TO DEAL WITH CLIMATE ANXIETY 

It has been a scary few weeks and climate anxiety is very real. If you feel overwhelmed and anxious about the climate problem, you are not alone. 

When it comes to climate change, fear isn’t enough to motivate long-term, sustained action. It may spur a short-term response; but long-term, it will paralyze us. 

What we actually need is efficacy – the understanding that if we act, we can make a difference in ourselves, in others, and in the world around us. And one of the best ways to build efficacy, in ourselves and others, is to look for examples of what other people like us are doing -- and share them --- and do them!

Find your local group of rebels here: rebellion.global/groups 

Reposted and inspired by @katharinehayhoe ‘s latest post! Check out her work. 

#hopeandhealing #resilient #climatesolutions #climatechange #climatechangeisreal #savingus #scicomm #mentalhealth #climateaction #climatesolutions #globalpandemic

'desertification, changing weather and famine are becoming more and more frequent'

'the long history of slavery, colonialism followed by post-colonial policies have served to keep Africa trapped in poverty. '

The climate crisis is imminent and he called for the global north to listen to the voices from the global south and to work together. 

Please show your support and agreement by engaging and spreading the message.

Description:
SPOTLIGHT: AMAZON DEFENDER ALEXANDRA NAVARAÉZ

‼️LINK IN BIO‼️

Writers Rebel interviews Alexandra Narváez, an indigenous Kofán defender from Ecuador’s northern Amazon region. 

As the first woman to join her community’s territorial guard, Alexa is a trailblazer. Her community of Sinangoe is famous for winning a historic legal battle against gold mining in 2018, which protected 79,000 acres of mega-biodiverse primary rainforest and the headwaters of one of Ecuador’s most important rivers. 

Watch the video to learn about the community's resistance, their ancestral stories, and how to support their struggle to protect the Amazon - Link in story.

Title: NA
Description:
SAVE THE NAME. SAVE THE PLANET. 

‼️LINK IN BIO ‼️ 

In May 2018 the name ‘Extinction Rebellion’ was first used in the formative Art Group meeting.

Since then it has been chanted on the streets all over the world.

This name is under threat.

Intellectual Property (IP) is as ‘strange' as the system it sprang from. In IP land anyone can apply to own a brand even if they didn’t create it. Over the past eighteen months we have successfully stopped people fraudulently claiming the rights to our work. Now we want to secure the name for the movement forever and ensure it remains out of the hands of commercial interests.

With your help we can ensure no one can claim our work, it will remain true to the copyright description on our website, forever. 

This may not sound like a big deal. But it is. If we don’t own the IP ourselves then someone, somewhere, will claim it. This is a danger to our social media accounts, our websites and other communication channels. And, when we own it, we can issue ‘cease and desist’ orders to platforms that sell fake merchandise, social media accounts that ‘pass off’ and fake affiliations.

It also means we can continue working together to co-create wonderful pieces of work, safe in the knowledge it won't be sold but will be enjoyed.

Donate today. Secure the Extinction Rebellion name, beat business as usual, make us merchandise free.

#climateemergency #actnow #tellthetruth #extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
There are more than 100 uncontacted tribes in South America and all live in the Amazon except one: the uncontacted Ayoreo who live in Paraguay 🇵🇾.

They reject interaction with mainstream society following violent encounters in the past. Right now they’re living in an ever-shrinking island of forest. Their contacted relatives and @survivalinternational are fighting to protect what remains of their land, to stop them being wiped out.

Take action for the survival of the Ayoreo - link in stories and Survival's bio.

📽️ Dates: 2001 - 2021
#UncontactedFacts #UncontactedTribesWeek

Title: NA
Description:
#UncontactedFacts

❓Did you know there are more than 100 #UncontactedTribes around the world - but the Sentinelese, who live on North Sentinel Island, are probably the most isolated tribe on the planet.

We don’t even know what they call themselves. But we do know that they’re much healthier than neighboring tribes who were forcibly contacted decades ago – many of them have been decimated.

Following a campaign by @survivalinternational and local organizations, the Indian government abandoned plans to contact them. That didn’t stop US missionary John Allen Chau from trying in 2018.

Missionaries continue trying to evangelize uncontacted tribes worldwide.

#UncontactedTribesWeek

Title: NA
Description:
Did you know it’s #UncontactedTribesWeek? 🙌 

We’re Survival International (@survivalinternational), the global movement for tribal peoples, and the only organization fighting worldwide to stop uncontacted tribes’ extermination.

Why’s it so important to fight for uncontacted tribes? 🤔

👉 They’re the most vulnerable peoples on the planet.
👉 They all face catastrophe unless their land is protected.
👉 Whole populations are being wiped out by violence from outsiders who steal their land and resources, and by diseases like the flu and measles to which they have no resistance. 

🏞️ #UncontactedTribes have vast botanical and zoological knowledge and a unique understanding of sustainable living. There’s irrefutable evidence that their territories are the best barrier to deforestation, particularly in the Amazon.

Keep an eye out for more on uncontacted tribes, right here on @ExtinctionRebellion’s account, today only! 👀✊

Title: NA
Description:
UNCONTACTED TRIBES WEEK TAKEOVER

@survivalinternational 
Survival International’s taking over our Instagram today to mark #UncontactedTribesWeek! 🏹🌎

There are more than 100 uncontacted tribes around the world from the Amazon to Indonesia, many of them survivors of past atrocities and massacres. With their rich cultures and unique worldviews, they’re a vital part of human diversity. 

They have vast botanical and zoological knowledge and a unique understanding of sustainable living. There’s irrefutable evidence that their tribal territories are the best barrier to deforestation, particularly in the Amazon rainforest.

If they’re left in peace they thrive, but everywhere they suffer racism, land theft, and genocidal violence just because they live differently.

Since 1969, Survival has led the global campaign for uncontacted tribes’ rights to their lands and livelihoods, and this fight is now more urgent than ever. Please spread the word on social media – look for the #UncontactedTribesWeek hashtag – and take action to let them live! ✊

You can help prevent genocide, put an end to the destruction of uncontacted tribes and their lands, and stop government violence and oppression.

👉 Follow: @survivalinternational

#UncontactedTribesWeek #UncontactedTribes #Indigenous #IndigenousRights
Image Text: SURVIVAL INTERNATIONAL INSTAGRAM TAKEOVER #UNCONTACTEDTRIBESWEEK Survival 33× extinciion rebellion

XR FINLAND DEMANDS 
ACTION 

Unioninkadulla nähtiin eilen laulua ja tanssia. Emme ole kuitenkaan täällä vain pitämässä hauskaa. 

Olemme turhautuneita ja väsyneitä. Olemme jatkaneet mielenilmausta nyt yli kolme päivää, eikä vaatimuksiimme ole vastattu.

Vaatimuksemme ovat seuraavat: 

❶ Kerro totuus. 
Hallituksen on julistettava Suomeen ympäristö- ja ilmastohätätila ja ryhdyttävä säännölliseen kriisitiedotukseen.

❷ Toimi nyt. 
Hallituksen on luotava sitova lainsäädäntö hiilineutraaliuden saavuttamiseksi vuoteen 2025 mennessä, ja aloitettava välittömästi laaja ekologinen jälleenrakennus.

❸ Laajennetaan demokratiaa.
Hallituksen on kutsuttava koolle kansalaisista satunnaisotannalla valittu kansalaisfoorumi. Kansalaisfoorumi käy puntaroivia keskusteluja tutkimustiedon pohjalta ja tekee ehdotuksia sosiaalisesti oikeudenmukaisista päästövähennyskohteista ja luonnonsuojelutoimista. Title: NA
Description:
G7 OCEAN REBELLION 

@theoceanrebellion As dawn broke this morning, the first day of the G7 summit in Cornwall, members of Ocean Rebellion staged a powerful theatrical action.  A mass stranding of mermaids, tangled in discarded trawler nets, washed up on a beach near the gathering of G7 heads of state. 

A foghorn dinghy sounded a deafening alarm, awakening the delegates at Tregenna Castle hotel from their apathetic dreams – 5 long blasts, the maritime SOS signal, signalling the imminent death of the oceans if the G7 heads of state fail in their high duty to act.

“Ocean Rebellion demands the G7 puts the ocean at the top of the agenda where it belongs. With fish stocks already 90% depleted, humanity cannot continue industrial fishing. Beam trawling alone emits more carbon than all of global aviation. These environmentally devastating intensive fishing methods must end NOW.  The seas are too valuable to destroy. Destroy them, and we destroy ourselves.  Ocean Rebellion calls for an emergency global ban on bottom trawling, on both biodiversity and climate grounds, by COP26.” - Sophie Miller of Ocean Rebellion

📸: Gareth Morris
@xr_photographers

Title: NA
Description:
G7: ACT NOW⁣
⁣
This weekend thousands of activists from many groups are taking to the streets and the beach in Cornwall as the G7 summit takes place. Extinction Rebellion are sounding the alarm on the G7's broken promises on the climate and ecological emergency which are already affecting people in the global south now. We need the world's richest nations to halt biodiversity loss, and rapidly reduce emissions to have any hope of climate justice. G7: Act Now⁣
⁣
Delegates from XR have presented letters from those on the front lines of this emergency to the G7 compound, marched to the G7 media centre, and even brought a boat. But these world leaders, propped up by a corporate media, continue to greenwash and make empty promises as they showboat on the world stage. G7: Tell The Truth⁣
⁣
The G7 is unable to think about major crises, they are part of a political economy obsessed with infinite growth. The leaders of the world's richest nations are stuck in the business as usual mindset. We know we need to change the system to confront this crisis. When you put ordinary citizens, representative of the population, with expert advice, they can redesign the system. We need a citizens' assembly now. G7: Trust The People⁣
⁣
#ActNow #TellTheTruth #CitizensAssemblies ⁣
⁣
Join the next wave of XR actions in the UK⁣. Go to @xrebellionuk bio. ⁣

Post Credit: @xrebellionuk

Title: NA
Description:
🔥 BURNING OUR CHILDRENS’ FUTURE 🔥

Rebels of @theoceanrebellion staged a theatrical action on the shores of the Cornish coastal resort Marazion, with the iconic St Michael’s Mount in the background. 

The action was part of an ongoing series of protests leading up to the G7 summit to be held nearby, featuring Boris Johnson sharing intimate quality-time in Cornwall with an oily Fossil Fuel Buddy. The celebrity pair were seen sitting on deck-chairs as the sun rose and a boat burned in the bay, billowing black smoke, across its sail inscribed ‘Your Children’s Future.’ 

The scene represents the UK government’s total lack of purpose to do anything to combat the catastrophic climate change, ocean acidification and biodiversity loss that will devastate all our futures and leave a dead ocean for future generations. 

@theoceanrebellion say the UK government must make the ocean a priority at the G7 summit, and want politicians to distance themselves from the fossil fuel industry. We demand all governments cease subsidies to shipping and begin to tax shipping fuel. We demand the fleet is furloughed until a full and open investigation of world fish stocks is completed, with all fisher folk to receive full pay using a tax on commercial shipping fuel. 

Countless young people have already decided not to have children because the future they will face is simply too hard. With extreme weather already afflicting many people, crop-yields are failing and food shortages are leading to conflict, forced migration and famine. Our disregard of the Ocean has led to a catastrophic decline in fish stocks, with many crucial habitats totally destroyed. 

The UK government must prioritise genuine action on climate and nature at G7. The time for posturing is over.

Photo Credit: Guy Reece

🎤PASS THE MIC🎤

Este sábado arrancamos la Rebelión Global #G7 enfrente de la embajada de Canada con un waltz! 💃🏻🕺🏻

En este waltz mostramos la situación de las mineras canadienses en México. Para visibilizar la hipocresía del gobierno de Canada, rumbo a la reunion de líderes del G7 que tendrá lugar en el Reino Unido del 11 al 13 de Junio.

🇲🇽 Un ejemplo importante del saqueo está en la minería: son las compañías mineras canadienses (en oro Goldcorp, Torex Gold, Equinox Gold, Alamos Gold, y Agnico Eagle Mines, y en plata estan Pan American Silver, y Fortuna Silver, entre otras), las cuales en los últimos 15 años han acaparado del 65% al 75% de la inversión extranjera en la minería. De las 10 minas de oro mas grandes de México, 6 son de mineras canadienses. México es por mucho el país con más extracción de plata en el mundo, y uno de los mayores en otros metales como el oro, cobre.

💰Y solo le pagan al gobierno mexicano menos del 1% en impuestos! Goldcorp (con sede en Vancouver), en Sonora pagó 0.04% en impuestos, 3000 veces menos que en Canada. Lo que NO es suficiente para cubrir el daño al medio ambiente, asi como la explotación humana y de recursos naturales. De las mas de 25 mil concesiones mineras en México, solo se hacen 200 visitas al año por parte de las autoridades.

😤Mas de 40 pueblos originarios han sufrido ocupación minera, y cuando protestan los asesinan. A los trabajadores mineros se les paga 8 veces menos que a los canadienses, y la mitad no tienen seguro medico.

💦La minería en México usa 400 millones de metros cúbicos de agua, y en muchos casos en zonas con estrés hídrico ya existente. Aparte de que son contaminados con metales pesados.

Este waltz de la muerte a dejado a las empresas canadienses ricas y al medio ambiente mexicano destruido.

#G7 #SuCodiciaNuestraMuerte #YourGreedourDeath
.
#LxsEstamosMirando #Wearewatchingyou #ProtejanNuestrxsDefensoresDeLaTierra #Protectourearthdefenders #HonrenSusDeudasMedioambientales #Honoryourenvironmentaldebts
#DejenDeMatarnos #StopKillingus

Title: NA
Description:
XR HEWA BORA DEMANDS JUSTICE FROM THE G7 

🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤

“We XR Hewa Bora being a group of indigenous people in Mugunga camp. Given the current climate situation, a campaign to raise awareness in our area (Mugunga) aimed at bringing to the local population the effects of climate change and its origin. It should be pointed out that the majority of the climate effects are from the production of factories and industries in G7 countries.

We local people gathered together as one, deciding and denouncing the environmental threats regenerated by G7 productions in terms of the environment. Note that these effects are disturbing our cultural season and causing a sharp decline in country production. 

We call for distress to all G7 countries to respect the Paris Agreement, because humanity needs a healthy environment.

Dear G7, human life is above your profits! Together let's protect the environment!”
- XR Hewa Bora, Democratic Republic of the Congo

Title: NA
Description:
XR BRASIL 🇧🇷 DEMANDS ACTION FROM THE G7 ON WORLD OCEAN DAY 

🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤

“On this June 8th, World Ocean Day, we need to warn the world about one of the biggest threats to our seas, in Brazilian territory, which is the 17th round of auctions for oil and gas exploration blocks by the Brazilian National Agency for Petroleum, Natural Gas and Biofuels (ANP). At the moment, activists from Arayara International Institue, Extinction Rebellion Brasil and Fridays For Future Brasil are performing artivism, in front of the ANP headquarters, in Rio de Janeiro, to raise awareness about the auction, which affects extremely sensitive areas, such as the National Marine Park Fernando de Noronha, the Environmental Protection Area in its surroundings and the Atol das Rocas Biological Reserve, putting at risk dozens of marine species critically endangered.

Also this week, the leaders of G7 countries – Germany, Canada, the United States, France, Italy, Japan and the United Kingdom – will meet in England, for three days, starting on Friday. Activists from the Extinction Rebellion movement and other organizations, in the UK and around the world, are planning responses to this meeting to demand effective action to stop the exploitation of fossil fuels and combat climate change.”
- XR Brasil 
@extinctionrebellion.brasil

LAKE VICTORIA IS DYING @xruggreatlakes #G7 #Act Now #Tell the truth.

In the middle of the 18thC,  Britian took the string towards infrastructural development due to the existence of Coal snd Raw materials. However towards the end of the 18thC and the start of the 19thC other European powers joined in and these included Germany,  France,  Italy and others. With the booming of the industral business across Europe which led to the exhaustion of raw materials that where facilitating production. The alternative case was Africa which later led to the 1885 Berlin Conference where african states where shared among the big wigs of Europe. With the invasion of Africa it meant exctraction of raw materials taking them to home countries however others considered settling up the industries in Africa. It must be remembered that industries are very largely known for the contributions toeards carbon emmissions ehich damages the ozone layer nevertheless persistent dumping of industral wastes both on land and in water. For this case Lake Victoria in Uganda the second biggest fresh water lake in the world has particularly been affected by the industral revolution and the wastes are partly responsible for the ultimate death of fish species around Lake Victoria. This is a very big problem. Mother Nature is being washed away by the greedy and everyone is silent. Time to act is now. Lake Victoria is bleeding.

Title: NA
Description:
XR TREES HOIMA DEMANDS THE G7 SAVE THE BUGOMA FOREST

🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤 

XR Trees Hoima joins the global action to amplify our voices about the Save Bugoma Forest campaign. 5 sq miles of land part of Bugoma tropical forest were given away to Hoima Sugar for sugar cane growing. Activists together with other environmental conservation organisations sued Hoima Sugar and National Environmental Management Authority, NEMA, in the courts of law for issuing a licence to Hoima Sugar which the activists termed as illegal and unlawful action. The activists lost the case to Hoima Sugar, meaning they will go ahead to clear cut the forest and plant sugar cane which still activists are against it.

“We are calling upon the G7 countries to stop supporting the so called investors of Hoima Sugar in terms of loans and put a total ban of their products to be consumed in their countries.

We are working to support community tree planting by giving them quality indigenous tree seedlings for planting in their degraded farm lands as well as raising awareness of the dangers associated with cutting the forest which include among others, wildlife displacement hence conflicts between communities and wildlife, climate change, desertification, etc.” 
- XR Trees Hoima, Uganda
@xr_uganda

🎤 Pass The Mic: Global Rebellion 🎤

¡¡Hoy en el Día del Medio Ambiente arrancamos la Rebelión Global #G7 con el Sonidero Rebelde!! 💃🏻🕺🏻

@xr_youth_mx, @xrchihuahua, @xr_toluca, @xr_mex,  y  @xr_pachuca estamos bailando, pero también estamos recordando la avaricia e hipocresía de los gobiernos y empresas de los países del G7, que lo que no pueden destruir en sus países vienen a destruir a los nuestros, quieren comprar y vender todo, como si la vida tuviese precio.

🗓La reunión de líderes del G7 tendrá lugar en el Reino Unido del 11 al 13 de Junio

😤 Estos países suelen celebrar que en 2015 firmaron el histórico Acuerdo Climático de París para limitar las emisiones globales. Pero la realidad es que ninguna de las naciones del G7 está cumpliendo las promesas que hicieron. 🌎⌛️

💰 Mientras tanto sus empresas vienen a México con promesas de generar prosperidad en el país a través de sus inversiones. Pero la realidad es que están saqueando nuestros recursos, y dejandonos un territorio esteril y contaminado. 

⛏Un ejemplo importante del saqueo y contaminación son las mineras canadienses. 

⛽️Dada la crisis climática, es urgente hacer cambios profundos en nuestra sociedad, economía y gobierno. Ya NO podemos seguir extrayendo petróleo!! Pero las empresas petroleras del G7, siguen impunes destruyendo el planeta. En México tenemos empresas de Estados Unidos, Italia, Reino Unido, Alemania, y Francia. Todas ellas acercándonos cada vez más al punto de no retorno y colapso ambiental. 🌎⌛️

🚗 La gran industria automotriz en México (No. 6 global en 2018) también es muy contaminante, no solo en producción sino también en el uso de los automóviles mismos.  Aquí también empresas del G7 sobresalen, por ejemplo de Alemania, Japón,  Estados Unidos. No podemos seguir produciendo automóviles, y menos de combustión interna. 

Los países del G7 NO están haciendo lo suficiente para limitar el calentamiento global. Por eso les decimos que #LxsEstamosMirando, necesitamos que #HonrenSusDeudasMedioambientales, #ProtejanNuestrxsDefensoresDeLaTierra, porque sus empresas nos están matando y por eso les decimos #DejenDeMatarnos, #SuCodiciaNuestraMuerte.

Description:
G7 GLOBAL REBELLION 
🎤 PASS THE MIC 🎤

Yesterday on World Environment Day @xr_makassar had a mural party in the city centre where they painted a giant climate emergency mural asking the G7 to act rather than greenwash and to mark the start of ‘resistance month’ for all Indonesian citizens who have been deprived the right of living on a healthy planet. Here’s some words from XR Makassar on the action and G7:

“Through our mural party we offer aspirations and social critics to our stakeholders to act quickly to cope with the climate crisis situation that threatens our survival. 

G7 We are tired of your polished words, bought at a huge expense from your slick think tanks. 

We are exhausted by your twisted plans to carry on as usual, while making yourselves appear the saviour of the planet. We are watching. 

We see G7 corporations destroying livelihoods and destabilising planetary safety nets in countries where you think you’re not seen. But we see you supporting the frackers, the drillers, the loggers, the polluters - all your friends.

We are calling on you G7, to listen, hear us for we are watching you and we will not be silent.”

We stand with you 🙏

@xrsheff 🇮🇩 Pass the Mic 🎤➡️ @XR_makassar in Indonesia! 🇮🇩

Title: NA
Description:
🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤

“Les pays du #G7 doivent arrêter de se réjouir avec le bénéfice de leurs usines tant que leurs usines produisent des dégâts environnementaux au niveau mondial et qui nous affectent actuellement aussi dans notre région. Actuellement ici à shasha, nous sommes affectés par des inondations chose qui n’existait pas il y a plus de 15ans. Ces inondations se sont accélérées ces dernières années, depuis 2010 et occasionnent la perte et la destruction de nos maisons, nos écoles et quelques fois ces inondations rendent impraticable la route. Nous appelons donc les pays G7 à prendre conscience face à cette situation, et à agir en faveur du climat pour donner la chance à ce monde de survivre. Ces inondations occasionnent des maladies comme la malaria parce que les milieux marécageux formés suite à ces dégâts sont devenus des poches de résistance des moustiques. Actuellement dans notre région, suite au changement climatique, les agriculteurs ne savent pas encore comment s'adapter à leurs saisons culturales, parce qu’ils avaient comme seul repère de début de la saison pluvieuse où La saison sèche. Suite à la perturbation des saisons par le changement climatique, ils ont perdu ce repère et beaucoup cultuve soit dans des périodes pluvieuses ou sèches. la production de la région  est sensiblement affectée suite à cette perturbation. Comme le principal activité ici à shasha et ses environs est l’agriculture, la communauté locale s’appauvrit d'avantage. XR  Shasha appelle donc ces pays à honorer leur dette en faveur du climat, pour freiner cette allure dévastatrice de l’environnement.”
- XR Shasha, Democratic Republic of Congo 
@xrshasha 

#PassTheMic #G7 #COP #COP26 #XRShasha #DRC #DemocraticRepublicOfCongo #NousDevonsAgirMaintenant

Title: NA
Description:
PASS THE MIC SOLIDARITY ACTION REMINDER 

The G7 represent the world's richest and most powerful governments who continue to pander to the multinational companies committing environmental crimes in Africa, Latin America and much of Asia. They are in bed together, seeking to maintain profit at the expense of people in the Global South and other MAPA who are the least responsible for the climate crisis.

The poorest 50% of humanity only accounted for 7% of the cumulative emissions between 1990 and 2015 while 10% of the richest accounted for 52%.

Today, XR groups from the global north will give their platforms and media resources to XR groups from places already heavily impacted by climate change. Let's come together and amplify their messages!

Title: NA
Description:
XR SUDAN DEMANDS HUMAN RIGHTS FOR ALL 

🎤 Pass The Mic: G7 Global Rebellion 🎤

“Forests in Sudan are between citizen's axes and troop's tractors. 

So, on 5th June 2021 #WorldEnvironmentDay we cleaned up litter in the Al- Sunut forest, which suffered huge damages from the cutting of trees by government commissioned tractors. We also discussed environmental sanitation and crimes, in addition to desertification, water pollution and raised community awareness to the importance of protecting the earth for the sake of future generations.”
- XR Sudan
@xr_sudan 

Our Letter to the G7: 

“Dear G7,

We, Extinction Rebellion groups in the global south, are asking members of the G7 to make decisions that embody human rights for all.

We ask that you be exemplary leaders globally and not only on your own territory. We ask that you stop what is happening in the global south which is being devastated by companies and consumption from the global north. 

This catastrophic destruction of climate and ecology is costing us our livelihoods and our lives. How many of us will be forced to leave our lands through water scarcity, soil degradation, pollution, fires, extreme weather events and sea level rise?

We ask that you restore and preserve existing spaces not only in the global north, but also in the global south. Right now, we see that the companies of the G7 are doing the opposite of this. 

We ask for a Paris Agreement for everyone. We hold you accountable. Your preservation is our preservation and our preservation is your preservation. 

Specifically, we say this: 
G7- We are watching you
G7 – We are tired of your polished words, bought at huge expenses elsewhere”
- XR Sudan 
@xr_sudan

Title: NA
Description:
Con este video queremos transmitir cómo el descubrimiento del petróleo en Ecuador dio inicio a una época de despilfarro de la naturaleza. 

Queremos ser escuchadxs por los países del Norte que lo han permitido y se han beneficiado sistemáticamente.

G7, estamxs cansadxs.

Cansadxs de la destrucción ambiental en Ecuador de parte de sus empresas petroleras y mineras.

De las políticas de sus instituciones financieras que nos obligan a seguir explotando y degradando a nuestra naturaleza.

Del dolor que sienten los pueblos indígenas y campesinos al ver cómo se entregan sus tierras ancestrales a empresas extranjeras.

¡Tenemxs miedo!

En Ecuador somos altamente vulnerables a inundaciones y sequías, y nuestras economías y formas de vivir dependen en un clima estable.

Nuestros ecosistemas megadiversos son frágiles a cambios, y las especies únicas que tenemos también dependen de un clima estable.

La búsqueda de petróleo y minerales ha causado despilfarro de la naturaleza en nuestra Amazonía y en el resto del país.

Nuestra agua, huertas y animales están contaminadxs.

Necesitamos más acciones urgentes, G7, para salir de la dependencia del petróleo y extractivismo. 

¡Dejen de ignorarnos y actúen YA!

Lxs estamxs mirando.

Title: NA
Description:
G7 - HONOUR YOUR ENVIRONMENTAL DEBTS

We, in the Global South, call on the G7 to take ownership of its immense responsibility for the climate crisis. We are losing our seasonal weather patterns. We are losing our homes and livelihoods to floods, fires, sea-level rise and extreme weather. We did not cause this, G7, you did. Honour the climate debt you owe us. 

The poorest 50% of humanity only accounted for 7% of the cumulative emissions between 1990 and 2015. While 10% of the richest accounted for 52%.

We call on the G7 to take ownership of its immense responsibility for environmental destruction. You let your companies pollute our lands with mining, fracking, forest and ecosystem destruction of all kinds. You even dump your waste in our lands. Our water is undrinkable, our soil unproductive, our air filthy. Honour the debt you owe us for this immense environmental destruction.

Title: NA
Description:
X-PRESS FEEDERS - CLEAN UP YOUR MESS 

MV X-Press Pearl, a Singapore-flagged container ship leaking acid and plastic pellets into the Indian Ocean around Sri Lanka, has begun to sink after burning for over two weeks near Colombo harbor. The vessel with a container leaking nitric acid reported smoke from the cargo on the 20th May and fire on deck on 21st May. 🔥🚢

The island's maritime regulations regarding these incidents are quite weak. Overlapping mandates of different government organizations, legal loopholes are yet to be fixed even though this is the third maritime adversary experienced by the country. On 28th May, Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) revealed in a press release that on 19th May, when MV X-PressPearl contacted SLPA to inform that it would arrive in the waters of the Port of Colombo at mid-night, SLPA had not been informed of any chemical leakage on board the vessel. ⚖️

It is estimated at least 3 containers full of nurdles (plastic pellets) have fallen into the ocean during the fire, which roughly calculates up to 3,975,000,000 nurdles which are now destroying marine life and corals. A substantial proportion of the ship's cargo is fuel, acid, and other toxic contaminants, which will be released into the ocean as the ship sinks. Any fuel and lube oil petroleum leak from the vessel will further worsen the damage caused by plastic nurdles and chemicals that fell into the ocean. ☣️💀

The public is already witnessing dead marine animals being washed ashore that have swallowed plastic pallets or toxins now dissolved in the ocean. ⏳

This is the worst environmental disaster in Sri Lanka's history and will affect the island for centuries to come. As the owners of the vessel MV X-PressPearl, the Singapore-based company @xpressfeeders should take responsibility for this destruction and compensate for the destruction it caused to our marine ecosystem as well as for the destroyed livelihoods of Sri Lankan fishing communities. 🗣️

Show your support 
1. Sign the petition - link in bio
2. Share this post, tag @xpressfeeders and demand they clean up their mess

Animation: @pradeep_siriwardhana

#ExtinctionRebellion #YourGreedOurDeath #PlasticPollution

Description:
G7 - YOUR GREED, OUR DEATH 

We call on the G7 countries to tell the truth about consumption.
The per capita consumption footprint of the richest 10% is more
than 10 times the 1.5C-consistent target for 2030, and more than
30 times higher than the poorest 50%
The G7 carbon-intensive economies are consuming too much and
it is destroying everyone’s basic needs. But it is especially
affecting basic needs in countries that did least to cause climate
and natural destruction. Our water is polluted by industry and
agriculture and dangerously diminished by climate change. Our
soil is depleted. Our forests cut and burned. Our food systems
destabilised by climate change. Our lands flooded and lost to
storms and sea-level rise. We did not benefit from your high-
carbon, high-polluting, high-destructive lifestyles. Yet we are at
the centre of its impact. Your greed: our death.

Title: NA
Description:
DON’T BURN OUR FUTURE 

Krisis iklim mengancam keberlangsungan hidup semua orang di muka bumi. Namun, anak-anak adalah kelompok yang paling rentan terhadap dampak krisis iklim. Seiring dengan meningkatnya kekeringan dan banjir yang menurunkan produksi pangan, anak-anak akan menanggung beban kelaparan dan kekurangan gizi terbesar. Saat suhu meningkat, bersama dengan kelangkaan air dan polusi udara, anak-anak akan merasakan dampak paling mematikan dari penyakit yang ditularkan melalui air dan gangguan pernapasan yang berbahaya. 

Dalam rangka hari anak internasional, mari kita gaungkan pesan pesan perjuangan untuk menuntut keadilan iklim bagi anak-anak yang berada di kehidupan kita sekarang. Karena mereka adalah masa depan bumi ini yang berharga, yang berhak untuk tumbuh bebas di lingkungan hidup yang sehat.

Buatlah konten berisikan pesan menutut keadilan ini dengan anak yang kehidupannya perlu diperjuangkan, dan unggah dengan tagar #BebasTumbuhDiLingkunganSehat dan #JanganRenggutMasaDepanKami lalu tag  @extinctionrebellion.id dan @jedaiklim agar pesannya bisa digaungkan lebih jauh lagi.

Demi kehidupan kita semua.

Mari bersuara dan beraksi.

Post Credit: @extinctionrebellion.id

Title: NA
Description:
CLEAN GAS IS A DIRTY LIE

A green washing machine is part of a creative blockade of Peterhead power station this morning with four rebels locked-on.

20 rebels from Extinction Rebellion Scotland and Glasgow Calls Out Polluters blocked the entrance to the SSE gas power station in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire, preventing vehicle access to the site, with four activists locked-on to a green-painted washing machine and two red gas canisters. 

The group’s banner says ‘Clean Gas is a Dirty Lie’ and hung green clothes on a washing line, which includes slogans like ‘COP26: Stop the Greenwash’ and ‘Climate Inaction Kills’.

Greenwashing” is when a company pays to advertise themselves as friends of the environment, while continuing to cause ecological destruction.

The UK Government have taken money from SSE to sponsor the United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP26) in Glasgow this November while the company run Scotland’s most polluting power station. 

We are also calling for a “Just Transition” away from a fossil fuel based economy that does not abandon those who would be most affected by that shift.

Post Credit: @xrscotland 

#ExtintionRebellion #XR #ActNow #Greenwash #PollutersOut #JustTransition #ClimateJustice #Scotland #Glasgow #COP26 #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalEmergency

Title: NA
Description:
🦒 NÄR BINA TYSTNAR 🦒 

När bina tystnar var en konstperformance för att uppmärksamma att vi befinner oss i början på den sjätte massutrotningen – en utrotning som vi som människor har åsamkat, och med en uppmaning till regeringen att kriminalisera ekocid. En miljon arter hotas av utrotning inom de närmsta decennierna. Så mycket som tre fjärdedelar av alla arter på jorden riskerar att försvinna under de närmaste århundradena om vi inte agerar nu. Flera studier visar också på en skrämmande nedgång i insektspopulationer - faktum är att 40 procent av alla insektsarter hotas av utrotning. I Sverige står redan 30 procent av alla bi- och humlearter med på Artdatabankens rödlista - de är alltså på väg att försvinna. Insekter är livsviktiga som föda för djur och som pollinatörer. Minst 75 procent av globala grödor är i någon utsträckning beroende av pollinatörer. Insektsdöden leder alltså till matbrist och svält och i förlängningen att människor dör. Det ligger således ett djupt allvar bakom titeln på vår aktion - utan naturen överlever vi inte.

Aktionen inleddes 12.30 på Sergels torg med att vi ramade in torget med banners, och började montera en giraff i naturlig storlek. Efter det följde en flashmob av blodindränkta rebeller.

Rebellerna som deltog i aktionen var mycket stillsamma, värdiga och tysta. Folk stannade upp och tittade. Vissa kom fram till de blodindränkta rebellerna och pratade. Efter ett tag kom polisen, och vissa rebeller som inte ville lyda blev bortburna.

Media skrev om oss. För länkar till artiklar, se linktree på vår profil.

Passa på att fira nu alla, XR-rebeller! Det här var en fantastisk aktion och sättet vi kunde genomföra aktionen på, budskapet vi förmedlade, allt folk och media som nåddes av vårt budskap, konstens kraft och styrkan i gemenskapen och samarbetet - det känns och är en seger. Njut och fira. Vi tar nya tag snart igen. ✨✨✨

Post Credit: @extinctionrebellionsv 

#närbinatystnardörvi #extinctionrebellion #rebelforlife #ecocide #ecocidelaw #sixthmassextinction #extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
NEWS REBELLION 

Die Klimakrise ist die größte Herausforderung des 21. Jahrhunderts. Deshalb ist es höchste Zeit, dass sich diese Tatsache angemessen in den Medien widerspiegelt. Mit bundesweiten Aktionen vor Redaktionen und Rundfunkanstalten wiesen wir die Medien heute auf ihre besondere Verantwortung für umfangreiche Berichterstattung hin.

Bereits am frühen Morgen enthüllten Menschen in Leipzig ein Denkmal aus Eis vor dem MDR mit der Aufschrift: "27.5.2021 // 419 ppm CO2 // Wir werden nicht sagen können, wir hätten nicht gewusst, was zu tun war". Nach der Aktion erhielten sie eine Einladung zum Gespräch mit dem MDR. Nach einem bunten Protest vor dem SWR Studio in Stuttgart wurden wir ebenfalls zu Gesprächen eingeladen.

In Hamburg begann vor dem Verlagshaus Gruner + Jahr eine Demonstration, die im weiteren Verlauf an den Redaktionen von SPIEGEL, ZDF, Bauer Media Group und ZEIT vorbeiführte. Bei Bauer Media Group klebten sich Menschen an die Scheiben, um ihrem Protest Nachdruck zu verleihen. Auch in Düsseldorf wurden Medienhäuser besucht, umgeben von großem Polizeiaufgebot.

In München befestigten sich mehrere mit Sekundenkleber und Eisenketten im Foyer der Sendezentrale des Bayerischen Rundfunks, um die Verantwortlichen der Sendeanstalt zu einer besseren Berichterstattung über die Klima- und Umweltkrise aufzufordern. Sie sendeten eine eigene Nachrichtensendung namens "GlueOn TV" aus dem Foyer des BR live im Internet. Weitere Unterstützer*innen besetzten den Vorplatz des Funkhauses und stellten eine Talkshow nach.

Dass sich @das_erste heute dazu entschlossen hat, #SprücheVor8 statt @KlimaVor8 einzuführen, verdeutlicht, warum wir weiter protestieren müssen. Wir fordern, dass die Medien ihre Berichterstattung konsequent an der Klima- und ökologischen Krise ausrichten und in jedem Ressort mitdenken sollen. Die Dramatik erfordert eine breite Aufklärungskampagne über die beiden in Verbindung stehenden Krisen. Auch darf das Problem nicht durch verharmlosende Begriffe wie "Klimawandel" heruntergespielt werden. Denn wir befinden uns in einer globalen Katastrophe! 

#ExtinctionRebellion #XR #FreeThePress #MediaRebellion #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis

Title: NA
Description:
Sri Lanka is witnessing one of its worst marine pollution disasters because of the fire in the container ship X-Press Pearl. 

According to the @pearlprotectors plastic pellets from the vessel have polluted Sri Lanka's Western Province Coastal Belt, causing irreversible damage to marine ecosystems and affecting the region's fishing industry for months to come. These pellets will absorb surrounding chemicals and toxins with time making them even more dangerous. ⚠️🐟

@oceanswellorg reports that there is also a possibility of acid rain due to the nitric oxide and nitric dioxide (NO and NO2) produced in the combustion of the vessel's chemicals. However, if the concentration remains low, the potential acid rain would likely produce less worrying results. 🌧️

They further state that the chemicals onboard the vessel such as nitric acid, caustic soda, solid sodium methoxide, cosmetics, methanol, and vinyl acetate will likely have local impacts and dissipate. However, the oil spill from the vessel remains a bigger concern. 🛢️

In the meantime the public is advised to refrain from touching/picking up any of the debris or wreckage from the vessel that floats ashore ‼️

Post Credit: @xrebellionlk Photo Credit: Colombo Gazette
Post Sources: @oceanswellorg @pearlprotectors & The Morning 

#XPressPearl #SriLanka #CoastalPollution #MarinePollution #OilSpill #AcidRain #PlasticPollution #ActNow #XPressFeeders #ExtinctionRebellion #XR #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #OceanRebellion #Sea

Title: NA
Description:
WORLD HEALTH ORGANISATION DIRECTOR GENERAL MEETS EXTINCTION REBELLION DOCTORS

Year after year, declaration after declaration, multilateral institutions - including the World Health Organisation (WHO) - have warned us: climate change and the loss of biodiversity endanger human health worldwide.

"Climate change is the greatest threat to global health in the 21st century" WHO

Global warming is an existential threat for future generations. More than a threat, it is in fact already a reality. As frontline health workers, we are confronted every day with the consequences of environmental deterioration on our patients and communities. The list of ailments they suffer from is getting longer every day. We are seeing more and more respiratory and cardio-vascular diseases due to polluted air, loss of working days and deaths due to heat waves, over and undernutrition due to lack of quality food, and diarrhoea and intoxications due to polluted drinking water.

Despite accumulating evidence, repeated warnings from numerous organisations and successive international conferences, worrisome indicators from monitoring tools and successive assessments, despite more frequent and more serious natural disasters, including the COVID-19 pandemic - probably heralding the emergence of new health disasters - the concrete actions implemented by our governments are not nearly enough considering the severity and urgency of the situation.

Faced with inertia, inaction and the abyssal distance between speeches and actions, we, the signatories, who witness every day the deterioration of the health of our patients and communities due to climate change and environmental degradation, demand: That health authorities in every country publicly state that climate change is putting people at risk of death, and act now to preserve life.

Find out more about the immediate actions healthcare institutions, professionals and governments can take to mitigate the worse effects of climate change and biodiversity loss - link in bio. 

#RedAlertWHO #ActForLife #WorldHealthOrganisations #Pandemics #DoctorsOfXR #XRDoctors #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #WHO

Title: NA
Description:
JUSTICE FOR THE ZADISTS 

On 21st May 2021, Activists from China, France and Switzerland started a indefinite hunger strike against ecocide. Demanding a acquittal to all the Zadists. 

In the Grève pour l'Avenir (Strike For Future) demonstrations, there were 4000 activists demanding immediate action on the climate and ecological emergency. Musicians and XR dancing rebels, XR Citizen Assembly, XR Doctors all greeted the hunger strikers in Saint Laurent. 

They held their boards high for people to see, and swam through the the crowds to share their flyers to invite people to bring their sleeping bags and join them. 

Later on, they wrote speeches in a rush. Robin repeated his speech about his story of repression.

Howey read her speech as a poem, about the eviction and brave zadists defending the hill of the Mormont. 

“The goddess of justice is upset. Children who want to protect their future are put in jail and fined, while multinationals like Lafarge/Holcim continue to dig up mountains and threaten fragile ecosystems."
- Howey

“We are the sacrificed generation, the last one who can change everything. We are applauded when we talk about changes, but when as try to build the future we want, we are arrested, we are gassed, we are hit."
- Robin 

As a normal stranger on the streets, they have exposed their vulnerabilities to the public, because they trust the connection and love to the earth and all beings. So they set themselves in the harms way to create a bridge to connect with everyone. 

Post Credit: @howey_ou 

#ClimateActivistsAcquittal #ZadistsAcquittal #ClimateJustice #ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #Switzerland #China #France #HungerStrike #Strike #StrikeForFuture #FridaysForFuture

Title: NA
Description:
XR BLOG: SEA LEVEL RISE 

For a long time, the ocean has been our greatest friend. It has helped us to survive, explore, and connect with one another over many thousands of years.

We owe our lives and many of the privileges we enjoy today to our relationship with the sea. But deep trenches have formed in this relationship that are manifesting in terrifying ways – and our species is entirely to blame. Since the dawn of the industrial revolution, humans have exploited both land and sea at ever-increasing rates for profit and power and our planet has become warmer and warmer as a result. 

Now our actions have transformed the ocean into a formidable foe: sea levels are rising faster than at any other point in recorded history and these swelling tides threaten to swallow up the land that many of us call home. It is now clear that this observable threat will have consequences never before seen in human history, some of which might just surprise you.

Read more on this in our blog article - link in bio. 

#ExtinctionRebellion #XR #ExtinctionRebellionBlog #XRBlog #ClimateCrisis #EcologicalCrisis #Blog #SeaLevelRise #Oceans #Sea
