Title: NA
Description:
No, el frío no sirve como argumento para negar el calentamiento global. 
No, dos días de nieve no desmienten décadas de conocimiento sobre la crisis climática. 

Por si hiciera falta, vamos a recordar algunos conceptos básicos del método científico:

En primer lugar, siempre debemos distinguir bien entre un caso y una tendencia. 

Un caso, o un momento, es un evento particular y muy localizado en el tiempo: como una semana de frío inusual. 

Una tendencia es un proceso general cuya existencia deducimos a partir de la observación de todos los casos particulares durante largos periodos de tiempo: como el calentamiento global, demostrado en el ascenso continuado de las temperaturas medias globales desde mediados del siglo XX, (con la famosa "pala de hockey" que se observa a partir de los años 70). 

Negar una tendencia (como el calentamiento global) seleccionando una fracción de casos particulares se denomina falacia “cherry picking”, y es muy habitual en el negacionismo y las teorías de la conspiración. 

Cuando nos encontramos en una situación de confrontación con posturas negacionistas, es importante tener muy claro lo siguiente: discutir de igual a igual con el negacionismo no es razonable, ni deseable, ni constructivo. Poner la ciencia y el negacionismo al mismo nivel sólo crea una falsa sensación de debate abierto, que no se corresponde al consenso científico en el tema, y legitima al negacionismo como una postura defendible (que es exactamente lo que busca). 

Ahora bien, tampoco es razonable, ni deseable ni constructivo responder de manera agresiva, insultando o ridiculizando a los negacionistas. Nuestro objetivo es concienciar y pasar a la acción, y nadie va a escuchar a quien le insulta. Este es uno de los diez principios de Extinction Rebellion.

Insistamos siempre en el consenso científico inapelable en esta cuestión, denunciemos las falacias lógicas habituales del negacionismo (“cherry picking”, confusión de procesos breves con largos, falsos términos medios, falacias ad hominem contra la comunidad científica...) y, sobre todo, recordemos que se trata de un tema en el que nos jugamos nuestra supervivencia, literalment

Post Credit: @esxrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @xrebellionwa: 

Extinction Rebellion cause disruption in the CBD to say: Extreme fire danger is the new normal, due to the climate emergency
 
On Monday 11 January at 12:30 pm, Extinction Rebellion (XR) protesters held a pop-up protest in Perth CBD, as bushfires continue to rage across the state one year after Black Summer.

The protest highlights the connection between the climate emergency and the bushfire emergency in response to the recent bushfires that have torn through Western Australia.
Recent bushfires across the state have endangered lives, damaged ecosystems and forced people to evacuate their homes.
XR spokesperson Gerard Mazza says, “we are causing disruption to remind people that the climate emergency creates deadly fire conditions. We must recognise this and act now on the climate crisis, to avoid further danger.”

XR demand that media and government tell the truth about the climate crisis. Scientific evidence states that the climate crisis makes bushfires more likely and severe.

Mr Mazza says, “We don’t want to cause an inconvenience for people, but we don’t have much choice, given that those in power have failed to tell the truth or to act. Someone has to sound the alarm.

“All media outlets should be highlighting the climate emergency in their reporting on bushfires. Government must tell the truth, too, by declaring a climate emergency and conveying the full extent of the dangers we face.”

Some Extinction Rebellion members have experienced the effects of bushfires firsthand. Julie Marsh is an Extinction Rebellion member from Denmark, Western Australia. She says, “I live with the constant threat of bushfire in our drying climate. Summer is no longer a pleasure, as I scan the horizon and sniff the air for smoke everday. I will it to stay cool, to protect our beautiful forest, and to protect my husband and two sons from having to go to fight the fire.”

Images: @miles_tweedie_photography 

#xrwaaction #xrwalocal #xrwa_local_groups 

@xrwawesternsuburbs @xrwagrandparents @xrwa_youth @xrwa_reapers @xrebellionaus @xrebellionaus

Title: NA
Description:
NATURE NEEDS JUSTICE 

Just as the climate movement demands climate justice, justice is needed in nature conservation! In national parks, for example, one sees that without justice in conservation Indigenous people are banished from their lands or even killed. Here it should be noted: 80% of all the world's biodiversity is currently found on the lands of Indigenous peoples, because they generally maintain very regenerative lifestyles that place little stress on ecosystems.

A systemic change in conservation is needed. Solutions like CO2-offsetting and green capitalism will not save life on this planet. Even more so if nothing is done about the consumption of people in the Global North and the industries and governments responsible for biodiversity loss.

Therefore, @extinctionrebelliondeutschland are launching the #NatureNeedsJustice campaign from the Global North to reflect on our responsibility and how we think and act. 

The campaign aims to raise awareness that conservation in the past and today is often linked to racism, and to identify solutions for just conservation that protects human rights and biodiversity at the same time.

📅 January Schedule

Week 1 - 11-15 January:
• The path to justice in the struggle for a liveable future - decolonisation, allyship and self-reflection

Week 2 - 18-22 January: 
• The racist and colonial roots of nature conservation and its neo-colonial present 

Week 3 - 25-29 January 
• Indigenous communities and biodiversity - securing land rights of communities and giving land back

👉🏾 Find Out More - Link in Bio 

#ClimateJustice #IndigenousRights #EnvironmentalJustice #Conservation #Biodiversity #Ecosystem #Regenerative #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalEmergency

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @xr_nyc ✊ Residents of New York City are joining allies in Alaska and around the world, responding to Alaska Native leaders’ call for an International Day of Solidarity on Wednesday, January 6th, the day the lease sale in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge is scheduled. They are calling for New Yorkers to rise up with indigenous Gwich’in and Inupiaq leaders, who oppose oil extraction in the Arctic Refuge, with An Hour of Solidarity during the lease sale, from 9:30am-10:30 AKST (1:30-2:30pm EST). Extinction Rebellion NYC invites the public, together with the organization Defend the Sacred Alaska, to voice outrage at this rushed and illegal lease sale through the Twitter hashtag #ProtectTheArcticRefuge, because oil extraction threatens all our futures and global climate stability.

With harmfully short notice, the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) announced on December 7th that they will sell oil leases in what Native leaders call ‘The Sacred Place Where Life Begins’ — Iizhik Gwats’an Gwandaii Goodlit — also known as the Coastal Plain of the Arctic Refuge. On November 17th, the BLM announced a “Call for Nominations,” asking companies to submit their leasing interests. This followed the Record of Decision (on the Final Environmental Impact Statement), released August 17th, in which was selected Alternative B: the most egregious and harmful option. This opens the entire coastal plain, the birthing grounds of the Porcupine Caribou, to oil extraction. 

👉For more information visit https://www.defendthesacredalaska.org/ @defendthesacredak http://ourarcticrefuge.org/, @ourarcticrefuge https://www.silainuat.org/, @silainuat https://nativemovement.org @native_mvmt 

👆Defend the Sacred Alaska is an Alaskan movement to boldly uplift our sacred connection to each other, the earth, and all living beings. 

#ProtectTheArctic
#StandWithTheGwichin 
#InupiatGwichinSolidarity
#DefendTheSacredAK
#XRNYC #ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateAction #ClimateCrisis #ClimateEmergency #ThereisNoPlanetB #RespectEarth #SystemChange #RebelForLife #ActNow

Title: NA
Description:
Santa and their elf were arrested last night. They left messages of climate peace on giant Christmas Tree in Tarntanyangga (Victoria Square, Adelaide). 🎅🎄👮‍♀️ 

AN ACTION BY @xrebellionaus ! 

On December 21, dressed in festive attire, Mai scaled the tree dropping banners reading ‘Climate Peace’ and ‘Goodwill to Earth’. They were assisted by their trusted elf, Keith. Other rebels who spray chalked messages surrounding the tree.

Both Mai and Keith were arrested and charged with trespass and property damage. They are both safe and in good spirits. Their court appearance is scheduled for March next year.

Santa is losing his home.

The combined rate of ice loss for Greenland and Antarctica is running at about 475 billion tonnes per year. Scientists are predicting the melting to occur six times its current rate by the end of the century.

If we want survival of our civilisation, governments must meet Extinction Rebellion’s 3 demands: Tell the Truth, Act Now, and Go Beyond Politics.

Failure to do this will lead to crop failure, widespread disease and ongoing natural disasters. All of which undermine the ability for countries to support themselves which will undermine attempts at world peace.

We must act now!

Title: NA
Description:
🚨 Support frontline communities of the Climate Crisis now! 🚨 (via @periodlink @gayoghana)

In Ghana, climate change has led to many families losing their main source of income as crops fail to grow due to water scarcity. 

As a result, many families have found themselves unable to afford hygienic menstrual items for their daughters.

In the Kurugu community, over two thirds of girls miss school every month because of this‼️

PeriodLink x GAYO’s plans to set up a reusable pad-making start-up and build three new boreholes aims to tackle these issues.

We will be facilitating the creation of women-led businesses that produce reusable sanitary items, as well as raising funds to build three new boreholes to grant greater access to water.💧 

To get this project on its feet as soon as possible, we need your help to purchase the machinery and materials necessary for the start-up and the boreholes. Each and any amount helps!

Read more about the project in the GoFundMe description at the link in @periodlink bio!

🇬🇭✊🏿

We must stop this Government leading us to 4^C warming, which means the complete, genocide and ecocide of the Global Majority - that’s our friends and families around the world, our heritage communities, and our future as young people. That’s genocide for Afrika, Asia, Abya Yala (the Americas, including the Caribbean and Latin America), all small island states and indigenous communities everywhere.

Title: NA
Description:
📅 On November 19, 2020, Extinction Rebellion Korea 🇰🇷 engaged in their first action of civil disobedience using bike locks to chain ourselves to the entrance of the National Assembly of Korea.
💥 The action was carried out in order to criticize the Korean government’s slow climate change response and its dismal NDC goal of reducing carbon emissions by a mere 18.5% by 2030 compared to 2010 levels. This plan was reaffirmed at the public hearing on Low-Emission Development Strategy (LEDS) held jointly by congress members and the government on the same day.
📢 XR Korea activists called for immediate climate action and voiced the demands of XR Korea including the net-zero target of 2025, a revolutionary and just structural change for radical carbon reduction, and the establishment of a citizen’s assembly or a national energy transition committee led by workers, local communities, and socially vulnerable groups. ⚠️
🛑👮 The action caused the entrance to the national assembly to be temporarily locked down by the police, and 11 out of 14 rebels were arrested on the scene. 🚔 The impact and consequences of the action’s aftermath are still underway. Because it was the first case of climate action in Korea that involved police arrest, XR Korea’s action on November 19 drew wide public attention with media interviews and various messages of support from citizens and grassroots organizations pouring in ✊✊✊

Title: NA
Description:
The world welcomes the 5th anniversary of the Paris Agreement with grief, disappointment and above all, rage and love to fight for true climate justice ✊

caption by @xrebellionind: 

“It is now 2020 and in the five years since the Paris Agreement was signed we have seen precious little action at the scale required to keep to the 2°C limit, let alone the 1.5°C one. And we do not have long left to act. Given the appalling lack of adequate action to date, limiting global heating to 1.5°C is really the very most we can hope for right now

We are at an intersection of global crises. Climate breakdown, ecological collapse, societal collapse, Covid-19 – all are symptoms of a toxic system that is driving us to extinction.

We cannot carry on like this. The system is killing us

The government knows the truth and still they pave the way for future crises. They ignored warnings about coronavirus and tens of thousands have died. Millions suffered. Now they’re ignoring predictions the world will pass 1.5°C in the next 5 years. That’s goodbye Paris Climate Agreement

Change is now. It’s time to decide together how we move forward in this emergency

As the coronavirus crisis exposes the sickness at the heart of our political leadership, humanity stands at a crossroads

We need to work together towards dismantling this toxic system to co-build a fairer, kinder, more humane society – or miss our best chance of mitigating the worst of the climate and ecological emergency

To stop the harm we must stand together and act now. Together we are powerful. Crisis doesn’t have to mean collapse

We still got this 

CREDITS FROM THE DIFFERENT ACTIONS IN THE COMMENTS BELOW 👇

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @extinctionrebelliondeutschland
• • • • • •
Dannenrod, Hessen, Germany

Heute startete die Aktionswoche im #Danni mit 1000 Menschen und einer Großaktion von @ende__gelaende

Der Kampf um den Danni geht nun in die entscheidende Phase. Nur noch wenige Baumhäuser und Strukturen stehen. Vielen Dank an alle tapferen Menschen, die sich der Zerstörung in den Weg stellen und heute dabei waren und an die, die seit Wochen und Monaten trotz Schnee und Kälte, Polizeigewalt und Repressionen vor Ort sind. Bei Minusgraden wurden heute Wasserwerfer, Schlagstöcke und Pfefferspray eingesetzt. Und trotz aller Widrigkeiten und Rückschläge wächst dieses Bündnis immer weiter zusammen.

Dies ist erst der Auftakt - we are unstoppable, another world is possible!

#dannibleibt #Danni #dannenröderwald #waldstattasphalt #keine49 #allewälderbleiben

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @xrslovakia

• • • • • •
Bratislava, Slovakia

We built a symbolic gallows on Kamenný náměstí

Today and yesterday, we symbolically hanged ourselves standing on melting ice cubes. The art installation located on Kamenný náměstí in Bratislava symbolized the melting of the polar and mountain glaciers, which is caused by global warming.

10. – 11. decembra prebehne rokovanie Európskej rady, počas ktorého sa rozhodne o dôležitých klimatických cieľoch na najbližšiu dekádu. Požadujeme, aby sa Slovensko zaviazalo k zníženiu emisií minimálne o 65%, ako odporúča Medzivládny panel pre zmenu klímy (IPCC). K tomuto cieľu sa pred voľbami zaviazali tri zo štyroch vládnych strán súčasnej koalície a my sme chceli tento záväzok touto cestou premiérovi pripomenúť.

Globálne otepľovanie, jeden z prejavov klimatickej krízy, spôsobené ľudskou priemyselnou  činnosťou, postupuje stále rýchlejšie. Z novej štúdie publikovanej v magazíne Nature Climate Change vyplýva, že roztápanie ľadovcov v Grónsku a na Arktíde zodpovedá najhoršiemu možnému scenáru Medzivládneho panelu pre zmenu klímy (IPCC). S podobným problémom sa potýkajú aj horské ľadovce. Napríklad alpské ľadovce stratili od začiatku 21. storočia približne šestinu ľadu a rýchlosť topenia ľadu v Himalájach sa za posledných 20 rokov v porovnaní s rokmi 1975 – 2000 zdvojnásobila. Takto masívna strata vody ovplyvňuje a ovplyvní jej dostupnosť pre stovky miliónov ľudí vo všetkých podhorských oblastiach sveta, čo s vysokou pravdepodobnosťou prehĺbi migráciu. Tento problém sa týka aj Slovenska. Každoročné znižovanie hladiny podzemnej vody priamo súvisí s malým úhrnom snehových zrážok. 

Apelovali sme však nielen na premiéra, ale aj na vôľu bežných ľudí pre podporu a prijatie zelenej politiky, ktorá môže znamenať aj zdanlivo nepríjemné opatrenia. Myslíme si, že táto zmena umožní ľuďom žiť kvalitnejší a plnohodnotnejší život v čistejšom a zdravšom prostredí. Slovensko má v porovnaní s okolitými krajinami najlepšie predpoklady stať sa lídrom v znižovaní emisií skleníkových plynov. 

autor fotografií: Karolína Gelatičová

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @xryouthsolidarity:  For ecosystems to flourish, governments must recognize and support the land rights of local communities and their crucial role in preserving biodiversity!
#DecolonizeConservation
°
🧐Approval of the #CinturãoVerdeGuarani law is essential for the preservation of the Atlantic Forest and indigenous peoples in São Paulo
°
🏹This project was developed by Guarani leaders in São Paulo. Its approval is essential so that the municipality's Indigenous Lands are strengthened and continue to preserve what remains of the Atlantic Forest. 🌱
°
This model of community-led conservation can inspire cities all over the world to fight for greater cultural and biological diversity
°
What can you do???
°
Spread the word! Push for conservation to be led by indigenous, local and peasant communities! 
°
DÓNATE to support the campaign of the Guaranì Yvyruppa Commission: link is in our Instagram bio 👈
°
Aguyjevete for those who fight! ✊🏽
#AprovaCinturãoVerdeGuarani

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @extinctionrebellionfrance about their rebellion wave in October in Paris by @_recutopia 

“[THE WORLD UPRIGHT]

Because our survival for a future on this earth goes through resistance!
Because our subsistence on our planet depends on resilience *!
Get involved ✊ 
Would we take back the issues around food sovereignty🥗
Today and tomorrow, let's participate in the creation of this world accordingly 🤗

If we don't quickly create a resilient, regenerative and just food system, we can never shut down the supermarkets and the fossil fuel industry without throwing our society into a food shortage 😬

Let us reappropriate our territories, to give back meaning to our future, to ensure that the crisis is not endured and exclusive, but the occasion of united, resilient and autonomous territories!

When the state deliberately abandons its responsibility to protect its citizens, it itself breaks the social contract.
Revolt then becomes our most sacred right, and our most indispensable duty.
Because every tenth of a degree counts, because each extinct species counts, because every minute counts, we are calling for a food revolution!
We are prepared to break the law and suffer the consequences, including imprisonment ✊

#RebellionNow

* Resilience: The capacity of an individual, group or system to overcome shocks or very great difficulties and to adapt.

___________________________________________________
Find more info on these subjects with these hashtags:

#ExtinctionRebellionFranceAnnonc

# ExtinctionRebellionFranceRIO2020

___________________________________________________

#Xr #ExtinctionRebellion #ExtinctionRebellionFrance #ClimaticJustice #ClimateAction “

Title: NA
Description:
XRDC: The Trump Administration is auctioning off tracts of Sacred Land in Alaska for Oil Mining 

We need YOU to send Love Letters to the Land 

They are set to make a decision before they leave office in January, and we need to do everything we can to stop it! 

Help us save the ANWR with Letters to the Land: 

Write about your love of the land, your fears about the future, or reminding Bureau of Land Management Employees that perhaps they need some extra coffee breaks in the next thirty days. 

We do not recommend you include
any identifying information, including your name, contact info, address, etc. Please mail your letters as you have them ready. 

Rather than delivering a giant pile of these all at once, we want a constant barrage that they can’t keep up with. 

To reach Anchorage by the
deadline (December 17) all letters must be mailed no later than December 9 with normal postage. 

Also consider sending them from different zip codes so that they will not all have identical postmarks

MAILING ADDRESS
State Director
Bureau of Land Management, Alaska State Office
222 West 7th Avenue, Mailstop 13
Anchorage, AK 99513-7504

Title: NA
Description:
Three Scenarios on 
The Post Covid-19 Economy in 2030

We are fast speeding towards a post covid-19 world. This new era is being signalled by the regulatory approval of a cocktail of vaccines. But what does it mean? Where are we going? 

Over 4-weeks in 2020, Complexity University (@10in10co ) bought together some 226 people from over 40 countries online, posing the question: What will a post-Covid 19 economy look like in 2030? 

Together we came up with 3 stories, or scenarios, for alternative futures. Each tells a story of a possible future based on an analysis of forces in play today. 

The Insurrection is set in 2030 rural KwaZuluNatal, South Africa, The Uprising is set in a 2030 Karachi, Pakistan and The Invitation is set in 2030 Oaxaca, Mexico. 

Each story plays with 3 “driving forces” shaping our future. 

The first is runaway climate change, which given our current emissions trajectory, looks set to worsen dramatically by 2030. 

The second is digital technology. We considered two poles. One pole is constrained digital transformation, where regulatory bodies or corporate governance constrain technology. The other pole is unconstrained digital transformation, where there are no brakes or constraints on technology. 

Then finally, we considered the state of  government, where either people fear government, or government fears the people. 

Each story presents an alternative future. They are NOT predictions. They are provocations. The aim of these stories is getting a better grip on our present and the potential consequences of our choices. 

As you read through these stories, consider three questions:

What feelings do each of the scenarios evoke in you personally?

Which scenario did you feel most attracted to and why? Which did you feel most uncomfortable with and why? How do you relate these scenarios to your life?

What shifts in the present are required to move towards a more desirable future and to avoid more harmful ones?

We encourage you to re-post them on social media with your own comments, observation

Description:
🎓Universities have predicted imminent climate disaster: Why are they not acting upon it? 🎓

☮ #MobilisePeace has formed an alliance of climate, ecological, social, and economic rights campaign groups in order to bring about rapid, dramatic and humane change to mitigate damage caused to the global ecosystem by climate change. 

✊ The joint aim is to highlight universities’ responsibility to mobilise its staff, students, and alumni into taking action through non-violent civil disobedience and to call for a national #CitizensAssembly.

Title: NA
Description:
On the Brink: TOMORROW Monday 30th Nov, 7pm GMT. Join @writersrebel online! 👉 LINK IN BIO 

~~~~ 🦎🦋🐝🦇🦔🐢 ~~~~
⌛ 1 MILLION SPECIES FACE EXTINCTION ⌛
~~~~ 🐅🐆🦍🐋🐘🦏 ~~~~

Writers Rebel @writersrebel will host an evening with writers and earth activists, Margaret Atwood, Amitav Ghosh, Lily Cole, Bianca Jagger and many others to raise awareness of animals at threat of extinction 🚨

Over the coming decade over one million species face extinction ☠️ 

It is estimated that 200 species go extinct every day.

We can remain silent or we can lend our voices however best we can to try to save them.

We have 20 writers and cultural figures reading new work and speaking to specific animals at threat from extinction.

You'll hear from:
Homero Aridjis on the Vaquita porpoise
Margaret Atwood on the Tasmanian devil 
Taiwanese artist Wu Ming-Yi on the pangolin
Judy Ling Wong on the snow leopard
Amitav Ghosh on the Irrawaddy dolphin
Lily Cole on the Rusty Patched Bumble Bee

As well as Ben Okri, Nana Oforiatta Ayim, Bianca Jagger, Prerna Singh Binda, Lydia Millet, Sangu Iyer, Laura Jean McKay, Laura Coleman, Martin Creed with their chosen animal yet to be revealed

Mya-Rose Craig aka 'BirdGirlUK’, David Lindo the Urban Birder, Erica McAlister, ‘Flygirl,’ and Gillian Burke will be our hosts for the evening

CALL TO ART 🎨: Artists are invited to create and share images of endangered species and extinct creatures for Remembrance Day for Lost Species. 

Post your images to social media with the hashtag #OnTheBrink

Sign up for the evening via link to Evenbrite in our bio or via @writersrebel bio 

We're in a #ClimateEmergency
#ExtinctionIsForever
#LostSpeciesDay
#WritersForLife
#OnTheBrink
Writers Rebel
Culture Declares Emergency
#AllWeCanSave

Sign up: https://eventbrite.com/e/on-the-brink-tickets-128515073043

Title: NA
Description:
Rebels all over the world took action to #BlockFriday! Swipe to check out just a few of the dozens of actions! Credits below... 

⛓Corporations are behind the mass destruction that consumerism has unleashed on the planet we share with all beings. Pollution, emissions and waste are all chocking our people and our planet, while consumption happens every day of the year, not only on Black Friday #TellTheTruth

#BlockFriday is NOT an opportunity to blame and shame the low-income families and people that rely on the discounted prices this day affords. It is an opportunity to make governments accountable to reign in corporations’ greed for the sake of life on Earth 🌎🚨 #ActNow #PeoplePower

⚙️ #BlackFriday is a testament to our system’s unchecked extremist consumerism at the expense of exploited workers and extracted materials, which destroy ecosystems and the livelihoods of many species, including humans 

We are in the 6th mass extinction. Our climate and ecosystems are collapsing. We need to REFUSE, REDUCE, REUSE, REPAIR, RECYCLE ♻️ We simply cannot afford to consume so violently: life is on the line. And we rebel for life! 🌱

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @extinctionrebellion.id
• • • • • •
📍[JAKARTA]

Generasi muda adalah kunci masa depan dunia. Sayangnya krisis iklim dan aktivitas manusia dapat menimbulkan kesenjangan yang berbeda antara kehidupan generasi saat ini  dengan generasi masa depan. Padahal, generasi saat inilah yang memegang kunci kendali terhadap kondisi lingkungan di masa depan. Namun, kebijakan iklim Indonesia masih belum mempertimbangkan hal ini. Pengendalian krisis iklim yang tidak serius justru dapat mengancam kesejahteraan anak-anak dan generasi masa depan.

Pada Hari Anak Sedunia, Extinction Rebellion Indonesia menuntut Kebijakan Iklim yang Berkeadilan Antargenerasi, sehingga dapat menjamin hak untuk hidup layak anak-anak dan generasi mendatang. Kami menuntut hal tersebut melalui aksi Toy Strike yang dilaksanakan di tiga kota: Malang, Makassar dan Jakarta.

Aksi kami di Jakarta hampir dibubarkan oleh pihak kepolisian, akan tetapi terus kami jalankan karena bersuara mengungkapkan aspirasi di ruang publik secara damai sudah menjadi hak setiap warga Indonesia yang dilindungi oleh UUD 1945.

Toy Strike merupakan salah satu bentuk dari Non-Violent Direct Action (NVDA) yang disesuaikan dengan kondisi pandemi. Dalam pelaksaanannya, kami membuka donasi mainan dan pesan aspirasi, agar semua orang bisa berpartisipasi tanpa risiko kesehatan. Mainan dan signage yang didonasikan tersebutlah yang akan menyampaikan aspirasi kita semua, yaitu: Kami Ingin Hidup

Kami percaya bahwa dalam menyampaikan aspirasi, kita memerlukan cara yang kreatif agar bisa menarik perhatian lebih banyak orang. Terlebih karena adanya pandemi yang mempersempit ruang kami untuk mengekspresikan diri. Maka dari itu, kami percaya melakukan mengungkapkan keresahan kami melalui aksi langsung tanpa kekerasan (NVDA) maupun melalui karya seni.

Selain Toy Strike, kami juga akan menyampaikan aspirasi terkait Keadilan Antargenerasi dengan seni, yaitu melalui pameran #TuaMudaPetuahKita di mana kita akan menampilkan sejumlah karya seni mengenai topik ini.

Yuk saksikan Opening Night pameran kami pada 25 November 2020! 

#ExtinctionRebellion 
#ExtinctionRebellionIndonesia 
#ToyStrike
#TuaMudaPetuahKita 
#DeklarasiDaruratIklim
#MenolakP

Title: NA
Description:
🔥Viking Burial of The #ParisAgreement and 🙃 impersonation of International Maritime Organization's delegates by 🔱 The Ocean Rebellion 🏴‍☠️ -> https://oceanrebellion.earth and #Greenwash clean up by the #DirtyScrubbers @theoceanrebellion @xrebellionuk 
.
🌐 The United Nations's IMO — facebook.com/IMOHQ —  and its delegates representing countries from all over the world met this week and decided to CONTINUE TORCHING humankind's present and future by allowing shipping's carbon emissions to grow at least until 2030.
.
💢 Yet the United Nations body says that it exists to "ensure the peaceful, cooperative, legally defined uses of the seas and oceans for the individual and common benefit of humankind."
.
😮 Common benefit of humankind⁉️ They're leading us to extinction‼️
.
⚓ The shipping industry produces 1 BILLION tonnes of C02 each year. That’s more CO2 than all but the top five highest emitting countries in the world, but we never talk about it. And world governments, just as with aviation, don't even include these figures in their own carbon budgets and much less do they include the embodied emissions of what is shipped and then consumed within their own borders. 
.
🐬 Shipping is one of THE biggest drivers of the climate and ecological crisis and everything related to shipping must dramatically change if we are to stand a chance.
.
🌊 So on Sunday #TheOceanRebellion carried out work commissioned by the #BlueRebellion at the #IMO, the only UN body with offices in the UK.
.
.
⌛The IMO's Marine Environment Protection Committee meeting was hosted by the #BalticExchange, home to the International Chamber of Shipping (ICS). ICS are a co-sponsor of the IMO’s latest climate “non-regulation” that allows ship GHG emissions to continue rising until 2030.
.
🎭 So on Monday, a trio of the masked suited characters representing ship industry executives appeared at the meeting's venue, this time vomiting and urinating fake oil onto a sculpture of a baby polar bear. 
..
🏆 The scrubbers then presented the ICS with an award for the "Fossil Fuel Lobbyist of the Year." PHOTO CREDITS @strikingfaces 📸 and @joaodanielper 📸

Title: NA
Description:
Writers Rebel interviews Jimmy Piaguaje (@jum_pia ), a young indigenous activist from Ecuador's northern Amazon region. 

He is Siekopai, a nationality with only 1600 people surviving; an endangered people fighting to defend a threatened eco-system.

In this in-depth interview, Jimmy speaks about his people’s resistance strategies and ancestral stories, and how the indigenous worldview could help to combat climate change.

As part of their resistance, Jimmy and a group of young Siekopai leaders have developed a number of innovative projects, safeguarding ancestral shamanic knowledge in video format and running environmental workshops with Siekopai youth. 

Their next goal is to open an alternative school with an educational model based on their own cosmovision. Please consider making a small donation or sharing their crowdfunding campaign to help them achieve this dream. (@nacion.siekopai) 

Link: https://writersrebel.com/read-interview-with-jimmy-piaguaje/

Please check the Linktree link in our bio to see the Crowdfunder for Jimmy!

Title: NA
Description:
Other State Forests (OSFs) are wilderness areas in Sri Lanka that are not legally recognized as Protected Areas. 

🌳 More than 700,000 hectares of Sri Lankan Wilderness Areas (the size of 980,000 football pitches) are made up of Other State Forests. 

🗣️ However, a recent decision taken by the Government of Sri Lanka, revoked Government Circulars No. 05 of 2001 and No. 02 of 2006 (which were introduced by previous Governments to protect these valuable forests), removing all protections from these forests and leaving them open to deforestation and land grabbing.

🇱🇰 Some of these Other State Forests are classified as Upper Montane Forests or “Cloud Forests” (less than 1% of the world’s woodlands are “Cloud Forests”), with the majority of these forests acting as lifelines for many endangered, endemic and point endemic plants and animals in Sri Lanka. 

Deforestation could lead to the loss of these endemic species to the world forever. 

🏭 These forests also act as carbon sinks, so if we lose them, we will not only lose the ability to sequester carbon but also release the carbon that was stored in these forests over thousands of years, contributing to global climate change. 

Help protect these Sri Lankan forests by sharing this post with hashtag #SaveOurForestsSL and show your support to @xrebellionlk by signing the petition in their bio. 

Artwork by @gihanmackay

#osf #forest #deforestation #srilanka #extinctionrebellion #actnow #climateaction #climatejustice #tellthetruth #powertothepeople #climateemergency #forestsofsrilanka #carbon #government #wilderness

🆘THE CLIMATE EMERGENCY IS NOW. Dozens dead, hundreds missing, hundreds of thousands affected in the Philippines#ReliefPH 🆘

👉 yacap.org/relief TO DONATE 

This is what we fight for: the least responsible for the climate crisis are the worst hit by its effects. We demand #ClimateJustice because our climate is collapsing NOW

repost from @extinctionrebellionph

The damage and suffering the Philippines is going through is not normal. Swipe to learn more about the links between climate change and typhoons, and what that means for vulnerable communities. #UlyssesPH #ReliefPH

On top of dealing with the global pandemic, the Philippines is now suffering the effects of the climate crisis with the arrival of 5 destructive typhoons within the past 4 weeks.

Most recently, Typhoon Vamco slammed northern regions of the country, leaving thousands struggling to survive. 

Extinction Rebellion Philippines is calling on rebels to donate to relief efforts and to help spread the word about what our country is experiencing. 

Please visit @extinctionrebellionph @thisiszerohourph or @yacaphilippines for more information! #ReliefPH 

The Philippines is no stranger to typhoons, with the country experiencing 20 typhoons over the past year. However, climate change is expected to lead to more intense typhoons and storm surges, which will affect vulnerable areas like the Philippines first. 

🆘The effects of the climate crisis are already here. 

🆘Lives are being lost. 

🆘Act now and declare a climate emergency.

Description:
#ShellGuilty @shell GRAPHICS BY AMAZING @xrlambeth 

📱 DIGITAL ACTION 📱- please repost this across Facebook, Twitter and Instagram tagging @shell to let them know we haven’t forgotten about the Ogoni 9 ✊

☠️ This 10th November marks the 25th anniversary of the murder of Ken Saro-Wiwa, Saturday Dobee, Nordu Eawo, Daniel Gbooko, Paul Levera, Felix Nuate, Baribor Bera, Barinem Kiobel, and John Kpuine. The Ogoni 9 activists were arrested and executed for protesting against Shell’s actions in the Niger Delta 

🚱 Shell has been extracting oil reserves under the wetlands of the Niger Delta, causing oil spills, gas leaks, and land, water, and air pollution on an enormous scale for decades. The Niger Delta is now one of the most polluted places on Earth, and the United Nations Environment Programme has said it could take up to 30 years to clean up the pollution that Shell and other oil companies have caused

⚖️ In 1995 Shell was implicated in a court case that resulted in the execution of 9 activists who led a peaceful campaign against Shell’s exploitation of the Ogoniland in the Niger Delta. Shell has been accused of bribing and coaching witnesses, as well as providing false evidence during the court case. The families of the Ogoni 9 have been looking for justice in courts around the world for 2 decades now

📣 Recently, a court in Hague has decided to hear the case brought forward by 4 of the Ogoni 9 widows to decide whether Shell was complicit in their execution. 

⚠️OUR DEMANDS in solidarity with the Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People

1️⃣We demand - that Shell pays reparations to communities impacted by environmental and human rights abuses, especially the Ogoni people of the Niger Delta whose land Shell has been forcefully destroying for decades 

2️⃣We demand - that the Government excludes Shell from all climate negotiations and policy making processes, bans government lobbying by fossil fuel companies, ends tax breaks for oil and gas, and excludes fossil fuel investment from Covid 19 recovery plans

3️⃣We demand - that Shell stops exploration for new oil and gas and begin the rapid process of ending fossil fuel extraction

#MOSOP #Ogoni9

Title: NA
Description:
HOW TO REBEL ✊ - content created by @xrcomsci

No one has the right to obey, Hannah Arendt famously stated, and there are plenty of ways to disobediently rebel for life!

#CivilDisobedience series Part 3/3: 

🛑 SAW ACTIONS

Distrusting business-as-usual

📏 SIT-IN
By using the body to resist and respond to violence and social injustice, protesters literally embody their cause. By remaining completely passive, protestors can maintain the moral political superiority of appearing in control rather than out of order—a control that make the protests noteworthy, emotionally effective, and relatable. By refusing to move, the protesters exert a subtle control over everyone’s actions.

📏 DIE-IN
Die-ins resonate with meaning beyond mere non-compliance. By behaving as if dead, protesters not only use their bodies to obstruct potential police action: They bring the issue of death front and center for observers. They provoke everyone in the vicinity to contemplate how one body can and should care compassionately for another.

📏 LOCK-ON
Let’s approach the body as a vast reservoir of signs and symbols, by envisioning it as capable of both persuasion and strong willed unruliness. A body in action is not only an instrument of expression, but also proof that something can be done.
Everyone in a lock-on feels locked in, but can be set free.

📏 GLUE-ON
"I believe that truth is the glue that holds government together, not only our government, but civilization itself."Where governments do not provide that glue, civilians themselves can make the truth stick to the public’s consciousness.

Title: NA
Description:
HOW TO REBEL ✊ content created by @xrcomsci

No one has the right to obey, Hannah Arendt famously stated, and there are plenty of ways to disobediently rebel for life!

#CivilDisobedience series Part 2/3: 

🎨 BRUSH ACTIONS: 

Creating a counterculture!

Brush-Actions are all about creating a counterculture and placing disobedient art in public.

🖌️ PAINT THE STREETS
Painting the streets is a vehicle of resistance, a symbolic act, creating the substance of the “volcanic eruptions of protest”! It achieves its goal when it touches the conscience of viewers through challenging the current social and political order. Street art, to be effective, must be disruptive, thought-provoking!

🖌️ GUERILLA GARDENING
“A weed is a plant that has mastered every survival skill except for learning how to grow in rows.” Activists can fertilize the ground for change: sow seeds, plant weeds and wild flowers all over the city. The atmosphere will thank them.

🖌️ GUERILLA THEATRE
“Guerrilla theatre can be considered as a ‘social technology’ – as a complex of fluid, experimental and developing forms through which the concrete meaning of new social forms, of community (directly in terms of the organization and interplay of the senses) can become more fully conscious in both image and practice.”

🖌️ BANNER ACTION
“Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.”

A witty slogan in a clever place is like offering a fruit basket to society.

🖌️ REVERSE GRAFFITI
“Reverse Graffiti is the process of cleaning specific areas of dirty pavements or walls which creates art or advertising through the contrast of clean and dirty sections.” There is something satisfying about cleaning away the dirt and have a pure and clean message appear amidst it.

Title: NA
Description:
HOW TO REBEL ✊ Keep organizing, keep acting, keep rebelling- celebrate wins because the world we want to built is within our grasp ❤️🔥 not one individual can do what real people power can: transforming the world! Tell the Truth, Act Now and establish Citizens’ Assemblies ✊

content created by @xrcomsci

No one has the right to obey, Hannah Arendt famously stated, and there are plenty of ways to disobediently rebel for life!

#CivilDisobedience series Part 1/3:

📣 MEGAPHONE ACTIONS 

Evoking attention!

📢 PUBLIC AGITATION
“That’s exactly the purpose of civil disobedience: to upset people, to trouble them, to disturb them. We who commit civil disobedience are disturbed, too, and we mean to disturb those who are in charge […].”
(Howard Zinn)

📢 CALL FOR BOYCOTT
Boycott is not a principle, it is a tactic depending upon circumstances. A tactic which allows people, as distinct from their elected but often craven governments, to apply a certain pressure on those wielding power in what they, the boycotters, consider to be an unjust or immoral way.
(John Berger)

📢 GUERILLA SOUNDS
“There is no noise as powerful as the marching feet of a determined people.” It’s impossible to close ones ears to a city flooded with sounds and music.
(Martin Luther King)

“Music has the power to break through barriers, and right now we really need to break through some barriers if we are to face this emergency.”

It’s impossible to close ones ears to a city flooded with sounds and music.

📢 LIGHT DISPLAY
Projections mark a new way to bring protest messages to the public in an accessible way. A large-scale projection, transforms space, and it creates a kind of temporary venue to have these conversations. “Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that."

📢 SWARMING
Swarming activists block traffic for a few minutes to inform about their cause, retreat, and then advance – again and again. From the point of view from the bee, every flower needs pollinating.

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @xrebellionind @mymollem.goa 
•••••••

🧐 Go to @mymollem.goa @actforgoa
bio to find out how you can support Goa. 

🌑 Over 5,000 people gathered at the South Western railway line in Goa, near the level crossing at Chandor, from 10:30 PM, until 4AM. The South Western Railway (SWR) was scheduled to proceed with the track doubling near the same crossing, during the late night hours 2nd November. 

💪 Braving the threat of Covid and late night dew, people representing various citizen and environmental groups, political parties and age groups showed up, determined to occupy the tracks until dawn. This risky move was the last resort, after the government and Railway had refused to respond to requests to scrap the project from several people's led movements rallying around this, and other linked issues (of disastrous ecological and social impact), regarding a steady plan to turn Goa into a coal hub. 

🗣️ Amidst speeches, announcements and even a folk dance performance, the infectious, rallying beats of a dhol-tasha band filled the air. The crowd kept growing from 10:30 onwards, and echoes of steely resolve and impassioned discontent filled the air. 

🚂 Chants of "Goans don't want coal!", "Kick out Adani, Jindal Sterlite" and "Wake up Goans!" were regularly heard in Konkani, Hindi and English. People settled down along either side of the railway tracks, which was ablaze with as many candles as there were protestors. 

⏱️ At some point after midnight, the Deputy Collector, Margao, arrived  to inform the protestors that they would be suspending all double tracking. The people demanded the Collector's order be issued in writing. Opposition to the South Western Railway has been going on for years, since as early as 2016.

#goa #coal #adani #stopadani #ClimateJustice #ClimateAction #powertothepeople #stopfossilfuel #coalisnotcool #savemollem #india #environment #development #project #fossil #railway

Title: NA
Description:
Repost from @xryouthsolidarity in solidarity with the anti-colonial struggle for Indigenous liberation 💚🌱: 

“The 12th of October used to be known as “Columbus Day”, but now we prefer to call it the “Day of Indigenous Resistance”, because the invasion by Columbus is nothing to celebrate. Rather, it heralded 500 years of genocide and plunder. The coup last year in Bolivia is a continuation of 500 years of colonialism, exploitation, plunder and oppression against the people
of these lands. And the resistance that the Bolivian people are waging, is a continuation of 500 years of resistance.” @boliviasolidaritycampaign

The BoliviaSolidarityCampaign, XRYouthSolidarity, and @xr_london joined in supporting the Majority World Internationalist Solidarity Coordinating Committee of Communities of Resistance (MWISCCCOR) and @xr_internationalist_solidarity , in the words of Kofi Mwali Klu “against the Environmental Racist Violence of the Fascist Golpistas of Neocolonialism in Bolivia today; who are terroristically prolonging the Genocide and Ecocide crimes of Columbus and the White Supremacy Conquistadores of Euro-Amerikkkan Imperialism against the Indigenous Peoples of Abya Yala and all our Communities of Resistance throughout the World! Let this be one more practical Reparations step towards our Merging of Rebellion in building a Global Anti-Fascist Peoples' Liberation Alliance in order to more effectively Stop the Maangamizi, Halt Eco-Fascism with our Unifying Might of Planet Repairs and Win Global Justice for All!”

Beginning at the Bolivian Embassy in London, we listened to stories of Indigenous resistance against imperialist oppression at the centre of our environmental and ecological breakdown today. We paused at the Spanish embassy to highlight the role of the Spanish empire in colonising Abya Yala and enslaving it’s peoples as well as Afrikan peoples, before finishing in front of the Christopher Columbus statue in Belgrave Square. We stood in solidarity with the Indigenous frontlines of resistance, past and present, and every movement across the globe that seeks to dismantle white colonial supremacy, as we chanted #ColombusMustFall

On October 13th five half naked Rebels were painted with flames to symbolise the 2019-20 bushfires. Outraged at the approval of the @Santos_ltd Narrabri gas plan, Rebels protested and glued themselves to the window of the NSW Independent Planning Commission, Sydney. ⁣

⁣
Five rebels have been arrested. ⁣
⁣
Stay tuned for more updates from Sydney’s #Rebellion2020: WE WANT TO LIVE 🌿⁣

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @xrcolombiaa: On October 11, Extinction Rebellion Bogotá wanted to inform the city about climate change, deforestation and the loss of ecosystems and native trees in Colombia.
.
Through direct non-violent actions, a meeting was held that tried to make visible the forest loss in the great natural regions of the country.
.
☣️ On the one hand, the vast tropical forests that make up the Colombian Amazon could become savanna ecosystems because of the fires this year.
🍃 Let us remember that the Colombian Amazon comprises 41% of the national territory and is home to unique vegetation, biodiversity, and cultural wealth.
☣️However, due to deforestation burns (they have been the worst in a decade), it is being destroyed along with the Peruvian, Bolivian, Ecuadorian and Brazilian Amazon.
.
☣️Additionally, more than 160 hectares of native forest in the Colombian Caribbean are threatened by fires and burns for the land grabbing of extensive cattle ranching and the planting of African palm monocultures.
.
⌛ Current statistics and data confirm the most critical scenarios to face the Climate crisis. We are on the brink of environmental collapse!
.
We need to continue acting through direct non-violent actions so that, among all of us, we can raise our voices and mobilize against extractivist policies and decrees.
.
What else has to happen for governments and large industries to act in the face of an imminent crisis? We need to integrate and sympathize with the struggles of indigenous, peasant, Afro and environmental movements that have historically been committed to environmental and social struggles, and together be part of the solution by turning this situation around.
.
We announce this great action on the street and invite you to join this rebellion for life.
.
We want to thank @artesinpausa for joining us and supporting us in this action.
Ph: @juliansanchezbautista and @marwiperdomorodriguez
.
#theamazonisnotapasture
#deforestation #climatic change #xrcolombia #xrbogota #extinctionrebellion #extinctionrebellioncolombia

Title: NA
Description:
XR Spain has begun their Rebellion! Keep an eye out to join, support and raise the alarm

repost from @esxrebellion 

Dehydration, extreme heat stroke or respiratory failure are some of the causes of death related to the climate crisis that are already occurring today.

With this action carried out on October 11 in Barcelona, ​​Granada, Valencia, Santander, Ibiza, Malaga, Cádiz and Murcia we wanted to show the past, present and future victims of the climate crisis.

In the words of the scientist of the Higher Council for Scientific Research (CSIC) Fernando Valladares: «Climate change kills. This year, about a quarter of a million people will die directly, but the figure rises to tens of millions if we include indirect causes.

In Cádiz and Murcia, the action has been carried out by #XRSanidad. The defense of the climate and biodiversity is the defense of health. Our lives are at stake and we want to live. That is why we rebel.

#ExtinctionRebellion #We Want to Live # Inaction is Death # Corpses #Death #Health #Public Health #Civil Disobedience

Title: NA
Description:
For hours during the Italian Rebellion XR activists were chained in front of the Eni Headquarters 

To explain why, here are some extracts from the letter sent to the Minister of Economic Development Stefano Patuanelli:

"Dear Minister Patuanelli,

We chained and chained to Eni's gates. Our mode of action is always radically nonviolent, even in communication, but we cannot remain silent in the face of political inaction towards Eni's “green turn”. Our interlocutors are not companies, which inevitably pursue a short-term private interest, but those who intend to guide our company towards far-sighted decisions aimed at guaranteeing the well-being of citizens.

In recent years, the appeals of scientists appointed to study the ecological and climate crisis by the governments themselves are increasingly dramatic, [...] Even those who, like us, had never found themselves carrying out such strong protests are realizing the gravity of the incipient emergency and the ten-year inaction of governments around the world, not least the Italian one. For this reason we have made a choice out of the ordinary, from our everyday lives, resisting the instinct for self-protection that all and all of us obviously feel. [...]

We ask you to come to us and talk about Eni and the choices that this government must make to protect those it has chosen to represent, so we can free ourselves from these chains. We would like to discuss with you how to prevent this Business As Usual from continuing, which now looks like a blind dance on the edge of a precipice.

We will wait for you here
With Love and Anger. "

Title: NA
Description:
A powerful Rebellion in Germany to demand urgent climate and ecological action

It is a shame that such actions have to take place, but the policy of the federal government leaves us with nothing else - at the moment it is driving us straight into the climate catastrophe.

Chaining at Andi: XR blocks the Ministry of Transport🔗💚

⚠️Around 80 activists from the Extinction Rebellion movement have been blocking the entrances to the Federal Ministry of Transport since 6.15 a.m. and demanding that the Dannenröder forest be cleared immediately under the motto #WaldstattAsphalt.

🌳With the peaceful action, we call on Minister of Transport Andreas Scheuer and Prime Minister Angela Merkel to stop the destruction of ecosystems such as the Dannenröder Forest immediately.

⚖️Furthermore, @extinctionrebelliondeutschland calls for a citizens' assembly to be called to work out a climate and socially just transport transition.

❌Despite the climate catastrophe and the collapse of our forests, the Ministry of Transport, under Andreas Scheuer, supports the clearing of a healthy mixed forest for the construction of another motorway, although we need the traffic turnaround right now.

Parts of the 300 year old Dannenröder forest have been cleared for the construction of the A49 motorway since October 1st.

- with blockades at the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Agriculture by @animalrebellion_germany, a funeral march of the dead trees through Berlin and a vigil at Invalidenpark. Determined, disobedient, colorful and corona-compliant, we demanded from politicians: # Stop the destruction of our livelihoods! 
Want to join the German Rebellion check out @extinctionrebelliondeutschland @xryouth_germany

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @extinctionrebellion.id
••••••••••

Tag: @jokowi @dpr_ri and use the hastags #TolakOmnibusLaw (cancel omnibus law) #MosiTidakPercaya to amplify this message.

• • • • • •
On the 5th of September the Indonesian People’s Representative Council (DPR) passed the controversial *omnibus bill* on job into law despite mounting opposition to the bill over its feared impact on the environment and labor rights. Even global investors, whom the bill targets, warn the Indonesian government that the jobs bill puts business activities at risks due to some articles in the bill that would undermine global action to tackle biodiversity loss and slow climate breakdown. 

People in Indonesia have decided to take it down to the streets and were met with tear gas. Over 500 people got detained, the situation for all workers is extremely scary right now. Third image: A protester waving the Indonesian flag behind a banner that says "Vote of no confidence, revolution is the solution" on Oct 8, 2020. (Photo: Nivell Rayda) @channelnewsasia

Not to mention, some of the bill’s provisions would also directly increase the risk of massive deforestation by eliminating existing legal protections for primary forest cover.

Assesment from Madani, a local environment NGO, warns that this bill could lead to the complete destruction of natural forest cover in the provinces of Riau, Jambi, South Sumatra, Bangka Belitung and Central Java over the next two to three decades.

Forests of Indonesia are the third largest tropical forests in the world. This is a catastrophic climate damaging bill that will have dire consequences to the whole world. 

The government of Indonesia need to repeal the Omnibus Law on Job Creation since it endangers the environment and will intensify the ongoing violation of the environment, workers and Indigenous Peoples’ rights.

visuals by: @mc.aminrais 

#tolakomnibuslaw 
#gagalkanomnibuslaw 
#mositidakpercaya 
#extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
On October 9, the world will know the winner of the Nobel Peace Prize 2020. This year a strong indigenous leader is competing: the Chief Raoni, an internationally recognized figure, defender of the Amazon rainforest and Indigenous peoples. We invite all friends and admirers of the Chief to share this post in support of the candidacy of leader Kayapó. 

The Kayapó indigenous community of Brazil have had an incredible contribution to the fight for the environment. Their work is crucial to protect us all! For hundreds of years Indigenous peoples defended biodiversity and life. Now, we must stand in solidarity with Indigenous people and appreciate their love of the planet! 

As youth, fighting for the planet, we've always got to remember that even as 5% of the world's population, indigenous people protect 80% of global biodiversity and are on the front lines of climate crisis. Currently, the Kayapó community is not only struggling with the effects of COVID-19 but also as a result of fires in the Amazon. 

Other ways to help include: sharing and signing this petition (http://chng.it/G6sPZJVb) and taking a picture with sign that says ‘#RaoniNobel2020’ to show your support! Let's bring this victory to the Amazon! 💧💚'

#IndigenousPeoples #Raoni #Nobel #RaoniNobel2020 #Kaiapós #Amazon

Title: NA
Description:
Any types of emotions are valid, don’t let anyone else tell you your feelings aren’t valid. We need to invest in more studies that look into the connections between climate change and mental health. As the current crisis continues to worsen, how do we meet the demand for climate therapists and eco-psychologists? It’s important to note that frontline communities have already been experiencing the devastating effects of the climate crisis, yet they still lack funding and resources available to them.

Based on the work of Australian environmental philosopher Dr Glenn Albrecht, taken from his book ‘Earth Emotions - New Words for a New World’

By: @queerbrownvegan

Title: NA
Description:
#Repost @xrebellionlk

• • • • • •
According to International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), Sinharaja is Sri Lanka's last viable area of primary tropical rainforest. More than 60% of the trees are endemic and many of them are considered rare. 

Since first week of August, a road is being constructed through Sinharaja National Reserve Forest. The road construction work goes on buffer zone of the rainforest in the Lankagama area to Deniyaya. Although building infrastructure is important for development we have to be mindful of how these construction impacts our environment and the consequences of such development in the long run. Especially when a road is being constructed through a rainforest which is also recognised as a Biosphere Reserve and World Heritage Site by UNESCO; it should be mandatory to follow the due process and do necessary assessments to find out the impacts it would have on such a pristine ecosystem.

However, it’s reported that this construction is happening with no necessary approvals from relevant authorities such as Department of Forest Conservation (DFC), Central Environment Authority (CEA) and Department of Wildlife Conservation (DWC). No Environment Impact Assessments (EIA) or a study has been conducted while Divisional Secretariats and other regulatory bodies were unaware of this project. 

Urbanization of these villages will not only pose threats to rare and endemic flora and fauna inside the rainforest, it will also increase the already worsening Human-Wildlife conflicts. 

We urge President @gotabayar to put an end to this destruction immediately and the authorities to take necessary action before we lose this unique and pristine ecosystem. The Sinharaja Forest Reserve is not only a heritage of the Sri Lankan people, but a heritage of the world.

Thanks @jayantha_wijesingha for info.

Title: NA
Description:
In Brazil, there is a saying that says: `The last indigenous sigh will be the last for humanity '

The Kayapó indigenous community currently faces a deadly threat - its elderly, who have the wisdom of resilience, climate adaptation and culture in their communities, are losing their lives due to COVID-19. They need urgent international support for medical supplies.

The spread of the human-ignited forest fires is now also greatly damaging the lives of the Kayapo! The magnitude of fires is vast and it is now damaging the respiratory systems of the community and devastating the ecosystem and wildlife. Climate change is not tomorrow. It is the reality of today! 

We ask that you stand by the Kayapó community and send a clear message of thanks for the service provided to humanity: link in bio to donate ‼️

Their contribution to the protection of the Amazon rainforest, at the service of the whole world, is crucial for humanity to survive the climate and ecological collapse that our Western way of life has brought to our planet. 

Its ancient culture includes carefully designed dance ceremonies with representative body painting patterns that encapsulate its cosmology. Its territory is part of the Ecotone Ecological Corridor in the South of the Amazon, which houses jaguars and ozelots!

In addition to fighting a pandemic, which painfully resembles the way their people were killed by disease during colonization, they are fighting for their rights. Once again, indigenous people are having to mobilize to gather the support and resources they need to survive. 

The Brazilian government's inability to respect its ancestral cultures shows how the legacy of racism and colonization continues to harm the less represented people in South America and the world today. 

450 years of struggle have shown how the resilience and determined spirit of indigenous peoples are fundamental to their ongoing struggle. We are in debt to their integrity, respect and love for their ecosystems and future generations. If we want to learn, it is our time to contribute and stand alongside them now!

Title: NA
Description:
Viruses that originate in bats could be quite deadly like the SARS, MERS, Ebola, Covid-19, Nipah/Hendra... Bats have been shown to host immune systems that are perpetually primed to mount defenses against viruses, viral infections then lead to a swift response that walls the virus out of cells. In simpler words, it protect the bats from getting infected with high viral loads but it also encourages these viruses to reproduce more quickly, increasing their risk of jumping to another species where the viruses will quickly overwhelm their new hosts, leading to high fatality rates. Humans are not spared. This makes bats a unique reservoir of rapidly reproducing and highly transmissible viruses. Disrupting bat habitat appears to stress the animals and makes them shed even more virus in their saliva, urine and feces that can infect other animals.

Natural habitat destruction, extreme pressure and stress imposed on wild animals, wildlife trafficking, live animals markets, atrocious farms animals living conditions... have consequences and we have just started to pay the price.

The Covid-19 pandemic is a wake up call and as we are asked to stay home it is time for reflexion. Where is our morality and ethic hiding? Is it the world we want? It is time to be serious.

To know more:

https://news.berkeley.edu/2020/02/10/coronavirus-outbreak-raises-question-why-are-bat-viruses-so-deadly/

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2020/mar/18/tip-of-the-iceberg-is-our-destruction-of-nature-responsible-for-covid-19-aoe

 Repost from  @xrcomsci

Title: NA
Description:
On 29th of August 2020, rebels from XR Indonesia directed shoe strikes in two different cities, Jakarta and Yogyakarta.

More than 500 pairs of shoes which have been sent from rebels all over Indonesia represented the voices of those demanding for Indonesia to be free from the climate crisis. The impacts of climate change due to the continual increase of global temperature have placed us in a critical point. This strike serves as both a warning and a demand for the government to declare a climate emergency 

This action is part of a whole campaign that XR Indonesia did in the month of August, which is widely celebrated as the month in which Indonesia declared its independence, revolving around how Indonesia as a country needs to be free from the climate crisis as well.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic health crisis which has not been resolved in Indonesia, we feel that it is not yet entirely safe for the people to take to the streets and voice their aspirations. The shoes that were gathered voluntarily during a period of 10 days symbolize the voice of the people, and they will be donated to several foundations in need. This shoe strike represents the hope for a livable earth, and it demands freedom from the climate crisis. This strike was conducted while adhering to strict health protocols.

Taking a step back from the horrible pandemic currently affecting the world, the climate crisis is still an existential threat to the human race. The appearance of a new crisis does not make another crisis disappear. We have little time left and actions need to be taken now"

On August 25th XR Argentine activists, in alliance with other organizations, performed NVDA across the entire country in rebellion against deforestation, grassland burning, the pork factories agreement with China and the use of pesticides. They join to claim a referendum about the agroindustrial model.

This year thousands of square kilometers were burned due to the combined action of a sustained dryout and fires used for land cleaning to prepare the land for livestock, agri-business and real state development.

In Buenos Aires, the capital of Argentina, police acted violently and detained two environmental activists without cause. All of the activists who were present responded nonviolently by holding a sit-in, clapping and singing songs to protest the arrests. An hour later the police released the detained activists.

We are joining them in solidarity  #StandingOurGround to evict Adani and end the desecration of our homelands. We will remain on country to enforce the eviction notice that we issued to Adani last week.

Soon, Adani will start draining the water table and digging their mine, causing irreversible damage to our lands, our sites and our sacred Doongmabulla Springs. They have given us no choice but to take urgent action to protect water, defend our Country and maintain our right to preserve and practice our culture.

They have been fighting against Adani’s Carmichael project for 10 years, it is our duty to continue.

Title: NA
Description:
Seafaring folk and coastal dwellers in Cornwall carried out a demonstration last night against polluting cruise shipping in Falmouth Harbour.

The World is a luxury floating apartment block comprising 165 flats. It is registered in the Bahamas, enabling wealthy residents to avoid paying their taxes and to dodge environmental and employment law. [1]

Newly formed grassroots protest movement Ocean Rebellion launching today has taken to the seas with an escalating series of non-violent actions against The World luxury apartment cruise liner, currently moored in Falmouth Harbour. [2] The World emits ten times more greenhouse gases per person per mile than a jumbo jet. Engagement with The World is the first of many actions designed to illuminate the processes of ocean degradation and shift stakeholders from ocean harm to ocean repair.

Ocean Rebellion took to the waters on the night of the 18th of August and projected a series of films onto The World luxury ship with clear messages SORT YOUR SHIP OUT and THE WORLD IS DESTROYING OUR WORLD Rebels were accompanied by a polar bear who boarded the ships bulbous bow joining the call for cruise shipping to stop. The World is directly responsible for melting over 200,000 square meters of sea ice each year rendering polar bears homeless, and bringing them to the brink of extinction.

Sophie Miller of Extinction Rebellion Falmouth, said “The oceans are the lungs of the world, it creates our weather and life on the planet began there. And yet many of us have a real disconnect from it now. I feel it’s so important to create and participate in actions like these to raise awareness and to engage people in a wider conversation about the seas and our future. With the melting of the Greenland ice shelf and the fact we are currently on track to significantly overshoot 1.5 degrees of warming, this is more important than ever.
“We also need to be aware that those in the global South are currently on the front line and are already experiencing the disastrous effects of this disconnect. Communities are suffering. People are dying and this is going to get worse unless we act now. I’m just human and a mother who wants a habitable planet

Description:
INTERNATIONAL ORANGUTAN DAY! 🌳🦧 #internationalorangutanday 

These marvellous creatures are deemed as the “human of the forest” in that we share nearly 97% of the same DNA. How amazing is that! You could say that they are human's closest relatives.

Sadly Orangutans are today an endangered species due to massive deforestation and illegal hunting in the forests where they live, their numbers are constantly diminishing. Our human lack of awareness about our interdependency with nature is killing people, planet and the life-forms that we share this Earth with. 

So, today, join hands, give a shout out and show some love for our dear close relatives as their populations are at serious risk. Let’s make a change before it’s too late!

That’s why we’re stepping up with @orangutanalliance and joining the #MySteptoProtect challenge! 

Our step to protect is to empower rebels all around the world to engage in civil disobedience and ask their governments to TELL THE TRUTH, ACT NOW and create CITIZENS ASSEMBLIES. 

Words by @orangutanalliance: 

Raise your voice for those who can’t through the Orangutan Alliance #MyStepToProtect challenge. To take part simply share a post of something that you do that’s eco-friendly and tag 3 friends to join the movement!

🌱If you choose to, you can take it one step further by purchasing one of our limited edition Orangutan Alliance soaps. For every soap purchased a tree will be planted in an area protecting critically endangered species.

Every action we take from here forward counts. Every individual counts, every individual matters, what will be your step to protect? Start sharing now! 💚

Title: NA
Description:
While COVID-19 has had an undeniably devastating impact on the world, it has also provided a glimpse of what a less polluted planet could look like, with the shutdown of entire industries giving way to clear blue skies and cleaner air. 

Studies have shown that this fall in air pollution has already had a dramatic impact on the physical health of many, while for others, it has afforded a closer connection to nature that has led to improvements in mental wellbeing.

In our new blog post, we explore this reduction via data and beautiful images, while discussing the effects and the ways we might continue to ensure a cleaner, brighter future for us all. 

https://rebellion.global/blog/2020/07/30/lockdown-emissions/

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @ffflatam: The fire left its marks on the forests of Latin America during 2019. The most affected were those of the Brazilian Amazon: the largest forest in the world registered a dramatic increase in the number of fires that occurred this year. Brazil captured world attention, but it was not the only country where forests and jungles were burned. In Peru, Colombia, Costa Rica, Bolivia, Mexico and Paraguay the fires showed how deforestation has made these ecosystems even more vulnerable.

Deforestation creates the conditions for fires to become more and more frequent.
And this lost of the forest, makes the local climate change , which is drier, and that makes the forests become flammable and susceptible. A rise of just one degree in the local temperature would be catastrophic for the forests.

We have to stop treating nature as an object, but rather as a subject.
It's time to go from indignation to action! Join the strike for climate justice and let's build another world! ✊🏽✊🏿✊🏽✊🏻

🎨: @fridaysforfutureperu @kesterone

Title: NA
Description:
🚨 PREMIERE 🚨 

We have launched a new short animated film entitled Extinction Emergency, and Why We Must Act Now. Directed and animated by Miritte Ben Yitzchak (@miritte_cubicle), voiced by British actress Naomie Harris (@naomieharris), and scored by Brian Eno (@brianeno) it urges us all to ACT NOW before it is too late.

🌱

The new animated short Extinction Emergency, and Why We Must Act Now, is the first of a two-part explainer video series for Extinction Rebellion, focusing on the climate and ecological crisis.

This moving film summarises the planet’s biodiversity loss, runaway consumerism and the ecological crisis that now faces us, and how the consequences will affect millions of lives around the world.

It will be followed by the second part - Climate Change, and Why We Should Panic - which focuses on the climate crisis. Voiced by Keira Knightley (@keiraknightley_official), it explains what’s causing climate change, why governments must enter crisis mode to tackle this issue, and what will happen if we don’t do something about it now.

🦋

Full credits
Voice-over: Naomie Harris
Music: Brian Eno
End theme music: Simon Bass
Direction, Design and Animation: Miritte Ben Yitzchak Script: Mark Ellis
Science and Script: Matthew Shribman @matthewshribman https://www.facebook.com/ScienceInTheBath/
Sound Design and Mix: Jack Hallett at Factory
Producer: Serena Schellenberg
Public Relations: Beverley Luckings and Nic Eliades at theclima.es Marketing and Distribution: Jonathan Mintram

🌸

Share it widely, show it to everyone you know, and urge them to ACT NOW, because everyone has the power to bring about great change!

Please join us TODAY, Sunday 9th of August, International Day of the World’s Indigenous people, for an urgent call to GLOBAL action by Indigenous leaders from Brazil 🌎🌍🌏 

📸 Genocide = Ecocide 👀 

To show your solidarity with the fight for Indigenous rights, paint your hands red and green, to show the world that you stand together with them in putting a stop to the continued genocide of Indigenous peoples. Post a picture online (on August 9th), with a link to their crowd funder (http://apib.info/donate/?lang=en), and use the hashtag #IndigenousEmergency, tagging @apiboficial and @extinctionrebellion.brasil 

If you can please donate to APIB here: http://apib.info/donate/?lang=en

"It's not just a number. Each indigenous body holds an ancestral enchantment. For each indigenous person who dies, part of our collective history dies too" - Celia Xakriaba

This is a day of rebellion to sound the alarm on the impact of Covid-19 in Indigenous communities and to raise funds for APIB (Articulation of the Indigenous Peoples of Brazil) to support those affected.

Indigenous people in Brazil are facing unprecedented threats: on top of attacks from government-sanctioned racism, land grabbing and big agribusiness, the Covid-19 mortality rate is higher among indigenous than non-indigenous people. Without the necessary medical help, lives that might otherwise be saved are being lost.

.

XR Abuja condemns the arrest of a fellow environmental activist, Okwori Onaji, for allegedly organizing a press conference to question the activities of miners in Owukpa, a suburb of Ogbadibo LGA of Benue State.
🌍
Onaji was arrested on Wednesday in Owukpa during a press conference to bring to the world’s attention the environmental degradation caused by the activities of miners in Owukpa.
🌍
This is a violation of the fundamental human rights of the activist whose soul aim is to safeguard the community and sustain the future generations to come.
🌍
Coal mining and coal money is dirty money and it means death as several principal emissions result from coal combustion such as Sulfur dioxide (SO2), which contributes to acid rain and respiratory illnesses; Nitrogen oxides (NOx), which contribute to smog and respiratory illnesses others are Particulates, which contribute to smog; haze, and respiratory illnesses and lung disease; Carbon dioxide (CO2), which is the primary greenhouse gas produced from burning fossil fuels (coal, oil, and natural gas); Mercury and other heavy metals, which have been linked to both neurological and developmental damage in humans and other animals; Fly ash and bottom ash, which are residues created when power plants burn coal.
🌍
Say NO to coal mining!
Release Onaji NOW!
🌍

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @apiboficial - When our maracas shake, we're on the move!

Covid-19 is hitting indigenous people violently in Brazil. It's not just the high mortality rate; other tensions and threats are being exacerbated by social isolation during the novel Coronavirus pandemic. We continue to face the neglect of the Brazilian Government, to fight for the right to live whilst helping the sick and honouring the legacy of those who didn't survive the virus. 

Since the beginning of the pandemic, the Articulation of Indigenous Peoples of Brazil (APIB) has been working in partnership with our grassroots organisations and indigenous supporters. We have already achieved a historic milestone with the online version of the Free Land Camp - when the National Assembly for Indigenous Resistance was held and the National Committee for Indigenous Life and Memory was created. The committee is a collective effort to monitor and gather data on the pandemic across the whole country. We have now launched our plan to confront this Covid-19 Indigenous Emergency, and we call on you to participate. 

It's now Maracá's turn. 

This is an international mobilisation to save lives. Please follow @apiboficial and give your support.

Title: NA
Description:
Pandemics, ecology, and climate are hopelessly intertwined - by @xrcomsci LINK IN BIO 👆

🌳

The climate and ecological crisis sickens and displaces both wild animals and human beings. It creates excellent conditions for pests like ticks and mosquitoes to breed as well as for deadly bacteria to multiply. And it literally thaws ancient pathogens from the ground. 

💥

All of these lead to disease, which, when left unchecked, can result in pandemics. ﻿ 

⚠️

This post explains some of the less-visible connections between infectious disease and the climate and ecological crisis; how many pandemics begin; and how, by fighting against environmental destruction, we can also play a part in preventing the next pandemic. 

🗣️

Pandemics and the environment are inseparable in these 6 ways:

1️⃣ Pandemics Start with Wild Animals:
What are some similarities between COVID-19, SARS, MERS, Ebola, swine flu (H1N1), Lyme disease, West Nile fever, and HIV/AIDS? All of these originated in wildlife before jumping to humans.

2️⃣ Wilderness Is a Wall that Keeps out Disease. We're Destroying It:
Shrinking wilderness and disease outbreaks go hand in hand. Destroying nature sickens wild animals, then brings their contagious diseases to us.

3️⃣ The Climate Crisis Strengthens Existing Diseases:
Warmer temperatures allow bacteria to multiply faster, while extreme weather creates flooding, sewage spillover, and standing pools of water, which all provide prime bacterial breeding grounds.

4️⃣ Air Pollution Weakens Our Defenses:
For COVID-19 sufferers, a small increase in a patient's exposure to air pollution was associated with an 8% higher death rate.

5️⃣ Diseases Will Continue Melting out of Frozen Land:
Pathogens trapped within previously frozen ground – responsible for such diseases as polio, anthrax, smallpox and the Spanish flu – will eventually be released.

6️⃣ We Can Fight Pandemics: 
It's too late to stop the COVID-19 pandemic from happening, but by fighting for the environment, you can be part of the fight against the arrival of the next pandemic.

Follow link in our bio to read the full article.
