Title: NA
Description:
2 posts from the amazing @regenxryouth help us explore #RegenerativeCultures and how words (#EarthEmotions) can help us 🌞:

#LivingRegeneratively understands our lives are interlinked: we are dependant on one another, our actions will affect each other. Protecting and looking after one another is also protecting and looking after ourselves, and doing it for ourselves means doing it for others too.
♾️
Living regeneratively also means engaging with the Climate and Ecological Crisis emotionally. Coming to terms with the gravity of the situation we are in can be an overwhelming experience; sometimes even traumatic. Being able to NAME and IDENTIFY emotions can help in moving through them. Words that articulate states of being and concepts create space for empathy and understanding.
🌸
Sharing with others who get what we’re going through can help us understand the process we’re in; that we’re not alone; and that we’re not crazy or overreacting. By allowing ourselves to be supported and supporting others, we find solidarity, deepen our connections with others, and actively create the more resilient and compassionate world we strive towards.
🐛
Emotions inform our activism too. Feelings will always impact our thinking: it is impossible to think ‘entirely’ rationally- we are human. Emotions inform our understanding of, and affect our reactions to, the world. If we know what feelings we are acting and understanding with, we can act more consciously and compassionately, and our decisions will be less ego-driven. It will be easier to be less biased. 
🌊
In our efforts to save the planet and ourselves, we must understand which emotions are driving us. Are my choices coming from fear, hopelessness, despair, panic, apathy, hope, love, empathy, calm or compassion? Maybe all of them at different times? How are these feelings impacting my activism?

[Source: ‘Earth Emotions’ by Glenna Albrecht]

🚨DISCLAIMER: if you are, or anyone you know is, currently in crisis and you suspect you/they might be a danger to yourself/themselves, prompt action is needed. Please reach out to a trained medical professional, a crisis helpline or friends and family. You/they are worth it.

Congratulations to our rebels in Kyoto, Japan for successfully preventing the construction of another palm oil plant! Their next target is an already existing palm oil power plant, which is disturbing surrounding residents with odors and air pollution. 

It is important to celebrate local victories and their global impact: THANK YOU REBELS ✊💚🌱

Oil palm development is responsible for deforestation of tropical rainforests, leading to extreme loss of biodiversity, as well as increasing greenhouse gas emissions 🚨. Globally, palm oil production affects 193 threatened species, and its expansion could threaten 54% of all threatened mammals and 64% of birds.

The draft EIA (Environmental Impact Assessment) notification 2020 of India will be passed in just 3 days. It has been published in only English & Hindi - this ensures that a large part of the population is completely unaware of the implications of EIA 2020 on their lives and livelihoods. ◽ ⁣
⁣
⭕ This tool is used to identify environmental, social and economic impacts of industrial/ corporate projects - the draft EIA 2020 is conveniently being diluted during these times of corona.⁣
⁣
❌ It ensures that many projects will kot require any public consultations - not even of the indigenous people who will be directly affected. ⁣
⁣
❌ The Post Facto approval ensures that if a project starts illegally the government will let it pass to favour "development". ⁣
⁣
❌ "Strategic projects" will be passed irrespective of the potential project site being the home of endangered species - this is again to boost the so called "development" of the country. ⁣
⁣
◽As XR we have always called out for system change. The toolkit in our bio will lead you to everything you need to know about this issue. We have 3 days until this will get passed. Please act now. ⁣

- @pollutersout - the Philippines, the Lumad indigenous group is being forced out of their ancestral lands by the military and paramilitary in order to benefit large foreign coal mining industries and logging companies. They are forced to go into the city to seek refuge, and their children are often separated from their families so they can stay safe.

The Lumad have set up their own schools, because of a lack of government & private facilities and education in their communities. These schools are often attacked and tagged as terrorists, and their government is bent on shutting these schools down.

The Lumad indigenous group needs our help! We cannot allow their government & military to forcefully displace innocent families from their own lands for the sake of benefitting mining and logging companies! They are fighting, and we must join the fight too!  #SaveLumadSchools #StandWithTheLumad

Title: NA
Description:
On #WorldRainforestDay we recognise the crucial role rainforests play in the climate and ecological global system. Rainforests are threatened by deforestation, fires and profit-seeking policies that seek to undermine the ecological services they provide for life on Earth
🔥⚠️
Tropical rainforests store about 25% of the Earth’s carbon. Just in the Amazon basin, around 90-140 billion tons of carbon are stored, equivalente to 9-14 decades of human carbon emissions (Yale’s Global Forest Atlas). Their role in mitigating climate change cannot be ignored
🚫🌳
Deforestation and slash-and-burn techniques are used to clear the forests for mining, farming or cattle ranching. Clearing not only produces emissions, but “triggers major shifts in rainfall and increased temperatures worldwide that are just as potent as those caused by current carbon pollution (ClimateFocus)”🔬
☠️⛔
When talking about the protection of the forests, it is crucial that we highlight the Forests’ Protectors: Indigenous communities. Indigenous communities all over the world protect 80% of global biodiversity (National Geographic), and the lands they manage have equal-or-higher biodiversity than protected areas (Environmental Science & Policy)
🦋🌱
The role of indigenous communities in protecting, sustaining and enriching the biodiversity of the rainforests must be a priority in efforts to preserve the role of these ecosystems for the global climate system
🌿🌸
Swipe to listen directly from Odette from the Baka Indigenous community in the Congo basin, from Olimpio Santos Wiramu from the Gajajara in the Amazon, and from Tainaky Tenetehar from the Guajajara, videos by @survivalinternational
🦜🌞
The messages from these Indigenous leaders are loud and clear: any conservation project must take them into account, they need international support and visibility if they are to continue protecting nature for the survival of all life on the planet. We need them and they need us to stand with their cause in #solidarity: donating to fundraisers (link in bio) and educating ourselves on the oppression they face
🌺🌊
On this #WorldRainforestDay, we say: Protect Indigenous Rights = Protect the Rainforests

Title: NA
Description:
report from @oxygenseven - Disaster looms for indigenous Amazon tribes as COVID-19 cases multiply. With the coronavirus spreading into remote territories across the Brazilian Amazon, indigenous leaders and rights officials are pleading with the government to adopt urgent measures to head off a catastrophe.
According to figures compiled by the Articulation of Indigenous Peoples of Brazil ( @apiboficial ), the country’s principal indigenous federation, deaths from COVID-19 in indigenous communities have risen from 46 on May 1 to 262 on June 9. Together with numbers tallied by state health departments around the country, APIB’s statistics show that 9.1 percent of indigenous people who contract the disease are dying, nearly double the 5.2 percent rate among the general Brazilian population. The growing number of cases and the government’s sluggish response have prompted allegations of incompetence and disarray in official efforts to protect vulnerable tribal populations from contagion. Indeed, government health-care workers, together with illegal mineral prospectors and other intruders, now figure among the principal vectors of infection into protected indigenous territories. A report released last week by the federal attorney general’s office accused a team of health workers of “flagrant negligence” and decried the likelihood that government nurses and technicians had spread the virus among the very indigenous populations they’re supposed to protect. #ActForAmazonia @oxygenseven @global_wildlife_conservation @apiboficial

Title: NA
Description:
On #WorldRefugeeDay we stand with the nearly 80 Million human beings forcibly displaced now, suffering all the more under the strain that the pandemic has put on refugee camps all over the world. 🌪
We stand with them, see their struggle and demand that governments realize that we all belong to the Earth, #allarewelcomehere. 🦋
We stand with them and seek to prevent the between 25 million and 1 billion climate refugees projected by 2050: climate action NOW will prevent human suffering then. #climatejustice 🌱
Please leave accounts that support the dignity and survival of refugees all over the world in the comments!
🕊
Graphics and original post by @theslowfactory - Today is #WorldRefugeeDay and climate-induced displacement is on the rise. According to the World Economic Forum an estimated 150 to 200 million could be forced to leave their homes due to desertification, rising sea levels and extreme weather conditions by the year 2050. Climate change is a human rights issue. Swipe for more info ➡️

Title: NA
Description:
repost from @fridaysforfuture -

The SOS Amazônia campaign is an initiative coming from Brazilian and international activists, created with the goal of helping traditional communities of the Amazonian territory battle Covid-19. Through collective international funding, we hope to raise 1 million Reais (about 195000 USD) to purchase of basic hygiene, food and health items. This action plans to benefit regions such as the city of Manaus and its surroundings and rural parts of the Amazonas state.
The health system in Manaus, the capital of the state of Amazonas and the main reference health center for most of the Amazon Rainforest's traditional peoples, has collapsed. As a consequence, millions of peoples' lives were put at risk. The city's press officers have announced over 100 deaths per day due to Covid-19, and this number can be higher with the addition of non-confirmed cases. We need to help both the rural and urban populations to contain the spread of the virus and therefore avoid the destruction of the heart of the Amazon.
The climate emergency is our generation's biggest challenge. It is a path of no return towards the extinction of all society across the planet that we must avoid. The mass deaths of the Amazon's peoples, especially the native peoples, will be a loss with global consequences.
The contributions can be made by people from any country through the sosamazonia.fund website. The raised resources will be managed by a committee composed by us and FAS representatives. Throughout the routing of funds, we will inform
everyone what is being purchased and which communities will benefit, maintaining transparency.
Help us to act NOW!
Please,
Save the Amazon.
#DefendTheDefenders
Make your donation through sosamazonia.fund/en
This appeal comes from Abel (@abelfrodrigues), Alma, Amália (@amaliagarcez), Anna (@annakernahan_), Aurélie Bray, Bianca (@biancabcastro), Daniel (@danielaraujon), Fernanda (@nands_rm), Greta (@gretathunberg), Iann (@iannunesc), Isabelle (@isabelleax_), Janderson (@_sil.ves.tre), João (@joaoduccini), Luisa (@luisaneubauer), Samela (@sam_satermawe), Sandyely (@vilaciosandyely), Valentina (@vavruass) and all of the millions of you

Title: NA
Description:
#DefendTheDefenders NBWL’s Standing Committee had on April 7 discussed a proposal for the use of 98.59 hectares of land from the Saleki Proposed Reserve Forest land for a coal mining project by NEC. 
The NBWl had approved the diversion of this forest land, 41.39 hectares of which it said was unbroken, for NEC’s Tikok open-cast coal mining project. NEC had suspended the Tikok project in October 2019 but was producing coal in its Tirap open-cast project nearby.

Saleki Proposed Reserve Forest currently suffers from pressures related to illegal logging and poaching. This will be compounded by the mining pressure, thereby creating severe problems for the wildlife as well as the indigenous inhabitants of the landscape. The affected will include Assamese communities, particularly Tai Phake, Khamyang, Khampti, Singpho, Nocte, Ahom, Kaibarta, Moran, Motok, Burmese, Tea-tribes (Adivasi tribes) and Nepali communities. 
However, the North Eastern Coalfields (NEC), a unit of Coal India Limited in Assam, has temporarily halted its operations following protests over its impact on a subtropical rainforest nearby. However, locals have reported that the illegal mining has been going on in the area. 
Assamese Translation Below.

Saleki Proposed Reserve Forest currently suffers from pressures related to illegal logging and poaching. Title: NA
Description:
Actions have consequences; good and bad. It’s easy to feel helpless in the face of global injustices, but we’ve seen change coming about around the world. ⁣
⁣
This is only the beginning. Racial, social, migrant & environmental justice will take time & energy, but this will not stop us. We will reflect on our own movement's impact on the intersections of climate justice. From there, we will act, in solidarity, in good faith and in love & rage; together we can change the world where all belong!⁣
⁣
WOULD YOU LIKE TO KNOW WHAT PROTESTING ACCOMPLISHED?⁣
⁣
👉🏾Within 14 days of sustained protests:⁣
Minneapolis bans use of choke holds.⁣
⁣
👉🏾Charges are upgraded against Officer Chauvin, and his accomplices are arrested and charged.⁣
⁣
👉🏾Dallas adopts a "duty to intervene" rule that requires officers to stop other cops who are engaging in inappropriate use of force.⁣
⁣
👉🏾New Jersey’s attorney general said the state will update its use-of-force guidelines for the first time in two decades.⁣
⁣
👉🏾In Maryland, a bipartisan work group of state lawmakers announced a police reform work group.⁣
⁣
👉🏾Los Angeles City Council introduces motion to reduce LAPD’s $1.8 billion operating budget.⁣
⁣
👉🏾MBTA in Boston agrees to stop using public buses to transport police officers to protests.⁣
⁣
👉🏾Police brutality captured on cameras leads to near-immediate suspensions and firings of officers in several cities (i.e., Buffalo, Ft. Lauderdale).⁣
⁣
👉🏾Monuments celebrating confederates are removed in cities in Virginia, Alabama, and other states.⁣
⁣
👉🏾Street in front of the White House is renamed "Black Lives Matter Plaza.”⁣
Military forces begin to withdraw from D.C.⁣
⁣
Then, there's all the other stuff that's hard to measure:⁣
⁣
💓The really difficult public and private conversations that are happening about race and privilege.⁣
⁣
💓The realizations some white people are coming to about racism and the role of policing in this country.⁣
⁣
💓The self-reflection.⁣
⁣
💓The internal battles exploding within organizations over issues that have been simmering or ignored for a long time. Some organizations will end as a result, others will be forever changed or replaced with someth

Title: NA
Description:
June 8th: World Ocean day.

Oceans are one of the priorities we need to look after if we are to survive as a species. 70% of the Earth is made up of oceans, more than half of the world's oxygen is created by phytoplanktons in the ocean. The oceans absorb 1/4th of carbon dioxide, a greenhouse gas that is released into the atmosphere, which in turn makes it more acidic, threatening the survival of marine life 🐟🦀🐡🦐🐠🐙 As a global society, we acknowledge that people play a major role in this restoration of our oceans- only when we come together can we achieve great goals like this. Let us take this day, and all days to come, to be conscious of the waste we produce, as a 10% of it ends up in the oceans. And more importantly, let’s take the day to recognize that protecting the oceans is protecting people: half of the world, 3.5 billion people, depend on the ocean for their primary source of food. 
The theme of 2020 is Innovation for a Sustainable Ocean. To do so, we need to understand all that has gone wrong in having sustainable oceans in the first place. and move ahead from there. As long as there is a will, there will be a way 💙💙💙 All we need to do is #ActNow.

Swipe to see @xrvalencia @xrmumbai @extinctionrebellionph @xrbarcelona @xr_tokyo 💙

Title: NA
Description: The Kolis of Bombay are the original residents of the 7 islands, co-existing with its fertile waters and rich biodiversity long before the city became what it is today. Over the last few hundred years they have been increasingly marginalized, first by different colonisers, and then their own urban counterparts, more keen on senseless development than with protection of natural ecosystems. Today they face an existential threat due to rising sea levels and the construction of the Coastal Road Project which threatens their millennia old source of livelihood. This episode interviews Sarita Fernandes, a researcher and marine ecologist who has worked extensively with the communities in their fight against what she calls 'neo-colonisation'.

Title: NA
Description:
Why is 5th of June celebrated as Environment day? 
This is done solely to spread awareness and encourage people to take action for the environment. 
2020 has shown us that if we don't #TellTheTruth which resulted in a Pandemic and we don't #ActNow for Black Lives Matter (BLM), we won’t create a world that centers climate justice. 
XR's regenerative culture has shown us that all we need to do is empower ourselves with the image that it will happen like the little girl in this video envisioned and all it takes is a group of people having that same thought to come together. 
This #worldenvironmentday, let yourself dream of what you want our world to look like. Clear skies, abundant biodiversity and a world filled with greenery.

For more info check

https://thegiganticchange.com/

Thank you @whoopigoldberg for working on this with us

Title: NA
Description:
#BlackLivesMatter ⁣
As an organisation Extinction Rebellion stands in solidarity with those most vulnerable in the face of the climate crisis. The climate crisis, however, is not a single issue; it is a result of colonial powers, inequalities, destruction of nature and communities in the name of profit, and silencing those who have tried to go against this system.⁣
⁣
This is where the silence ends. This is where we must scream louder than ever.⁣
⁣
The Black Lives Matter (BLM) movement is not a trend to follow only when everyone is posting about it online; it is a movement that should force us to do better, work harder and research further every day.⁣
⁣
If you have privilege, use it; if you think you don’t know enough to comment, ask & learn. ⁣
⁣
Climate activists, environmentalists, conservationists, this movement is part of the core of our fight for social justice - let’s make each voice count. ⁣
⁣
What concrete actions are your national and local groups taking to dismantle structural racism? What more do you think you can do?⁣
⁣
reposted from @chnge⁣
⁣
⁣
#ActNow #TelltheTruth #blm

Title: NA
Description:
Conservation has a dirty secret and we need to uncover it if we are serious about #justice, about transforming our relationship with nature, stopping the harm and beginning to support true #PlanetRepairs. 🤐🌱
Join the livestream TODAY at 4 pm BST//3 pm UTC  from  @xryouth_uk and @xr_internationalist_solidarity Facebook as well as XR facebook, twitter youtube and insta live (  https://www.facebook.com/XRYouth/posts/579443049621689)
🚫🦋
We welcome this conversation as a chance for #XR to grow and listen to the courageous truth speakers who are bringing their messages to us:
🗣️💬
Stephen Corry, the esteemed and much respected director of @SurvivalInternational, will talk to us about the early #colonial history of conservation/national park movement from 1860s-1920s.
📚
Mordecai Ogada, a powerful grassroots activist and speaker from Kenya, will give background to the Kenyan history of conservation 1950s - present.
🇰🇪
Fiore Longo, one of Survival International's campaigners based in the Congo, will talk about the brutal ways mainstream conservation is perpetuating colonial #genocide right now in the Congo.
🌳
We'll then welcome questions from the audience and invite the speakers to respond with their unique viewpoints, experiences and knowledge. This is a chance to learn from and engage with some of the world's leading figures fighting for justice in #conservation - don't miss this opportunity!
👀❓
This event is hosted by both XR Youth Solidarity team UK and XRISN - and is backed by those teams as a direct challenge to @ExtinctionRebellion, a challenge to go deep into the dark histories and presents of conservation; to uncover the bloody secrets buried there and to work to banish them in solidarity with the true freedom fighting peoples of the world!
✊🏻✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿 ➡️FOLLOW ➡️ @survivalinternational for more info on the work they do! 
#DecolonizeConservation #FortressConservation #ColonialConservation #Wearenaturedefendingitself #decoloniseourminds #humanplanet #tribalrights #indigenousrights #indigenousconservation #indigneouslivesmatter #survivalinternational #internationalistsolidarity #youthsolidarity #youthinaction #youthriseup #xryouth

Title: NA
Description:
We cannot claim to #actnow & #tellthetruth if we do not stand in solidarity with Black communities: #Blacklivesmatter today and always. We, as Extinction Rebellion, recognise we must do much better if we want to claim to fight for all of our collective futures. We rebel for life, and we must rebel against racism. ✊🏻✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿
We make use of our first principle, and declare ourselves anti-racist, because our shared vision of change depends on upholding #intersectionalenvironmentalism, identifying and acting on how injustices and violence against oppressed communities and the Earth are interconnected and inextricable. Intersectionality is a necessity if we are to create a world that is fit not only for generations to come, but fit for those that are being oppressed right now. 🌎🌍🌏
We make use of our fourth principle to openly challenge ourselves and our toxic system, and pledge to do the work to dismantle and challenge racism, as well as supporting the inspiring resistance against racism, within our individual, local, national and global contexts.
🆘
We make use of our fifth principle to value learning and reflecting  as we commit to proactively undertake the emotional and intellectual labour to learn about the colonial history and the violent present of environmental and social injustices against Black, Indigenous and POC.
📚 
We make use of our seventh principle to actively mitigate for power within the environmental movement and amplify the messages of Black, Indigenous and POC activists and environmental leaders. We will not remain silent and complicit in the violence against the Black community during this pivotal moment. We stand in solidarity.
🗣
“If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.”
Desmond Tutu

#blm #socialjustice #Blacklivesmatter #justiceforgeorgefloyd #whiteprivilege #antiracism #intersectionality #solidarity

Title: NA
Description:
As an environmental movement, we believe in climate justice. This is not possible when many of our community face unjust oppression. We share this important piece in ‘Intersectional Environmentalism” by @greengirlleah . 🌍 
Stating “Social justice cannot wait.

It is not an optional “add-on” to environmentalism. It is unfair to opt in and out of caring about racial injustices when many of us cannot. 
These injustices are happening to our parents, our children, our family and our friends. I’m calling on the environmentalist community to stand in solidarity with the black lives matter movement and with Black, Indigenous + POC communities impacted daily by both social and environmental injustice.

Please swipe to learn more about intersectional environmentalism and take the pledge.
Here is a list of some of my favorite accounts I follow that raise awareness for intersectional environmentalism, please tag more in the comments!: @mikaelaloach @toritsui_ @jamie_s_margolin @queerbrownvegan @diandramarizet @wildginaa @aditimayer @naturechola @nativein_la @amaze_me_grace @she_colorsnature @switchbackshawty @bleavitt8 @badgal_brooky @teresabaker11 @ImKevinJPatel @Xiyebeara @lainetew @sophiakianni @xiuhtezcatl ” and more @guajajarasonia @eloyterena @ninagualinga @helenagualinga @angelakaxuyana @apiboficial @midiaindiaoficial @midianinja @amazonwatch @amazonfrontlines @thisiszerohour @pollutersout

Description:
The Baka community has experienced and continues to experience immense suffering at the hands of WWF. They suffer because WWF still to this day employs Fortress conservation despite all provided evidence showing its effectiveness at environmental protection and bloody history of human rights abuses.🌿 ⠀
⠀
WWF is seeking to invade indigenous land, with the intention of evicting each and every Baka man, woman and child. They are undertaking this act of oppression in the name of ‘conservation’, they are forcibly removing the original protectors of this land in the name of the ‘Messok Dja national park’. The creation of ‘protected area’ has already caused huge violence upon the Baka people at the hands of WWF’S eco guard militia’s. The longer this invasion of indigenous land continues the more unrelenting the violence, abuse and suffering will continue for the Baka people.✊🏾✊🏿⠀
⠀
Join us in a tweetstorm putting pressure on WWF along with @survivalinternational to cancel the park on (these times). ⠀
#defendthedefenders @pollutersoutafr @pollutersout

Title: NA
Description:
#OneForPH Donation Drive: 🌏💚 Last May 14, 2020, the Philippines was hit hardly by Typhoon VongFong. The typhoon hit the island of Eastern Samar, leaving over 160,000 Filipinos displaced, thousands of families still homeless and dying from hunger, while battling the Coronavirus pandemic at the same time.
🌏💚
It's been 12 days since Typhoon VongFong struck and people are still crying for help due to the lack of political will to help generate funds for suffering Filipinos. Evacuation centers are running out of supplies and can barely follow protocol to control to spread of the virus, while struggling to feed hungry families. Extinction Rebellion Philippines, Youth Advocates for Climate Action Philippines (YACAP), and Zero Hour Philippines are kindly asking for your donations for the #OneForPH Relief Fund that will go directly to the most vulnerable of Filipino communities during this time.
🌏💚 Please check @extinctionrebellionph & @thisiszerohourph for more details

Title: NA
Description:
🚨URGENT - NAIROBI NATIONAL PARK IS UNDER THREAT! 🚨
*
Nairobi National Park (#NNP) is located just outside #Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya, and lies within the Athi-Kapiti Ecosystem. This ecosystem consists of vast open plains with a large and diverse range of species such as giraffes, rhinos, lions, zebras and baboons 🦒🦁
*
🛑 Due to massive declines in wildlife resulting from #colonial settler style “development” NNP was established in 1946 to halt #biodiversity loss. ✋🏾Today this same genocidal and ecocidal model of western “development” continues to threaten this #ecosystem by planning to destroy it for luxury hotels, eateries, and residential houses. 💥 #StoptheMaangamizi !
*
💢This proposed “development” plan would only serve the interests of the elites, both nationally and internationally, who will directly benefit from it at the expense of local communities and generations to come!! 🤑 *
☝🏿Not only this, but it also disregards the historical injustices that created NNP where local #Maasai #pastoralist communities were forcibly removed from their lands, or coerced to give it up under the promise of it being for the sole objective of “#conservation” *
🌞It ignores the #IndigenousKnowledge through which wildlife has been conserved over thousands of years! Noting that 65% of Kenya’s #wildlife exists outside the #protectedareas and are best conserved by these communities. *
🌿All this must be acknowledged and the memory and cultural practices honoured by keeping the communities closer to the park. 🥀Any damage to the park will cause cultural and psychological damage to the community who call this place home and have very important cultural and social values attached to this land. *
👣They have lived in these plains since time immemorial and ensured its conservation through cultural and social bonds, and traditional practices that centred on certain wildlife species, which ensured that conservation principles became part of their way of life and this must be honoured. *
Therefore, it is our duty to take notice of this and stop the destruction of Nairobi National Park!!! #SaveNNP ✊🏾✊🏾
*
Post continues in the comments below...

Title: NA
Description:
The Guaraní have been forced to isolate in their communities due to the high risk of contagion. Their security and safety is being actively ignored by the Brazilian government whose negligence is currently resulting in large scale illegal forest destruction as well as posing a threat to the survival of the indigenous of Brazil. 😷

The Guarani Yvyrupa commission has asked those who believe in their struggle for funds to buy food and hygiene items, to ensure the protection and survival of their communities. ✊

And the world has responded! 125 people from all over the world have donated and so far £4000 has been raised!!! 🌍

This will enable 200 families to purchase food, hygiene equipment and safely isolate without the threat of contagion. A massive thank you to everyone for your contributions. The money raised will ensure the guardians of the Atlantic forest can continue defending their home and the Brazilian eco-system. 🌳🌳 However, the Guaraní are still at great risk. There is still a growing need for vital supplies to ensure families can stay safe and isolate, as the grasp of the virus deepens in Brazil. 🙏

We are currently halfway to our goal of reaching £8000 which will protect and support 400 families!! A donation of £20 will ensure one family can safely isolate and protect themselves during this pandemic. However, any amount you can donate will go a long way to not only ensure the safety, survival and way of life of the Guaraní but also their ability to protect the Brazilian ecosystem: a lifeline for all humanity and the planet in the current ecological crisis 💜💜 Link to donate: https://www.chuffed.org/project/solidarity-guarani-community-in-brazil 🌱

We stand in solidarity with the Guarani Yvyrupa's purpose to ensure the protection of indigenous rights! We are all part of ONE planet, ONE global family! #UnitedinDiversity. The health of ONE is the health of ALL!

Title: NA
Description:
Their voices were silenced for defending the natural assets which are the world heritage #defendthedefenders @fff.digital @pollutersout 
1️⃣ Oneida Epiayú was leader of the Wayuú community; Oneida denounced cases of corruption in food programs🍉🍅 organized by the Colombian Institute for Family Welfare; she was shot dead

2️⃣ Arbildo Meléndez Grandes was leader of the Cacipibo indigenous community; Arbildo was trying to obtain a property title📃 for his community, contending for this with the invaders of the land; he went out to hunt; then he was found shot dead in the middle of the forest.

3️⃣Eugenie Roy Martínez Pérez was an environmental activist🌎 and studied biology at the Technology Institute of Vale in Oaxaca. During the quarantine, he went to a ranch, where he sought to study local animal life.There they shot him dead. He was 21 years old.

Indigenous communities are in grave danger, but they are fighting.
✊🏼✊🏽✊🏾✊🏿
Justice is demanded for the crimes that have been committed against natural resources and therefore against indigenous, Afro, and peasant communities. We need to continue together in social resistance 🎨 artwork by
Natasha Leong @natasha.leong
Bernice Chong @berniceticles

Title: NA
Description:
On April 29th, a mob sent by usurpers of the Mapuche Buenuleo community’s territory entered the community and attacked the members present at the time, including children between the ages of 2 and 11. The Mapuche are a community of Indigenous People in southern and central Chile, as well as south-east Argentina and the Patagonia. These attacks have been ongoing since September 10th 2019.
🚫⚠️⛔
At the end of the 18th century, not everyone could comprehend or even find out about the suffering of the Mapuche People during “La Conquista del Desierto”, “The Conquest of the Desert”. The Elders still mourn remembering these stories, the cries of the children impregnating the memory and the body. The complicity between those in power still remains to this day. Violence is one of the tools through which racism and colonialism are expressed in denying the right to self-determination of Indigenous Peoples.
✊🏻✊🏽✊🏿
The community has begun a petition alongside a press release, if the cause of the Mapuche People speaks to you, contact @pupichikechoike o Deolinda Buenuleo (werken de la comunidad). This is the link to the petition: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VAXdu3JvLHHYsbmbj2VfQJgrJrFuJ-3iDFNAz7vztf4/edit?usp=drivesdk 🌎🌵🌊 #Mapuche #self-determination #DefendTheDefenders #Indigenousrights  @pollutersOut @fff.digital

Title: NA
Description:
Today @haluami, an indigenous activist from Buenos Aires, will talk about how they became interested in climate activism after thinking about how large corporations and climate change itself affect the lives of indigenous peoples, especially their mother's people.
#pollutersout #climatejustice #huelgadigital
🌏🌎🌍
Hoy @haluami, activista indígena de Buenos Aires, hablará sobre cómo se interesó en el activismo climático al pensar en cómo las grandes corporaciones y el cambio climático en sí afectan las vidas de los pueblos indígenas, especialmente la gente de su madre.
🌏🌎🌍
Hoje, @haluami, ativista indígena de Buenos Aires, falará sobre como se interessou pelo ativismo climático, pensando em como as grandes empresas e as mudanças climáticas afetam a vida dos povos indígenas, especialmente o povo de sua mãe.
🌏🌎🌍
Aujourd'hui, @haluami, activiste indigène de Buenos Aires, parlera de la façon dont il s'est intéressé au militantisme climatique en réfléchissant à la façon dont les grandes entreprises et le changement climatique lui-même affectent la vie des peuples autochtones, en particulier le peuple de leur mère.
🌏🌎🌍
‎سيتحدث اليومhaluami ، وهو ناشط أصلي من بوينس آيرس ، عن مدى اهتمامه بالنشاط المناخي من خلال التفكير في كيفية تأثير الشركات الكبرى وتغير المناخ نفسه على حياة الشعوب الأصلية ، وخاصة شعب أمهاتهم.

Title: NA
Description:
We are supporting the 8 week long #DefendTheDefenders campaign! It will uplift indigenous peoples and environmental defenders, who suffer government and corporate oppression, for protecting our Earth. Each week we will spotlight different international regions and local activists.⁣
We will partner with @pollutersout & @fff.digital  to host webinars, story challenges, cyber storms, and more. Help us raise international awareness and mount pressure on local officials by sharing this post on your story!⁣

Estamos lançando nossa campanha de 8 semanas #DefendTheDefenders! Ela vai elevar os povos indígenas e defensores do meio ambiente, que sofrem a opressão de governos e de empresas para proteger a nossa terra. A cada semana vamos destacar diferentes regiões e ativistas locais.⁣
Vamos fazer uma parceria com @fff.digital para hospedar webinars, desafios de histórias, tempestades cibernéticas e muito mais. Ajude-nos a aumentar a consciência internacional e aumentar a pressão sobre as autoridades locais, compartilhando este post nos seus stories! ⁣
🌏🌎🌍⁣ ¡Estamos lanzando nuestra campaña de 8 semanas #DefendTheDefenders! Elevará a los pueblos indígenas y defensores del medio ambiente, que son oprimidos por los gobiernos y las empresas para proteger nuestras tierras. Cada semana destacaremos diferentes regiones y activistas locales.⁣
Nos asociaremos con @fff.digital Digital para organizar seminarios web, desafíos de historias, tormentas cibernéticas y más. ¡Ayúdanos a crear conciencia internacional y aumentar la presión sobre las autoridades locales al compartir esta publicación en tus historias! . ⁣
🌏🌎🌍⁣ نطلق حملتنا #الدفاع_عن_المدافعين لمدة 8 أسابيع! سترفع الشعوب الأصلية والمدافعين عن البيئة ، الذين يعانون من اضطهاد الحكومة والشركات لحماية كوكبنا. سنسلط الضوء كل أسبوع على مناطق دولية مختلفة ونشطاء محليين.⁣
. سنتعاون مع fff.digital@ لاستضافة ندوات عبر الإنترنت وتحديات القصة والعواصف السيبرانية والمزيد. ساعدنا في رفع مستوى الوعي الدولي وممارسة الضغط على المسؤولين المحليين من خلال نشر هذا المنشور على قصتك!

Title: NA
Description:
@fridaysforfuture
‘Hello again, Global Leaders. Last year, we were marching in the streets of the world, reporting the climate emergency. We have listened to promises of a better world and a sustainable society. Now we came back to talk with you. Manaus is the capital of the Brazilian Amazonas state, and, along with Belem do Pará, it is the heart of the Amazon Rainforest. Manaus is an almost remote area, without national visibility in Brazil. Its health system collapsed, and we are not even at the peak of the pandemic. The Town Hall has announced over 100 deaths per day due to Covid-19, and this number can be higher with the non-notified cases. The public authorities in the heart of the Amazon Rainforest are asking for help: we ask the developed countries with already recovered health systems, please, have mercy, and help us avoid the mass death of the Amazon population. Manaus is asking for medical equipment, qualified people, volunteers and attention. As everyone knows, the climate emergency is our generation’s biggest challenge. It is a path of no return that leads to the extinction of society in all countries, all continents. The high death rate of the Amazon people, in the traditional communities, will be a loss with global consequences. More than ever, deforestation is growing in the Amazon, which will soon reach a point of no return.’ .
The video was edited by Talita (@tatywainer)
This appeal came from Abel (@abelfrodrigues), Amália (@amaliagarcez), Anna (@annakernahan_), Aurélie Bray, Bianca (@biancabcastro), Daniel Holanda(@danielaraujon), Fernanda (@nands_rm), Greta (@gretathunberg), Iann (@iannunesc), Isabelle (@isabelleax_), Janderson (@_sil.ves.tre), João (@joaoduccini) and Valentina (@vavruass)
#sosamazonia #climatestrikeonline #Fridaysforfuture #extinctionrebellion #savetheamazon

Title: NA
Description:
The Guaraní are currently forced to choose between starvation and contagion. Support the Guardians of the Atlantic Forest to buy enough food and hygiene items to self-isolate and survive the pandemic. ✊🏾 Link to donate in bio: https://chuffed.org/project/solidarity-guarani-community-in-brazil 🌎 
Our planet is currently experiencing a climate and ecological emergency, where human economic activity has already pushed our global ecosystem to the brink of collapse. ☠️ Being only 0.4% of indigenous peoples worldwide, indigenous communities in Brazil defend and preserve 20% of the Earth's #biodiversity. Indigenous communities have been, and still remain, the last barrier of defence against the loss of biodiversity and collapse of ecosystems. 🍃 
Centuries of exploitation, violence and displacement from their ancestral lands have left the Guariní exposed and vulnerable to the effects of the #Pandemic. 🆘 
Brazil has the most COVID-19 cases in Latin America. Despite this, the government has left the Guaraní people (the largest indigenous community in Brazil) without protection or help. 😷 
Supporting indigenous communities is not an act of charity but an act of solidarity with their resistance: for the global ecosystem to survive they have to win this fight against the virus. 🦠 
If we want to survive the climate crisis, we must stand in solidarity with indigenous people during this pandemic! ⚖️ The Guaraní Commission Yvyrupa, one of the largest indigenous organisations in the world, is asking for financial support from those who believe in their struggle to protect the forests. This will enable them to buy basic food and hygiene items without risking contagion by leaving their communities. 🦜 
Aguyjevete for those who fight! @xryouth_uk @Xr_Internationalist_Solidarity 
2nd graphic by @midiaindiaoficial, voice of the indigenous communities of Brazil! For us, for our ancestors, for those to come! 
#contracoronavírus #saudeindigena #povosindigenas #solidaritynotcharity #reparations #landdemarcationnow #demarcacaonao #yvyrupa  #aguyjevete #stopecocide #stopgenocide #unityindiversity #stayhomenotsilent #covid19 #stopecocide  #stopgenocide

Title: NA
Description:
💚🌎 'Huge Victory' for Standing Rock Sioux Tribe as Federal Court Rules DAPL Permits Violated Law
🌎💚
"This is what the tribe has been fighting for many months. Their fearless organizing continues to change the game."
🌎
A federal judge handed down a major victory for the Standing Rock Sioux tribe of North Dakota on Wednesday, ruling that the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers violated the National Environmental Policy Act by approving federal permits for the Dakota Access Pipeline.
The USACE must complete a full environmental impact study of the pipeline, including full consideration of concerns presented by the Standing Rock Tribe, the judge ruled. The tribe has asked the court to ultimately shut the pipeline down.
.
.
.
#ActNow #RebelForLife  #nogoingback #rebelforlife #ActNow #extinctionrebellion #climateemergency #globalwarming #protest #alonetogether #climateemergency

Title: NA
Description:
🌸AFRIKAN LIBERATION AWARENESS MONTH🌸⁣
⁣
African Voices Forum (AVF), XR Internationalist Solidarity Network Extinction Rebellion Bristol, Extinction Rebellion Youth UK are forming a very special partnership to engage and empower during Afrikan Liberation Awareness Month (ALAM)⁣
⁣
✊🏿Afrikan Liberation Awareness Month is commemorated in May on a global scale. It is an opportunity to counter Afrikan targeting racism known as Afriphobia by celebrating Pan-Afrikan Resistance, knowledge and culture in a system that negates Afrikan humanity, displaces countless Afrikan People from their ancestral Homeland and robs us of our true heritage.⁣
⁣
💥In the midst of a Climate and Ecological Emergency formations of Indigenous Peoples, like the Pan-Afrikan Movement and other Communities of Resistance as well as Women and Youth must be in the lead of the fight for Planet Repairs in the Global South.⁣
⁣
Join us for an online mini-series to discuss strengthening globally coordinated action as Afrikans with the solidarity of our allies in the fight to Stop Ecocide and Genocide; by way of institutionalising Planet Repairs at the local, national and international level.⁣
⁣
💫This is what is meant by the Pan-Afrikan demand for MAATUBUNTUMAN in UBUNTUDUNIA.⁣
⁣
👇🏾 JOIN US 👇🏿⁣
⁣
8TH MAY - 6-7.30pm BST - The Global Black Experience of Ecocide⁣
⁣
16TH MAY - 6-7.30pm BST - Youth In Action and Decolonising Planet Repairs ⁣
⁣
25TH MAY - 6-7.30pm BST - Women's Voices,  Pan-Afrikan Lense ⁣
⁣
👆🏿 All events will be livestreamed on @ExtinctionRebellion ⁣
⁣
Brought to you by: African Voices Forum @xr_internationalist_solidarity @xrbristol @xryouth_uk

Title: NA
Description:
The wealthiest 10% of the global population produce half of the planets individual-consumption-based emissions.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
In contrast the poorest 50% of the world’s population (around 3.5 billion people) are responsible for only 10% of emissions. However it is these people who will suffer the most immediate and brutal effects of climate change and ecological breakdown. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Western societies are mostly responsible for human-influenced climate change, due to overconsumption — yet, geographical positioning and infrastructure put the Global South at higher risk of extreme weather events, extreme heating and droughts. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The world’s wealthiest nations need to live up to their responsibility and #ActNow on the crisis that they have created. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#PlanetaryEmergency #ClimateJustice ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Graphic from @xr_youth ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Sources: @oxfam and ‘On Fire: The Burning Case For a Green New Deal’ by #NaomiKlein

Title: NA
Description:
We are living through history in the making! ✊
🌍
We're now at a point where we can go forwards or backwards. We can either return to #BusinessAsUsual, structural injustices and the exploitation of people and nature — or progress to cooperation, global solidarity, resilience, justice and equality.
🌎
✊ There is #NoGoingBack. There is no better opporutnity for our species. We must decide NOW! ✊ #rebelforlife
🌏
Let's move forward to a society that questions unlimited growth and respects the limits of our planet. #BailoutThePlanet
🌍
"Climate change is not the problem. Climate change is the most horrible symptom of an economic system that has been built for a few to extract every precious value out of the planet and its people, from the natural resources to the fruits of our human labour. This system has created this crisis."
— Colette Pichon Battle, Climate Justice and Human Right Lawyer
🌎
With this big picture, and the coronavirus scenario, our immediate priority is to prevent the spread of COVID-19, but in long-term, it is important to tackle habitat and biodiversity loss.
🌏
We are in this fight together with our Mother Earth.
🍃
Thank you @extinctionrebelliondeutschland .

#nogoingback #windsofchange #change #history #bailouttheplanet #extinctionrebellion

Title: NA
Description:
@xr.hellas
🇬🇷
In the midst of the corona virus pandemic, Greek people are in a mandatory lockdown and the parliament is functioning with less than 10% of its MPs present, and thus unable to conduct a just democracy. At the end of April, the Greek government will try to pass a new law disgracefully named ''Modernization of the Environmental Legislation'' that effectively withdraws environmental regulations so that new ''investments'' can be made that will undoubtedly destroy the country's and subsequently the Earth's environment for the sake of short-term profit. We are witnessing the demolition of the democracy as this health crisis being treated as an opportunity by the right-wing neo-liberal government. And we need to act now.
🌎
This bill promotes hydrocarbon mining and withdraws regulations for oil and gas extraction while companies like Total, Repsol, Exxon-Mobil and Edison have been awarded licenses in 2018 to drill a sea area of 60.000 square kilometers that equals 30% of the country's mainland.
🌏
Also, in the making is a new pipeline project, the ‘’Eastern Mediterranean (EastMed)’’ that will transfer natural gas form Israel, through Cyprus, Greece, and into the rest of Europe and strengthen the fossil fuel industry.
🌍
These projects, are taking advantage of Greece's weak financial position that hasn't yet recovered from the 2008 crisis. Through these developments, the E.U. will achieve more energy independence from outside suppliers, thus saving billions of euros and increasing its strategical power. The caveat is that this process, sponsored by powerful EU countries and the fervently capitalist Greek government, will cause a whole country to be environmentally destroyed, inflicting suffering on the Greek people who will not benefit at all from these new sources of non-renewable energy. These happen inside the supposedly progressive E.U. that frequently points the finger at more authoritarian foreign governments, while it's house is burning. Make no mistakes, this is the modernization of colonialism, not of the environmental law."
🚫
Stop the bill. Sign the petition! Link in bio. For more information follow @xr.hellas

#actnow

Title: NA
Description:
We are all in this together, but this pandemic doesn’t affect everyone equally. 🌍 🌎 🌏 ⁣
⁣
Similar to the climate crisis, race and class both play a huge role in this epidemic. Black and brown communities, and the poorest members of society, are often hit the hardest. 📣 📣 📣 ⁣
⁣
For example, in the USA, black Americans are dying in disproportionate numbers. ⁣
⁣
According to @guardian “African Americans face a higher risk of exposure to the virus, mostly on account of concentrating in urban areas and working in essential industries. Only 20% of black workers reported being eligible to work from home, compared with about 30% of their white counterparts, according to the Economic Policy Institute.”⁣
⁣
Let’s do what we can to help each other through this. Acts of kindness are highly important, but so is standing up for social and ecological justice. ✊🏾✊🏻✊🏿⁣
⁣
Spread love, speak out. 🗣🗣🗣⁣
⁣
#LoveAndRage #ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateJustice #SocialJustice #BlackLivesMatter #Activism #DigitalRebellion ⁣
⁣
Graphic by ⁣@xr_nyc
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Indigenous Peoples are fundamental to the preservation of ecosystems. They are also among the communities suffering the most in this #Pandemic, alongside other traditional peoples and urban workers around the world.
😷
Being only 0.4% of indigenous peoples worldwide, indigenous communities in Brazil defend and preserve 20% of the Earth's #biodiversity. Indigenous communities have been, and still remain, the last barrier of defence against the loss of biodiversity and collapse of ecosystems.
🚧
For this precise reason, the #Guaraní, like many other indigenous peoples, are attacked by a government that does not respect their rights, and wants to destroy their lands for profit. Thus contributing to the acceleration of Climate Change  #StopEcocide #StopGenocide
💸
Supporting #indigenous communities means supporting the health of ecosystems for the whole of humanity! If we want to survive the climate crisis, we must stand in solidarity with indigenous people during this #pandemic.
🏞️
Impoverished by the destruction of their Atlantic forest, the Guaranì indigenous people do not have enough land or savings to self-isolate and are marginalized in healthcare: the brutal choice they face is between hunger and an even more devastating contagion. ☠️ Brazil, and in particular the South and South-East has had the most #Covid19 cases in Latin America. Therefore, the #Guaraní people, the largest #indigenous people in the region, are asking for our financial support to face the new #coronavirus pandemic. 🦠
To stop a history of genocide from repeating itself, they want to follow the guidelines of health agencies and #selfisolate. However, as well as #Coronavirus, they are worried about hunger. 🌽
In this #emergency, the Guaraní Commission Yvyrupa are asking those who support their struggle and believe in their fight for the protection of the forest to support them financially so they can buy basic food and hygiene items for their families without risking contagion by leaving their communities. ⚖️
We must act in solidarity!
💚
 Donation link- http://www.yvyrupa.org.br/apoie-a-cgy/.
🌍
Graphics by @midiaindiaoficial voice of the indigenous communities of Brazil
💚
#solidarity

This is over. #FossilFuelsGameOver #RadioactiveOil

La industria del petróleo vive un momento de extraordinaria vulnerabilidad. El precio se desploma y la conciencia ambiental se eleva en todo el mundo junto con la pandemia. 🌏🌍🌎

💰💰Banks are just as much to blame for the climate crisis as the fossil fuel giants they continue to fund. If we sever the flow of money to oil, gas and coal companies we can stop the disastrous effects of climate change.⁣
⁣
💷💷UK Banks are some of the worst offenders in Europe. Between them HSBC and Barclays have funnelled £158 billion into fossil fuels since the Paris Agreement. And they’re putting more money into fossil fuels every single year.⁣
⁣
⏱⏱When the time comes to rebuild our economies and livelihoods beyond the covid-19 pandemic, we must put people and the planet at the centre of our recovery. ⁣
⁣
For more information visit: www.fundingclimatechaos.co.uk ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Esta semana, Extinction Rebellion celebra el aniversario de la “Rebelión de abril” que tuvo lugar durante 11 días, empezando el 15 de abril de 2019 con nuestro bote rosa, nombrado tras la activista ambiental hondureña, Berta Cáceres. 💚

Una rebelión que vio a XR crecer de un grupo de activistas marginales de @xrebellionuk , los cuales ocuparon 5 puentes, a un nombre familiar que es parte del escenario mundial. 🌏 ——— 💚
This week Extinction Rebellion celebrates the anniversary of the April Rebellion that took place across 11 days starting on 15th April 2019 with our pink boat named after Honduran environmental activist Berta Cáceres.
🌏
A Rebellion which saw XR grow from a group of fringe activists who occupied 5 bridges from @xrebellionuk into a household name and player on the world stage. -
#XR #internationalrebellion #extinctionrebellion #alonetogether #act #tellthetruth #beyondpolitics

Title: NA
Description:
✊👨‍🌾Today on #internationalpeasantsrightsday we shout out @la_via_campesina_official leading organisation on struggle for peasants rights.⁣
⁣
🌾La Via Campesina is an international movement born in 1993 bringing together millions of #peasants, small and medium size farmers, landless people, rural women and youth, indigenous people, migrants and agricultural workers from around the world. ⁣
⁣
🌼💫Built on a strong sense of #unity, #solidarity between these groups, it defends peasant agriculture for #foodsovereignty as a way to promote #socialjustice and dignity and strongly opposes corporate driven agriculture that destroys social relations and nature.⁣
⁣
✋ Their DEMANDS:⁣
1. Defending Food Sovereignty, Struggle for Land and Agrarian Reforms⁣
2. Promoting Agroecology and Defending Local Seeds⁣
3. Promoting Peasant Rights and Struggle Against Criminalization of Peasants⁣
⁣
We share here their call to action and encourage everyone to bring this fight into their lives - and make sure you visit www.viacampesina.org to hear frontline news and stories from peasant communities around the world.

Design: @soph.ieholin

Title: NA
Description:
🗣 PEOPLE, NOT PROFIT!⁣

There is overwhelming evidence that climate and ecological breakdown, caused by human activity, is already costing and destroying lives. ⁣

⁣
The pursuit for profit has already taken too many lives. Indigenous activists are frequently murdered for protecting their land from oil extraction and deforestation. Millions of people have been killed as a result of flooding, drought, heatwaves, or toxic air pollution. ⁣
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
⚠🌎
The fate of the Indigenous communities = The fate of Life
👩🏻‍⚖️👨🏻‍⚖️ Indigenous rights are fundamental to the preservation of the global ecosystem and to the survival of humanity. Due to their ecological worldviews and practices, indigenous communities are essential to the health of ecosystems. 🏭

The lie of colonial Western development has destroyed indigenous culture, economic and political independence for centuries. This same mindset of development has polluted our air and water, propelling our civilization towards ecological and climate breakdown. It is time to join in solidarity and resist.
💰

When indigenous communities are dispossessed of their lands, agribusiness and other industrial corporations have destroyed those ecosystems for profit. A third of Earth's soil is already acutely degraded due to industrial agriculture and climate change. ☠️ If the climate and ecological emergency continues to unfold, studies predict a collapse of the human population throughout this century. Indigenous people are not only the most important defense of humanity against the ecological catastrophe, but are also leading climate resilience. 🌀

Indigenous communities' relationship with the environment, based on ancestral spiritual, cultural, social and economic interdependence, gives Indigenous peoples a unique advantage to prepare for and respond to the impacts of climate change and catastrophes.
🌱

Our planet's biodiversity, climate and ecosystem depend on Indigenous people. Protecting their rights in solidarity means protecting the future survival of the human species.
💚

STOP ECOCIDE/GENOCIDE!
🛑

#climateaction #indigenousrights #stopecocide #StopIndigenousGenocide #solidaritynotcharity #unitedindiversity

Title: NA
Description:
🌍 👑🦜🌎🇧🇷👩🏾🌴👨🏾‍🌾🌳🌏 🍃
Protecting indigenous rights in Brazil = Protecting the Amazon = Protecting life! 💚
Indigenous people make up just 5% of the world's population yet they protect 80% of Earth’s biodiversity. 🌴
Brazil holds 20% of that biodiversity and 98.5% of Brazilian indigenous territory is in the Amazon, our planet's major carbon sink.
🌳🍃
Right now the fate of indigenous communities in Brazil, and therefore the survival of our ecosystem, is in the hands of the Brazilian legal system. The Brazilian government is trying to strip all indigenous peoples of their current land rights. 🇧🇷
The government aggressively support turning the Amazon into an agribusiness heaven.
🔥
Current trends in livestock, agriculture, logging, fires and droughts,  project that 55% of the Amazon will be destroyed by 2030 if action is not taken.
🚱
Pressure has been ramped up since a far-right government came into power with an ecocidal vision of opening up the Amazon for commercial agriculture, mining and oil and gas extraction. Indigenous land rights are the only thing standing in their way.
👨‍🔬
Scientist Daniel Nepstad says indigenous lands are 'the most important barrier to Amazon deforestation.’ If indigenous communities lose their lands, Brazilian ecosystems will be wiped out to make room for profitable projects.This will turn the Amazon into a savanna, rainfall becoming reserved on a regional scale. This could effectively activate a global ecological collapse. It would also create economic genocide for Indigenous peoples in Brazil.
🇧🇷
Our planet's biodiversity, climate and ecosystem depend on Indigenous peoples. Protecting their rights in solidarity means protecting the future survival of life.
🌍 🌎🌏
The fate of indigenous communities in Brazil = The fate of life. 💚
STOP ECOCIDE!
🛑

#climateaction #amazon #amazonia #stopecocide

Title: NA
Description:
🔥💨 Already in lockdown because of the coronavirus, Ukraine is now also contending with fires in the post-apocalyptic landscape of the Chernobyl zone.

After a warm and dry winter, the fires are far larger than the typical brush fires in the Chernobyl zone. 
Saturday’s strong winds could spread the fires to the remnants of the nuclear plant and the equipment that was used to clean up the disaster, said Kateryna Pavlova, the acting head of the agency that oversees the area, in a telephone interview. “At the moment, we cannot say the fire is contained”

Over time, radiation has settled into the soil, where its half-life ticks away mostly harmlessly. But the roots of moss, trees and other vegetation have absorbed some radiation, bringing it to the surface and spreading radioactive particles in smoke when it burns. Also, radioactive particles can land on gardens or fields and later be consumed in food .
-
- .🔥💨 ES: Ya encerrada por el coronavirus, Ucrania ahora también se enfrenta a incendios en el paisaje postapocalíptico de la zona de Chernobyl.

Después de un invierno cálido y seco, los incendios son mucho más grandes que los típicos de matorrales en la zona de Chernobyl.

Pero los fuertes vientos del sábado podrían propagar los incendios a los restos de la planta nuclear y el equipo que se utilizó para limpiar el desastre, dijo Kateryna Pavlova, la directora interina de la agencia que supervisa el área, en una entrevista telefónica. "Por el momento, no podemos decir que el fuego está contenido"

Con el tiempo, la radiación se ha asentado en el suelo, donde su vida media avanza casi sin causar daño. Pero las raíces de musgo, árboles y otra vegetación han absorbido algo de radiación, llevándola a la superficie y propagando partículas radiactivas en el humo cuando se quema. Además, las partículas radiactivas pueden aterrizar en jardines o campos y luego ser consumidas en los alimentos.

Credit NYTimes

#extinctinorebellion #climateaction #wildfires #chernobyl

Title: NA
Description:
Wildfires currently rage across northern Thailand. The forest fires have been burning for several weeks amid dry conditions, destroying hundreds of acres of land and taking the lives of people and animals. ⁣
⁣
According to the Bangkok Post, “villagers have to stand at the forefront, reaching the hotspot as fast as they could to put out the blaze because in the eyes of the state they are "typical culprits" for fire disasters. But, in fact, they are forest guardians who have dealt with fires every year. They are the ones who help build fire buffer zones.⁣
⁣
Even though the state set up fire fighting stations, the number of officials manning them is limited.⁣
⁣
As the fire fighting continues, small people, for example villagers and a village leader along with low-level rangers, have sacrificed their lives. One forest firefighter committed suicide, leaving a death note that attacked cronyism and bureaucratic red tape that makes fire fighting much tougher. ⁣
⁣
As city people are hit hard during the Covid-19 pandemic, they can still find food in the supermarkets and survive. But it's different for forest dwellers, they will have no access to the forest, their only source of food, sometimes being referred to as a traditional supermarket. And, ironically, they have to take all the blame for the stubborn blazes.”⁣
⁣
Images: Bangkok Post ⁣
⁣
#ThailandForestFires #ExtinctionOrRebellion #Wildfires #ClimateJustice #EcologicalBreakdown #ClimateEmergency

Title: NA
Description:
.
Donation link in @helenagualinga bio💚

CORONAVIRUS AND THE CLIMATE CRISIS - THOUSANDS OF INDIGENOUS PEOPLE IN URGENT NEED AFTER EXTREME FLOODS 
As indigenous people in the Ecuadorian Amazon fight to prevent the spread of COVID-19 into their territories, extreme floods on the Bobonaza river have caused bridges to collapse, flooded homes and food gardens  threatening the livelihood of thousands of people.This is the worst flood in recent history, caused by deforestation and climate change. This is the Climate Crisis!

The coronavirus pandemic exacerbates the situation, because government agencies are overrun dealing with the virus outbreak and have little resources to provide emergency help. These communities have no access to basic services, which leaves these indigenous people in an extremely vulnerable situation. 
Indigenous peoples of the Amazon are on the frontlines of climate change, protecting living forests while resisting extraction and other threats They are putting their lives on the line and now they need our SUPPORT! 
All donations will go directly to the affected communities via  AmazonWatch. 
THANK YOU! -

CORONAVIRUS Y LA CRISIS CLIMÁTICA - MILES DE INDÍGENAS CON NECESIDADES URGENTES DESPUÉS DE INUNDACIONES EXTREMAS

Mientras los indígenas en la Amazonía ecuatoriana luchan para prevenir el coronavirus en sus territorios,  inundaciones sin precendentes en el río Bobonaza, en Ecuador, han causado que cientos de familias pierdan sus hogares y también dañen sus cultivos. Escuelas han sido arrazdas. Esta es la peor inundación en la región, causada por el cambio climático y la deforestación. Esto es la crisis climática

La pandemia de coronavirus exacerba la situación, porque las agencias gubernamentales están saturadas atendiendo el brote del virus y tienen pocos recursos para brindar ayuda. Estas comunidades no tienen acceso a servicios básicos, lo que deja a las familias indígenas en una situación extremadamente vulnerable.

Los pueblos indígenas de la Amazonía están luchando contra el cambio climático, arriesgando sus vidas y ahora necesitan nuestro APOYO. 
Todas las donaciones irán directamente a las comunidades afectadas a través de AmazonWatch.

Title: NA
Description:
"El coronavirus está disminuyendo las emisiones", "La Madre Tierra se está limpiando” y "Los humanos son el virus", en los medios principales y en los círculos de activistas climáticos.⁣
⁣
Necesitamos examinar lo que realmente significan estas ideas, y tener claro que cualquier afirmación de que una pandemia global y la pérdida de miles de vidas humanas es algo bueno para el clima, es mucho más peligroso que el virus en sí.⁣
⁣
Estamos viviendo un momento de mucha incertidumbre y miedo, donde las personas más vulnerables están expuestas a grandes riesgos y la muerte. Cualquier reclamo que ponga la responsabilidad de la crisis climática a los pies de los más marginados, es un paso en el camino hacia el ecofascismo - una ideología progresiva que pisotea a los que se consideran "menos" en un intento para "salvar la tierra", con sus raíces en el nazismo. Algunos grupos de la extrema derecha han estado posando como Extinción Rebelión para propagar ideas fascistas. Condenamos estas tácticas y rechazamos abiertamente y luchamos contra sus ideas.⁣
⁣
El cambio climático, es causado por nuestro sistema profundamente desigual y destructivo que se dedica a obtener ganancias para pocos, en vez de el bienestar de todos - no por personas comunes que luchan para sobrevivir en un mundo injusto. Las narraciones engañosas sobre la "superpoblación" pueden conducir a la promoción de la eugenesia o un estado de una sola raza logrado por políticas opresivas contra la inmigración.⁣
⁣
Ya estamos viendo cómo el fascismo se esta metiendo en muchos aspectos de nuestras vidas. Si vamos a luchar por un cambio que sea realmente justo ante la creciente crisis climática y ecológica, ¡debemos estar atentos contra el ecofascismo!⁣
⁣
Esta es una crisis, con efectos secundarios que pueden provocar cambios si lo deseamos, pero todo eso está en la incertidumbre. Por ahora, nos enfocaremos en la solidaridad de la comunidad, la asistencia de ayuda mutua/divulgación y la cultura regenerativa.⁣
⁣
Nos solidarizamos con todas las víctimas de desigualdades y injusticias. ¡No estas solo!

Title: NA
Description:
"The environment is so important – not just because it sustains all life on Earth but also because of its beauty. That's enough of a reason to fight for it. ⁣
⁣
Growing up in Lincolnshire in the UK made me realise how beautiful the natural world is and I hope to preserve it for many future generations, in the hope that they will be able to come to the same conclusion."⁣
⁣
- Daze @xrebellionuk from #FacesOfTheFuture series by @Taltakingpics⁣
⁣
"El planeta es muy importante, no solo porque sustenta toda la vida en la Tierra, sino también por su belleza. Esa es razón suficiente para luchar por él.⁣
Crecer en Lincolnshire, en el Reino Unido, me hizo darme cuenta de lo hermoso que es el mundo natural y espero preservarlo para  generaciones futuras, con la esperanza de que puedan llegar a la misma conclusión ".⁣
⁣
- Daze @xrebellionuk de la serie #FacesOfTheFuture de @Taltakingpics⁣
⁣
#HumansOfXR #loveintimesofcorona

Title: NA
Description:
As the global community struggles to cope with the #COVID-19 pandemic, some of our brothers and sisters are facing the situation from exceedingly difficult circumstances. These are very difficult times for everyone, but remember to have gratitude if you are lucky enough to at least have a safe home to isolate in.⁣
⁣
Repost from @ninagualinga whose community Sarayaku is under water after extreme flooding. ⁣
⁣
"My family, my friends, and people along the Bobonaza river basin have lost their homes, crops, animals, everything. The bridge that connects my community is destroyed. The school is gone. It is the worst flooding ever in the region. I am devastated and I feel powerless from afar. ⁣
⁣
The past days we have been doing everything in our power to prevent the coronavirus pandemic from entering our communities because that would be a complete disaster – and now this... My people need support now."⁣
⁣
Find the link in our insta stories to send your support. ⁣
⁣
Our thoughts are with you and your community @ninagualinga

Title: NA
Description:
This global pandemic is forcing us to stay inside. An intimate retreat with our doubts and perhaps our fears too.⁣
⁣
A retreat, however, that with all its challenges also presents us with certain opportunities. ⁣
⁣
Stop, breathe. Adapt a regenerative attitude. Let’s strengthen ourselves, internally, emotionally and physically.⁣
⁣
In turn we’ll see that we are all connected, even from afar. ⁣
⁣
The distancing presents us with the opportunity to be closer together than ever. To become aware of the ties that unite us, to admire in all its splendour the radiant light that was always there, covered by the smog curtain of savage capitalism.⁣
⁣
The pandemic has too many parallels with the climate crisis for us to remain silent about it. It will come.⁣
⁣
But for now, let us breathe. To reflect on our responsibility towards the most vulnerable and on creative ways to use our privileges. To receive the call to solidarity with an open heart. And to experience the sweet paradox of being able to see better than ever, in isolation, that we are one.⁣
⁣
En esta situación que estamos viviendo mundialmente nos toca estar metidos adentro. Un retiro íntimo con nuestras dudas. Con nuestros miedos quizás también.⁣
Un retiro, sin embargo, que con todos sus desafíos también nos presenta ciertas oportunidades. Como la de volver a adentrarnos.⁣
Parar, respirar. Ponernos en actitud regenerativa. Fortalecernos mucho, interior, emocional y físicamente. Y a su vez, ver que hay una red que existe y nos contiene, incluso desde la lejanía. Une red que además de nutrirnos, nos invita a conectar con nuestra responsabilidad hacia todos los seres que la conforman.⁣
El distanciamiento nos presenta la oportunidad de estar más juntos que nunca. De tomar conciencia de los vínculos que nos unen, de admirar en todo su esplendor la luz radiante que siempre estuvo ahí, tapada por la cortina de smog del capitalismo salvaje. La situación actual con esa pandemia tiene demasiados paralelos con la crisis climática como para que nos quedemos callados al respecto. Ya vendrá.⁣
Pero por ahora, a respirar. A reflexionar sobre nuestra responsabilidad hacia los más vulnerables y sobre formas creativas de usar...

Title: NA
Description:
We take time to consider the very serious and ongoing threat that Coronavirus (Covid-19) poses to our activities and the planned Waves of Rebellion. Rebels have been working tirelessly to find a path which seeks to protect life, support the most vulnerable, and draw our communities together in a time of crisis.⁣
⁣
‘Business as usual’ has been disrupted with a shocking jolt, and people everywhere are called on to do what we can to slow the progress of this pandemic.⁣
⁣
Advice from healthcare professionals and experts is to self-isolate and limit social contact to slow the spread of Coronavirus. Rebels are encouraged to hold meetings online wherever possible, and to think carefully before organising in-person gatherings.⁣
⁣
Slowing this virus down will make a big difference to how well we can care for people who are affected. By limiting our contact with others, where possible, we can relieve unnecessary strain on healthcare providers and save lives.⁣
⁣
As rebels, we can choose to engage with and support our local communities in this crisis. This is an opportunity to prefigure the world we want to build: one that chooses life and regeneration over despair and fear.⁣
⁣
—————————————-⁣
⁣
Nos tomamos el tiempo para considerar la actual y gran amenaza que el Coronavirus (Covid-19) representa para nuestras actividades y olas de rebelión  planeadas.  Los rebeldes han estado trabajando incansablemente para encontrar un camino que busque proteger la vida, apoyar a los más vulnerables y unir a nuestras comunidades en este momento de crisis.⁣
⁣ "Los negocio de siempre" se han interrumpido de forma impactante, y se pide a la gente de todas partes, que hagan lo que puedan, para frenar el progreso de esta pandemia.⁣
⁣
 El consejo de profesionales de la salud y expertos es limitar el contacto social para frenar la propagación del coronavirus.  Se alienta a los rebeldes a celebrar reuniones en línea siempre que sea posible, y a pensar detenidamente antes de organizar reuniones en persona.⁣
⁣
Photo reposted from @extinctionrebellionbath #covıd19 #extinctionrebellion #digitalstrikeforclimate

Title: NA
Description:
We are renaming the International Support Team (IST) as Global Support in order to more appropriately reflect our global network that reaches beyond borders. Global Support is here to provide XR groups with the resources to start and the support to flourish, through training, funding, tech infrastructure, and more.⁣
⁣
If you are interested in being part of a Global Support working group, visit our stories to find out how.⁣
⁣
To support the increasing number of groups all over the world and Global Support, find the link to donate to our international crowdfunder in our insta story. ⁣
⁣
We are excited to continue to work with XR groups across the world in 2020!⁣
⁣
————————————-⁣
⁣
Cambiamos el nombre del Equipo de Soporte Internacional (IST) por Global Support (Soporte Global) para reflejar más adecuadamente nuestra red global que va más allá de las fronteras. Global Support está aquí para proporcionar a los grupos XR los recursos para comenzar y el apoyo para prosperar, a través de capacitación, financiamiento, infraestructura tecnológica y más.⁣
⁣
Si está interesado en formar parte de un grupo de trabajo de Soporte global, infórmenos aquí (https://forms.organise.earth/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=872857&lang=en).⁣
⁣
Para apoyar el creciente número de grupos en todo el mundo y equipos del Global Support, aquí (https://chuffed.org/project/xrinternational) es nuestro Crowdfunder internacional.⁣
⁣
¡Estamos muy entusiasmados de seguir trabajando con grupos XR en todo el mundo en 2020!⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown

Title: NA
Description:
Breaking: A new report from @AmazonWatch reveals the hypocrisy of five of the world’s biggest financial firms — @BlackRock, @HSBC, @GoldmanSachs, @JPMorgan @Chase, and @Citi — despite recent headlines describing new commitments to environmental sustainability.⁣
⁣
These “Dirty Five” companies are pouring billions into crude oil extraction in the western Amazon, despite explicit opposition from indigenous groups on the ground, and the worsening of the climate crisis. ⁣
⁣
Read more: https://amazonwatch.org/crude⁣
⁣
#EndAmazonCrude #StopTheMoneyPipeline #KeepItInTheGround #DefundFossilFuels⁣
#ProtectTheAmazon #IndigenousRights⁣
⁣
_____________________________________⁣
⁣
Último momento: Un nuevo informe de @AmazonWatch revela la hipocresía de cinco de las firmas financieras más grandes del mundo: @BlackRock, @HSBC, @GoldmanSachs, @JPMorgan @Chase y @Citi, a pesar de  titulares recientes  que describen nuevos compromisos con la sostenibilidad ambiental.⁣
⁣
Estas 5 “compañías sucias” están invirtiendo miles de millones en la extracción de petróleo crudo en el oeste de la Amazonía, a pesar de la oposición explícita de los grupos indígenas en el terreno, y la aceleración de la crisis climática. ⁣
⁣
Leer más: https://amazonwatch.org/crude

Title: NA
Description:
“Tropical forests are taking up less carbon dioxide from the air, reducing their ability to act as carbon sinks and bringing closer the prospect of accelerating climate breakdown.⁣
⁣
The Amazon could turn into a source of carbon in the atmosphere, instead of one of the biggest absorbers of the gas, as soon as the next decade, owing to the damage caused by loggers and farming interests and the impacts of the climate crisis, new research has found.” As cited from @guardian ⁣
⁣
We must urge our global governments to #ActNow ⁣
⁣
Visit our JOIN US story highlight to find out how to get involved.⁣
⁣
———————————-⁣
⁣
“Los bosques tropicales están absorbiendo menos dióxido de carbono del aire, reduciendo su capacidad de actuar como sumideros de carbono y acelerando la posibilidad de un colapso climático.⁣
⁣
El Amazonas podría convertirse en una fuente de carbono, en lugar de uno de los mayores absorbentes de gas, a partir de la próxima década, debido al daño causado por la tala indiscriminada, la industria agrícola y los impactos de la crisis climática, nuevas investigaciones han demostrado ". Como se cita en @guardian⁣
⁣
Debemos exigir a los gobiernos mundiales que  #Actuenahora⁣
⁣
Visita nuestra historia destacada JOIN US (únete) para descubrir cómo participar.⁣
⁣

Title: NA
Description:
WHY IS CLIMATE BREAKDOWN A WOMENS ISSUE?⁣
⁣
Yesterday, XR groups all over the world took part in actions to highlight the disproportionate impact of the climate and ecological emergency on women⁣
and the resulting increase in violence, hardship and rape. The effects of climate breakdown are already been felt by our sisters in parts of the Global South. ⁣
⁣
A January 2020 report for the International Union for the Conservation of Nature found that climate breakdown and environmental degradation are driving an increase in violence against women, including rape. ⁣
⁣
UN figures indicate that 80% of people displaced by climate change are women.⁣
⁣
Globally, women are more likely to experience poverty, and to have less socioeconomic power than men. This makes it difficult to recover from disasters which affect infrastructure, jobs and housing. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion groups took to the streets for #InternationalWomensDay in Colombia, Chile, Spain, Turkey, The Gambia, Pakistan, Nigeria, Uganda, DRC, Belgium, Israel, The Philippines, Switzerland, Argentina and the UK. ⁣
⁣
#Equality #IWD #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown ⁣
⁣
Photos: @thelightscaper @xrebellionuk @extinctionrebellionnigeria @xrargentina XR Hewa Boro Congo @xraaa_n @yokolusisyani @extinctionrebelliondk @unwisemonkeys.

Statistics Source: International Union for the Conservation of Nature https://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/library/gender/Gender%20and%20Environment/UNDP%20Linkages%20Gender%20and%20CC%20Policy%20Brief%201-WEB.pdf
