Title: NA
Description:
CHINA 🇨🇳 | We’re counting down to #InternationalWomensDay with stories from women of the world, as told by #ExtinctionRebellion groups.⁣..⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
“Tang Na is a joyful old lady, she has been living in Li Mountain village for 50 years since her marriage. 19 years ago, her husband broke his leg in an accident while working as a miner for a local company which soon went bankrupt. His labor was not fully paid, let alone the injury compensation.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Ever since her husband’s disability, Tang Na burdens all the labor inside and outside the house. Villagers here have been counting their livelihood on oranges for over three decades. When the harvest was decent, Tang Na had to carry 200 loads from field to home, around 20,000 kg.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
However, since 2016, the harvest has been failing villagers’ hope because of unexceptionally heavy frost in winter.⁣⁣
Now there is only one family in the village still taking care of their orchids. But no one buys the oranges anymore, since they became too sour because of the weather. So the farmers have changed strategy to selling orange skins to Chinese medicine producers, and leaving the flesh to rot in the soil. Apparently, there is more work and less profit compared to old days. And it’s mostly women who are left in the village to deal with this low-profit work.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
Traditionally, men are given more opportunity to flow and venture while women are stuck at home with kids and chores.”⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Words and images provided by Ziqi from XR China

Title: NA
Description:
with stories from women of the world, as told by #ExtinctionRebellion groups.⁣..⁣
⁣⁣
“The frontline communities are the ones worst effected by this emergency. Women are hit the worse because they are generally the ones taking care of the household and looking after the children whilst the man is at work – sometimes the are forced to take the children to work, to double up on the money. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Whilst recording this video, I felt the most important job for women is to keep the hope alive. We have witnessed some men drink out of frustration resulting in them becoming violent. Women are the ones who keep the family stitched together. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
This women has lived on the rocks at the edge of the sea all her life. The rocks are sharp and jagged, there is no way to keep beds for her children. Sometimes when the tides rise, their belongings float away.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
I have seen the children carrying back water from the toilet of the nearest community – in water cans almost the size of them. The woman’s voice keeps ringing in my head; climate refugees are not welcomed by the present community. After spending 13 days coming to film here, I cannot imagine spending a week living like that––let alone a lifetime––and still maintaining hope.”⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Words and film by Subham Chaudhuri @xrmumbai

Title: NA
Description:
“My family have been into activism for a long time. We’re from Honduras and that country is filled with tons of crime and violence—we’ve been protesting against those issues—but my climate activism really began after Hurricane Sandy. ⁣
⁣
I live in South Queens – very close to Jamaica Bay and the Atlantic Ocean. Hurricane Sandy completely flooded the neighbourhood right below us. It was insane to see homes completely destroyed; these are neighbours ors, friends, people I knew... and their homes were completely gone. After the hurricane I noticed these issues were effecting is directly, and they’re going to effect more people like us who live in vulnerable spaces. ⁣
⁣
This is happening as a result of corporations abusing their powers and governments who don’t want to put through policies that will help mitigate or end the effects of climate change... ⁣
⁣
Coming from Honduras, where climate change will be more impactful... knowing there’s already lots of poverty and violence there, I imagine what it will be like when there are more, stronger hurricanes hitting there. ⁣
⁣
If we don’t put an end to manmade climate change, we’re going to see more of these issues arise.” ⁣
⁣
– Roberto (Robby) Quesada, @xryouth.nyc⁣
⁣
#HumansOfXR #ExtinctionRebellion ⁣
Image Text: PROTECT NOT FOSSIL EARTH OUR A CHILDREN LIVABLE PLANET FUELS. NEED

Title: NA
Description:
Colonialism and the land-grabbing of Indigenous territories has fulled the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣
⁣
Indigenous communities live in relative harmony with the natural world. However, the global economy currently profits from the domination of nature and the extraction of an unsustainable amount of natural resources — extracted from stolen indigenous lands.⁣
⁣
For centuries Indigenous people have been on the frontlines defending nature. ⁣
⁣
We must listen to indigenous voices, as they offer crucial insight about our connection to, and the protection of our natural world. We must also stand with indigenous peoples and defend their rights.⁣
⁣
“What governments around the world are doing is not correct. They aren’t respecting the planet. They aren’t respecting indigenous people. They aren’t even respecting their own laws that are written down. Please support us. Please pressure your government.”⁣⁣⁣
- Davi Kopenawa, spokesperson for the Yanomami people⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #IndigenousRising #wetsuwetenstrong ⁣
⁣
Photo by @emilycontadorkelsall reposted from @extinctionrebellionsydney

Title: NA
Description:
THIS IS AN ECOLOGICAL EMERGENCY⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Climate change threatens 1 in 3 species of plants and animals in the next 50 years, according to @cnnclimate⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Researchers from the University of Arizona “found that approximately one in three plant, insect and animal species could face extinction by 2070. However, things could be even worse if emissions continue to rise as rapidly as they have in recent decades”.⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣
We are currently experiencing the Sixth Mass Extinction – currently losing up to 200 species per day. Five other mass extinctions have happened throughout the course of history, however the Sixth Mass Extinction is a direct cause of human activity.⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣
According to the researchers, the number of species facing extinction could drop “if we make a collective effort to address climate change”. ⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
🌍 Take to the streets! ⁣⁣⁣
Visit our ‘Join Us’ story to contact your local XR group to find out how you can get involved.⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
🗣️ Use your voice!⁣⁣⁣
Educate those around you by talking about the climate and ecological emergency. Share posts and raise awareness through your social media account to inspire people to take action.⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
WE NEED EVERYBODY NOW!⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown #SpeciesExtinction #ExtinctionMeansForever

Title: NA
Description:
Rebels in Venice @xrvenezia took part in some #Discobedience during the annual Venice Carnival.⁣ ⁣
The carnival attracts tourists from all over the world, #ExtinctionRebellion aimed to inspire attendees to #ActNow and get involved with activism to urge global governments to confront the Climate and Ecological Emergency.⁣ ⁣
Rebels also drew attention to imminent threat of rising sea levels destroying the city itself. Some experts predict that Venice will be completely under water by the year 2100 due to rising sea levels and land subsidence (the sinking of the Earth’s surface caused by the removal of materials below the surface).⁣ ⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣ ⁣
🌎 Think Global, Act Local⁣
Head to stories and find your local group. Contact them today to see how you can help!⁣ ⁣
Video by @xrvenezia⁣ ⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown

Title: NA
Description:
WHY DID XR PROTESTORS DIG UP THE TRINITY COLLEGE LAWN?⁣ ⁣⁣@xrebellionuk
⁣
⁣
Trinity College is a college at the University of Cambridge in the UK. ⁣
⁣
This action was designed to highlight Cambridge Trinity College’s refusal to divest from the fossil fuel industry and their plans to tear up an ‘innocence farm’ in Kirkton and build a business park – despite local protests.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
BUT WHY DIG UP THE LAWN? ISN’T GRASS GOOD?⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
No, not really. Trinity’s manicured lawn is a monoculture: no diversity.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
The college happily funds and destroys acres upon acres of actual habitats, destroying the homes of wildlife and people much poorer than themselves.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
The ‘pristine’ lawn is a status-symbol and nothing more. In Great Britain grass lawns have always been a way for aristocrats to show their wealth: excess land that they can afford to leave barren.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
Trinity College’s lawn can be repaired in a few days at a small cost in relation to their wealth – no humans or animals were hurt during this action. ⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
On the other hand, the habitats that have been destroyed through Trinity College’s funding of fossil fuel projects are completely irreplaceable. ⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
Temporary damage to the lawn of the UK’s third biggest land owner sparked media outrage –– imagine if the media was this concerned about holding the climate and ecological criminals to account…⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #TheTimeIsNow⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
Illustration by Jessica Agar, using ideas articulated by Nathan Williams, Edie Turner and Linda Richardson⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
Photos by @dorrez2k8 
photos reposted from @xryouthcambridge

Title: NA
Description:
As the city of Jakarta faces another bout of flooding, @extinctionrebellion.id took to the streets to urge the government to address the climate and ecological emergency.⁣
⁣
Rebels painted heartfelt messages on umbrellas inspired by the Indonesian proverb, 'Sedia Payung Sebelum Hujan' (meaning, prepare your umbrella before it rains.) This proverb is often used to urge action to prevent a bad thing from happening.⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion know that something catastrophic is already happening, but through collective action, we can PREVENT the worst from happening.⁣
⁣
The people of Indonesia are continuously urging their government to declare a climate and ecological emergency, and they will not stop until this has been achieved and adequate action has been taken to address it. ⁣
⁣
Visit our JOIN US story highlight to find your nearest XR group and get involved today. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #EverybodyNow #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown ⁣
⁣
Photography by @andydotdaniel

Title: NA
Description:
Last week, the Antarctic registered a temperature higher than 20ºC (68F) for the first time on record. ⁣
⁣
According to @guardian “this region stores about 70% of the world’s fresh water in the form of snow and ice. If it were all to melt, sea levels would rise by 50 to 60 metres, but that will take many generations. UN scientists predict oceans will be between 30cm and 110cm higher by the end of this century, depending on human efforts to reduce emissions and the sensitivity of ice sheets.”⁣
⁣
We must act now. Join #ExtinctionRebellion in non-violent rebellion against the governments of the world for climate and ecological justice. ⁣
⁣
Visit our JOIN US story highlight to find out what you can do. ⁣
⁣
#Antarctica #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown #ExtinctionOrRebellion

Title: NA
Description:
BOYCOTT FASHION WEEK! ⁣
⁣
@xr.boycottfashion are asking for the @BritishFashionCouncil to cancel #LondonFashionWeek in light of the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
This weekend, #LFW has gone ahead as usual. The same applies to New York, Milan and Paris... This is no time for business as usual. Today, rebels from @xrebellionuk took to the streets to demand action on the unprecedented emergency that we face.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The fashion industry is in desperate need of systemic change in order to reduce its impact on the planet. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We are calling on the fashion industry to use its influence and creativity to sustain all life on Earth. This is not the death of creativity or fashion, but a call for radical transformation. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Join @xr.boycottfashion today and pledge not to buy new clothing for 52 weeks. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣

#ExtinctionRebellion #RebelForLife #XRBoycottFashion #ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown

Title: NA
Description:
Enough is Enough... Together we march. Massive March on February 22 in London. ⁣1pm - 4pm. ⁣@xrebellionuk⁣
⁣
We are on the threshold of something new.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Extinction Rebellion is one part of a much greater movement and we are stronger together.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
-Enough of police clamping down on peaceful protesters.⁣⁣
-Enough of being labelled extremists for standing up for each other.⁣⁣
-Enough fires decimating wildlife and homes from the UK to the USA, Australia to Amazon & Africa. ⁣⁣
-Enough devastating droughts, floods and storms. ⁣⁣
-Enough of the media controlling our story.⁣⁣
-Enough government failure.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
More courage. ⁣⁣
More collaboration.⁣⁣
More love. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We will march together wearing our hearts on our sleeves. We must continue to come together from a place of fierce love.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If you believe in the right to peacefully protest, please join us on 22nd February - event link in Bio. ⁣⁣
⁣
Craft for climate, wearing pink and red ⁣⁣
**create your own heart and wear it on your sleeve** ⁣as we march together in resistance and solidarity.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Yes @lbc we agree: #Enoughisenough. ⁣
Together we march.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#RebelForLife #climateemergency #climatechange ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#actnow #extinctionrebellion #london

Title: NA
Description:
@mobilize.earth has partnered with #ExtinctionRebellion and @amazonwatch to set out on a new course to mitigate the climate and ecological emergency by bringing together people from all walks of life. We are working to mobilize everyone - industry, activists, politicians, farmers, immigrants - to respond to the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
We work to:⁣⁣⁣
- Tell the truth about the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣⁣
- Engage and connect individuals and organizations across industries, cultures and political divides and work towards tangible responses to the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣⁣
- Design a future in which we can all thrive by working with leaders, scientists, entrepreneurs and activists.⁣⁣⁣
We are now in a fight for all life on our planet. No one is prepared to face this alone and no one should. Join Mobilize Earth and become part of something bigger. This fight needs you.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Click link in bio to see what you can do⁣
www.mobilize.earth⁣
⁣⁣⁣

Title: NA
Description:
On the eve of the #Oscars2020 @xryouth.la occupied the Hollywood sign demanding that the entertainment industry “take urgent action” on the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣
⁣
“The Hollywood sign is an iconic symbol of glamour and film history – but with Hollywood also comes a history of excess and discrimination, which are part of the roots of the climate emergency. Some stars of Hollywood are aware of the scale of the climate crisis, and some have started to take action… But we do not believe that Hollywood as a whole has taken an acceptable stance on the climate crisis.”⁣
⁣
We demand that the industry uses its talent, resources and influence to capture attention and use the platform to educate and demand action from the governments of the world. ⁣
⁣
If you’re a young person interested in joining #ExtinctionRebellion follow @xryouth for ways to get involved. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow

Title: NA
Description:
The Canadian police have used brutal force against the Wet’suwet’en people, who are defending their lands and blocking the construction of a pipeline project. ⁣
⁣
The Wet’suwet’en people have not consented to a pipeline – one of the largest private sector investments in Canadian history – being built through their territory. Forceful and aggressive measures from the Canadian government and police force completely undermine the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples. (UNDRIP) The UNDRIP states that “Indigenous peoples shall not be forcibly removed from their lands or territories”. ⁣
⁣
The Canadian government are putting profit before people; violating the rights of Indigenous peoples and investing in a project that will accelerate the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣
⁣
We are standing with the people of Wet’suwet’en. The world is watching. ⁣
⁣
#WetsuwetenStrong #NoTresspass⁣
⁣
Photos reposted from @xr_vancouver by @gracegrignon

Title: NA
Description:
“We, representatives of 45 indigenous peoples in Brazil, more than 600 participants, were summoned by chief Raoni to meet between January 14 and 18, 2020 in the village Piaraçu (Terra Indígena Capoto Jarina), with the objective of bringing together our forces and denounce that a political project of the Brazilian government of genocide, ethnocide and ecocide is underway.

The Brazilian State has to understand that it has a historic debt to indigenous peoples. We are the first inhabitants of our country. We not only defend the environment: we are Nature itself. If they kill the environment, they are killing us. We want the forest forever standing, not because the forest is beautiful, but because all these beings that inhabit the forest are part of us and run in our blood."

Title: NA
Description:
We are heartbroken to hear of the passing of an incredible young scientist, conservationist and activist known to us as Iggy Fox.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
Iggy worked with Extinction Rebellion from our early days and has contributed a vast amount of wisdom, time and love to the movement. He was known amongst rebels for his kindness, warmth, determination and incredible commitment to the cause of climate, ecological and social justice.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
At the time of his passing, Iggy was working as part of an anti-poaching group in South Africa. We are deeply saddened by this tragic news – the global justice movement has lost a truly wonderful person. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We are forever grateful for everything that you did to raise awareness and protect our precious Earth and all the life it sustains.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Thank you for your inspiration Iggy. Your legacy lives through us all. ⁣⁣
__________⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Here are some words from Iggy’s mother: ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Beloved Raphael, beloved Iggy- ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
You were a force of nature, and now you are a new kind of force : you are atoms of chlorophyll, you are water, you are an ants nest, you are moss on a stone, a birds feather, a wolf’s paw print, a tiger, a tree, a praying mantis, a stingray, a squirrel. You are the sky and the sea and the forests and the mountains and the marshes and the deserts and everything in between. With your scientist’s and your writer’s eye, I think that’s how you’d see it.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
You didn’t believe in heaven because you knew heaven was here on Earth. You saw it clearly and you helped others see it. It’s all here. All we could ever wish for or need us is all around us.⁣
⁣⁣
Let’s celebrate him, with love and rage in our hearts: love for him and for this planet , rage against the injustices and damage knowingly  inflicted by its elected and non elected leaders.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
But mostly, love.

Title: NA
Description:
“What governments around the world are doing is not correct. They aren’t respecting the planet. They aren’t respecting indigenous people. They aren’t even respecting their own laws that are written down. Please support us. Please pressure your government.”⁣⁣
- Davi Kopenawa, spokesperson for the Yanomami people⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
Chief Raoni, with other indigenous leaders, including Davi Kopenawa, travelled to London to spread awareness of the dire situation in Brazil and to deliver an indigenous manifesto to the British Government.⁣⁣
⁣ ⁣⁣
We must listen to indigenous voices, as they offer crucial insight about our connection to, and the protection of our natural world. We must also stand with indigenous peoples and put pressure on our government to act now on the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
“If people continue to destroy the planet, nature will take her revenge. Indigenous people won’t die alone.”⁣⁣
- Davi Kopenawa⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
Reposted from @xr_youth partnered with @flourishdiverse⁣⁣ ⁣⁣
#Indigenous #ClimateJustice #ExtinctionOrRebellion.

Title: NA
Description:
BREAKING: Watch Hollywood ecological activists including #JoaquinPhoenix, Rosario Dawson, Matthew Modine, Q’orianka Kilcher, Oona Chaplin, Adria Arjona, and Albert Hammond Jr. of The Strokes, in a film that encourages everyone to #ActNow for climate and ecological justice. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
@mobilize.earth has partnered with #ExtinctionRebellion and @amazonwatch to set out on a new course to mitigate the climate and ecological emergency by bringing together people from all walks of life. We are working to mobilize everyone - industry, activists, politicians, farmers, immigrants - to respond to the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We work to:⁣⁣
- Tell the truth about the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣
- Engage and connect individuals and organizations across industries, cultures and political divides and work towards tangible responses to the climate and ecological emergency.⁣⁣
- Design a future in which we can all thrive by working with leaders, scientists, entrepreneurs and activists.⁣⁣
We are now in a fight for all life on our planet. No one is prepared to face this alone and no one should. Join Mobilize Earth and become part of something bigger. This fight needs you.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Click link in bio to see what you can do
www.mobilize.earth
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #GuardiansOfLife

Title: NA
Description:
A recent report has found that the world’s  consumption of materials has hit a record 100billion tonnes a year, according to @guardian ⁣
⁣
“The climate and [ecological] emergencies are driven by the unsustainable extraction of fossil fuels, metals, building materials and trees. The report’s authors warn that treating the world’s resources as limitless is leading towards global disaster.⁣
⁣
The materials used by the global economy have quadrupled since 1970, far faster than the population, which has doubled. In the last two years, consumption has jumped by more than 8% but the reuse of resources has fallen from 9.1% to 8.6%.” ⁣
⁣
It is Western societies who are mostly responsible for human-influenced climate change, due to overconsumption — yet, geographical positioning and infrastructure put the Global South at higher risk of extreme weather events, extreme heating and droughts. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The world’s wealthiest nations need to live up to their responsibility and #ActNow on the crisis that they have created. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#PlanetaryEmergency #ClimateJustice ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Sources: @guardian and ‘On Fire: The Burning Case For a Green New Deal’ by #NaomiKlein
Image Text: We consume a record 100bn tonnes of materials a year.

⁣
⁣
“Caring for myself is not self-indulgence, it is self-preservation, and that is an act of political warfare”.⁣⁣
– Audre Lorde⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
#RegenerativeCulture is a broad term, but basically it means: to be nice to yourself, those around you and the Earth.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
The need for regenerative culture is one of the #ExtinctionRebellion 10 Values and Principles; to create a culture which is healthy, resilient and adaptable.⁣ ⁣⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Many scientists believe that we are currently in the midst of the Sixth Mass Extinction – losing up to 200 species per day. ⁣
⁣
The previous mass extinction happened around 65 million years ago when a suspected asteroid hit Earth and wiped out 75% of its species. ⁣
⁣
However, the mass extinction we are facing today is a direct consequence of human activity. ⁣
⁣
Join #ExtinctionRebellion today to demand urgent action from our global governments. Check out our “JOIN US” highlight to find out how. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #SixthMassExtinction⁣
⁣
Reposted graphic from @xrtasmania

Privileged politicians simply cannot relate to our struggles which is why they refuse to acknowledge this issues existence. I joined the movement because I was sick of not being acknowledged and fully ready to make some noise.”⁣

Just because they were born with a silver spoon in their mouths they think they know it all. They don’t want us to be out here because we’re making too much noise. They don’t want us to be out here because they think that we don’t own these streets. But this is not the Police’s street. It’s not the Government’s street. It’s our street.”⁣

Title: NA
Description:
“Oxygen in the oceans is being lost at an unprecedented rate, with “dead zones” proliferating and hundreds more areas showing oxygen dangerously depleted, as a result of the climate emergency and intensive farming, experts have warned.⁣ ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣
Low oxygen levels are also associated with global heating, because the warmer water holds less oxygen.⁣ ⁣
⁣
⁣
When excess artificial fertiliser from crops, or manure from the meat industry, runs off the land and into rivers and seas, it feeds algae which bloom and then cause oxygen depletion as they decompose.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The problem of dead zones has been known about for decades, but little has been done to tackle it. Farmers rarely bear the brunt of the damage, which mainly affects fishing fleets and coastal areas. A few years ago, the meat industry in the US was found to be responsible for a massive dead zone measuring more than 8,000 sq miles in the Gulf of Mexico.”⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Taken from @guardian⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Source: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/dec/07/oceans-losing-oxygen-at-unprecedented-rate-experts-warn⁣⁣
⁣
Image Text: OCEANS ARE LOSING OXYGEN AT AN UNPRECEDENTED RATE

Title: NA
Description:
#RebelsWithoutBorders have arrived in Davos for the World Economic Forum (#WEF), where @gretathunberg and @autumn.peltier have addressed attendees, along with other extraordinary, teenage change-makers from around the world.⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Around 30,000 business leaders, international political leaders, economists and celebrities have gathered to discuss global issues – allegedly “committed to improving the state of the world”. However, just 100 companies, all of whom belong to the #WEF are responsible for 71% of global emissions since 1988.*⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
After a 50km, 3-day hike through the Swiss alps – rebels have arrived at the forum with a clear message for attendees: NO MORE BUSINESS AS USUAL⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#TheTimeIsNow #WorldEconomicFailure⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣
*Source: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2017/jul/10/100-fossil-fuel-companies-investors-responsible-71-global-emissions-cdp-study-climate-change

Title: NA
Description:
“As fires continue to strike the east coast of our sacred land, we’ve lost incredible amounts of flora and fauna, and the air is blanketed in an intense smoke that washes over the cities. The indigenous people remain some of those most significant affected by this ongoing disaster.⁣
⁣
I come from the Yorta Yorta people, an Indigenous tribe based two hours north of the city currently known as Melbourne, a colonial land. ⁣
⁣
The Indigenous people affected by these fires live many hours away from the cities. These are their custodial lands, which they’ve inhabited for 80,000 years. Indigenous people have an incredibly powerful physical and spiritual connection to the land, which has perished at the hands of mistreatment and neglect. It’s likely that First Nations people will be left out of the recovery process entirely, leaving many of these communities – who haven’t moved since colonisation – to flee to cities like Melbourne and Sydney. The direction of their lives will change forever, and their mental, social, and spiritual health will inevitably decline.”⁣
⁣
Words by @drmngnow written for @dazed (find the full article in our story)⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion stand in solidarity with all the Indigenous communities of Australia who have been affected by the fires.

The wealthiest 10% of the global population produce half of the planets individual-consumption-based emissions.⁣

⁣
Western societies are mostly responsible for human-influenced climate change, due to overconsumption — yet, geographical positioning and infrastructure put the Global South at higher risk of extreme weather events, extreme heating and droughts. ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
HUMANS OF XR | “I first began striking for the climate on the 15th of March, during one of the first international strikes. I felt one strike was not enough and wanted to keep going every Friday, but I began striking without missing my school first, so I began informing my classmates; my journey around Istanbul began during the summer, when Greta said this was something to work for not just at school, but throughout the year. I started to strike alone – even after schools opened –  with a sign that reads ‘Are you aware of the ecological crisis? I can tell you about it if you like.’ People were very keen to talk to me about this subject, so I wanted to expand my horizons by going to a different place each week, and I now strike every Friday reaching out to as many people as I can.”⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Nearly half a billion animals have been impacted by Australia's wildfires in New South Wales alone. Ecologists at the University of Sydney predict millions potentially dead. This figure excludes bats, insects and frogs – meaning the true number is likely to be much higher. According to the researchers, the total number of animals affected nationwide may be as high as a billion.⁣
⁣
Wildfires are not new to Australia, but climate change has resulted in higher intensity and frequency – with wildlife on the frontline. According to @CNN "Australia has the highest rate of species loss of any area in the world, and researchers fear that rate could increase as the fire disaster continues."⁣
⁣
Animals all over the world are in trouble. We are currently experiencing a sixth mass extinction, caused by human overconsumption. Habitat destruction, overhunting and toxic pollution are all contributing to the crisis. Today, species are becoming extinct at a significantly faster rate than over the millions of years before. ⁣
⁣
We need to #ActNow to save our precious wildlife. If not now, when? Head to our stories to join the rebellion today. ⁣
⁣
#AustralianWildfires #ExtinctionOrRebellion #SixthMassExtinction ⁣
⁣
Photos reposted from @extinctionrebellionsydney

Title: NA
Description:
AUSTRALIA IN CRISIS @xrebellionaus ⁣
Bush fires burn across the country. ⁣
⁣
So far, 23 people have died with more deaths predicted. ⁣
⁣
Over 1,300 homes have been destroyed. ⁣
⁣
Over 480 million animals have been killed. ⁣
⁣
Roughly 5.9 million hectares have perished. ⁣
⁣
The climate crisis is not a distant threat. This is happening right now. Urgent action needs to be taken against the climate and ecological emergency to prevent further catastrophe. ⁣
⁣
#TheTimeIsNow #IfNotNowWhen #ActNow⁣
⁣
Photos by @mattabbottphoto @dale_appleton reposted from @xryouthus & @extinctionrebellionsydney

Title: NA
Description:
At least 17 people have died and tens of thousands have been left homeless in Jakarta, due to deadly flash floods. @extinctionrebellion.id  According to The New York Times, the rains are the most intense to strike the Indonesian capital “since record keeping began.”⁣
⁣
40% of Jakarta — the capital of Indonesia situated on the island of Java — is now below sea level.⁣
⁣
Unlike the Netherlands, of which only 50% is more than a foot above sea level, Indonesia hasn't had the opportunity, time or resources — given how the current worldwide financial system operates — to build a complex defence system against storm surges and flooding from heavy rainfall, that are now more intense and recurrent thanks to the #ClimateCrisis. ⁣
⁣
We must #ActNow to urge our governments to take the necessary action⁣
to prevent global temperatures from rising beyond 1.5°C. Too many lives have already been lost. Join #ExtinctionRebellion today to make your voice heard.⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #EverybodyNow⁣
⁣
Photography: AP Photos / Achmad Ibrahim, Dita Alangkara and Tatan Syuflana

Disabled protest is a right. ⁣
⁣
During the October International Rebellion in London XR activists gathered in mass outside Scotland Yard, to protest the actions of police who had seized numerous disabled rebel’s equipment during actions over previous days. This degrading behaviour from the police demonstrated a complete lack of respect for the rights of disabled protesters. ⁣
⁣
It is crucial that the journey to #ClimateJustice is intersectional and inclusive in order to build a fairer, greener future for all. Extinction Rebellion welcomes everyone to join us at all of our actions and we are always open to hear your feedback about how we can work to make our organization inclusive and accessible! ⁣

#ExtinctionRebellion #EverybodyNow #ClimateJustice

Title: NA
Description:
This is what the climate crisis looks like. ⁣
⁣
Australia is on fire. Millions of hectares have been burnt, people have died, volunteer firefighters have been killed and injured, huge areas of rainforest and wildlife lost, hundreds of houses demolished, Sydney choked with smoke, ash falling into the sea, temperature records repeatedly broken, towns living through drought… and this is only just the beginning of Summer. ⁣
⁣
Despite the horror unfolding across the country, Prime Minister Scott Morrison is actively working to make Australia one of the world’s leading producers of fossil fuels. ⁣
⁣
Business as usual cannot continue. This is not normal, this is climate change. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #AustraliaWildfires #TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever⁣
⁣
Photo reposted from @nampix via @xrebellionaus

Title: NA
Description:
A Russian youth climate activist has been sentenced to prison for taking part in a demonstration in Moscow. ⁣
⁣
Arshak Makichyan is a part of @FridaysForFuture and has also been striking as an individual. In Russia, mass demonstrations without permission are illegal - however, the law makes it virtually impossible for permission to be granted. ⁣
⁣
Arshak’s prison sentence is a disproportionate punishment for peaceful protest. In many places around the world, Earth’s defenders are being punished and even killed. The right to defend our planet is a human right. ⁣
⁣
#LetRussiaStrikeForClimate

Title: NA
Description:
ENVIRONMENTAL DEFENDERS ALIVE AND FREE!⁣
⁣
The blood of murdered environmental leaders in Latin America are the seeds for a generation that is rebelling for life!⁣
⁣
This piece of activism was created to show respect for the environmental defenders murdered and persecuted in this decade, such us Paulo Guajajara (2019) and Berta Cáceres (2016) that were honored in this creation and will be always remembered. ⁣
⁣
Paulo was the first of this new wave of killings of indigenous people in Maranhão (Brasil) this year. A year marked by Ecocide in Brazil (Amazon fires, oil in the beaches, Brumadinho …) The community of life calls for help.⁣
⁣
Did you know that Brazil is one of the countries that killed more environmental activists in the world in the last few years?⁣
⁣
The defense of the community of life must be considered a human right, and today environmental activists do not have the proper legal instruments to preserve their integrity.⁣
⁣
What we are experiencing in Brazil today, and the case of Alter do Chão brigade members accused and arbitrarily arrested, shows us how the defenders are paying with their lives, their freedom and their rights. These are not only crimes against democracy, but also crimes against peace. All these crimes are connected.⁣
⁣
REBEL FOR LIFE!⁣
⁣
One community of life, one common destiny.⁣
⁣
⁣
Author and co-creative facilitation: Pedro Cunha LiveTodayArtivism. @pedrocunha.eco⁣
⁣
In cooperation with: LACEMOS, Extinction Rebellion, UNOY Peacebuilders⁣
⁣
#rebeldepelavida #rebelforlife #lideresvivos  #ExtinctionRebellion

⁣
The #GlobalHungerStrike has seen over 400 strikers from all over the world take part to highlight the food vulnerability caused by the Climate & Ecological Emergency and in solidarity with those already suffering. ⁣
⁣
For millions of people, hunger striking is not an option. Food is scarce for those living in vulnerable areas, due to extreme heat, drought, soil erosion and other contributing factors. ⁣
⁣
Elsewhere in the world hunger strikers are still on strike outside the UK government buildings and Shadi Sror in Israel has passed day 20.⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Scientists have called for immediate action after warning that we may have already crossed a series of climate tipping points, presenting “an existential threat to civilisation.” ⁣
⁣
A tipping point is reached when the consequences of global warming are no longer able to be stopped. It was originally thought that extreme temperature increases of 5°C would take us past these tipping points, however new research has shown that this could happen between 1°C and 2°C of warming. ⁣
⁣
We have already risen temperatures beyond 1°C and are currently on track to rise beyond 2°C. ⁣
⁣
The consequences of this warming will most significantly effect those who have contributed the least carbon emissions. The wealthiest 10% of the global population produce half of the planet's individual-consumption-based fossil fuel emissions. In contrast, the poorest 50% of the global population are responsible for only 10%. This is why we must campaign for change.⁣
⁣
Check out our JOIN US story highlight to find out how you can get involved in the fight for #ClimateJustice⁣
⁣
Source: The Guardian ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #ActNow #RebelForLife
Image Text: Earth may have already reached several climate tipping points

Title: NA
Description:
Yesterday marked the first day of #COP25 in Madrid, where 25,000 participants have arrived in the Spanish capital. ⁣
⁣
The UN climate talks began with opening statements from leading political figures including UN Secretary General, Antonio Guterres, and the Spanish Prime Minister, Pedro Sánchez.⁣
⁣
The aim of COP25 is to decide the rules of the Paris Agreement – agreeing how carbon markets will be governed, with the aim of transitioning to a zero-carbon economy. There will also be discussions about how to compensate poorer countries who will have to deal with the harshest impacts of the crisis. ⁣
⁣
@esxrebellion and supporters from abroad, will be on the ground in Madrid to demand that urgent action is taken to address the emergency. ⁣
⁣
#UltimatumCop25 #ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #EverybodyNow

The Amazon is still burning, the Pantanal and Cerrado are up in flames, Indigenous leaders being murdered. Now, the global community need to step up the pressure to force the president to act on this crisis. ⁣⁣

WHAT CAN YOU DO? ⁣⁣

Title: NA
Description:
We are asking you to join us, in a planetary rebellion of non-violent direct action and civil disobedience.⁣
_____________________⁣
⁣
WHAT ARE OUR DEMANDS?⁣
⁣
1) TELL THE TRUTH⁣
Global governments must tell the truth by declaring climate and ecological emergencies, working with other institutions to communicate the urgency of change and instruct the public about the necessary changes.⁣
⁣
2) MAKE NECESSARY CHANGES⁣
Governments must enact legally binding policies to quickly stop biodiversity loss, reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero, make ecocide a crime against humanity and begin emergency planetary repair programs.⁣
⁣
3) FORM CITIZENS ASSEMBLIES Governments must create and be guided by legally binding decisions of citizen assemblies on climate, ecological and inter-generational justice.⁣
_____________________⁣
⁣
Citizens of Colombia have been on #NationalStrike for 9 days; their demands to the government of Colombia have been manifested and heard, however @xr_bogota_ still joined the #GlobalClimateStrike to demand that the necessary action is taken.⁣
⁣
Governments around the world have declared a "Climate and Ecological Emergency", but so far nothing has been done. We must ensure that these words are meaningful and that governments make the necessary policy changes. ⁣
⁣
#COP25 ⁣
#UltimatumCOP25⁣
#JusticiaSocial #JusticiaGlobal #RebelionGlobal #MovimeintoDeMovimientos #RebelionContraLaExtincion #ExtinctionRebellion

Title: NA
Description:
Gideon Mendel's images force us to confront the real-life consequences of the climate and ecological emergency – real people, real homes... ⁣
⁣
Millions of people around the world are already suffering, and if we don’t act now, this will only get worse. ⁣
⁣
If not you, who? If not now, when? ⁣
⁣
Join us on Friday, as we take to the streets for the #GlobalClimateStrike – to demand action from global governments, we need #EverybodyNow ⁣
⁣
Check out our “Up Next” story highlight to find out how you can get involved. ⁣
______________________________⁣
⁣
Words from the photographer @gideonmendel ⁣
"Drowning World is an exploration of flooding using photography and video. My aim in this long-term project is to portray the human condition within the context of overwhelming climate events around the world. The subject matter has fundamentally challenged my practice: over the years there has been a shift from a traditional documentary approach to one that incorporates more conceptual and metaphorical elements alongside a deepening activism.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
In 2007 I photographed two floods that occurred within weeks of each other, one in the UK and the other in India. I was struck by the contrasting impacts of these floods, and the shared vulnerability that seemed to unite the people I encountered in this landscape.⁣ Since then, I have endeavored to visit flood zones around the world, witnessing a shared human experience of catastrophe that transcends geographical, cultural and economic divides.”⁣
⁣
The project now incorporates the UK (2007, 2014 and 2016), India (2007 and 2014), Haiti (2008), Pakistan (2010), Australia (2011), Thailand (2011), Nigeria (2012), Germany (2013), The Philippines (2013), Brazil (2015), Bangladesh (2015), the USA (2015, 2017 and 2018), and France (2016 and 2018).⁣⁣
⁣
#RebelforLife #ActNow #ClimateEmergency #climatechange #EcologicalEmergency #extinctionrebellion #rebelforlife ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
We are facing a climate and ecological #PlanetaryEmergency that threatens the future of all life on Earth. ⁣
⁣
We know that fossil fuels are one of the main contributors to the problem however, global production of oil, coal and gas continue to rise. ⁣
⁣
According to UN Environment, we are currently on track to produce more then twice the amount of fossil fuels by 2030, then recommended to keep global warming beyond 1.5°C. ⁣
⁣
Temperature rises beyond this limit will take us into unprecedented territory. We must #ActNow to demand that the global governments take action against the fossil fuel companies; for too long politics has been wrapped up in corporate interests that put profit before people and planet. ⁣
⁣
On Friday we take to the streets for the #GlobalClimateStrike Check out our “Up Next” story highlight to find out how you can get involved. ⁣
⁣
Source: @climatehomenews ⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #EverybodyNow #TheTimeIsNow

Title: NA
Description:
Hundreds of students and alumni from Yale & Harvard stormed the football field to disrupt the #HarvardYale game, calling for climate justice and divestment.⁣
⁣
A number of organisations are acting together to spread the message that #NobodyWins when our universities invest their combined $70 billion endowments in fossil fuels and Puerto Rican debt holdings. Students refuse to be complicit in these actions and ask their institutions to be leaders in the climate justice movement. ⁣
⁣
Fans flooded the field to join the protest, creating a crowd too large for the police to obstruct. ⁣
⁣
This is the first time in history that students have disrupted a major sporting event for fossil fuel divestment. ⁣
⁣
📍On Friday 29th November, school strikers and their supporters will be taking to the streets again. Will you be joining them? Find out how to get involved ⁣by checking out our “Up Next” story highlight.⁣

Description:
Yesterday, hundreds of thousands of Colombians took to the streets to demand better living conditions, food sovereignty, protection of their rivers, mountains, paramos and oceans, and access to public education.⁣
⁣
Colombia was 2018’s most deadly country for earth defenders. Over 170 social and environmental leaders have been murdered in 2019 so far, and 136 indigenous people have been murdered under Ivan Duque’s current administration.⁣
⁣
The second most biodiverse country in the world, Colombia’s ecosystems are being violated by multinational extractivist and food industries.⁣
⁣
As thousands of Colombians take to the streets to demand better conditions for their lives and environment, we invite you to act in solidarity by sharing the information (you can find a link to share in our insta-story.)⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Police have arrested 9 hunger strikers in Washington @extinctionrebelliondc who were occupying the office of @speakerpelosi to ask that she would meet with them to discuss the climate and ecological emergency. ⁣
⁣
Pelosi has acknowledged that “we must face the existential threat of our time,” but she has failed to introduce the climate emergency resolution. Time is running out, global governments need to act now. ⁣
⁣
Today, more than 400 people from 27 countries are on day 5 of the #GlobalHungerStrike⁣
⁣⁣
This is a drastic and desperate action which aims to highlight the devastating impact that the climate and ecological emergency is already having on global food supplies, particularly affecting countries in the Global South where there is higher risk of drought. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The hunger strikers are employing this last resort tactic after more than three decades of petitions, protests and campaigns have failed to secure the urgently needed responses to mitigate ecological and climate breakdown. By denying themselves their basic needs, the hunger strikers hope that their bodies will sound the alarm. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Time has almost run out to address the ecological crisis, unless rapid action is taken now...⁣⁣
⁣⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO? ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
1️⃣ Support our strikers by donating to Extinction Rebellion. You can find the link in our stories if you wish to do so. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
2️⃣ Spread the word - over the next few weeks, we’ll be sharing stories of the hunger striker’s journeys. Please share their stories to help draw attention to the cause. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
3️⃣ Join the #GlobalClimateStrike on the 29th November and the 6th of December. Email your local XR group to find out how to get involved (find them in our “JOIN US” story highlight.) ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExinctionRebellion #HumansofXR #RebelForLife #ActNow #HungerStrike⁣ #PlaneteryEmergency ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
**We do not advise taking part in a hunger strike without the support and monitoring of an organisation and medical professional.**

Title: NA
Description:
Today Australia is experiencing record temperatures and dangerous bushfire conditions across six states. Such conditions are the result of greenhouse gas emissions. ⁣
⁣
Entire koala colonies have been burnt. More than a million hectares has burnt in NSW alone; fires killing and displacing countless animals and destroying habitats. ⁣
⁣
Bushfires have destroyed 612 homes so far this season in NSW. Six people have died. More than 50 fires are still burning, Sydney is clogged with smoke. ⁣
⁣
In Victoria, more than 2000 firefighters have been fighting raging fires. ⁣
⁣
Catastrophic fires in South Australia; 33 people injured and 11 properties damaged. ⁣
⁣
67 fires are burning out of control in Queensland. ⁣
⁣
...we all know this is not normal. This is a #PlanetaryEmergency This isn’t just happening in Australia; it’s also happening across Africa, Asia, America and Latin America. ⁣
⁣
There is still time to act, but we must #ActNow⁣
⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🌎 Think global, act local...⁣⁣⁣
Get in touch with your local XR group today to get involved with actions. Joining your local group is a great way to meet like-minded people and find out about actions and events to get involved in. You can find your local group by checking out our "join us" story highlight. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
📆 Join the #GlobalClimateStrike⁣⁣⁣
Taking place on Friday 29th November and Friday 6th December. Keep your eye on our Instagram for more information and follow the organisers, @FridaysForFuture⁣⁣⁣
We need #EverybodyNow to take to the streets. If not you, who? If not now, when?⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
💚 Spread the love...⁣⁣⁣
The most impactful thing you can do is take to the streets, but sadly this just isn't an option for everybody. If you can't join us in person, share the message on all your social media platforms and encourage other people you know to join. You can also help fund the rebellion through donations (you can find the link in our insta-stories.) ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Photograph reposted from @xrebellionaus

Title: NA
Description:
A group of 36 activists recently began their journey to sail from Europe, across the Atlantic, to Chile for #COP25 - to raise their concerns about the negative impact of air travel on our planet. Through their media campaign, @SailToTheCOP are campaigning for policy change to make it easier, more affordable and more attractive to choose sustainable travel options like going by train, bus and bike.⁣
⁣
Now that the Climate conference has been moved to Madrid, they are calling for all COP participants to #RailToTheCop⁣
⁣
1️⃣ Can you make it to Madrid, from 2nd - 13th December, by rail or road? @esxrebellion are inviting international rebels to join them for the conference, to turn up the pressure and demand urgent action. ⁣2️⃣ Can’t make it to Madrid? Follow the link in bio on @sailtothecop to find information about how you can contact your countries representatives and ask them to choose a more environmentally friendly transport option to the COP
⁣
#ClimateEmergency #EcologicalBreakdown #TheTimeIsNow #ExtinctionOrRebellion #EverybodyNow

The next #GlobalClimateStrike will be happening on Friday 29th November and Friday 6th December. ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Yesterday, more than 400 people from 27 countries, began a #GlobalHungerStrike to demand that global governments take immediate action on the #ClimateAndEcologicalEmergency ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
This is a drastic and desperate action which aims to highlight the devastating impact that the climate and ecological emergency is already having on global food supplies, particularly affecting countries in the Global South where there is higher risk of drought. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The hunger strikers are employing this last resort tactic after more than three decades of petitions, protests and campaigns have failed to secure the urgently needed responses to mitigate ecological and climate breakdown. By denying themselves their basic needs, the hunger strikers hope that their bodies will sound the alarm. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Time has almost run out to address the ecological crisis, unless rapid action is taken now...⁣⁣
⁣⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO? ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
1️⃣ Support our strikers by donating to Extinction Rebellion. You can find the link in our stories if you wish to do so. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
2️⃣ Spread the word - over the next few weeks, we’ll be sharing stories of the hunger striker’s journeys. Please share their stories to help draw attention to the cause. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
3️⃣ Join the #GlobalClimateStrike on the 29th November and the 6th of December. Email your local XR group to find out how to get involved (find them in our “JOIN US” story highlight.) ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExinctionRebellion #HumansofXR #RebelForLife #ActNow #HungerStrike⁣ #PlaneteryEmergency ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
**We do not advise taking part in a hunger strike without the support and monitoring of an organisation and medical professional.**

Title: NA
Description:
The Italian city of Venice has experienced the worst week of flooding in its history. Two people have been reported dead, and officials have declared a state of emergency in the area. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Shocking events such as this one, seem to be becoming the new normal all over the world. In Venice alone, St Mark’s Square now floods more than 60 times a year – up from four times a year in 1900. Some experts predict that Venice will be completely gone by the year 2100 due to rising sea levels and land subsidence (the sinking of Earth's surface caused by the removal of materials below the surface.)⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We must #ActNow to put pressure on global governments and demand that the take the action to fight this #PlanetaryEmergency. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🌎 Think global, act local...⁣⁣
Get in touch with your local XR group today to get involved with actions. Joining your local group is a great way to meet like-minded people and find out about actions and events to get involved in. You can find your local group by checking out our "join us" story highlight. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
📆 Join the #GlobalClimateStrike⁣⁣
Taking place on Friday 29th November and Friday 6th December. Keep your eye on our Instagram for more information and follow the organisers, @FridaysForFuture⁣⁣
We need #EverybodyNow to take to the streets. If not you, who? If not now, when?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
💚 Spread the love...⁣⁣
The most impactful thing you can do is take to the streets, but sadly this just isn't an option for everybody. If you can't join us in person, share the message on all your social media platforms and encourage other people you know to join. You can also help fund the rebellion through donations (you can find the link in our insta-stories.) ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Photographs by Mirco Toniolo for @guardian via @xryouthus | Source: The Conversation

Title: NA
Description:
Indigenous leaders from Brazil have been touring Europe with the message, “Indigenous Blood: Not A Single Drop More.”⁣
⁣
During the @apiboficial visit to London Extinction Rebellion, amongst other environmental and human rights organisations, have been supporting their cause by holding a number of actions in the city. ⁣
⁣
Yesterday, Extinction Rebellion activists gathered outside the Brazillian Embassy to remember Amazon Guardian, Paulo Paulino Guajajara, who was recently assassinated in an ambush by loggers. Sadly, Paulo Paulino Guajajara is one of many Indigenous people, killed in the pursuit of corporate greed and environmental destruction. These are the people on the frontline of the climate and ecological crisis. ⁣
⁣
Today, protesters gathered outside the London Black Rock headquarters, an investment management company who explicitly fund and profit from the exploitation of the Amazon, and are therefore accountable for the human rights abuses that Indigenous peoples face.⁣
⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣
⁣
It’s time for economic disruption of the industries ravaging Latin America. Join #BoycottForAmazonia for at least 1 year…⁣
⁣
Starting from the 1st of December, we are asking people to boycott products and services originating from conflict, deforestation and fire areas. These products are especially beef, leather, soy, timber, sugar, gold and palm oil. ⁣
⁣
Check out our insta-story and join our Facebook event for more details (including an explicit list of specific companies to boycott – coming soon!)⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ActNow #ActForAmazonia #NotASingleDropMore #EverybodyNow⁣
⁣
Photos by Anna Sherwin

Title: NA
Description:
The world’s youth are fighting for their future. On Friday November 29th, children and young people all over the world will walk out for the #GlobalClimateStrike⁣
⁣
We cannot leave the youth to fight this battle alone. We stand alongside the youth because they are the ones who will experience a future of further climate breakdown, ecological collapse and biodiversity loss. ⁣
⁣
Devastating consequences of the emergency are already happening across the globe, if we don’t #ActNow it will be too late. ⁣
⁣
We need #EverybodyNow ⁣
Will you stand with us?⁣
⁣
Here are 3 things you can do right now to start your activism journey... ⁣
⁣
1. Add November 29th to your diary - the next date for the #GlobalClimateStrike with @FridaysForFuture and @YouthStrikeForClimate (Use the template in our insta-story to write to your employer about why you should join the strike.) ⁣
2. Check out our “Join Us” story highlight to find your local XR group and email them to find out when they will be meeting and what they have planned for the #GlobalClimateStrike⁣
3. Introduce your friends to Extinction Rebellion - share a post or story to encourage other people to join us. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #TheTimeIsNow⁣
⁣
Photos by @Taltakingpics⁣ @e.llaphillips @simonebirdy @thelightscaper @adrift.us

Title: NA
Description:
Science tells us that the climate and ecological crisis means longer and more intense fire seasons. Changes to temperature and soil moisture can make wildfires spread faster and become even more difficult to put out. These are images of the fires that are burning across eastern Australia right now. ⁣
⁣
Due to global warming, fire season is becoming more intense and arriving earlier each year – Summer in Australia is yet to begin, but already lives have been taken and at least 150 homes have been destroyed due to bush fires. ⁣
⁣
There are fears that the death toll will rise as emergency services are able to access impacted areas. In addition to human lives, countless animal lives have also been taken and their habitats destroyed.⁣
⁣
All across the world, our house is on fire. The resources of firefighters and emergency workers are already stretched. We need to make a drastic global effort to urgently reduce greenhouse gas emissions and aim to keep global temperatures below 1.5°C of warming. We need to act now before it’s too late. ⁣
⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO?⁣
⁣
🗓 29th November - Save the date and join the next #GlobalClimateStrike follow @fridaysforfuture to find out how to get involved. ⁣
⁣
📧 Email your local XR group to find out what events they have planned in your local area. You can find out how to get in touch with them by checking out our JOIN US story highlight. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #EverybodyNow #PlanetaryEmergency #Wildfires #OurLungsAreOnFire⁣
⁣
Photo 1 by @stoll_photography reposted from @xrebellionaus⁣
Photo 2 reposted from @xr_youth_aus⁣

Title: NA
Description:
This morning, Extinction Rebellion activists staged an action on the river Thames in London. @xrebellionuk A classic suburban house was seen floating down the river, sinking into the water in yet another attempt to send an SOS to the government on climate inaction and draw attention to the threat humans face from climate change and rising sea levels. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The ongoing flood disaster in Derbyshire and Yorkshire has so starkly illustrated, our homes, businesses and families are at very real risk. We are watching, in real-time, as people’s lives are destroyed around the world and in the UK. Unless action is taken to halt biodiversity loss and reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero these tragedies are set to worsen. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Scientific predictions of rising sea levels by 2100 range from less than 1 metre to as high as 5. The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) suggest a rise of less than 2 metres, but past assessments have almost always underestimated the pace of climate change. The rate of melting Greenland ice sheets recorded this summer was not predicted until 2070. At its peak, this ice was melting at a rate of 140,000 tonnes per second – a total figure equivalent to 200 river Thames.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The UK Prime Minister does not consider widespread flooding across the UK to be a national emergency. Extinction Rebellion disagrees. Many people in the UK, like many others around the world before them, have had life-changing experiences this week. We stand in solidarity with all of those who have lost their homes and livelihoods and will continue to demand action until the severity of this global emergency is realised.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Created by Katey Burak and Rob Higgs⁣⁣
Photography by Zoe Broughton ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #ExtinctionRebellion #EverybodyNow #SeaLevelRises #ThisIsAnEmergency #Flooding

Title: NA
Description:
Indigenous leaders from across Brazil (APIB) are in Europe to denounce the governments war against their people and the environment. ⁣
⁣
The ‘Indigenous Blood: Not A Single Drop More’ delegation are visiting 18 cities in 12 countries, over 35 days. They are raising awareness of President Bolsonaro’s violation of Indigenous rights and strengthening international support for the protection of their lands and lives. ⁣
⁣
“The importance of bringing our voice to this side of the world is to pass on some of the history of the suffering we endured over the last 519 years —which is now deteriorating further, with the legalisation of environmental crime and human rights crimes, by the current government that does not respect anything.” - Alberto Terena⁣
⁣
Follow APIB and the individual leaders on Instagram, for updates on their tour (tags in image.)⁣
⁣
Photographs from a hearing in Belgium Parliament last week, by @midiainfiaofficial via @amazonwatch ⁣
⁣
#BoycottForAmazonia #NotASingleDropMore #GuardiansOfTheForest

Title: NA
Description:
Over 1500 citizens gathered in at India Gate, in New Dehli, to demand immediate action on the cities hazardous pollution levels.⁣
⁣
According to the World Health Organisation, air pollution in India is estimated to kill about 1.5 million people every year; these statistics make air pollution the fifth-largest killer in India. ⁣
⁣
People of all ages joined the demonstration, which succeeded to directly trigger action for Indian citizens:⁣
1. The Indian Prime Ministers office set up a special panel to address the issue, within a few hours of the protest. The panel is due to report on the issue within 2 weeks.⁣
2. The Supreme Court of India asked the Central Government and respective state governments to fix the crop and waste burning issue of Dehli within a week. ⁣
3. The Center accepted that Green Fund will be used to combat toxic air pollution. ⁣
4. The Indian Prime Minister asked the Agriculture Ministry to distribute equipment urgently so that crop burning is no longer necessary. ⁣
⁣
Despite these promises, the air is still unsafe and activists will keep the pressure on until the air pollution reaches safe levels. ⁣
⁣
The protest was organised by a collaboration of movements; @xrebellionind @LetMeBreathe_In @FridaysForFutureIndia_ along with other activists. ⁣
⁣
Photography by Arjun Mahatta and co, via @FridaysForFuture ⁣
⁣
#RightToBreathe #ExtinctionRebellion #IndiaGate #SolutionNotPollution #ActNow #RebelForLife

Title: NA
Description:
XR BRASIL NEED YOU! ⁣
⁣
Extinction Rebellion Brasil @rebellionextinctionbr are appealing for the global XR communities support, following a devastating oil spill in the largest biodiversity hot spot in the South Atlantic Ocean.⁣
⁣
No companies are yet to claim any responsibility for the incident, however the oil is still coming, and the locals don't have any government help. People are getting sick from cleaning hundreds of kilometres of beaches with their bare hands, and trying to rescue the animals suffocating in oil. ⁣
⁣
There has barely been any international reporting on the incident – XR Brasil are asking for people to contact their regional newspapers and ask them to report on this. The international community need to step up the pressure to force the president to act on this crisis. ⁣
⁣
The Amazon is still burning, the Pantanal and Cerrado are up in flames, Indigenous leaders being murdered, there were two more Guajajara forest guardians killed just this week – and now the coast is covered with oil.⁣
⁣
WHAT CAN YOU DO? ⁣
⁣
It's time for economic disruption of the industries ravaging Latin America. Join #BoycottForAmazonia for 1 year...⁣
⁣
Starting from the 1st of December, we are asking people to boycott products and services originating from conflict, deforestation and fire areas; these are especially beef, leather, soy, timber, sugar, gold and palm oil.⁣
⁣
Check out our story for more details. ⁣
⁣
It’s time to #ActNow⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #BoycottForAmazonia #ActForAmazonia #RebelForLife #EverybodyNow

Description:

⁣
Where are your plans for the Climate and Ecological Emergency?⁣
⁣
Scientists have warned that we have just over a decade to dramatically cut global emissions, to avoid global warming beyond 1.5°C.⁣

#WhereIsYourPlan? ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Yesterday marked one year since @xrebellionUK declared rebellion against the UK government. In the ‘Declaration of Rebellion’ delivered to the Houses of Parliament, XR promised to continue acts of peaceful civil-disobedience until the government meet our demands. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The demands are: ⁣⁣ 1) #TellTheTruth⁣⁣
Governments must tell the truth by declaring planetwide climate and ecological emergencies, working with other institutions, including but not limited to the media and education sectors, to communicate the urgency for change, and educate the public on the changes required, effectively acting in accordance to the truth. ⁣
 2) #ActNow⁣⁣
Governments must enact legally-binding policies and regulations to rapidly halt biodiversity loss, reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero, make ecocide a crime against humanity, and commence emergency programmes of planetary repair.⁣ ⁣
⁣
3) #CitizensAssembly⁣⁣
Governments must create and be led by legally binding decisions of Citizens’ Assemblies on climate, ecological and intergenerational global justice, for the above demands, including timelines for solutions and concrete plans of action, but not limited to the above demands.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Over the past year, countries all over the world have organised their own rebellions, adjusting the demands where necessary to compliment their own political system. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We have seen hundreds of actions across the globe as well as two Worldwide Rebellions... and we’ve only just started. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We are a global movement fighting for climate justice. To win, we need #EverybodyNow⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Check out our JOIN US story to find your local XR group and contact them today, to find out how you can get involved. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Extinction Rebellion always hold our hands up and take responsibility for our actions. It is time our governments did too. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
We all have blood on our hands for the part that we play in the climate and ecological emergency. We don’t yet live in the decarbonised world that we are all fighting so fiercely in pursuit of.  We are all hypocrites, and unwillingly part of this destructive and unjust system. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Millions of people around the world are already suffering the consequences of climate and ecological collapse – and this is just the beginning.  We need to create the biggest movement there has ever been, to confront the biggest crisis humanity will ever face. We need all the hypocrites we can get. We need #EverybodyNow ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Visit our “JOIN US” story highlight to find out how to get involved today. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
#TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever #ExtinctionRebellion #RebelForLife #TellTheTruth⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Pictures @taltakingpics

Title: NA
Description:
The clock is ticking. ⁣
⁣
We have just over a decade to lower carbon emissions in line with what scientists are telling us, to have any chance of minimising climate and ecological catastrophe. If we do not act now, the consequences will be devastating. ⁣
⁣
There are already people suffering at the hands of this crisis, particularly in the Global South; extreme temperatures, flooding, drought and crop failures are becoming much more frequent events. If we don't act now, this situation will only get much worse.⁣
⁣
Scientists and Indigenous communities have been warning us about the consequences of our actions for a long time, but global governments and corporations have refused to listen. Instead, they have continued to destroy our planet and put millions of lives at risk in pursuit of profit. ⁣
⁣
We must stand together beyond borders, and demand that our governments tell the truth and act now on this crisis.⁣
⁣
Join us in the fight for climate justice. Visit our story highlights to find out how you can get involved today.⁣
⁣
The time is now. Extinction or rebellion?⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #EverybodyNow #ActNow #TheClockIsTicking #TikTok #RebelForLife⁣
⁣
Video by @hillmark

Title: NA
Description:
The world's largest oil and gas companies all knew exactly what would happen, as a result of extracting and burning fossil fuels. ⁣
⁣
Exxon Mobil's scientific studies from 1982 contain startlingly accurate projections of carbon dioxide levels reaching dangerously high limits and global temperatures increasing an average of 1°C warming by 2019.⁣
⁣
Back then, they knew what would happen, and they didn't care. Today they know what's coming, yet they still don't care. ⁣
⁣
Governments worldwide not only allow these companies to continue exploiting people and planet for profit, but they also offer them subsidies, persecute those who oppose them and dismantle legislation against them.⁣ ⁣
This has to stop. Things need to change. ⁣
⁣
Visit our story-highlights to find out how you can get involved in the fight for climate justice. Find and join your local XR group today. It's time to #ActNow⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionOrRebellion #ClimateJustice #ClimateAndEcologicalCrisis #RebelForLife #NoFutureInFossilFuels

Title: NA
Description:
This is what the climate crisis looks like. ⁣
⁣
The Kincade fire is burning across California. Residents have been using the world “apocalypse” to describe the raging fires, evacuation orders, forced power outages and terrible air conditions. ⁣
⁣
To the North, the Kincade fire spread across Sonoma county, where around 180,000 people have been evacuated. ⁣
⁣
Thousands of fire fighters are battling against the raging forest fires, but the fire has already burned an area twice the size of the city of San Francisco, destroying nearly 100 buildings. ⁣
⁣
In many continents across the world, communities are suffering the consequences of human-made climate change. Catastrophic weather events, forest fires, droughts and flooding are becoming more frequent; this year alone, we have seen devastating impacts across Asia, Latin America, Africa and the Arctic. ⁣
⁣
So many people are already suffering because of this crisis. If global governments don’t act now, these devastating events will only happen much more frequently. That is why we need #EverybodyNow to demand action; we need our governments to admit that we cannot continue with business as usual.⁣
⁣
Check out our Instagram story highlights to learn about what we do and how you can’t get involved. Join us, and hundreds of other activists around the world, in the fight for climate and ecological justice. ⁣
⁣
Information and images from the @nytimes via @xryouthus ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ClimateandEcologicalCrisis #ClimateBreakdown #CaliforniaWildfires #KincadeFire #ClimateJustice

Title: NA
Description:
Frontline defenders are risking their lives to protect forests, land and water. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Last week, defenders united in the heart of the struggle, Pará Amazonia, to share their stories and strategies. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
15 countries represented.⁣⁣
10 Indigenous Peoples and Quilombolas.⁣⁣
30 Social Movements and Organisations.⁣⁣
150 Participants.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The 3rd International Forest Defenders Conference refuses to abide by the borders put in place to divide us.⁣ We are in the fight for Climate Justice together and we need #EverybodyNow to play their part.⁣
⁣⁣
#FrontlineDefenders #ClimateJustice #ClimateJusticeNow #actforamazonia

Title: NA
Description:
“I am carrying a lulav. It’s very ancient symbolism from the Bible which says that on this festival you should take hold of beautiful fruits and leafy boughs and palms, and celebrate for seven days with them. It’s a festival of rejoicing. ⁣
Extinction Rebellion is about getting back to Earth, and usually Jewish people see themselves as urban people. It’s a thanksgiving and an end to the harvest. You shake the lulav and the etrog fruit together, to symbolise that the world is made up of all sorts of different people and you need them to combine. You shake them north, east, south and west, heaven and Earth.”⁣
⁣
Rabbi Jeffrey Newman was arrested in London during the #WorldwideRebellion, protesting for climate justice. He has been working with the Earth Charter for 20 years and joined XR last November and is now a part of #XRJews ⁣
⁣
Photography by @HelenaSmithPix and Gareth Fuller ⁣
⁣
@HumansOfXR #HumansOfXR #ExtinctionRebellion #NowOrNever #EverybodyNow

Title: NA
Description:
The climate is changing due to human activity. The richest 10% of the global population have contributed 50% of global carbon emissions – and now the world's poorest peoples are suffering the direct consequences. The system is deeply flawed. ⁣
⁣
The warming of the climate has contributed to ecological breakdown that threatens all life on Earth, and still, our politicians allow business as usual. ⁣
⁣
We are living through a climate, ecological and humanitarian emergency. This is why we must continue to take to the streets and make a stand for climate justice.⁣
⁣
This is a Planetary Emergency. ⁣
⁣
Change politics, not the climate. ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ExtinctionOrRebellion #ActNow #TheTimeIsNow #SystemChange #ClimateJustice #RebelForLife⁣
⁣
*statistics source: Oxfam

Title: NA
Description:
Thousands of you joined us on the streets, all over the world for the October #WorldwideRebellion – we are so grateful to every single one of you for giving your time to join the movement and standing up for climate justice.⁣
⁣
We are Extinction Rebellion and we are demanding that the global governments #TellTheTruth and #ActNow on the climate, ecological and humanitarian emergency. ⁣
⁣
We may be taking some regenerative time after October’s events – but the rebellion isn't over, the movement has only just begun. ⁣
⁣
If you have only just discovered us, please check out our story highlights to find out who we are and how you can get involved. We need #EverybodyNow⁣
⁣
Make your choice. Extinction, or rebellion?⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever #RebelForLife

Content by Matt Shering, @xrebellionuk @xrberlin @climatesavegambia @xrebellionaus

Title: NA
Description:
Hundreds of people gathered at Trafalgar Square in London, despite Metropolitan police suspending the right to protest across the city. @xrebellionuk ⁣
⁣
The right to protest is a human right. We’re in a climate and ecological emergency. If protesting is against the rules, then the rules must be broken.⁣
⁣
We will continue to take to the streets until global governments take sufficient action.⁣

#ExtinctionOrRebellion #ActNow #EverybodyNow #TheTimeIsNow #WeAreTheAlarm ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
Rahajeng Nurrahmani, 25 years old.⁣
⁣
"I was born in a city famous for its forest fire smog. This city is called Pekanbaru, on the island of Sumatra. My journey with smog began since I was just a little kid, and 25 years later, this smog is still happening. Even when I move to Jakarta, my journey with smog hasn't ended. I still suffer from the smogs of fossil fuel combustion. The government has failed me and everyone. So that's why I'm rebelling. To fight for my future and the future of our planet."⁣
⁣
Sign translation: DECLARE CLIMATE EMERGENCY NOW⁣
⁣
#HumansOfXR #WorldwideRebellion⁣
⁣
Photo by @danihuda⁣
⁣
-⁣
⁣
"Saya lahir di satu kota yang dikenal dengan asap kebakaran hutannya. Kota ini adalah kota Pekanbaru di pulau Sumatra. Perjalanan saya dengan asap bermula sejak saya kecil, dan 25 tahun kemudian, asap-asap ini masih ada. Bahkan ketika saya pindah ke Jakarta, perjalanan saya dengan asap masih belum berakhir. Saya masih menderita dari asap-asap pembakaran bahan bakar fosil. Pemerintah telah mengecewakan saya dan semua orang. Itulah alasan saya memberontak. Untuk memperjuangkan masa depan saya dan masa depan planet ini."⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #ActNow #RebelForLife #NowOrNever #EverybodyNow

Title: NA

⁣
This is in direct opposition to the scientific consensus on the climate and ecological crisis. Come and join us!⁣
⁣
#Google stop platforming climate denialism!⁣
⁣
#YouTube show the world the truth!⁣
⁣
How? Don't allow ecocidal fossil fuel polluters and funders of climate and ecological breakdown advertise on your platforms or even be on them!⁣
⁣
Listen to 97% of scientists! The science is CLEAR. ⁣
⁣
Facebook: same to you! Unfriend climate deniers! Oh. And stop banning us and limiting our reach please. We are telling the truth to save your children too!⁣
⁣
#TellTheTruth #TruthNow #FamiliesNow #Xrfamilies #ClimateandEcologicalEmergency #ActNow #ExtinctionRebellion #ExtinctionOrRebellion #ActNow⁣

A community of grandparents gathered outside Buckingham Palace in London yesterday to protest for climate and ecological justice. ⁣

Title: NA
Description:
“I've come down today from hospital, without having told my doctor's, because I think this is important. They might not be able to fix me but we can still save the planet. I grew up in Sri Lanka so I've seen the affects of climate change first hand. The government know what's going on, they've declared a climate emergency but they're not acting on it. So even though it's hard for me to protest and they've taken away all our equipment which means it was so much harder for me to get here, I still have a more of a voice than many people around the world are given and so I am using that."⁣
Katie, 22, @arkatier #HumansOfXR⁣
⁣
Disabled XR rebels protested outside New Scotland Yard in London, against the confiscation of crucial accessibility equipment. This had made their intended protest, a basic human right, impossible. ⁣
⁣
The confiscation made protest inaccessible to disabled and neurodivergent rebels. Anyone standing with the disabled rebels were threatened with arrest on the grounds of assembly. The police refused neutral legal observers access during the arrest of the disabled rebels. Three were arrested in total, including the CEO of Inclusion London, which promotes equality for the deaf and disabled in the city.⁣
⁣
Photos by @taltakingpics ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #TheTimeIsNow #NowOrNever #EverybodyNow #ActNow

Title: NA
Description:
As the worldwide rebellion continues into its second week rebels in Indonesia marched 4KM along the biggest main road in the capital, Jakarta. ⁣

We decided to do it on a Sunday morning, because due to other poltiical unrest (the inauguration of Indonesia’s president second term is on the 20th of october) currently it is very sensitive in here. The police and government have been really cracking down on street protests.⁣
⁣
Unfortunately theres only around 60-75 people who attended due to the fact that, the climate crisis issue have basically never been in the public discussion realm in Indonisia at all, I would say majority of people here dont even know that the Forest Fire in Sumatera and Kalimantan going on right now is even more difficult to contain due to the longer summer, or the fact that the crop failures that have been going on in Java are due to Climate Change as well.⁣
⁣
But this is just the start in Indonisia, and hopefully we can grow this movement so that even more people can participate in our actions in the future.⁣ We need #EverybodyNow to take to the streets to demand climate justice. This is a climate, ecological and social emergency that effects all life on Earth. ⁣
⁣
If you’re new to XR, check out our story highlights to find out what we stand for and how you can get involved. ⁣
⁣
If you can’t be present on the streets you can still support us by spreading the word on social media and donating to to rebellion (link in our insta-stories). ⁣
⁣
Thank you to all the incredible rebels around the world who have joined the XR movement so far, and all the other climate warriors fighting this cause in other movements. #TheTimeIsNow⁣
⁣
Choose, extinction or rebellion? ⁣
⁣
#ExtinctionRebellion #ActNow #NowOrNever #ExtinctionOrRebellion ⁣
